Title: Business Analyst
Description: Create, coordinate and execute test scripts, utilizing formal testing methodologies to verify that system and business applications meet specific requirements.
Descriptions:
Iron Systems is an innovative, customer-focused provider of custom-built computing infrastructure platforms such as network servers, storage, OEM/ODM appliances & embedded systems. For more than 15 years, customer have trusted us for our innovative problem solving combined with holistic design, engineering, manufacturing, logistic and global support services.

Job Title: Business Analyst
Location: Regina SK Onsite

About Job:
The Business Analyst will help business users understand their respective business processes and resolves issues using technology, processes, people, and structure.
This position plays an integral and strategic role in organizational success, as they are a key player in helping the business to make informed strategic decisions.
They are responsible for managing business requirements and must ensure that requirements are met by project managers, built by software developers, delivered effectively by a secure system of networks, tested by quality control, managed by the data owners, and accepted by the customers and stakeholders.
Within the Project Management Office, Business Analysts are responsible for applying the existing business analysis methodologies and processes to ensure successful contributions of end products as required by the project.
Additionally, Business Analysts are encouraged to participate as team members in establishing business analysis methodologies, practices and procedures which further enhance the existing Information Technology Division business analysis framework.
The Business Analyst must have a collaborative approach in working with the Project Manager, the business SMEs, internal ministry Business Analysts, third party vendor specialists, internal/external deployment team and the Application Management team. A large part of this role involves coaching and mentoring a group of business SMEs throughout the project lifecycle.
Skills and Responsibilities:
Apply a business analysis framework for success.
Document Business Process and Workflow Models (As-Is and To-Be).
Document Use Cases based on Business Process and Workflow Models.
Effectively analyze information, problems, situations, practices or procedures.
Elicit, document, manage and communicate functional and non-functional requirements throughout the project lifecycle.
Analyze business requirements and translate into business rules.
Define and scope the business problem or opportunity and identify solution and/or alternative solutions.
Verify that the solution meets the requirements and quantify the benefits and costs of each solution.
Identify any risks, issues and assumptions with the solution and contribute to an effective control and risk management process.
Work closely with technical teams to ensure their translation of requirements to solutions meet the needs of the users and integrates into the overall GOS architecture.
Act as a liaison between technical teams and Subject Matter Experts (SME’s), etc.
Research, develop, and recommend the implementation of new approaches and technological solutions for data and integration services.
Create and document feasibility studies, business cases, technical assessments, RFX requirements, project charters, user manuals, system manuals, policies, processes and procedures, etc.
Create and manage a robust plan for testing that ensures the end product supports business processes.
Create, coordinate and execute test scripts, utilizing formal testing methodologies to verify that system and business applications meet specific requirements.
Perform as Test Lead, to guide the business SMEs through the process of User Acceptance Testing (UAT) to ensure business requirements are sufficiently identified, traced and functional in the finished system.
Provide quality assurance in relation to the accuracy and integrity of the information provided in the solution.
Facilitate meetings and workshops with internal and external stakeholders.
Prepare and deliver presentations to internal and external stakeholders.
Preparing the business for change by conducting organizational readiness activities.
Develop training, training materials and facilitate training for both technical and non-technical audiences.

Title: Total Rewards Analyst
Description: Support the team with research, data analytics and modeling, analyzing internal and external practices to further design our total rewards programs.
Descriptions:
As a Total Rewards Analyst, you will be responsible for the analysis and administration of competitive total rewards programs that are innovative, compliant, cost effective and which support Extendicare’s Total Rewards strategy. The ideal candidate is analytical and organized with a passion for benefits and compensation data. Acting as a subject matter expert, you add value by applying technical expertise to support the development of total rewards programs, completing cost modeling, preparing compensation reports, presentations and analysis for various stakeholders. In this role, you will report to the Manager of Total Rewards and join a highly motivated team at an exciting time with the implementation of Workday.

This position will be located at our Head Office in Markham, Ontario and will have flexibility for both remote and in-office work based on our hybrid work model.

What you will deliver:
Support the team with research, data analytics and modeling, analyzing internal and external practices to further design our total rewards programs.
In preparation for collective bargaining negotiations, analyze total rewards data, complete cost modeling and compile reports and documentation.
Work with the Labour & Employee Relations team to implement CBA changes related to total rewards.
Assist and provide support in the annual compensation cycle including market research, creating and administering merit increase data files, and contributing to the continuous improvement of the compensation process.
Conduct and participate in total rewards surveys that support the ongoing development of our Total Rewards strategy. Analyze results and present data to show overall market trends and competitiveness.
Help develop and implement on-going benefit projects.
Work closely with the Human Resources and Benefits Operations teams in answering inquiries related to our total rewards program and processes.
Provide advice and guidance to leaders, people managers and HR Business Partners in the interpretation and administration of the organization's total rewards programs and processes.
Act as a liaison for our total rewards programs with our HR Business Partners, people managers and employees.
Provide on-going support to the Workday team to ensure a successful Workday implementation.
Participate in projects as assigned.
What you bring to the role:
Bachelor's degree in HR Management, Business Administration or Commerce with a focus in Finance.
Minimum 3 years’ experience in Total Rewards or as an HR Analyst.
Professional designation (CCP, CEBS or other equivalent designation in progress or completed) would be considered an asset.
Expert level user of Excel (i.e. pivot tables, lookups, advanced formulas) and modeling with large and complex HR/Financial data sets.
Excellent financial acumen including a basic understanding of financial terms and concepts.
Ability to collect and analyze big data to thoroughly think through problems and situations.
Experience presenting information clearly and effectively both verbally, and in writing.
Solid knowledge of HRIS, preferably Workday.
Customer-focused attitude, with the ability to understand, anticipate and identify customer needs.
Solid organization, planning, time management and multi-tasking skills.
At Extendicare, we believe that working as a team creates an environment that allows us to reach our potential. We value each employee, encourage equal opportunity for growth and recognize achievement. As a valued member of our team, you can expect:
Continuous mentorship, support for life-long learning and growth opportunities
Opportunities for advancement and career growth within the organization
A rewarding and meaningful work experience where you can enrich your life and the lives of others through your work.
Employee Family Assistance Program.
Robust benefits package.

Extendicare is a leading provider of care and services for seniors throughout Canada. Through our network of over 115 operated senior care and living centres, as well as our home health care operations, we are committed to delivering care throughout the health care continuum to meet the needs of a growing seniors’ population in Canada. Our qualified and highly trained workforce of 23,700 individuals are united by a dedication to quality care and by our vision of being the best provider of senior care and services in Canada.

In accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code, Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and Extendicare's Policies on Accommodation, a request for accommodation will be accepted as part of Extendicare’s hiring process.

Busbud is the leading online travel agency focused on intercity bus travel and mobility, with the broadest global coverage. Track, report, and analyze website analytics and PPC initiatives and campaigns

Optimize copy and landing pages for paid search engine marketing campaigns

2 + years of proven SEM experience, eCommerce experience, and success managing PPC campaigns across Google, Yahoo and Bing

Compensation based on experience

Health benefits & stock options
Apple equipment

Remote

Title: Pricing Analyst
Description:
Maintain tools with accurate data and assumptions.
Analyse, process and understand data to ensure accurate assumption and outcome reporting.
Descriptions:
Founded in 1982, WPO is the largest independent provider of holistic wellbeing solutions. Through our customized programs, and comprehensive global network of credentialed providers and professionals, we support individuals to become healthier, happier and more productive both personally and professionally. Trusted by 51% of Fortune 500 companies, we deliver high quality care digitally and in-person to over 75 million individuals across 116,000 organizations in more than 200 countries and territories.

Description:

WPO’s Pricing Department centralizes all pricing related processes and works collaboratively with other departments to deliver flexible client pricing options. The Pricing team analyzes a wealth of data to respond to new global opportunities while striving to preserve healthy profit margins on new business. Additionally, the Pricing team documents cost and utilization assumptions, matching to real world revenue and expense outcomes.

The Pricing Analyst supports and responds to requests for pricing from internal stakeholders, as well as documenting and reporting on pricing assumptions. In addition, the Pricing Analyst tracks client quote statuses and documents contracted pricing terms. The position requires the ability to apply analytical and critical thinking skills to solve business problems and further develop WPO’s pricing capabilities. Lastly, the Pricing Analyst ensures all pricing tools support WPO’s operational and financial goals. The role reports to the Director of Pricing and is based in Canada.



Responsibilities:

· Deliver pricing with documented assumptions and flexible alternatives to internal stakeholders’ requested client pricing
· Maintain and update pricing quotes and assumptions databases with matching outcomes
· Review Client contracts
· Support and respond to “pricing desk” one-off or custom pricing requests
· Coordinate with internal departments to collect and store data and other inputs for pricing models
· Maintain tools with accurate data and assumptions
· Analyse, process and understand data to ensure accurate assumption and outcome reporting
· Developing pricing automation tools to enhance efficiencies in calculating pricing and gathering data
· Support stakeholder reporting processes





Benefits
Not only will you have the opportunity to make a huge impact at one of largest independent wellbeing solutions leader, you will also have access to:

Private healthcare and dental coverage
Vision Benefits towards glasses and Contacts

Life Insurance at no cost
Registered Retirement Savings Plan

EAP Support Service

Travel Reimbursement
Paid time off

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Knowledge of data warehouse/business intelligence concepts, architectural components is considered an asset.
Analyze data to provide insight and ad hoc reports…
Descriptions:
REALTOR.ca is the most popular real estate listing and information platform in Canada. It builds business for REALTOR® members and establishes consumer trust and loyalty by supporting Canadians through their home-buying and selling journeys. It operates under the guiding principles of delivering value to consumers and members and continually evolving to meet and exceed market expectations. REALTOR.ca is more than a listing service – it’s the nexus of the Canadian property buying and selling journey.
Summary
The Senior Business Systems Analyst supports the creation, enhancement, and maintenance of CREA’s IT Services by documenting requirements, contributing to system design, and assuming a leadership role throughout the Systems Development Life Cycle of REALTOR.ca and related products and services.
Function
This position is a rare opportunity to join the REALTOR.ca Analyst team. We are looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst who is personable, results-driven, and has proven leadership experience working across complex, multi-team projects. The Senior Business Systems Analyst has a strong background in Business Systems Analysis and Solutions Architecture and proven ability to perform in an Agile environment.
Core Competencies:
Leadership Skills
Business Analysis
Systems Analysis
Solutions Architecture
Data Analysis
Creative Problem Solver
Critical Thinker
Business and Technical Writing
Presentation Skills
Customer Service
Position Accountabilities
Lead a high-performing team of analysts
Lead the development and enhancement of REALTOR.ca and supporting technology solutions on behalf of REALTORS®, consumers and Real Estate Associations:
Organize and facilitate requirements gathering sessions with project stakeholders, team members and end-users.
Document requirements that meet the needs of the Business and Technology
Present solutions to key business stakeholders
Analyze data to provide insight and ad hoc reports to product managers and IT stakeholders
Take a leadership role in designing, planning, and coordinating projects that involve multiple scrum teams
Establish, improve, and enforce requirements standards within the Business Systems Analyst team
Participate in meetings related to product release activities
Contribute to the creation of QA and UAT test strategies.
Consult on integration and acceptance testing

Act as a liaison between Business, Development, and Quality Assurance teams.
Identify risks to project deadlines or budget.
Facilitate integration activities with external partner organizations and third-party vendors.
Contribute to assessing project scope and feasibility
Contribute to troubleshooting enhancement and production support-related issues
Mentor colleagues in documentation best practices
Motivate and support the team in achieving on-time, on-budget, on quality solutions
Advise on BSA team roles and responsibilities, including project assignments and scrum team balancing
Identify any issues and make recommendations to the IT management team
Contribute to the establishment and adherence to IT security best practices
Requirements
University degree (IT, IS, or business administration with IT focus) or equivalent certification or experience
At least 10 years experience as a Business Systems Analyst or similar role
Experience managing staff
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment
Advanced use of SQL
Proficient in written and spoken English; bilingualism an asset
Demonstrated track record with consumer-facing, web/mobile-based projects considered an asset
Knowledge of data warehouse/business intelligence concepts, architectural components is considered an asset
This is a Hybrid position, with a mixture of working on-site-minimum two (2) days per week and remotely.

Title: Inventory Control Analyst
Description:
Support ongoing master data clean-up projects.
Detail oriented, accurate data entry to ensure that correct information is available for all departments.
Descriptions:
Taro Pharmaceuticals is a multinational, specialty pharmaceutical company with a vision of reaching people and touching lives globally as a leading provider of valued medicines. We are dedicated to meeting the needs of our customers and the overall community through the innovation, development, manufacturing and marketing of the highest quality healthcare products.

Established in 1950, Taro’s world class production facility is located in Brampton, Ontario, with a current team of over 600 Canadian employees. Our company’s focus on the dermatology sector has made us a leading manufacturer and supplier of specialized topical products with a diverse portfolio of creams, ointments, liquids, and gels.

With support from our parent company, Sun Pharma, one of the world’s largest specialty generic pharmaceutical companies, we are committed to providing a healthy, safe and rewarding environment for all of our employees.
Our reward packages have been designed to meet the needs of our diverse workforce and their families. For additional information visit: www.taro.com.

What we offer:
A safe and clean; GMP regulated work environment
Opportunities for career growth and development
A competitive wage/salary
Incentive bonus programs that are designed to reward employees for their individual contributions
Benefit programs designed to support our employees and their families, including a comprehensive health & dental benefits package, group RRSP matching program, direct access to healthcare and well-being programs, and paid time off
Employee training and organizational development programs including tuition reimbursement, internal mobility programs, and employee recognition programs

Roles & duties:
Work with the Manager, Inventory Control to improve inventory accuracy and complete inventory reconciliations.
Responsible to generate cycle count sheets for daily, weekly and annual cycle count checks for the warehouse, report findings, evaluating variances and ensuring variances are corrected in SAP.
Responsible for inventory reconciliation between Taro SAP and UPS SAP on a bi-weekly basis to ensure inventory accuracy and efficient utilization.
Responsible for adjusting inventory in SAP based on Incident Investigation Reports/Damages from UPS.
Responsible for maintaining optimal inventory levels for lab consumables/production consumables and pro-actively flag to the procurement team when re-supply is needed.
Review and analyze inventory for production requirements, ensure Raw Materials are available for production.
Closely work with the warehouse to ensure orders sent for destruction are picked and closed in the system.
Support the Material Master Specialist on day-to-day material master changes; act as a back-up when needed.
Manage transition date of old to new Components and advice various stakeholders inventory depletion dates.
Manage inventory depletion of materials based on production reduce and/or create new Batch Orders.
Assist the Master Data Specialist in creation of bill of materials (BOM), routings, capabilities, work order notes, and item label override, as it relates to production.
Assist with Internal and External Audits.
Support the creation and amendment of SOP’s as they relate to inventory processes and procedures at Taro.
Represent department on projects as required.
Perform root cause analysis with corresponding corrective action recommendations.
Actively participate and/or lead Continuous Improvement projects.
Additional duties as assigned.
Support ongoing master data clean-up projects

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
Ability to work and adapt in a fast and dynamic organization while maintaining strong controls over details to support decisions.
Sound administrative skills, knowledge and proficiency in current Windows software packages.
Ability to follow written and oral instructions as well as communicate effectively with co-workers and supervisors.
Demonstrated passion for excellence with respect to treating and caring for customers.
Demonstrated experience with generating and interpreting reports.
Exceptional organizational skills, ability to multitask and prioritize work assignments while meeting deadlines
Detail oriented, accurate data entry to ensure that correct information is available for all departments.
Ability to work under pressure & multi-task in a fast paced work environment.
Excellent communication skills, strong business writing
Diligent adherence to deadlines required to meet production plans.

If you are interested in this opportunity, please submit your resume to [email protected] referencing Compounder in the subject line. We thank all applicants, but only those selected for further consideration will be contacted. No phone calls please.
This position is open to applicants legally authorized to work in Canada.

Title: HRIM Analyst
Description:
Strong data analysis and reporting skills using PS Query, MS Excel and MS Access, PS Query.
HRIM analyst performs the collection and preparation of routine and…
Descriptions:
Purpose:
The role of the HRIM Analyst is to act as a liaison between Human Resources functional user groups and technical group to help define functional business requirements, analyze and validate system functionality by performing user acceptance testing to ensure solution meets established business requirements. HRIM analyst performs the collection and preparation of routine and special HR operational reports, including creating and executing queries and reports. They are second line specialized support for inquiries/issues for the university's employees and managers with regards to HR Self Service, Time and Labor, Absence Management and eReports Security. Provides support, responds to inquiries and requests for assistance with the organization's HR System to troubleshoot, analyze and resolve problems. Coordinates and/or provides training to units within the University as it relates to deployed HR system functionality. Participate in user acceptance testing in support of implementations, Peoplesoft inquiries and document results.

Education:
Post secondary degree in Computer science or Business Administration or equivalent work experience. Human Resources related training or certification.

Experience:
Minimum two years' experience in Human Resources Information Management with practical experience in full suite of PeopleSoft HR modules in version 9.1 or higher for HR Core, NA Payroll, Base Benefits, Position Management, Time and Labour and/or Absence Management modules. Experience investigating, analyzing, testing and implementing system applications in a large integrated PC/ internet technology-based delivery environment. Several years experience working in a public sector department/division. Experience working within a project team environment. Experience delivering training to resolve issues related to system usage and business processes. Experience training HR system users (employees, managers and administration).

Skills:
Demonstrated expertise in all phases of HR systems analysis, and related concepts and a thorough knowledge of the tools and techniques applicable to the business processes being supported.
Experience in end to end testing of solutions including detailed documentation of test results.
Proven ability to successfully complete projects of varying magnitude and complexity
Ability to train HR functional users with the new system and related products.
Solid team player, capable of working independently and in a team atmosphere`.
Ability to participate in multiple projects with competing priorities and strict deadlines.
Content development experience using UPK (User Productivity Kit)
Strong data analysis and reporting skills using PS Query, MS Excel and MS Access, PS Query.
Ability to communicate effectively with University Information Technology Services, managers, employees and other stakeholders
Strong written, verbal and presentation skills.
In depth knowledge of Human Resources policies and procedures is essential
Understanding of relational database structures, implementation cycles, information systems and IT architecture is an assetKnowledge:
Extensive familiarity with all aspects of HR related business processes is essential.
Knowledge of emerging IT trends, technologies and thorough knowledge of HR application systems, preferably PeopleSoft/Oracle HCM version 9.1 or greater.
The HRIM Analyst must also have a strong understanding of relational databases.
Solid understanding of standard implementation cycles is required as well as understanding of information systems and IT architecture.
Understanding of payroll processing cycles.

Additional Notes:
Ability to work on multiple priorities and projects and to operate within deadlines.
Extensive computer-oriented work that may require long hours and /or weekend work to accommodate project deadlines.
Please note: This position requires the candidate to produce a verification of degree(s), credentials(s), or equivalencies from accredited institutions and/or international equivalents at the time of interview.

York implemented a revised CPM Compensation Framework in 2019. The Framework is a salary grid consisting of 6 or 8 steps (depending on job grade) which is reviewed annually with possible adjustments, and a lump sum Performance Based Recognition Award. Employees will receive the grid adjustment and depending on performance, eligible permanent employees may move to the next step of the grid and may receive a lump sum Performance Based Recognition Award.Visit the CPM Compensation page on the HR Website to find out more about York's CPM Compensation Program.

Title: IT Business Analyst
Description:
An ability to design, deliver, and interpret diagrams, data models and documentation.
You enjoy working on big-picture data transformation, framework building,…
Descriptions:
We are excited to speak to you about this opportunity. If you are interested in joining our growing team, please apply to this link directly.
Who We Are
Emphasys Software is the largest full-service provider to serve the public housing, housing finance, and redevelopment marketplace. Across our five divisions, we provide software that modernizes and streamlines complex processes for housing authorities, agencies, lenders, and governments in almost every state. Through our products and services, we help house roughly half of the families most in need within the United States.
Who we need & what’s in it for you:
Emphasys Housing Finance Agency (HFA) division provides products that support multi-family housing, single family loan portfolio management, and financial solutions.
As a Business Analyst with Emphasys HFA, you will help us transform our data into actionable insights to support growth-minded business decisions. You will also establish a framework and knowledge base to demonstrate how our industry-leading products meet customer needs.
Influence and impact. You want to channel your relationship-building, solution-oriented thinking, and technical knowledge to elevate products that will help millions of Americans access the housing services they need.
Professional development. You want to be mentored and supported as you take on the role of a subject matter expert, customer champion, and technical analyst, leveraging data to create solutions for our organization and our customers.
Security. As we enter economic uncertainty, we know it can be hard to consider a career move, but at Emphasys and Aquila, we want you to know that we are stable with expert leaders at the helm and committed to the people who join us.
What you will focus on:
Building insights. You will:
Collect and transform new and existing data to create a knowledge base that demonstrates how Emphasys software products work and benefit our target audience.
Aggregate, digest and analyze internal business metrics, including financial, quality and productivity measures.
Conduct analysis to create a big-picture view and generate actionable insights.
Share data-supported insights with business leaders, provide feedback to enhance operations and features, and identify the strengths and weaknesses of the finished product.
Be the voice of the customer. You will:
Proactively communicate and collaborate with external and internal customers, acting as translator and champion.
Design and deliver documentation, including functional requirements, Business Requirements Documents, Use Cases, GUI, Screen, and Interface designs.
Stay up to date. You will:
Maintain in-depth knowledge of our solutions and services.
Keep abreast of federal, state, and local regulations related to HUD programs that could impact our products and clients.
What you bring:
Education. You have a Bachelor’s degree in a Computer Science or Technology field and familiarity with both business practices and software engineering.
Knowledge and drive. You enjoy working on big-picture data transformation, framework building, customer needs analysis, and feature development planning. You have experience eliciting and writing technical requirements to guide the work of a software engineering team. You have experience balancing multiple concurrent projects and completing deliverables on time.
Technical expertise. You have:
Proficiency with MS Office.
Comfort working in SQL.
Skills to develop BI dashboards.
An ability to design, deliver, and interpret diagrams, data models and documentation.
Ownership. You work with a sense of urgency and hold yourself accountable for exceeding expectations and meeting deadlines. You continuously seek new information and learning opportunities, staying at the forefront of best practices in the industry.
Interpersonal skills. You have a deep appreciation for diverse opinions and approaches. You have flexible and effective communication skills. You can:
Explain technical concepts to a non-technical audience.
Express patience and empathy with customers.
Build impactful working relationships within and across teams.
Why Join
Emphasys Software has been a part of Aquila, a subsidiary of Constellation Software Inc., since 2008. Responsive to the needs of multiple markets, and acting as a thought partner to ensure success, Aquila invests in category-defining B2B/B2G software companies globally. We are a well-managed, profitable company that operates like a startup with the financial backing of a larger organization.
Emphasys brings together bright, talented people who aspire to excellence and share a commitment to upholding our mission: To be a company of outstanding people delivering vertical market software solutions through long-term partnerships with clients.
Our entrepreneurial culture, lean environment, and people come together to form a dynamic organization where purpose drives our growth. With the autonomy to be creative and curious, we collaborate and iterate to achieve real impact in the communities we support.
Apply Now
We encourage and appreciate candidates with diverse backgrounds and experiences. If you have 70% of the qualifications we seek and want to play an integral role in our success, express your interest here.
Emphasys Software promotes equal employment opportunities for all. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, disability, national origin, veteran status, marital status or any other basis covered by appropriate law. All employment decisions are made based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities and accommodations are available on request.
We are excited to speak to you about this opportunity. If you are interested in joining our growing team, please apply to this link directly.

Title: Sr. Data Analyst, Theatre Development
Description: ; demonstrating knowledge of data governance, data quality management concepts and data quality tools (i.e. Informatica DQ).
Descriptions:
ABOUT IMAX:
IMAX is not your everyday entertainment experience. With over 50 years of history as a global innovator in entertainment technology, our employees and their careers have constantly gone beyond the ordinary. From offices across North America, Europe, and Asia, we combine proprietary software, architecture, and equipment with industry-leading knowledge and connections to create experiences that take audiences beyond the edge of their seats to a world they have never imagined. Our Hollywood team are trusted movie business insiders with decades of production experience, acting as advisors to top filmmakers and studios across the world. Our technology experts are leaders in the industry, constantly pushing the limits of what is possible in entertainment. Our sales and marketing teams are talented professionals who build and enhance the IMAX brand globally.

IMAX's network is among the most important and successful theatrical distribution platforms for major event films around the world, and our growing Live and Enhanced businesses have allowed us to bring the IMAX Experience to our partnerships across live music, events and streaming to provide the best possible experience across any screen. As the world’s leading entertainment technology company, IMAX has revolutionized the way people experience movies, and continues to push the boundaries of entertainment experiences forward. Our employees are driven by a passion to take audiences around the world to places they have only dreamed of.

Come explore IMAX – where innovation, creativity and passion come together. Get inspired, get involved, and ignite your future with IMAX!

Job Description/Requirements

JOB DESCRIPTION

Reporting to the VP, Theatre Project and Strategic Initiatives. The Senior Data Analyst will take ownership of the department’s data analytics / reporting to empower cross functional teams and guide business decisions. The Senior Data Analyst will work closely with the Development and Data teams to provide support in the creation of detailed analytical models and providing expert opinion related to the integration and processing of data relevant to the business.

Responsibilities:
Utilize programmatic and quantitative methods to identify patterns and relationships in large data sets, as well as apply mathematical, statistical, and other data-driven analysis to address intelligence questions
Conduct detailed analysis on data used across business units to evaluate processes and improve on/create new features
Analyze and improve business processes specific to discrepant data scenarios
Provide expertise and translate the business needs to design; and develop tools, techniques, and metrics, and dashboards for insights and data visualization

Requirements/Qualifications:
Data Analysts with a Master’s degree in Analytics, Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics or in a related field
3-5 years of industry experience in data analysis using SQL, SAP & Python
Understanding of Scripting experience in (Python, Perl, JavaScript, Shell)
Practical knowledge of data in various forms (data warehouses/SQL, unstructured data environments/PIG,HIVE, Impala)
Familiarity with BI reporting tools (i.e. Tableau and Business Objects)
Experience working within process management and improvement methodologies – Lean, Six Sigma, etc.; demonstrating knowledge of data governance, data quality management concepts and data quality tools (i.e. Informatica DQ)
Understanding of Agile development methodologies, software design patterns, network design and architecture
Experience in quantitative analysis and statistical modelling
Must be able to work well under pressure and achieve results within the scheduled time-frame
Must have strong writing and verbal communication skills to perform their job duties
Our Commitment To You

IMAX is proud to be an equal opportunity employer!

At IMAX you will be part of a culture built on respect - one that recognizes the unique talents of everyone on the team. We're proud of the differences that make us all unique and we support unity, acceptance, and equal rights for all. Diversity and inclusion among our employees are critical to our success as a global company.

For consideration, please apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest in IMAX but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please note, IMAX is currently operating in-office 5 days-a-week. Additionally, all permanent full-time employment is subject to background and employment/reference checks.

Title: Application Support Analyst
Description:
Gathering and analyzing data in support of business cases, requests for proposal and systems requirements.
Ability to conduct research into production issues.
Descriptions:
POSITION SUMMARY:
The Application Support Analyst role is to support the planning, design, configuration, and launch of business improvements in support of organizational processes across our Senior’s Living business line. This includes identifying, analyzing, configuring, and validating business needs to ensure alignment to the required business capabilities. Gathering and analyzing data in support of business cases, requests for proposal and systems requirements. The Application Support Analyst may also be responsible for generating and compiling reports based on the findings, complete with probable causes and viable solutions to systems issues. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate, and resolve systems issues to maximize the benefit of IT system investments.
This Position is Hybrid
POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
Activity A: Application Configuration/Support (75% of time)
· Actively support the application portfolio in compliance with determined Service Level Agreement.
· Resolve and document application incidents and defects
· Issue Tracking and status reporting
· Validate business requirements and configure new software features to enhance business capabilities and/or efficiencies.
· Execute in-depth analysis to identify root causes of problems and contribute to the development of system solutions
· Clarify and translate business requirements/objectives into functional specification decisions
· Independently or in collaboration with peers, configure enhancements and coordinate/conduct appropriate testing according to defined specifications.
· Coordinate and/or migrate new enhancements/configurations across various platform phases (DEV to UAT to Prod)
· Ensure consistency and standardization across multiple instances of the same solution, where necessary.
· Develop and maintain user manuals and guidelines

Activity B: Assist in Creating Application Efficiencies (25% of time)
· Assist in the definition, development, and documentation of business requirements, objectives, deliverables, and specifications on a project-by-project basis in collaboration with internal clients, taking into consideration platform capabilities.
· Create systems models, specifications, and diagrams to assist with the interpretation of business requirements into feasible options and communicate these to the business stakeholders.
· Assist in research sessions in prototyping new capabilities to enhance business processes, operations, and information process flow.
· Develop an understanding of existing business processes and recommend changes that leverage best usage of a platform and/or solution
· Design and conduct software tests on new and existing capabilities when a QA resource is not available
· Maintain appropriate Change Management processes for Production changes.

QUALIFICATIONS:
· Excellent written and spoken English language skills, with the ability to communicate professionally
· Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or Information Systems or other technically relevant degree
· Minimum 2 - 3 years of Application Support Analysis experience.
· Experience supporting the requirements definition and configuration of Cloud and/or SaaS based solutions, on both the functional/business and technical levels.
· Knowledge related to clinical information systems and familiarity with governance issues and requirements
· Ability to assess and understand solutions at a platform level and make recommendations to ensure consistency and standardization across the platform.
· Experience in requirements analysis, configuration proposals, and cost/benefit analysis in support of client requirements.
· Ability to work effectively with front-line functional areas, end-users, and other IT professionals, specifically in building relationships and managing expectations.
· Experience in defining, implementing and/or enhancing requirements gathering processes and templates.
· Electronic health record, Clinical Care solutions and/or Senior’s Living knowledge is an asset.
· Knowledge of PointClickCare platform solutions is an asset.

SKILLS/ COMPETENCIES:
· Ability to conduct research into production issues
· Exceptional diligence with proven analytical and problem-solving abilities
· Strong customer service skills
· Working knowledge of ITSM/ITIL process analysis and improvement (Service Now, Change, Incident, and Request, etc.)
· Initiative-taking with the ability to produce quality work with minimal supervision.
· Flexible and adaptable in learning and understanding modern technologies & processes
· Strong written, oral, and interpersonal communication skills
· Ability to work in a collaborative environment
· Ability to work flexible hours
About Us:
At SE, we love what we do. Every day, we bring hope and happiness to clients, homes, and communities across Canada. We treat each person with dignity and love, like our own family; we build empathy; and we do the right thing. We are always inspired to make a difference. As a not-for-profit social enterprise, we share knowledge, provide the best care, and help each client to realize their most meaningful goals for health and wellbeing. We’re a great place to work, and we hope you’ll join our team.
SE Health is monitoring the global COVID-19 pandemic closely and following all public health directives, including recommendations from the World Health Organization, Government of Canada, and federal and provincial health authorities. Our top priority is the health and safety of our clients, their families and our staff.
Please note that due to the unprecedented circumstance of the Global Pandemic and the resultant public health crisis; and in the interest of the health and safety of our patients/clients, employees, and greater good of public health, SE Health requires those that wish to work for this organization to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Fully vaccinated means a person has received both doses of the COVID-19 vaccine and it has been 14 days since the last dose
SE Health is committed to the success of all its employees. If you feel you need accommodations because of illness or disability, please do not hesitate to contact Human Resources at careers@sehc.com at your earliest convenience.

Title: Purchasing Data Analyst
Description:
1-3 years of data anlytics experience.
Ability to analyze data for effective decision-making.
The Purchasing Data Analyst is a well-organized individual who…
Descriptions:
Sunrise Farms is a group of companies that has grown from an initial focus in the poultry industry including hatchery operations; poultry farming; primary processing; and further processing; to distribution of other protein products across Canada.

Our humble start was in 1983 with one small processing facility in Surrey, British Columbia. We have now grown to serve a broad range of customers, both domestically and internationally. Sunrise Farms remains Canadian family owned, producing quality food products from processing plants located in British Columbia, Alberta, Manitoba and Ontario.

We have approximately 3,200 full-time and part-time employees who are experienced, dedicated to their craft, and exceptional at delivering quality products from farm to table.
We are proud of our long-standing partnerships with family-owned Canadian chicken farmers to produce high-quality products. We take our role in the farm to table process very seriously and are honored to deliver farm fresh Canadian food to Canadian tables from coast to coast.

The Purchasing Data Analyst is a well-organized individual who pays close attention to detail, and has a thorough understanding of numerical analysis, as well as database management. The purchasing Data Analyst is a key member of Sunrise Farms corporate purchasing team, providing a variety of non-poultry related velocity reports by supplier and by sku(s) in order to help maximize cost efficiencies. This person is a gatekeeper, entering and monitoring contract pricing in the company Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) software and works very closely with the Corporate DIrector of Purchasing.
Responsibilities:
Oversee the day-to-day responsibilities of Syspro database management.
Gatekeeper of contract pricing, including unit of measures (UOM) information, etc.
Provides velocity reports and analysis - su;;lier volumes, sku volumes, COGS analysis (poultry NIC).
Participates in the preparation and overall review of issuing Requests For Proposals (RFPs).
Liaises with and supports buyers at the plant level.
Monitor Purchase Orders (POs) and contract pricing compliance and training.
Looks for opportunities and inventory management improvements.
Looks for distribution and logistics improvement for purchases into plants.
Develop SKU forecast based on historical sales and recent trends.
Participate in local and company-wide process improvement initiatives.
Other responsibilities as required.

SENIOR TECHNICAL ANALYST (TRAVIS PROJECT)
Requisition #: R23-2740
Location: Remote (from anywhere within Canada)

Number of Resources required: 1

Estimated Overtime/Standby per month: 15.00
Submit to Tri-global: March 16, 2023 (on or before 12:00 PM Mountain Time)
Closing Date: March 17, 2023 (10:00 AM Mountain Time)
------------------------------------------------------------------------
Tri-global Solutions Group Inc. is seeking one (1) Senior Technical Analyst to join our talent Service Delivery team at Government of Alberta (GoA) to support TRAVIS, the Permitting and Approvals Section (Central Permit Office sub-section) of the Carrier and Vehicle Safety (CVS) Branch within Alberta Transportation.
The successful contractor(s) have an anticipated April 1, 2023 start date for an initial 12-month contract (ending March 31, 2024) with 12-month extension available (total contract term up to 24-months).
NOTES ON LOCATION: Resource will work remotely, though must be available for onsite meetings if required (which is unlikely). Work must be done from within Canada, due to network and data security policies. Standard Hours of work are 08:15 - 16:30 Alberta time.
Please review the project overview and requirements below. If you meet the requirements and are interested in submitting for this role, please reply to this job posting.
If you know other consultants who may be interested in this opportunity kindly share this job posting.
Thank you.
Tri-global Solutions Group Inc.
302, 11007 Jasper Avenue NW
Edmonton, AB T5K 0K6
------------------------------------------------------------------------
PROJECT OVERVIEW
We require a Senior Technical Analyst for the project delivery of the IMT Sector ministry projects to Modernize & Enhancements of GoA Service Delivery within Ministry of Technology and Innovation.
Initiatives to Modernize & Enhancements of GoA Service Delivery include multiple Department applications including the following:
TRAVIS supports the Permitting and Approvals Section (Central Permit Office sub-section) of the Carrier and Vehicle Safety (CVS) Branch within Alberta Transportation. Currently, TRAVIS is a suite of in-house custom-built applications for managing the business of issuing and maintaining data mainly for commercial vehicle permits and operating authority certificates. TRAVIS provides permits for most jurisdictions within the Province including Municipalities and Counties.
TRAVIS is a business vital system, supporting the activities of major industries of the Alberta economy, including oil/gas, mining, forestry and construction. Therefore, both the industry stakeholders and Alberta Transportation require reliable service 7/24, 365 days a year. TRAVIS supports over 17,000 users with most of those being external to the GoA. Over 200,000 transactions are processed by TRAVIS each year.
The TRAVIS Modernization Implementation project was initiated to move the business critical TRAVIS off a soon to be unsupported mainframe onto BERNIE based solution.
TRAVIS DMP Reporting project will gather business requirements related to reports and analytics, develop and implement data ingestion and migration and storage, define data archival and retention policies, implement the plan to provide data analysis, and develop Power BI custom reports and dashboards for various TRAVIS business functions.
ADDITIONAL DELIVERY DETAILS
The resource must:
Support development of project deliverables including, requirements gathering and process documentation to meet project milestones. Support Project Management status and financial reports and schedules as required.
Support business needs by ensuring that project delivery is in alignment with business / technical requirements and application development. Analyze organization or business domain and document the business, processes, systems, assessing the business model or its integration with technology. Leading workshops and User Acceptance Testing during the development of business applications.
The deliverables/artefacts to be produced is not limited to above mentioned list.
DESCRIPTION OF SERVICES
Responsible for taking business requirements and translating them into technical requirements and solutions.
Create project documents and associated planning documents.
Create stakeholder analyses.
Lead consultations and facilitate stakeholder meetings.
Create business requirements, functional specifications and technical requirements.
Create new business and technical processes and complete business process reviews/re-engineering for existing processes.
Facilitate business process improvement sessions.
Assist in the development of new IT services.
Schedule, organize and lead project status meetings and other meetings as required.
Provide support by bridging communication between vendors, client ministries, and corporate technical and business teams.
Escalate unresolved issues/risks, options and recommendations.
Responsible for business architecture design, software system specifications design, and database modelling.
Participate iterative development using model-based processes .
Perform project management, business and technical analysis and systems design in delivering complex software solutions spanning n-tier development environments.
Produce project artifices with XML; UML and/or other web-services technologies.
Prepare, update and manage documents defining the business requirements, software requirements, functional design, and project plans and schedules reflecting achievable deliverables for the applications.
Prepare regular project status reports indicating project deliverables, possible risk and issues, time-lines and anticipated effort.
Ensure appropriate project communication occurs to all parties involved during all phases of the project.
Identify required user training.
Additional responsibilities as required by the Project Manager for a Business Analyst or Lead Technical Analyst role
MANDATORY SKILLS

University graduation in business, management or a related discipline and 4-yr Technical Business Analyst (BA) experience;
OR

OR

- Proposed resource must work from within Canada, due to network and data security policies. Standard Hours of work are 08:15 - 16:30 Alberta time. Client does not pay for travel to attend on-site meetings
DESIRABLE / NICE TO HAVE SKILLS

- Experience in facilitating meetings and communicating with senior management and project stakeholders (5+ years)

Title: Business Analyst - PXM
Description:
Ability to find innovative opportunities related to product data management for clients and teams.
As the Product Information Management Consultant, you will be…
Descriptions:
At Valtech, we imagine and create the world of tomorrow!
With more than 5,000 innovative profiles, creatives, developers, designers and digital experts working in its 50 offices around the world, Valtech distinguishes itself by its end-user centric approach and its innovation process. With its values of sharing, boldness and authenticity, Valtech makes sure to put the human element at the heart of the digital experiences it develops - for its clients as well as for its employees.
At Valtech_Commerce, we are more than 300 employees who are passionate about e-commerce. By joining us, you'll be part of a company that puts people first and you'll be able to grow and evolve with access to a global network of innovators.

What you will do:
Content is at the core of eCommerce experiences. As the Product Information Management Consultant, you will be guiding clients on surpassing their goals through the creation of forward-thinking business roadmaps, plans, audits and workshops.

Your clients will span various industries, sizes and locations. In collaboration with internal stakeholders like Valtech’s Director of Product Strategy and our team of eCommerce Experts, you will develop platform integration strategies for PIM, DAM, PLM, and others.

Analyze, understand and explain client needs as it relates to product information management.
Work with clients to redefine the product lifecycle and improve business processes.
Organize and lead discovery phases with clients and the Valtech team.
Support clients in the adoption of the Product Information Management (PIM) platform through planning, training, and change management.
Develop in-depth knowledge of the inriver platform, along with other Product Information Management platforms like Riversand, Stibo, Akeneo, Salsify, and Enterworks.
On occasion, participate in the sales cycle by supporting the Directors of Sales and Account Directors.
Participate in the growth of Valtech’s PIM practice.
What you should have:
Minimum of 5 years experience working in eCommerce or business analysis.
Bachelor’s or master’s in a technology-related domain or equivalent experience.
Ability to find innovative opportunities related to product data management for clients and teams.
Ability to establish solid client relationships and credibility with renowned clients and teams, as well as with internal and external stakeholders.
Leadership experience and ability to take initiative.
Excellent oral and written language skills (an asset).
The perks :
Flexible PTO Policy!
Valtech_ is lucky to collaborate with amazing organizations (local to global). If you want to learn and grow as an eCommerce specialist, this is the place for you.
Flexible schedule, with a 37.5 hour work week.
The possibility to work remotely and $500 to outfit your home office when you first start.
The possibility to work from wherever you want (subject to approval).
Life, medical and dental insurance with 24/7 access to counseling and telemedicine & an employee assistance program (EAP).
Company contribution to your retirement savings.
A community of supportive people (from your day-to-day colleagues to the company owners).
Offices all across the globe including in Montreal and in Sainte-Thérèse, on the northshore of Montreal.
A strong corporate culture where the values Share, Dare and Care are a part of the company’s DNA.

Title: Business Analyst
Company: Home and Community Care Support Services
Description:
Identifies, designs, develops and maintains data repositories, business applications and interfaces.
Excellent in requirements gathering methods (interviewing,…
Descriptions:
Job Description:
We are amid a momentous time for health care in Ontario as we move towards better connected care for patients, families and caregivers focused on their needs. Home and Community Care Support Services Mississauga Halton is pivotal in this process. Entrusted through our provincial mandate to deliver local health care services such as home and community care, access to community services and long-term care home placement, we are helping everyone to be healthier at home through connected, accessible, patient-centred care.

We are currently recruiting a Business Analyst

Competition #: FY2223-159
Date Posted: February 1, 2023
Date Closed: until Filled
Start Date: as soon as possible
Reports to: Manager, Information Management
Category: Temporary Full-time until April 19, 2024
Team: Information Management
Primary assigned location: 401 The West Mall, Etobicoke (current hybrid model)

POSITION OUTLINE

Reporting to the Manager, Information Management, the Business Analyst is a liaison between the portfolios and Business Systems within the Home and Community Care Support Services Mississauga Halton. Participates in the identification of business requirements, definition of function specifications, monitoring of project activities throughout the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). The purpose of the role is to provide comprehensive services to support the design, development, implementation and rollout of business systems with emphasis on the enhancement of client care, customer service, improved efficiency, quality and optimize the use of resources.

DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Business Support
Identifies, defines and documents information requirements, business processes and functional specifications to support business decisions via meetings, data analysis and audits, surveys with stakeholders etc.
Proposes solutions and modifies business applications and interfaces to fulfill business needs. The typical deliverables are:
Business Requirements
Business Rules
Use Cases
Business Processes
Data Flow
Acceptance Test Plan
Lead, or participate in project teams, develop project plan, monitor and enforce project timelines
Apply project standards to obtain required approvals for changes, requirements and execution activities
Researches and recommends practices, models, technologies and software to meet business needs
Participates in the implementation of new practices and models for service delivery
Contribute to the training provided to end-users
Applies requirements of data privacy legislation to business support activities as mandated

Technical Support
Resolves incidents and problems related to the business applications and interfaces using the helpdesk solution
Identifies, designs, develops and maintains data repositories, business applications and interfaces
Identifies, defines and documents the impact of new software releases to existing business practices and processes
Identifies, defines, develops, conducts and documents testing according to Acceptance Test Plans
Ensures operational procedures are followed to enable the efficient operation of systems
Provides technical and functional knowledge to support training for staff and/or key-trainers
Liaises with external personnel or organizations to affect solutions
Develops and delivers reports outside the scope of Decision Support
Acts as technical mentor as appropriate
Applies security best practice as appropriate

Team Building
Develops professional working relationships with team members
Works respectfully, positively and collaboratively within a team environment sharing experiences and lessons learned
Supports the team and works with team members to ensure department needs are met including absence coverage

QUALIFICATIONS

Education, Training & Experience
Post-secondary education in, Information Technology, Business Information System, Engineering or related field
Minimum of three (3) years’ experience in related field
Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP) and/or Certification of Competency in Business Analysis (CCBA) designation an asset
Experience and working knowledge of tools, techniques, measures and systems for developing and monitoring information systems
Working knowledge of relational database systems such as MS-SQL Server, Oracle, MySQL, etc., being able to write and modify SQL queries, stored procedures and views

Skills and Attributes
Adept in the use of MS Office applications (e.g., Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, etc.)
Understanding and commitment to quality service and best practice
Excellent effective listening and facilitation skills
Excellent in requirements gathering methods (interviewing, data modelling, business process modelling, etc.)
Flexible, adaptable and responsive to change
Strong ability to analyze complex information, problem-solve and make good decisions
Accountable for own actions and decisions, making decisions within the scope of the position and referring issues/problems/events to the manager as required.
Self-directed with the ability to organize, plan, prioritize and multi-task
Demonstrated critical thinking
Detail-oriented

Home and Community Care Support Services values the health and safety of its employees and is committed to the prevention of COVID-19 exposure and transmission of infection to employees, patients, caregivers, volunteers, visitors and residents. As a requirement of Home and Community Care Support Services Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination Policy, all employees must be considered fully vaccinated for COVID-19.

Home and Community Care Support Services Mississauga Halton is a respectful, caring and inclusive workplace, committed to Employment Equity. We welcome diversity in the workplace, and encourage applications from all qualified individuals including women, members of visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities. REALTOR.ca is the most popular real estate listing and information platform in Canada. Function

Document requirements that meet the needs of the Business and Technology

Title: Inventory Analyst / Data Analyst
Description:
Reporting to the VP and senior buyer this is a key position with in the company.
Position:* *Inventory Analyst / Data Analyst*.
Job Types: Full-time, Permanent.
Descriptions:
The Company -
Chens is committed to maintaining an family feeling working environment where team members will work together, have a place to grow and pursue excellence, have the latitude to take ownership of their careers and the support and encouragement necessary to be the best they can throughout their career. We are a Canadian, family owned, food and household distributor which has grown and prospered since 2008
Position Overview –
Reporting to the VP and senior buyer this is a key position with in the company.
Position: Inventory Analyst / Data Analyst
The inventory Analyst will actively make decisions on a weekly basis, purchasing inventory. You will be responsible for identifying, analyzing and communicating with vendors, sales managers and category managers to ensure a lean supply chain. You will also need to periodically organize inventory cycle counts
What we are looking for
Experience in product replenishment in the grocery industry is required
Experience with an ERP. Experience with Microsoft Dynamic Navision is an asset
Work experience with Jet report and Power BI
Strong working knowledge of Excel is required
Strong knowledge of grocery wholesale business in terms of seasonality and product mix
Diploma in Business Administration, Supply Chain, or equivalent experience is required
Must be detail-oriented and must be able to handle multiple priorities in a faced-paced environment
What you’ll do:
Forecasting and Replenishment
Maintains Min/Max stock levels by managing the product order cycles, vendor minimums, vendor lead times, product shelf life, truckload capacity and logistics schedules and executing purchase orders

At Kruger Products we have a shared vision for greatness. We manufacture some of North America’s most popular tissue brands - Cashmere®, Purex®, Scotties®’, SpongeTowels®, White Cloud®, as well as products for use away from home. We always want to do better for our customers and our world. The awards we’ve earned remind us that our hard work and commitment to doing the right thing pays off. But they aren’t what keep us going. It’s the people who work here, who believe in what we do – and how we do it that truly matters.
We are leaders in our communities, leaders in sustainability, and leaders in connecting with our consumers. Our headquarters is in Mississauga, ON, and we proudly have nearly 2,700 employees spread across eight manufacturing plants in Quebec, British Columbia, Ontario, and Tennessee.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
The Customer Supply Chain Analyst is responsible for overseeing product flow from our manufacturing and warehouse sites to the store shelves. This individual will ensure supply chain continuity, maximizing of sales, and seeking opportunities for continuous improvement on all aspects of supply chain execution.
This opportunity on the Kruger Products team is an 18 month contract.

Complete the daily analysis of inventory/stock at the Distribution Centre (DC) and store level for your customer account

Review inventory and order patterns for customer DCs and store inventories

Title: Business Analyst, Decision Support - Full Time - Markham Site
Description:

We are seeking a passionate, creative and innovative individual who will…
Descriptions:
Land Acknowledgement:
Oak Valley Health honours the traditional territory of the closest Indigenous communities, the Chippewas (chi-puh-waas) of Georgina Island and the Mississaugas of Scugog Island. The Haudenosaunee (Ho-de-no-shau-nee) and Anishinaabe (Ah-nish-in-ah-beh) have lived, worked and existed on this land from time immemorial. This land is covered by Treaty 13 signed with the Mississaugas of the Credit, and the Williams Treaty signed with many Mississauga and Chippewa bands.

Forbes Canada Honouree
We are honoured to be recognized as one of Forbes Canada’s Best Employers for Diversity 2022. We ranked within the top 150 organizations across the country. Learn more about our commitment to EDI. https://www.oakvalleyhealth.ca/about-us/equity-diversity-and-inclusion

Who you are:
You encompass Oak Valley Health’s core values and live the words of Respect, Trust, Commitment, Compassion and Courage
You are a patient and/or client centered individual who performs at an exemplary standard
You are a team player with excellent communication, critical thinking and prioritization skills

What we are looking for:

The Decision Support team at Oak Valley Health provides analytical support to all sites and services across organization as well as to selected internal and external initiatives. Our team is composed of highly qualified and experienced data management and analytics professionals from a range of analytics backgrounds and use variety of methods from simple analysis to advanced statistical modelling to support our clients.

We are seeking a passionate, creative and innovative individual who will excel at providing data and analytical support for Oak Valley Health’s clinicians, and corporate business areas.

We are seeking a passionate, creative and innovative individual who will excel at providing data and analytical support for Oak Valley Health’s clinicians, and corporate business areas.

You are seeking an exciting opportunity to showcase your talents as a Business Analyst. You possess a strong work ethic and a passion for advancing healthcare through developing and reporting clinical, quality and operational Key Performance Indicators (KPIs); interpreting, visualizing, and presenting findings; developing and maintaining cross-sector scorecards and dashboards; and performing data quality investigations.

As an ideal candidate, you are comfortable working with large-scale clinical and administrative datasets, you understand how a hospital and/or information management environment functions.

Reporting to the Manager, Analytics & Business Intelligence, and working directly with other members of the Decision Support and Business Intelligence team and/or individuals at various levels within the organization, you will:

Analyze, interpret, and present data, and create and maintain technical documentation;
Support clinical and non-clinical areas in the development of KPIs, dashboards, data visualizations, and reports (routine and ad hoc) for the purposes of monitoring and optimizing organization performance on quality, safety, operations, and planning;
Provide analytical support and expertise to facilitate effective and efficient benchmarking and prediction analysis at corporate and clinical program-levels;
Support reporting to various external reporting agencies including Ontario Health, and the Ministry of Health and Long-term Care;
Conduct data quality investigations and engage in continuous data quality improvements;
Commit to, and actively work to remain knowledgeable and up-to-date in the assigned field;
Challenge the status quo and recommend innovative ways to improve reporting process efficiency and quality.

What you bring to Oak Valley Health:
Required:
Completion of a recognized university degree in Medical Informatics, Industrial Engineering, Epidemiology, Statistics, or Business; equivalent combination of education and experience;
Three (3) or more years of experience in a decision support environment in healthcare including experience preparing analyses of operational, and quality measures
Experience working with multiple CIHI datasets (DAD, NACRS, OMHRS, NRS, and CCRS) and other large healthcare datasets (e.g., IntelliHealth, Case Costing)
Working knowledge of health care funding methodologies (HBAM and QBP)
Demonstrated proficiency in qualitative and quantitative data analytics, visualization, and reporting
Experience with relational database structures and the extraction and manipulation of data using Microsoft SQL
Strong programming and data management skills, including but not limited to proficiency in a statistical or programming tool (e.g., R, Python)
Proficient use of MS Office suite (specifically Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Display a positive attitude towards complex challenges as well as routine maintenance and administration tasks
Self-motivated and able to work independently with minimal supervision and also possessing a positive team spirited attitude
Excellent interpersonal and client relationship skills
Strong written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Ability to multi-task with strong attention to detail within a fast-paced environment with changing priorities
Adhering to confidentiality and privacy requirements for sensitive financial and clinical information.

Considered an asset:
A Master’s degree in Medical Informatics, Industrial Engineering, Epidemiology, Business, or an equivalent combination of education and experience;
Experience applying various statistical or data science techniques such as: Forecasting, Predictive Modeling, Correlation and Regression
Prior experience in a major Health Information System (HIS), specially Meditech
Prior experience in working with a Business intelligent tool, particularly “Information Builders” or Webfocus considered as a strong assest
Knowledge of health care reporting requirements (e.g. OHRS and MIS guidelines)
Experience with Cristal Reports, Integrated Decision Support (IDS)

Office:
Our office is in the Markham area (379 Church Street).

Salary Grade:
Band L: $38.23 - 46.62

Who we are:
Oak Valley Health is one of Ontario’s leading community healthcare organizations. Across our two sites (Markham and Uxbridge) and Reactivation Care Centre (RCC), we provide high quality, patient-centred care to more than 435,000 patients each year. We offer diagnostic and emergency services and deliver clinical programs in acute care medicine and surgery, addictions and mental health, and childbirth and children’s services. We are also proud to be part of the Eastern York Region North Durham Ontario Health Team (OHT).
Our 526 physicians, 28 midwives, 2,400 staff and 1,000 volunteers serve patients and families with an honoured to care mindset and are focused on delivering an extraordinary patient experience to the residents of Markham, Whitchurch-Stouffville, Uxbridge and beyond. We are dedicated to providing access to the right care, at the right time, in the right place by the right people and at the right cost. Are you ready to join us?

COVID Statement
As a result of the COVID-19 pandemic and the need to strengthen and promote health protection to patients, staff and members of the public attending in the hospital, prior to the first day of employment with the Hospital, all successful candidates are required to provide proof of COVID-19 vaccination (full vaccination is required). In order to provide you with fair & equitable accommodation, you must submit supporting medical exemption documentation or an affidavit detailing why your religion prohibits you from receiving the COVID-19 vaccine.

Oak Valley Health Diversity Statement
Oak Valley Health takes pride in serving some of Canada’s most diverse communities. We are committed to fostering an environment of equity and inclusivity where every person can work and receive care safely, openly and honestly. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nation of origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, marital or family status, belief system, or other factors related to one’s personal identity and/or values. Descriptions:
Canada, Kingston
Today, Lonza is a global leader in life sciences operating across three continents. While we work in science, there’s no magic formula to how we do it. Our greatest scientific solution is talented people working together, devising ideas that help businesses to help people. In exchange, we let our people own their careers. Their ideas, big and small, genuinely improve the world. And that’s the kind of work we want to be part of.
Lonza Kingston is IMMEDIATELY hiring a Database Analyst to join Lonza's Personalized Medicine Innovation team, for a 6-month contract position. This Database Analyst position provides an opportunity to work directly with scientists while learning about cutting edge technologies in the field of cell and gene therapy.
Our goal is to increase our capabilities while maintaining our platform as the market-leading platform for patient-scale cell therapy manufacturing.
This position is located on site at our Kingston office. The work schedule is Monday - Friday 8:30a-5:00p.
Key responsibilities:
Aid with database management, data collection, and data organization
Enter and update database with prescribed data, and review a variety of stored documents against each case to ascertain correct data input requirements. Transfer files as required.
Classify information in order to enter data accurately.
Verify data by reviewing and amending data.
Comply with data integrity and data protection policies, ensuring sensitive information is kept confidential and discretion is applied.
Be proactive in highlighting and communicating problems/potential problems in a timely manner.
Key requirements:
High school diploma required. Degree in life sciences, preferred.
Some knowledge in cell biology and cell characteristics required.
Must be able to demonstrate understanding of biological processes.
Must be able to recommend best practices in linking multiple databases.
Some working experience with database maintenance, reporting methods and data entry required.
Advanced level MS office suite especially Excel required; MS Power BI is a plus.
Knowledge and ease of use of formulas/graphing/visual summaries helpful to use/additions to database required.
Basic-level experience with scientific methods required.
Problem solving, critical thinking, team collaboration, good communication and organizational skills required.
Every day, Lonza’s products and services have a positive impact on millions of people. For us, this is not only a great privilege, but also a great responsibility. How we achieve our business results is just as important as the achievements themselves. At Lonza, we respect and protect our people and our environment. Any success we achieve is no success at all if not achieved ethically.
People come to Lonza for the challenge and creativity of solving complex problems and developing new ideas in life sciences. In return, we offer the satisfaction that comes with improving lives all around the world. The satisfaction that comes with making a meaningful difference.
