Title: Business Data Analyst
Description: The candidate should have solid investment operations knowledge, data loading and scheduling, managing reference data, market data and systems testing…
Descriptions:
Why you’ll love working here:
high-performance, people-focused culture
our commitment that equity, diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our work environment and business success, which helps employees feel valued and empowered to be their authentic selves
learning and development initiatives, including workshops, Speaker Series events and access to LinkedIn Learning, that support employees’ career growth
competitive, 100% company-paid extended health and dental benefits for permanent employees with recent additions to promote inclusive coverage to a diverse employee population. These recent additions include gender affirmation and fertility drug and treatment coverage
membership in HOOPP’s world class defined benefit pension plan, which can serve as an important part of your retirement security
access to an annual wellness reimbursement program for health and wellness-related expenses for permanent employees
virtual fitness, yoga and meditation classes, nutritional consultations and wellness seminars
we offer a hybrid flexible work model that embraces remote work in Ontario for eligible roles
the opportunity to make a difference and help take care of those who care for us, by providing a financially secure retirement for Ontario healthcare workers
Job Summary

Reporting to the Senior Manager of Investment Data Management - Data Delivery, the Business Data Analyst will support mission critical functions of data operations and data governance ensuring the timely availability of accurate investment data for HOOPP.
The Business Data Analyst will ensure investment applications have complete information for business users daily. This includes monitoring and responding to the daily cycle of events, ensure data integrity and availability within investment applications, data reconciliation, pricing integrity, security master, integrity of reference data, market data and straight-through trade capture. Data governance practices ensures the integrity, usability and transparency of investment data. The Business Data Analyst will be involved in maintaining the investment data dictionary, reviewing data governance processes and practices keeping current on industry standards in the data governance space. The Business Data Analyst will assist in the design, build, support and use data quality checks in support of governance process and integrity of investment data across multiple systems. The Business Data Analyst will assist in the design and implementation of data quality best practices.
The position requires strong problem solving and analytical skills coupled with experience in the capital market space. The candidate should have solid investment operations knowledge, data loading and scheduling, managing reference data, market data and systems testing experience. The candidate should be SQL literate and comfortable navigating databases. This position requires the individual to be available at 7:00 a.m. to support the investment data management functions. This position also requires the individual to be on support during some holidays depending on investment market activity. There may also be the occasional weekend work for system testing or implementations.

What you will do:
Data Operations / Delivery
Ensure completeness of daily data jobs cycle. Work with IT in repairing failed jobs, re-running processes as required and optimizing scheduling.
Resolve data integrity issues on a timely basis, escalate as needed and work cross team to resolve issues. Candidate should be able to contribute to finding root causes and resolutions for improving controls and efficiency.
Respond timely, accurately and clearly to questions and problems that arise in the availability, integrity or completeness of Investment Data.
Review data integrity checks to assess potential data issues resident in the various investment applications. Create, develop, implement and test data quality checks, processes and procedures to manage data, content quality and reconciliation requirements.
For Production systems the Business Data Analyst is responsible for security master, reference data, maintaining tables and data translations. The controls must be executed for static data, pricing, market data and automated trade capture on an ongoing basis.
Participate in daily operational support scrums to ensure solid support of clients that support HOOPP's investment activities.
Data Excellence
Where changes to application functions are identified, the Business Data Analyst is responsible to work with IT by assisting in the preparation of specifications, providing test cases, testing finished product and signing off.
Document operational processes, data flows, controls and test cases and results.
Establish Partnerships
Develop effective working relationships with HOOPP’s investment management teams, operational teams, custodians, auditors, IT and external vendors and business partners.
Develop a detailed understanding of HOOPP’s investment business and the various systems and operation processes used to support it.
External Market Data Management
The Business Data Analyst will work closely with IT and vendors to ensure that the security reference manager, market data, and pricing data feeds meet or exceed HOOPP Data Standards.
Strong Data Governance
Actively monitor and execute data governance controls, this includes the ongoing maintenance of HOOPP’s investment data dictionary.
Contribute to the development of best practices and data governance standards.
Proactively validates data using exception handling tools and techniques. Contributes to the continuing improvement of data quality and identify opportunities to leverage new business tools to meet the challenges of a dynamic investment environment.
Work cross functionally with securities operations, financial and investment reporting, IT and external parties to ensure consistent state of accurate, timely and accessible investment data.
Backup
Primary back up and support for Senior Analysts as required.
Other duties as assigned related to continuing improvement plans and projects.

What you bring:
Knowledge of investment management principles and practices with solid knowledge of marketable securities, derivatives, private placements, infrastructure and real estate.
Experience in the capital market space. Your experience in investment operations, fund valuations or data operations will be especially valuable.
Highly analytical with strong consulting and problem-solving skills.
Solid communication skills verbal and written. Ability to understand and articulate complex topics.
Experience working with databases and knowledge of report development concepts.
Competency in SQL language.
Competency in Python a definite asset.
Advanced Excel knowledge using macros, pivot tables and lookup functions.
Proactive and results oriented with proven time management skills and the ability to work well under pressure and manage multiple tasks concurrently.
Post-secondary training in finance or equivalent experience. Completed the Canadian Securities Course. Enrolment or completion of professional training (CFA, BABOK) is not required though will be an asset.
3 to 5 years in investment and financial systems administration, implementation and reporting.
A team player. Must be able to work cross team.
Comprehensive understanding of middle and back-office processes and technical applications.
Competence with database report writers and software tools in the data quality and data governance space.
An understanding of the accounting and performance reporting requirements will be an asset to this position.
Experience with or proficiency with systems being utilized for the Investment business (SAP HANA, Eagle PACE, SIMCORP Dimension, Bloomberg, UC4, PagerDuty and SQL query analyzer).
This position requires an above average, technically inclined individual who is a self-starter and highly motivated to manage financial data/systems in an integrated environment.

Title: Business systems Analyst
Description:
System and data analysis experience with mapping current and existing data flows between systems.
Analytical skills with a bend to data flow documentation and…
Descriptions:
Get started on an exciting career at Element!
Element employees make a difference in the lives of others every day. We are re-defining the fleet management industry to be people first, then business – delivering on our promise of a superior client experience. This takes hard work and innovation, and we need more like-minded people on our team.
Business systems Analyst
What We Need

We are looking for a Business Systems Analyst to join Element Fleet Management. As the largest pure-play fleet manager in the world, we provide unmatched products and services and solutions to our clients.

At Element, employees play a critical role in delivering value to customers and ensuring an exceptional client experience. We are committed to the success of our clients, employees, and investors by fostering a culture where every employee can make a difference!

Are You:
A versatile, driven individual with high intellectual horsepower, strong communication, keen attention to detail, and well-honed business judgment
Someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment, seek to continuously improve the effectiveness of processes, and consistently deliver strong results

The Business Systems Analyst role serves as a liaison between the Business Analyst and software development teams. S/he translates the initial business requirement through analysis of interconnected systems to validate the functional and non-functional requirements and creates a set of technical specifications to aid in the solution design for implementation. S/he conducts an analysis of data, systems integration, and flows to support the creation of solutions and documentation including nonfunctional requirements.

A Day in the Life
Responsible for gathering and documenting functional and nonfunctional Specifications
Help to define the scope of assigned project work
Ensure that requirements are aligned to the technical specifications
Drive progress during the requirements stage of a project by ensuring all integrations points from a systems and data perspective are analyzed and documented in the technical specifications
Work with the business to determine use patterns and growth expectations to ensure there is documentation of the nonfunctional requirements of the project

Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in business, Computer Science, or 5+ years’ equivalent work experience
Strong facilitation and organizational skills
Excellent communication both verbal and written
Understanding of software development life cycle (multiple disciplines Agile/Scrum, waterfall etc.)
Analytical skills with a bend to data flow documentation and enterprise relationship documents
Experience in documenting technical specifications (functional and nonfunctional)
Experience with process improvement
Demonstrated problem solving skills
Systems/process knowledge with a strong emphasis on modern software design, including mobile products
Understanding and experience with analysis of legacy platforms, software, and hardware
System and data analysis experience with mapping current and existing data flows between systems
Knowledge of and hands-on experience with SAP S4/HANA a plus
#LI-REMOTE
#LI-TS1

A culture of innovation, empowerment, decision-making, and accountability
Comprehensive health and welfare benefits that serve the needs of you and your family and foster a culture of wellness
Additional benefits and amenities, including paid time-off programs (vacation, sick leave, and holidays)
Hybrid work environment for most positions

Title: Airbus Canada - Nouveau gradué - A220 Analyste Performance | New grad - Fleet Performance Analyst
Description:
Ability to analyze data and present key insights.
Create applications using data visualization tools to create new dashboards and reports.
Descriptions:
Job Description:
Nouveau Diplomé - A220 Analyste Performance
OBJECTIF GLOBAL
L'analyste soutiendra l'équipe dans le cadre d'initiatives et de projets visant à améliorer la fiabilité opérationnelle, la disponibilité des aéronefs et à réduire les coûts de maintenance de la flotte d'aéronefs A220. Le titulaire du poste sera principalement chargé d'analyser de grandes quantités de données et de présenter des informations clés à un public pluridisciplinaire, dans le but d'améliorer les performances de la flotte
PRINCIPALES RESPONSABILITÉS
Contrôler les performances de la flotte d'avions A220 en service à l'aide des données fournies par les compagnies aériennes et les fournisseurs
Soutenir les activités visant à optimiser la fiabilité opérationnelle, la disponibilité des aéronefs et les coûts directs de maintenance (DMC) de la flotte A220
Effectuer des analyses sur les systèmes et les composants de l'avion afin d'identifier les problèmes de fiabilité et de coûts de maintenance
Identifier des recommandations et/ou des actions correctives en collaboration avec d'autres départements et évaluer leur impact potentiel sur les performances de l'avion.
Mettre en place, créer et automatiser des rapports sur des compagnies aériennes, des systèmes ou des composants spécifiques et les présenter à une équipe pluridisciplinaire
Créer des applications à l'aide d'outils de visualisation de données pour créer de nouveaux tableaux de bord et rapports

PROFIL DE COMPETENCES
Education:
Bachelor en informatique, ingénierie, mathématiques ou dans une discipline technique connexe
Une expérience de la gestion des données, de l'analyse et de l'élaboration de requêtes est un atout.
Familiarité avec les outils analytiques tels qu'Excel ou SQL. Une expérience avec R ou Python est un atout.
Maîtrise de l'anglais, tant à l'oral qu'à l'écrit
La maîtrise du français est un atout.

Compétences professionnelles:
Excellentes compétences en matière de relations interpersonnelles, de communication et de présentation
Compétences avérées en matière de leadership
Capacité à analyser des données et à présenter des informations clés
Competences social :
Très motivé par l'assistance et les services à la clientèle
Bonne coordination et compétences interpersonnelles pour s'engager avec les clients, les partenaires commerciaux et universitaires, les fournisseurs et les autres départements d'Airbus.
Esprit d'équipe, adaptabilité, ouverture d'esprit et flexibilité
Team player who takes initiative, highly motivated with a sense of responsibility and good judgment
Débrouillard, capable de résoudre des problèmes et à l'aise pour fournir des solutions.
Veuillez télécharger votre curriculum vitae.
L'utilisation du genre masculin a été adoptée afin de faciliter la lecture et n'a aucune intention discriminatoire.
Airbus Canada souscrit au principe d'équité en matière d'emploi et encourage les femmes, les autochtones, les personnes handicapées et les membres des minorités visibles à soumettre leurs candidatures.
_____________________________________________________________________________
NEW GRADUATE - A220 Fleet Performance Analyst
BASIC PURPOSE
The analyst will support the team with initiatives and projects to improve operational reliability, aircraft availability, and reduce maintenance cost of the A220 aircraft Fleet. The jobholder will be primarily responsible for analyzing large amounts of data, and presenting key insights to a cross-disciplinary audience, with the purpose of driving fleet performance improvements.
MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES
Monitor the aircraft performance of A220 in-service aircraft fleet using data from airlines and suppliers
Support activities to optimize Operational Reliability, Aircraft Availability and Direct Maintenance Cost (DMC) of the A220 fleet
Perform analysis on aircraft systems and components to identify reliability and maintenance cost issues
Identify recommendation and/or corrective actions in collaboration with other department and evaluate their potential impact on aircraft performance
Set up, create and automate reports on specific airline, system or components and present to cross-disciplinary team
Create applications using data visualization tools to create new dashboards and reports

PERSONAL PROFILE
Educational Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or a related technical discipline
Experience in data management, analysis, and query development is an asset
Familiarity with analytical tools such as Excel or SQL. Experience in R or Python are an asset
Fluent in English, both oral and written
French is an asset

Professional skills:
Excellent interpersonal, communication and presentation skills
Demonstr
ated leadership skills
Ability to analyze data and present key insights
Behavioural skills :
Highly motivated by Customer support and services
Good coordination and interpersonal skills to engage with Customers, Business and Academic Partners, Suppliers and other Airbus departments.
Team player, adaptable, open-minded and flexible.
Team player who takes initiative, highly motivated with a sense of responsibility and good judgment.
Resourceful, problem solver and comfortable with providing solutions.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Knowledge of data warehouse/business intelligence concepts, architectural components is considered an asset.
Analyze data to provide insight and ad hoc reports…
Descriptions:
REALTOR.ca is the most popular real estate listing and information platform in Canada. It builds business for REALTOR® members and establishes consumer trust and loyalty by supporting Canadians through their home-buying and selling journeys. It operates under the guiding principles of delivering value to consumers and members and continually evolving to meet and exceed market expectations. REALTOR.ca is more than a listing service – it’s the nexus of the Canadian property buying and selling journey.
Summary
The Senior Business Systems Analyst supports the creation, enhancement, and maintenance of CREA’s IT Services by documenting requirements, contributing to system design, and assuming a leadership role throughout the Systems Development Life Cycle of REALTOR.ca and related products and services.
Function
This position is a rare opportunity to join the REALTOR.ca Analyst team. We are looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst who is personable, results-driven, and has proven leadership experience working across complex, multi-team projects. The Senior Business Systems Analyst has a strong background in Business Systems Analysis and Solutions Architecture and proven ability to perform in an Agile environment.
Core Competencies:
Leadership Skills
Business Analysis
Systems Analysis
Solutions Architecture
Data Analysis
Creative Problem Solver
Critical Thinker
Business and Technical Writing
Presentation Skills
Customer Service
Position Accountabilities
Lead a high-performing team of analysts
Lead the development and enhancement of REALTOR.ca and supporting technology solutions on behalf of REALTORS®, consumers and Real Estate Associations:
Organize and facilitate requirements gathering sessions with project stakeholders, team members and end-users.
Document requirements that meet the needs of the Business and Technology
Present solutions to key business stakeholders
Analyze data to provide insight and ad hoc reports to product managers and IT stakeholders
Take a leadership role in designing, planning, and coordinating projects that involve multiple scrum teams
Establish, improve, and enforce requirements standards within the Business Systems Analyst team
Participate in meetings related to product release activities
Contribute to the creation of QA and UAT test strategies.
Consult on integration and acceptance testing
Contribute to IT architecture, design, and product implementation activities.
Act as a liaison between Business, Development, and Quality Assurance teams.
Identify risks to project deadlines or budget.
Facilitate integration activities with external partner organizations and third-party vendors.
Contribute to assessing project scope and feasibility
Contribute to troubleshooting enhancement and production support-related issues
Mentor colleagues in documentation best practices
Motivate and support the team in achieving on-time, on-budget, on quality solutions
Advise on BSA team roles and responsibilities, including project assignments and scrum team balancing
Identify any issues and make recommendations to the IT management team
Contribute to the establishment and adherence to IT security best practices
Requirements
University degree (IT, IS, or business administration with IT focus) or equivalent certification or experience
At least 10 years experience as a Business Systems Analyst or similar role
Experience managing staff
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment
Advanced use of SQL
Proficient in written and spoken English; bilingualism an asset
Demonstrated track record with consumer-facing, web/mobile-based projects considered an asset
Knowledge of data warehouse/business intelligence concepts, architectural components is considered an asset
This is a Hybrid position, with a mixture of working on-site-minimum two (2) days per week and remotely.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those under consideration for the role will be contacted.

Title: HR Analyst, Operations
Description:
Handling sensitive data in accordance with data protection regulations.
Ability to use data to tell a compelling story, and disseminate trends and patterns…
Descriptions:
About The Salvation Army
Mission Statement
The Salvation Army exists to share the love of Jesus Christ, meet human needs and be a transforming influence in the communities of our world.
Vision Statement
We are an innovative partner, mobilized to share hope wherever there is hardship, building communities that are just and know the love of Jesus.
Core Values
The Salvation Army Canada and Bermuda has four core values:
Hope: We give hope through the power of the gospel of Jesus Christ.
Service: We reach out to support others without discrimination.
Dignity: We respect and value each other, recognizing everyone’s worth.
Stewardship: We responsibly manage the resources entrusted to us.
To learn more about the work of The Salvation Army (TSA), check us out at: The Salvation Army - About Us.
About the Position
The Human Relations function is committed to creating a work environment where people experience:
Meaningful work;
A sense of hope and optimism;
An environment of trust; and
Inspired results.
The HR Analyst will be responsible for delivering proactive business intelligence and management information to line managers and stakeholders which will inform the decisions of our HR business leaders in the Canada and Bermuda Territory.
The HR Analyst will work with internal stakeholders within the Human Resources function to maximize the effectiveness of key strategic and operational projects and grow the people-data reporting function and people analytics capability into a predictive and trend-focused approach.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Accuracy: Provide accurate data that can be relied upon to inform decisions, working with other members of the HR Operations team to improve data accuracy within the HR Information System (HRIS).
Data Protection: Ensure that all data is stored and shared in a safe way, adhering to General Data Protection Regulations.
Reporting: Act as a contact for people analytics, focus on producing data in an agile way that is tailored to the needs of each stakeholder.
People Cost, Headcount, Performance: Partner with key stakeholders to develop an accurate and clear methodology to track total people costs. Provide headcount data which is clear and instructive so that managers can more easily predict their staffing levels and costs year over year. Using data analysis tools, help identify high achievers within the organization.
Key HR Processes: Use data to contribute to the efficiency and effectiveness of key strategic projects and processes within the HR function e.g., benchmarking, organizational design, learning needs analysis, employee engagement etc.
Presentation of Data: Presenting data both electronically and in person which clearly articulates any findings, assumptions and suggestions that can be used effectively and practically by the stakeholder.
Management Information: Develop a reporting suite that can be accessed on a self-service basis by managers. Work with key stakeholders to deliver meaningful and tailored reporting that drives effectiveness by highlighting risks and trends against external benchmarking data.
Performance Through Data: Develop methods to track return on investment for people-related costs so that the organization can track where to invest its staffing costs and HR processes/initiatives. Provide people-related context and information which can help to influence future philosophy and strategy.
QUALIFICATIONS AND EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:
Completion of a university program in Human Resources
CHRP/CHRL designation is an asset
Process improvement certification is an asset (Lean, six sigma or equivalent)
Alternative combinations of education and experience may be considered.
A minimum of two (2)+ years of experience working within an HR function with in-depth knowledge of HR functions, products, and services
A minimum of two (2) years’ experience working in HRIS Reporting and Analytics
Workday, Oracle or Ultipro – Kronos (UKG) HRIS experience is an asset
Comprehensive knowledge of project management as well as process analysis and continuous improvement tools
Experience using data to identify trends based on benchmarks for people analytics
Advanced proficiency with the Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word, PowerPoint) required
Experience using reporting tools for the extraction and manipulation of data
Experience developing report suites to be access via self-service
Handling sensitive data in accordance with data protection regulations
Develop an understanding and support for the mission and purpose of The Salvation Army in Canada and its implications as related to position responsibilities.
PREFERRED SKILLS/CAPABILITIES:
Ability to communicate with various levels of the organization both written and verbally
Customer service focused, approachable, diplomatic, discrete
Reliable, pro-active, and resourceful
Ability to understand the nature of a request and provide suitable responses, information to a wide range of stakeholders
Able to work with ambiguity
Ability to use data to tell a compelling story, and disseminate trends and patterns based on large amounts of raw data
Detail-oriented and able to effectively organize, prioritize and plan
Strong ability to collaborate across teams to achieve common goals
Strong sense of integrity and confidentiality with professional ethics and a balanced sense of fairness and flexibility
Compensation
The target hiring range for this position is $60,421 to $75,527 with the ability to progress to a maximum of $90,632. Placement in the salary range will be based on factors such as market conditions, internal equity, and candidate experience, skills, and qualifications relevant to the role.
Other Details
The Salvation Army will provide reasonable accommodation upon request. Please let us know if you have a need for any accommodation.
We thank all applicants and will contact candidates selected for next steps. Internal Applicants, please speak with your manager about your intentions prior to submitting your application.

Salary: $60,000.00-$75,000.00 per year
Benefits:
Dental care
Employee assistance program
On-site parking
Paid time off
RRSP match
Vision care
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Work Location: Remote
Application deadline: 2023-03-31

Description:
Working with the development and technology teams to create conceptual data models and data flows.
Troubleshooting and optimizing data systems.
Descriptions:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Lead Business Analyst (Data Modeling)
Job Description
WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?
The Strategic Exploration Team was formed to perform discovery and analysis for future work ideas in Wealth Management Canada. The purpose of this team is to explore high level business ideas aligned with business goals and provide recommendations for the best technical and business solutions to meet their goals.
WHAT WILL YOU DO?
Translating business needs, processes and procedures into a workable system, and articulating on specific software requirements by communicating about these requirements with technology experts and business stakeholders.
Evaluating existing Wealth Management Canada back-end data systems for variances, discrepancies, and efficiency.
Working with the development and technology teams to create conceptual data models and data flows
Reviewing/Recommending modifications of existing systems for cross-compatibility
Recommending/Implementing data strategies
Developing physical end-to-end data model across Wealth Management Canada systems
Troubleshooting and optimizing data systems
Developing best practices for data coding to ensure consistency within the system
WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?

Business Analysis/Business Systems Analysis, Data Analysis/Data Modeling experience in complex programs across multiple systems or capabilities
Demonstrated ability in written and oral communication skills along with strong presentation skills. Ability to determine the information and communication needs of the audience
Strong strategic, analytical, and technical experience
A strong understanding of technology and/or financial services industry
Deadline-driven and results-oriented; able to meet consistently high quality standards while handling a variety of tasks and deadlines simultaneously

Nice-to-have:
Experience in a matrix environment, such as a large, publicly traded corporation
Ability to facilitate between and influence key decision makers at all levels
Strategic thinker with excellent interpersonal skills to work across functions and businesses
What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
A world-class training program in financial services
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work

Title: Data Analyst Health Surveillance
Description:
Ability to write data management and analysis programs using data programming tools such as SAS or R.
Experience managing and querying data in large relational…
Descriptions:
Data Analyst Health Surveillance

BC Centre for Disease Control
Vancouver, BC

In accordance with the Mission, Vision and Values, and strategic directions of Provincial Health Services Authority patient safety is a priority and a responsibility shared by everyone at PHSA, and as such, the requirement to continuously improve quality and safety is inherent in all aspects of this position. The Data Analyst, working within a designated service line, provides data management and maintenance services, ensures quality and integrity of data for the various information systems, performs regular analysis of data, and supports information system use by departmental staff. The Data Analyst reports to the Coordinator for Data Standards and Integration, and has a functional relationship to the service line the Analyst is assigned to.

What you’ll do
Performs data management and preparation activities, including data extraction, transformation, and documentation. Develops and maintains data collection and recording systems such as databases, spreadsheets, and web-sites, including designing ad hoc reports. Writes computer code and data queries to capture and edit data, and/or liaises with information systems department for same. Creates analytic reporting tools to allow internal and external users to analyze data. Receives and responds to ongoing requests to evaluate data, systems, processes and procedures. Automates routine data management tasks using standard programming tools.
Performs descriptive analyses and produces summaries and analytical reports using statistical software and coding, identifying all data limitations that apply. Identifies issues, trends, and developments. Communicates findings to Centre staff and external stakeholders at the local, provincial and federal level. Automates routine analyses using standard programming tools.
Monitors data quality in the information systems like the Public Health Information System and disease databases, proactively identifies and communicates anomalies that indicate data quality issues, and ensures that data used for analysis purposes or distributed to stakeholders is of the highest quality possible. Follows up with regional health authorities on missing, erroneous, and duplicate data to achieve high quality data. Corrects data errors in a timely manner. Documents processes for these procedures.
Prepares and maintains documentation and reports such as user guides, procedure manuals, metadata, code documentation, data security policies and data dictionaries.
Supports data security by assigning and deleting access for various applications and network file systems. Ensures the secure transfer of patient data to stakeholders when authorized to.
Assists as needed with gathering data, entering data, researching historical and archival data, accessing on-line databases, performing interviews, and obtaining data from national, provincial and local agencies and individuals. Links data from separate sources such as the client registry and MSP.
Provides training and user support to users on software applications used by department staff. Attains high-level proficiency with the centre’s data warehouse and related tools in order to train and support staff in the assigned service line.
Maintains the departmental content on the Inter, Extra and Intra nets. Recommends and implements changes to, and development of, web sites, and web site content. Adds links, URLs, PDFs, MS Excel files, word documents and graphics to web sites using html programming language.
Participates in review, critique/ enhancement identification, documentation, and planning of systems such as the centre’s data warehouse, providing information about data requirements and workflows as needed.
Coordinates the placement of the rotating co-op student in the department, provides orientation, assigns and oversees their activities, and evaluates their performance.
Performs other related duties as assigned.

What you bring
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Health Information Science or Computer Science or equivalent and three (3) years’ experience as a data analyst/scientist, preferably in community health and/or the health information field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Skills & Knowledge
Commitment to upholding the shared responsibility of creating lasting and meaningful reconciliation in Canada as per TRC (2015) and BC's Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples Act (2019).
As a strong asset for consideration, we are looking for our successful candidate to have: Knowledge of social, economic, political and historical realities impacting indigenous communities and familiarity with Indigenous Cultural Safety and anti-racism and accompanying reports (BC DRIPA, TRC, etc.).
Ability to write data management and analysis programs using data programming tools such as SAS or R.
Experience managing and querying data in large relational or multidimensional databases and data warehouses an asset.
Ability to create data visualizations.
Knowledge of standard software packages, spreadsheet, statistical, graphical, database, communication and web software.
Knowledge of descriptive statistics.
Knowledge of PC systems and applications.
Familiarity with health-related terminology.
Ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing.
Ability to operate related equipment
Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
What we bring

Every PHSA employee enables the best possible patient care for our patients and their families. Whether you are providing direct care, conducting research, or making it possible for others to do their work, you impact the lives of British Columbians today and in the future. That’s why we’re focused on your care too – offering health, wellness, development programs to support you – at work and at home.
Join one of BC’s largest employers with province-wide programs, services and operations – offering vast opportunities for growth, development, and recognition programs that honour the commitment and contribution of all employees.
Access to professional development opportunities through our in-house training programs, including +2,000 courses, such as our San’yas Indigenous Cultural Safety Training course, or Core Linx for Leadership roles.
Enjoy a comprehensive benefits package, including municipal pension plan, and psychological health & safety programs and holistic wellness resources.
Annual statutory holidays (13) with generous vacation entitlement and accruement.
PHSA is a remote work friendly employer, welcoming flexible work options to support our people (eligibility may vary, depending on position).
Access to WorkPerks, a premium discount program offering a wide range of local and national discounts on electronics, entertainment, dining, travel, wellness, apparel, and more.

What we do
The Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) plans, manages and evaluates specialized health services with the BC health authorities to provide equitable and cost-effective health care for people throughout the province. Our values reflect our commitment to excellence and include: Respect people – Be compassionate – Dare to innovate – Cultivate partnerships – Serve with purpose.

Learn more about PHSA and our programs: jobs.phsa.ca/programs-and-services

PHSA is committed to employment equity, encouraging all qualified individuals to apply. We recognize that our ability to provide the best care for our diverse patient populations relies on a rich diversity of skills, knowledge, background and experience, and value a safe, inclusive and welcoming environment.

Reconciliation is an ongoing process and a shared responsibility for all of us. The BC Governments’ unanimous passage of the Declaration on the Rights of Indigenous Peoples Act was a significant step forward in this journey—one that all health authorities are expected to support as we work in cooperation with Indigenous Peoples to establish a clear and sustainable path to lasting reconciliation. True reconciliation will take time and ongoing commitment to work with Indigenous Peoples as they move toward self-determination. Guiding these efforts Crown agencies must remain focused on creating opportunities that implement the Truth and Reconciliation Commission Mandate.

Title: Business Analyst – EDI
Description:
We are looking for a Business Analyst to work with clients to validate data files moving through LBMX’s data network.
Report status on all projects.
Descriptions:
LBMX is growing again . . .
We are seeking a Business Analyst – EDI

LBMX is a dynamic and growing software solutions company with an international perspective, located in London, Ontario. As we continue our growth trajectory, we are seeking talented, compassionate, and driven individuals to join our team as a Business Analyst in our EDI department.
We have done well, and we have an even more exciting future. That means we want our newest employees to be a great fit with who we are and where we want to go. We want to offer careers to good people, who strive for a work-life balance, care about doing a good job, and enjoy being part of a team where you and your hard work are valued. Come and help us make LBMX a better company and an even better place to work!

Position Description:

LBMX is the leading private marketplace provider for Buying Groups and Purchasing Co-operatives. These marketplaces are designed to electronically connect the members of buying groups with their supplier partners.
We are looking for a Business Analyst to work with clients to validate data files moving through LBMX’s data network. They will also coordinate and manage the parties and activities involved in projects they are responsible for. A high level of computer competency is required but no experience in computer programming is necessary.
Successful candidates must possess superior verbal and written communication skills and be committed to providing an exceptional customer experience. Successful candidates will also have strong people and organizational skills and be comfortable as an effective member of a productive team.
Successful candidates will join the team at our London, Ontario office.

Responsibilities:
Facilitate meetings with customers, identify requirements, and provide project updates.
Report status on all projects.
Configure customer accounts.
Resolve daily document and file errors by analyzing the root cause and communicating to the appropriate party.
Act as a primary contact for internal and external customers.
Follow-up and correspond with customers as required to meet project deadlines.
Act as an advocate for customers within internal meetings and discussions.
Demonstrate commitment and professional approach to providing excellent customer service.
Skill Requirements:
Ability to review and comprehend technical business requirements documentation.
Understanding of basic business documents such as invoices, purchase orders, purchase order confirmations, etc.
Strong attention to detail. Effective problem-solving and problem-prevention skills.
Strong verbal skills and ability to develop rapport with people over the phone and through video messaging software such as Microsoft Teams.
Enthusiastically work closely with others in a positive team environment.
Independently manage multiple projects from start to finish, while managing time effectively to meet deadlines.
Competent and comfortable in the use of computers, including standard business software such as Excel, Outlook, and Word.
Willingness to eagerly take on new tasks as required.
Proven ability to self-manage and function effectively in a professional environment.
Must be fluent in English (reading and writing).

Experience Required:
Two or more years of relevant job experience including but not limited to supply chain management, IT project management, business analyst, systems analyst, accounting, etc.
OR Post secondary education (Diploma or University Degree) in accounting, business management, supply chain management, computer science/programming

Nice to Have:
Experience working with a remote team would be considered an asset
Understanding of data files in various forms (i.e. CSV, Excel, XML, etc.) and accompanying file layouts.
Exposure to various Accounting/ERP/POS systems (Infor SXe, Epicor Eclipse, SAP, etc.)
Familiarity with EDI standards (X12, EDIFACT) and data transport protocols (FTP, AS2, VAN, etc.)
Knowledge of using JIRA, Salesforce, and Zendesk

The Perks of Working with us!
Competitive salary
Extended benefits including a health spending account and employee assistance program
3 weeks vacation to start with additional paid “LBMX holidays” throughout the year, plus flexible summer hours
Company matched GRSP contributions
Education subsidies for job related courses
Maternity/Parental and Compassionate Care Leave Top Up Program
Flexible work options including a $500 Staples Allowance for new hires and a monthly in-office benefit to subsidize commutes
Quarterly company wide outings (golf, baseball games, laser tag, tail gating, etc.)
A healthy work/life balance
Named one of Canada’s Top 100 Small & Medium Employers (2022)

About LBMX Inc.

At LBMX, we care about shared prosperity and believe in the power of independent businesses and their buying groups to create sustained economic growth. This belief comes from two decades of providing the world’s only group focused technology and advisory services to help buying groups, purchasing cooperatives and their independent businesses flourish.
We are a leading business marketplace experience provider that helps independent businesses, their buying groups and suppliers buy better and sell more. Our premier solution has transformed billing and ordering, rebate programs management, real-time analytics, e-commerce and product information management across industries including building materials, sporting goods, industrial manufacturing, food equipment, grocery, agricultural, and more.

LBMX is based in London, Canada and has customers throughout Canada, United States, United Kingdom, Australia and New Zealand.

LBMX is committed to providing a fair and equitable work environment and encourages applications from qualified women, men, visible minorities, aboriginal peoples and persons with disabilities. LBMX is also committed to providing accommodations throughout the interview and employment process. If you require any accommodations, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Adians think about how every decision they make will impact our customers and go the extra mile to deliver an exceptional customer experience. It does not matter if you are a new or seasoned Adian. We welcome diverse perspectives and encourage each other to speak up. Title: Business Analyst - Phama Technical, GxP/CSV Specialist
Description: Ø Strives for harmonization of business processes across numerous sites/locations and departments by propagating common standardized data models, applications,…
Descriptions:
The Business Analyst (BA) is a self-starter with expert BA capabilities and extensive experience in delivering validated (CSV) IT products in a highly regulated GMP environment. They must be a polished negotiator, leader, and communicator when partnering with Roche/Genentech’s global business units. Experienced in Agile SCRUM or Scaled Agile methodology. You will work closely with Supply Chain / Operations, partner management, and affiliate teams and collaborate with IT Business Partners and/or Product Managers in business development activities. This includes but is not limited to translating business strategy into ERP-enabled solutions, portfolio management processes, feasibility studies, and clarifying available technology/ processes in place. You will be assigned to a program called CGTi which stands for Cell & Gene Therapy Industrialization.
CGTi is a newer and evolving business unit of Roche/Genentech. It is a fast-paced change filled environment within a globally matrixed organization that requires an open and flexible mindset.
Responsibilities:
Ø Demonstrate knowledge of current GxP requirements and documentation standards, with the ability to write user stories and user acceptance tests that are validation ready (CSV), and ensure compliance of change requests to the change management procedures.
Ø Acts as an interface between business and IT functions and is a contact point for business leads in order to launch initiatives and deliver validated GxP functionality.
Ø Collaborate with IT Product Managers, stakeholders, Product Owner, and development team - Developers, Testers, IT Architects, External Vendors, and Adoption Services.
Ø Displays skills and capabilities in the area of business partnering and/or product management.
Ø Strong track record to perform detail-oriented work with a high degree of accuracy and able to explain complex concepts with clarity and simplicity
Ø Analysis of user stories and solution proposals.
Ø Strives for harmonization of business processes across numerous sites/locations and departments by propagating common standardized data models, applications, and technologies that are in line with the cross-functional or IT strategies and architectures.
Ø Explore opportunities and take additional roles as squad lead as appropriate.
Ø Ensures delivery in line with Project and launch timelines of the IT solutions
Candidate requirements:
Ø Project-based work experience in pharmaceutical, healthcare, or life sciences companies
Ø Experience with delivery of GxP/CSV business/end-user applications
Ø Strong communication skills and the ability to train/coach others - fluent in written and spoken English
Ø Familiar with Manufacturing, Quality, intercompany order processing, and outbound logistics processes.
Ø Experience with implementing ERP (SAP) and integration technologies (e.g. Mulesoft).
Ø Prior experience with cell & gene therapy supply chains, patient access and/or physician portals is a plus.
Ø Experience with HP ALM, Jira and Agile (SCRUM, SAFe) ways of working / delivery
Ø Familiar with development,, testing and DevOPs processes - ability to understand technical processes
Ø Constantly looking for improvements in ways of working (Process/tools/organization) and works independently.
Ø Travel Requirement - 20% (as needed)
Must Have:
Ø GXP standards with CSV within pharmaceutical, healthcare or life sciences industry
Ø Familiar with Manufacturing, Quality, Intercompany order processing and outbound logistics
Ø Polished communicator and stakeholder management within an Agile organization

8 hour shift

As part of your role, you’ll be comfortable with numbers, analysis and continuously looking to improve our data collection methods and analytic practices.

BECOME PART OF OUR TEAM

Here at BRP, we’re creating new ways to get people moving forward, where their experiences are measured by emotion rather than distance. All around the world, our products, achievements and aspirations are a reflection of our teams’ unique expertise. Want to bring your true self on this adventure?

Participate in business and executive meetings to gather requirements and make recommendations around reporting/BI solutions.

THIS ROLE IS A GOOD FIT IF YOU HAVE THE FOLLOWING SKILLS AND QUALITIES:

A bachelor’s degree in a quantitative discipline (mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, finance).

3+ years business and data analyst experience.

Experience identifying trends and developing a story to connect the dots.

Strong interpersonal and communication skills.

Attention to detail and the ability to effectively multitask in a deadline-driven atmosphere.

Fluency in English (French an asset).

Do you have other qualifications? Tell us what is unique about you that is a great addition to the team.

Does this sound like you? We look forward to receiving your application.

AT BRP, WHEN WE TALK ABOUT BENEFITS, WE GO ALL IN.

Let’s start with a strong foundation — You want it, we have it:

Annual bonus: we work hard, and we know it. This yearly thank you is our way to fuel your dreams.

Generous paid time away: winding down is as important as creating the future of recreational products.

Pension plan: we want to make sure you’ll enjoy retirement; we’ve got you covered.

Collective saving opportunities: being part of BRP allows you to tap into the strength of our saving programs.

Industry leading healthcare: fully paid by BRP, this program is here for you, whatever happens, so you can focus on what matters.

What about some feel good extras:
Flexible work schedule: balance is key to innovation, and we want to make sure you are at the top of your game with a schedule that will work for you.

Summer schedule: time flies at BRP, so we hit pause to enjoy it.

Holiday season shutdown: between Christmas and New Year’s, we close our facilities and refill on good times.

Educational resources: you love what you do, and we get you resources to stay cutting-edge, so we all win together.

Discount on BRP products: what we build is amazing, freeing, revolutionary, and you're first in line for the experience.

WELCOME TO BRP

We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce made up of close to 20,000 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey.

Title: Business Analyst
Description: Documenting solution features, specifications, KPIs/metrics and reporting requirements utilizing user stories, use cases, current and future state process flows…
Descriptions:
Utilize your Expertise as a Business Analysis Professional
To Improve Processes, Products, Services and Software

CPA Ontario is currently in search of a Business Analyst who will be responsible for actively engaging with business users, IT, and subject matter experts (SMEs) to identify, capture, and recommend improvements to business requirements, process workflows, and other specifications to create or improve the services, products, and technologies used. In this role, you will also analyze and interpret data, reengineer business processes, support the development of strategies, and provide insights to help the organization make informed decisions.
What You’ll Be Doing:
Facilitating sessions with stakeholders to document detailed business analysis, outlining issues, opportunities, and possible solutions.
Developing end-to-end process maps highlighting the stakeholders’ interactions to identify business capabilities, functions executed, systems and applications used, and data involved.
Documenting solution features, specifications, KPIs/metrics and reporting requirements utilizing user stories, use cases, current and future state process flows, data maps, data dictionaries, requirement traceability matrix, wireframes, etc.
Leading the scrum team and assisting in sprint planning by actively mitigating or removing roadblocks and monitoring the developed solutions for alignment with initiative objectives at all stages.
Managing requirements backlog for iterative agile delivery, refining and reprioritizing product backlog items to accommodate urgent business needs, shifting priority and resource fluctuation; assessing change requests and impacts; negotiating trade-offs with other teams.
Developing test plans, test cases, and supporting testing activities, providing a holistic view of test strategy and test data, reviewing test results, and removing any roadblocks.
Serving as a solution ambassador by collaborating with cross-functional teams for solution implementation, integration, and supporting organizational change management activities.
Who You Are:
A post-secondary graduate in Business, Computer Science, or other related discipline along with agile and scrum certifications. Lean or Six Sigma Certification is considered an asset.
An IIBA certified professional with a minimum of 5 years progressive experience in business analysis or product management positions with a strong focus on information technology projects.
Extremely well-versed in business analysis, business process management, quality assurance, project delivery practices, and standards across the project lifecycle.
Experienced with Jira and software solution lifecycle methodology including agile and waterfall development; ITIL certification is considered an asset.
A skilled presenter with strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills, and able to deliver proposals, gather business requirements and contribute perspective to support the stakeholder decision-making process.
An outstanding communicator – both written and verbal - with well-developed influencing skills to drive dialogue with business partners while also understanding their underlying needs and requirements while managing their expectations.
What We Offer:
A fast-paced environment. Collaboration, innovation and passionate professionals are at our core. We relentlessly pursue what’s next to unlock the full potential of you and us together.
Flexible work environments. As part of our Hybrid work culture, we provide flexible, remote work options to support you in your career, in addition to in-office teamwork and collaboration.
Diversity and inclusion. We recognize the value in our differences and prioritize inclusivity to bring together the best talent to protect the public, advance the profession and enable CPAs to lead business and society forward.
Ongoing learning and career growth. We want your career to skyrocket. We support unlimited career advancement and professional development opportunities with learning investments to promote your future growth. Thrive with us.
Focus on your well-being. With industry leading benefits and wellness programs, including a healthy lifestyle allowance, mental health resources and more, we’re committed to your well-being.
Who We Are:
We protect the public. We advance the profession. We enable CPAs to lead business and society forward. We ensure that our 100,000 members and 21,000 students meet the highest standards of integrity and expertise. We help them stay ahead of global market trends and abreast of regulatory change. CPAs represent a globally recognized, premium designation. Our Chartered Professional Accountants are valued by organizations in all industries for their financial expertise, strategic thinking, management skills and leadership. We believe that success happens when both business and society benefit. For information on the profession visit: cpaontario.ca.
We Appreciate Your Interest In CPA Ontario And This Position:
At CPA Ontario, we are committed to building high-performance teams. Our selection process is thorough, and all candidate applications are reviewed. Should your qualifications and experience meet the requirements of this role, a member of our recruitment team will contact you. We encourage you to set up CPA Ontario job alerts for positions that align to your experience and career goals.
CPA Ontario is an inclusive employer. Accommodation is available under the Ontario Human Rights Code. If you require a disability-related accommodation to participate in the recruitment process, please email accessibility@cpaontario.ca with “Accommodation Required” in the subject line to provide your contact information. A member of the Recruitment team will contact you within 48 hours.

Title: Pricing Analyst
Description: As a Pricing Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing pricing data and developing pricing strategies to optimize business profitability.
Descriptions:
Company Description
Gentek is a leading manufacturer and distributor of vinyl/aluminum siding, windows, and other exterior home improvement products. With 3 manufacturing facilities and 22 distribution branches in Canada, we pride ourselves on providing our customers with superior service. This can only be achieved by having a fantastic group of employees and we know that they deserve a great work experience, which we strive to provide.
As a Pricing Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing pricing data and developing pricing strategies to optimize business profitability. Your duties will include reviewing and monitoring pricing structures; researching market trends to conduct competitive analysis; and collaborating with cross-functional teams to provide data-driven insights and recommendations. You will also be responsible for tracking and evaluating pricing performance, making adjustments as needed, and preparing reports for senior management.
Job Description
Review invoice line items and follow up on those with low or negative margins
Analyze and approve/reject orders that require special pricing
Assist in special project related to window pricing (OMNI project)
Establish a daily process for identifying and correcting pricing discrepancies
Standardize project pricing across Canada
Monitor and evaluate competitor pricing strategies and market trends to inform pricing decisions
Establishing and maintaining relationships with sales reps to gain insight on regional pricing
Prepare pricing reports for senior management and other stakeholders
Create a dashboard to maintain and track average selling prices, costs, and margins
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, or a related field
2+ years of experience in pricing analysis, finance, or a related field preferred
Strong analytical skills and attention to detail
Excellent communication and collaboration skills
Initiative and ownership on tasks and the ability to work independently
Proficiency in Microsoft Office specifically Excel
Advanced Power BI skills an asset
Additional Information
Gentek is growing. Come grow with us. The people at Gentek are the difference. If you are interested in joining our team please respond with cover letter and resume.
Accommodations for applicants with disability available upon request.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst

Knowledge of data warehouse/business intelligence concepts, architectural components is considered an asset.

Descriptions:
REALTOR.ca is the most popular real estate listing and information platform in Canada. It builds business for REALTOR® members and establishes consumer trust and loyalty by supporting Canadians through their home-buying and selling journeys. It operates under the guiding principles of delivering value to consumers and members and continually evolving to meet and exceed market expectations. REALTOR.ca is more than a listing service – it’s the nexus of the Canadian property buying and selling journey.
Summary
The Senior Business Systems Analyst supports the creation, enhancement, and maintenance of CREA’s IT Services by documenting requirements, contributing to system design, and assuming a leadership role throughout the Systems Development Life Cycle of REALTOR.ca and related products and services.
Function
This position is a rare opportunity to join the REALTOR.ca Analyst team. We are looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst who is personable, results-driven, and has proven leadership experience working across complex, multi-team projects. The Senior Business Systems Analyst has a strong background in Business Systems Analysis and Solutions Architecture and proven ability to perform in an Agile environment.
Core Competencies:
Leadership Skills
Business Analysis
Systems Analysis
Solutions Architecture
Data Analysis
Creative Problem Solver
Critical Thinker
Business and Technical Writing
Presentation Skills
Customer Service
Position Accountabilities
Lead a high-performing team of analysts
Lead the development and enhancement of REALTOR.ca and supporting technology solutions on behalf of REALTORS®, consumers and Real Estate Associations:
Organize and facilitate requirements gathering sessions with project stakeholders, team members and end-users.
Document requirements that meet the needs of the Business and Technology
Present solutions to key business stakeholders
Analyze data to provide insight and ad hoc reports to product managers and IT stakeholders
Take a leadership role in designing, planning, and coordinating projects that involve multiple scrum teams
Establish, improve, and enforce requirements standards within the Business Systems Analyst team
Participate in meetings related to product release activities
Contribute to the creation of QA and UAT test strategies.

Contribute to assessing project scope and feasibility
Contribute to troubleshooting enhancement and production support-related issues
Mentor colleagues in documentation best practices
Motivate and support the team in achieving on-time, on-budget, on quality solutions
Advise on BSA team roles and responsibilities, including project assignments and scrum team balancing
Identify any issues and make recommendations to the IT management team
Contribute to the establishment and adherence to IT security best practices
Requirements
University degree (IT, IS, or business administration with IT focus) or equivalent certification or experience
At least 10 years experience as a Business Systems Analyst or similar role
Experience managing staff
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment
Advanced use of SQL
Proficient in written and spoken English; bilingualism an asset
Demonstrated track record with consumer-facing, web/mobile-based projects considered an asset
Knowledge of data warehouse/business intelligence concepts, architectural components is considered an asset
This is a Hybrid position, with a mixture of working on-site-minimum two (2) days per week and remotely.

Title: BUSINESS ANALYST
Description:
Monitoring CSDS data quality for accountability reporting;
Supporting the CSDS business owner in completing the application maintenance plan to ensure system…
Descriptions:
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH
BUSINESS ANALYST
PAY BAND 5
OPEN COMPETITION
(An alternate work location may be considered within New Brunswick)
The Department of Health is seeking an individual to join the Addiction and Mental Health Branch as a Senior Business Analyst. The role is an important position in the implementation of the Stepped Care Model accountability framework.
The Business Analyst will work collaboratively with the Addiction and Mental Health Branch Team, Regional Health Authorities, Health Analytics, and other government partners on the collection of data and information, developing of key performance measures and leading the development of dashboards to assist in the evaluation of performance in the delivery of programs and services to New Brunswickers who suffer from an addiction and mental health illness.
The successful candidate will report to the Addiction and Mental Health Branch and will be responsible for:
Understanding the Addiction and Mental Health business processes and information management system workflow, identifying gaps and assist in the development of future improvements for monitoring services;
Working collaboratively in the development and implementation of standards within the workflow of services such as data collection requirements for each level of service intensity;
Assisting in the development and implementation of performance indicators for these services within the Stepped Care Model accountability framework;
Leading the Addiction and Mental Health Indicator Working Group;
Leading and supporting the development of reports and dashboard requirement specifications for the Stepped Care Model accountability framework;
Organizing testing and completing result documentation for the CSDS Maintenance Team, and/or Health Analytics;
Monitoring CSDS data quality for accountability reporting;
Developing and delivering dashboard training.
Reviewing data requests, coordinating, and analyzing the output, and responding to the requestor (ex: Health council, RHA, etc.);
Supporting the CSDS business owner in completing the application maintenance plan to ensure system changes for new/modification of data measures are implemented in a timely manner;
Other related duties.
This position requires a strong organizational and results oriented individual who has statistical, analytical, interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to summarize and present data analysis and findings as well as lead and implement standards within an operation. The individual must be able to work independently and as part of a team.
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or Information Technology and a minimum of five (5) years related experience. An equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered.
Written and spoken competence in English is required. Please state your language capability on your application.
Applicants must clearly demonstrate the essential qualifications to be given further consideration. Please ensure that preferred language for assessment is identified on your resume.
In the event that this competition poses difficulties in recruiting a qualified candidate, a covering off appointment at a lower level may be made. In that case, candidates with less than the required related years of experience may also be considered.
ASSET QUALIFICATIONS: Preference may be given to candidates that demonstrate the following asset qualification:
Project Management.
Subject to the response to this competition, candidates may be required to demonstrate on their application the asset qualification in addition to the essential qualifications in order to be given further consideration.
BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES: The successful candidate will possess the following behavioural competencies:
Analytical thinking/judgment;
Strategic thinking;
Results orientation.
TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES: The successful candidate will possess the following technical competencies:
Records and information management;
Planning and organizing skills;
Knowledge of auditing.
Résumés should be in chronological order specifying education and employment in months and years including part-time and full-time employment.
Salary: $61,204 to $85,514 per annum
We encourage applicants to apply on-line at https://www.ere.gnb.ca/competition.aspx?lang=E&t=Y or by mail at the following address by April 2, 2023 indicating competition number 35-22-0094. This competition may be used to fill future vacancies at the same level.
Department of Health
Human Resources
4th floor, 520 King Street
Fredericton, NB E3B 5G8
Telephone: (506) 453-4331
E-Mail: HR-RH.DH-MS@gnb.ca
We thank all those who apply however only those selected for further consideration will be contacted.
Candidates registered with the Equal Employment Opportunity Program and veterans, who demonstrate they are among the most qualified, shall be given preference at the time of appointment.
We promote a scent-reduced environment.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.
