Title: Compensation Analyst
Description: Proven experience working with compensation surveys (submitting survey data, analyzing data, creating benchmarks).
Descriptions:
About the Role:
Sama's People Team is committed to creating a first-class HR service for employees and leaders globally. The Compensation Analyst role is no exception to this mission - we are looking for a detail-oriented and passionate person who will help us perfect our compensation offerings and best practices. The ideal candidate is resourceful, analytical, and flexible, with an appetite for making changes and building out best practices.
Responsibilities
Own, maintain and periodically update compensation benchmarks across the organization by analyzing data from various sources and updating data accordingly
Identify, analyze and create new compensation benchmarks according to business need and growth
Provide ad-hoc compensation recommendations to leaders, Talent Acquisition Partners & HRBPs as needed
Work with HRBPs in all GEOs on compensation related projects, deliverables and requests (NA/EUR/ASIA/AFRICA)
Develop, own and maintain a tool or location to host compensation data and benchmarks
Create and work with manager to send promotion letters when applicable
In partnership with HR Leadership and E-Team, develop, articulate and implement Sama's Total Rewards philosophy
Assist HRBP team in end-of-year planning for salary increases
Partner with the People Operations Specialist to negotiate benefits and act as a benefits expert for all employees at Sama
In partnership with People Operations team, continuously improve and negotiate benefits offerings in all Sama locations;
MInimum Qualifications
3+ years of relevant experience, with 1-2 years within a Compensation or Total Rewards function
Experience using various sources to identify compensation data
Proven experience working with compensation surveys (submitting survey data, analyzing data, creating benchmarks)
Ability to complete detailed research and explain findings in a concise manner
Capable of solving problems efficiently without additional supervision
Demonstrates exceptional judgment
Strong understanding of Compensation best practices, programs and interventions
Outstanding decision-making skills
Highly dedicated and responsive; demonstrates outstanding follow-through and the ability to quickly and effectively get the job done
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working with benefits administrators/vendors & negotiating benefits offerings
Capability to carry out and/or lead projects and initiatives as both a project lead and key contributor

About Sama
Sama provides high-quality training data that powers AI technology for Fortune 2000 companies such as Google, Walmart, Ford, Microsoft, and Marriott. We're experts in data curation and data annotation for 2D and 3D image, video, and sensor data for machine learning algorithms.. Sama offers the highest quality SLAs in the industry, along with cutting-edge ML-assisted annotation tools, QA processes, and security and compliance standards.
Founded in 2008 on the belief that "talent is equally distributed, but opportunity is not", Sama is driven by the mission to expand opportunities for those who are underprivileged. As a certified B-corp, Sama has provided worker training programs to increase economic opportunity for more than 13,000 people from underserved communities. By connecting our customers with amazing talent in East Africa, we've impacted more than 59,000 workers and their dependents.
Today, our vision is to provide data scientists, ML engineers, and data operations teams with an indispensable, integrated platform for AI data preparation, labeling, and collection.
For more information, visit www.sama.com.
More information can be found at:
Featured in Forbes: How Ethical Is Your AI?
Sama Honored on Inc. Magazine's Annual List of America's Fastest-Growing Private Companies — the Inc. 5000
Reversing Poverty - Ted Talk by our founder Leila Janah
Our Culture:
Sama is quite unique. We are a technology company with a social mission. People that thrive in a high-growth environment, love working on the bleeding edge of technology, and really care about having a positive impact on the world are a great fit for the Sama culture. Our core values are One Team, One Goal - Deliver. Period. - Trust & Transparency - Customer First - Humanity.
Our Benefits:
Sama offers competitive compensation commensurate with experience and a full benefits package, including: medical, dental, and vision insurance, long-term disability insurance, life, and AD&D insurance, employer-matching Group RRSP, generous holiday and vacation policies, sabbaticals, a monthly fitness stipend, and professional development opportunities.
At Sama, we pride ourselves in being a diverse and equal opportunity employer.

Title: Senior Revenue Operations Analyst
Description:
A passion for data, data visualization and strong attention to detail.
Experience as an analyst, or prior educational experience related to data & visualization…
Descriptions:
Loopio is a workplace that unleashes learning & growth opportunities for our Loopers. We provide autonomous, challenging work that allows each employee to master their craft. We attract and retain people who are naturally curious, have grit and are eager to grow and build their careers. At Loopio, we genuinely support each other, because true success comes from working as #oneteam.

Revenue Operations at Loopio serves as the connective tissue across the organization, offering critical insights, data and analysis to support our ambitious growth. With high visibility, and the ability to drive impact cross functionally - our team supports both internal and external customers through systems, data and processes. With data driven decision making at the core of how we operate, this role is critical for the business. We are looking for a curious Senior Revenue Operations Analyst that is passionate about data analysis and a deep desire to help our team continue to make an impact across the organization!

What You'll Be Doing
Act as a key pillar on the Revenue Operations team, supporting our charter to drive key business outcomes effectively and efficiently
Independently gather and interpret data to surface clearly articulated insights, identify and recommended areas of improvement, and work with the business to prioritize the improvements based on business impact
Build custom reports for senior leadership as needed to surface critical business insights and to enable leaders to quickly move from insight to action
Work directly with CX, Sales, Marketing and Finance managers to support alignment, and leverage data in order to support their objectives and key results
Partner closely with Revenue Operations Specialists to help drive strategic projects forward through the collection of relevant data insights
Support with revenue metrics gathering and visualization for weekly company wide meetings, monthly metrics reviews and quarterly board decks
Engage in research using data from multiple internal and external sources to support initiatives and uncover business insights
Create and maintain metrics reports and dashboards on revenue activities and business impact
Support data quality and reliability by helping to define master data strategy and to develop data governance policies and procedures to help maintain the accuracy of customer, financial and product master data

What You'll Bring to the Team
A passion for data, data visualization and strong attention to detail
Understanding of SaaS, and key metrics used to track and measure growth
The ability to consume, synthesize and draw meaningful conclusions using data gathered using SQL, Salesforce reports, financial systems and/or Google sheets
Experience working with data to forecast and visualize marketing and sales pipeline performance
Excellent communication skills and the ability to act as a key partner with leaders from across the company
Experience with Project Management, helping to drive forward complex projects from initiation to completion
Experience as an analyst, or prior educational experience related to data & visualization
Experience working cross functionally with Sales, Marketing, Customer Experience, Finance and Product teams a plus!

Where You'll Work
Loopio is a remote-first workplace because we recognize the advantages of working flexibly. We have two Hub Regions, which means that employees live and work within a 300 KM radius of Toronto (within Ontario) or Vancouver (within British Columbia) and work within regular business hours in their timezone.
Loopio’s office headquarters are located in Toronto’s vibrant Kensington Market. All Loopers have the option to work from home. Ontario Loopers have the option to work in the Toronto HQ and BC Loopers may work from our co-working office in Gastown Vancouver. It is whatever works best for you!
You’ll collaborate with your teams virtually (we’re just a Zoom call away!) and have established core sync hours and focus time during the workday to enable us to work smarter together
Why You'll Love Working at Loopio
Your manager supports your development by providing ongoing feedback and regular 1-on-1s
You have tons of autonomy and responsibility: this role provides an opportunity to try new things and push creative boundaries
You’ll learn more than you thought was possible; our team is obsessed with personal and professional growth (every Looper receives a professional mastery allowance each year)
You’ll be set up to work remotely with a MacBook laptop, a monthly phone and internet allowance, and a work-from-home budget to help get your home office all set up!
Join us in quarterly company celebrations and a company-wide annual retreat to celebrate the big wins and milestones as #oneteam!
You’ll be joining a culture that has thoughtfully built out opportunities for connections in a remote-first environment.
We have Employee Resource Groups, House Teams (curious? ask us about it!), virtual yoga, cooking classes and many more moments for us to have fun and learn together!
You’ll be a part of an award-winning workplace and one of Canada’s fastest-growing companies with ample opportunity to make a big impact here!
We recognize that all too often, potential candidates don’t apply for a position simply because they don’t hit every single criteria included in the job description—particularly members of underrepresented groups.

Whether or not your experience checks off all the boxes on a job posting, we still encourage you to apply to ensure that your application receives a review from our team. We understand that a resume can only showcase so much during the applicant stage, so we've created prompts in the application for you to share more about yourself. If you've made a career transition (or a few!), you’re self taught in a new role, or you have skills/experience you’d like to highlight, we want to hear more about what you could bring to the table.

Title: Analyst, Aircraft Economics, Maintenance Data & Sales Support
Description:
Identify potential data validity/integrity issues and address data quality issues to improve technical reporting.
Three to five years in Aerospace.
Descriptions:
The Organization
De Havilland Aircraft of Canada Ltd. (‘DHC’) is a proudly Canadian aerospace company currently transitioning its corporate headquarters to Calgary, AB. DHC is undertaking a consolidation of its underlying subsidiary companies under a single brand currently offering engineering, aftermarket, new aircraft manufacturing, modifications, parts manufacturing and flight training. DHC currently has approximately 1,200 employees based in BC, AB and ON as well as in markets and distribution hubs world-wide. Our strong entrepreneurial spirit, together with a culture of empowerment, quality and innovation create opportunities to grow and succeed in an organization with a proud heritage and bright future.

Position Summary
We have an opening in our Customer Services Department for an Analyst, Aircraft Economics, Maintenance Data & Sales Support. The analyst will review and analyze technical queries related to all aspects of aircraft reliability and aircraft economics as well as compile detailed reports and presentations. The analyst will close such queries timely and with highest quality. The analyst will also aggressively support aircraft sales campaigns. The selected candidate will be reporting to the Chief, Maintenance Data Analysis, and Aircraft Economics.

Duties & Responsibilities
Review, prioritize, analyze, and respond to all assigned queries related to reliability, maintenance costs, aircraft economics and other analyses of various maintenance & operational data
Utilize/validate/enhance existing engineering analyses or conduct new analyses to develop a solution to the operator’s queries
Work closely with originators of queries (De Havilland – internal and external customers) to ensure all necessary data are obtained in order to meet customer’s expectations with regards to timeline and quality
Work independently and with Maintenance Programs and Planning Specialists to support them and align in all Maintenance Engineering queries, reports, projects, and assignments
Identify potential data validity/integrity issues and address data quality issues to improve technical reporting
Provide qualitative and timely reliability and cost data and analyses to key supporting functions in Customer Services and Support, Sales & Marketing, Procurement, Engineering and other De Havilland teams
Aggressively and timely support De Havilland’s Sales and Marketing teams in their campaigns
Work very closely with In-Service Engineering, Customer Support Account Managers, Field Service Representatives, In-Service Supplier Management, Marketing/Sales Service and Support, Engineering, Procurement, and other De Havilland teams
Participate in customer technical evaluations, customer meetings, conferences and working groups

Education and Professional Qualifications
University Degree in Engineering with at least 3 years’ experience in Industrial or Aerospace or College Diploma in Aviation Technology with at least 5 years’ experience in the Aerospace Industry

Experience:
Three to five years in Aerospace
Strong analytical abilities and experience using statistics to resolve engineering problems
Robust understanding of reliability and aircraft direct maintenance costs
Aircraft maintenance programs and planning concepts, methods and management are a definite asset
Good knowledge of aircraft systems
Familiarity with De Havilland aircraft Dash 8 Series 100, 200, 300 and 400 is a definite asset
Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools and Oracle database is a valuable asset.
Thorough understanding of airline operations and independent maintenance organizations, intimate knowledge of their maintenance & engineering structure and functions is a valuable asset.

Skills
Advanced user knowledge of MS Office Suite (Excel, Access, MS Word, and PowerPoint)
Basic SQL Skills
Robust ability to manage tight deadlines and prioritize workload accordingly
Able to work independently or as part of a team
Able to conduct multidimensional queries of databases containing historical queries and solutions; able to validate/enhance/improve such solutions
Strong customer service skills
Excellent communication and presentation skills
At De Havilland Canada, we aim to be inclusive and diverse and provide equal opportunity for employment. All qualified applicants, regardless of gender, age, race, religion, sexual orientation, and disability, are encouraged to apply.

E.B. Horsman & Son (EBH) has been in business since 1900. We are strong, nimble and growing! EBH is proud to be a

Continuous Development. You will have access to our EBH University for personal & professional development. Training & Development
has been an essential part of our culture. Increasing our knowledge not only builds confidence but empowers growth through learning.

About the Opportunity:
We are experiencing an exciting growth trajectory at E.B Horsman, which creates new opportunities for entrepreneurial and self-driven individuals
who are looking to make a meaningful and empowering impact to drive our company forward.
We are looking for an experienced Systems Analyst with a "can do" attitude, primarily responsible for all aspects of the ERP enterprise application
lifecycle, including coordination with user groups to identify solutions that improve business processes, implementing process and system changes,
system maintenance and maintaining an application roadmap. This role will be reporting directly to the VP, Technology and Digital Solutions.

This is a full-time position with the ability to work remotely.

Excellent analytical and technical skills

Excellent documentation skills

Teamwork & Collaboration | Integrity| Commitment | Reliability | Initiative | Continuous Improvement

The Data Analytics Lead Analyst is a senior-level position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists, a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within Compliance Technology Services and contributes to directional strategy. Recognized subject matter Data Quality authority for Compliance Technology Services. Requires Capital Markets and trade surveillance data experience. Bachelor's degree - Computer Science, Finance or Data Science /University degree or equivalent experience

Title: Supply Chain Analyst
Description:
Demonstrated analytical capabilities to turn data into insight and insight into action.
The successful candidate will make an impact by driving the supply chain…
Descriptions:
Cardinal Health, with over 1300 employees in Canada, is an essential link in the Canadian healthcare supply chain, providing over 70,000 products to healthcare facilities and medical professionals across the country.
Reporting to the Supply Chain Manager, the Supply Chain Analyst leads the forecasting and replenishment functions for an assigned portfolio. This role is critical in our category focused S&OP process to review gaps and work collaboratively in offering solutions. The successful candidate will make an impact by driving the supply chain planning process forward, including areas such as: Supplier Management, Internal and External collaboration, procurement, and will be responsible for maintaining high levels of customer service by managing forecasts, procurement, customer demand and inventory levels.
This role follows a Hybrid Workplace Model.
For more information on what it is like to work for us, please watch this video: Cardinal Health - Wings
Your Contributions to the Organization will be:
Execute a collaborative process with internal and external stakeholders to forecast, share information, address issues and concerns
Involved in the S&OP process to review supply disruptions at the category level and work with the Marketing team to identify and offer solutions to the customer.
Responsible for event management, execution of new and discontinued items, reporting and analytics
Ability to work and build strong relationships with internal customers, sources of supply, and business peers
Effectively manage inventory to provide high levels of customer service while also maximizing inventory turnover
Perform all supply planning for assigned portfolio and issue purchase orders to suppliers and ensure timely delivery
Expedite, prioritize, and optimize inventory to ensure we meet or exceed our targeted customer service levels
Assist in the resolution of issues involving order promising, deviations to planned inventory levels, establishment and utilization of safety stock, and customer delivery difficulties
Identifying opportunities for process improvements that improve service, speed or cost, through analysis of supply chain information and metrics
Decision-making: involves understanding business/customer needs, identifying problem areas, analyzing supply chain parameters and working with management to support business strategies and customer needs
Communication and follow up with other areas of the supply chain, operations and transportation to ensure product flow
This Job might be for you if:
Bachelor’s Degree in engineering, Business, Mathematics, or a related field
2+ years of Supply Chain experience (Supply Planner, Demand Forecasting, Replenishment etc.)
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite, including Excel, Access and PowerPoint (e.g., Pivot tables, VLOOKUP, linking, macros, etc.)
Experience in SAP preferred.
Self-motivated, solid time management, computer and analytical skills
Demonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment
Strong communication and leadership skills (verbal, written and presentation)
Demonstrated analytical capabilities to turn data into insight and insight into action
APICS certification or SCMA designation or in the process of completing is preferred.
Proven ability to make continuous improvements (Lean Six Sigma) - preferred
Cardinal Health Canada is dedicated to the health and safety of its employees, customers and communities. Title: Business Analyst, Housekeeping
Description:
Develop a data quality management plan that ensures the integrity of program data.
Provide overall data analysis, while applying methods to enhance data quality…
Descriptions:
Job Summary:
Come work as a Business Analyst with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!

Reporting directly to the Director, the Business Analyst is responsible for providing financial, accounting, HR, quality KPI analysis and support, analyzing data and identifying trends, opportunities for improvements in service and efficiencies that could be gained by innovative practices. The position supports strategic planning initiatives by conducting ongoing analysis of business systems data from various perspectives, using advanced statistical and analytical methods. Customizes reporting to suit business needs and advises management on recommendations for improving internal and external processes. The position will monitor and advise on the performance of the quality management system, produce data and report on performance, measuring against set indicators.

As a Business Analyst with Vancouver Coastal Health you will:
Adopt a systems approach to analysis ensuring an alignment with strategic goals and objectives of the department.
Develop a data quality management plan that ensures the integrity of program data.
Provide overall data analysis, while applying methods to enhance data quality and integrity.
KPI development, management
Create forms for survey and other data collection and tracking, assembles, edits and enters data gathered into appropriate databases.
Assist in developing spreadsheets and databases to accurately forecast results and produce reports
Review problematic data trends and support the development of plans to mitigate and resolve identified issues.
Support the annual planning process by analyzing labour and non-labour utilization trends to provide background information for the planning process; assists in implementing the plan at the detailed budget level; and participates in the education of stakeholders in the operational planning process.
Assist in performing operational financial tasks including budget and cost pressure development, invoice validation and processing, and preparation of analyses to support accruals Prepares briefing papers, operation review and strategic business cases.
Assist in requesting and gathering information/data for ad hoc requests
Perform quality assurance audits and reports on program process and outcome metrics.
Maintaining processes to manage project finances
Identify relevant training needs and delivers training to relevant stakeholders on the proper use of various data sources and visualization tool.
Perform other related duties as required.
Qualifications:
Education & Experience
Master’s Degree in Business Administration or Information Technology or related field
One (1) to two (2) years’ recent, related experience in data analysis and system quality management, including the use of querying tools (e.g. PeopleSoft, Crystal Reports, Access, Excel, SQL) to access relational databases, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Knowledge & Abilities
Uses strong statistical skills to analyze data and information.
Strong knowledge of quality processes.
Strong facilitation and education skills. Ability to communicate effectively with all levels of staff and management.
Ability to function in both a long-term strategic perspective and short term operational perspective. Comprehends broad implications of business decisions.
Identifies, collects and analyses relevant data and information including industry-wide assessments and research.
Innovative and results oriented.
Anticipates risks and opportunities and And developed / recommends plans to …
Physical ability to perform the duties of the role.
Ability to work effectively in both self-directed and team environments.
Exercises strong initiative, self-direction and problem-solving abilities to identify gaps and opportunities for improvement.
Practices diligence and care when gathering, maintaining, monitoring, calculating and summarizing data. Ability to gather, summarize and report information in a clear and concise manner.

Closing Statement:

As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?

VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.

Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families

Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.

We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.

Vancouver Coastal Health is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers in 2023.

Title: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Within DUA, Advancement Data & Reporting Services is responsible for divisional data quality, data acquisition practices and data entry standard.
Descriptions:
Date Posted: 03/21/2023
Req ID: 30381
Faculty/Division: Division of University Advancement
Department: Advancement Services
Campus: St. George (Downtown Toronto)
Position Number: 00001174

Description:

About us:

The Division of University Advancement (DUA) aims to sustain and enhance the University of Toronto’s academic mission, leadership, and worldwide impact, by engaging alumni and private sector constituentsmeaningfully in the mission of the University, building mutually beneficial relationships of increasing value and satisfaction over time.

DUA at the University of Toronto is engaged in a transformative agenda deeply rooted in the University’s vision for growth and innovation. We are focus on growing fundraising efforts; enhancing the effectiveness and satisfaction of alumni engagement and programs; building advancement talent capacity within and across divisions; creating an organization and culture that fosters diversity and inclusiveness.

Your opportunity:

Within DUA, Advancement Data & Reporting Services is responsible for divisional data quality, data acquisition practices and data entry standard. The Analyst is responsible for supporting all end-users of various advancement systems and reporting mechanisms as well as reviewing, analyzing, documenting and developing queries, exports, reports and lists that contribute to information management and data integrity at an enterprise level.

The incumbent works in an enterprise level, multi-stakeholder project structure, partnering as a member of a cross-functional team focused on delivering high impact data and reporting solutions involving information from various database systems. The incumbent contributes to improving current and future data integrity and reporting services deliverables that support advancement activities by utilizing business analysis methodologies to document and translate data and reporting requirements into technical specifications and creating data extracts, reports and lists to
support University advancement activities. The incumbent establishes close working relationships with team members, subject matter experts, and technical partners within and outside the immediate project structure.

The incumbent collaborates in the launch, support and maintenance of core operational data and reporting services and business processes. This includes responsibility for eliciting clear, concise, non-conflicting requirements from subject matter experts who may or may not understand how technology can be used to positively transform the business process.

Your responsibilities will include:

Advising clients and technical subject matter experts on best practice for documenting system requirements
Analyzing and documenting business requirements
Assessing needs and contributing to the development of business systems
Planning the implementation of new business system processes
Writing complex specifications based on system requirements
Training end-users on procedures and the use of supported IT systems
Collaborating oncost estimates
Scheduling and assigning work to a small group in a limited area

Essential Qualifications:

Bachelor's Degree or acceptable combination of equivalent experience. A certificate in Business Process Management and/or Business Analysis are considered an asset.
Minimum five (5) years experience working with business process and/or business analysis.
Experience with business analysis management methodologies and techniques, includingrequirements analysis, flow charts, process modeling and process mapping, test design andexecution.
Experience with use of business analysis practices and tools.
Experience using Business Intelligence software and Data Visualization tools to createdashboards.
Experience with data analysis, writing database queries using Structured Query Language,stored procedures, and triggers, preparing and presenting reports to internal stakeholdersand training users.
Functional knowledge and experience in relational database management system conceptsand associated reporting tools.
Experience using Microsoft PowerBI
Demonstrable skill in multiple technologies in Business Intelligence, data architecture, datamodeling, design and implementation.
Strong analytical skills, able to interpret business requirements and articulate them intomodels and concepts that plug into bigger scope projects.
Strong communication skills, able to present requirements, concepts and procedures; ableto design and deliver training and support materials.
Demonstrated knowledge and skills in the following categories:
Relational databases (e.g. – MS SQL Server, Oracle, DB2, etc.)
Data management tools (e.g. – MS SQL Server Management Studio, MS SQL ServerReporting Services, MS Visio)
BI visualization tools (e.g. – Microsoft PowePivot/PowerView/PowerMap, Tableau,BusinessObjects, etc.)
Scripting languages (e.g., T-SQL, PL/SQL, etc.)
BI/DW Methodologies (e.g. – Kimball DW, Theta ETL infrastructure, Theta Pragmatic Agile,etc.)

To be successful in this role you will be:

Communicator
Cooperative
Multi-tasker
Organized
Problem solver
Self-directed
Tactful
Team player

Develop data models, data mapping and transformation.
Manage, maintain, and interpret the business client data logical data model and data transformation to…
Descriptions:
Position Overview
Company: CGL
Number of Positions: 1
Language: This role operates in English.
Work Model: Hybrid
Alternate Title: n/a
Additional Information:
This is a 12 month contract position.

The work location for this role is flexible to the GTA.
The Opportunity:
We are a leading Canadian financial services co-operative committed to being a catalyst for a sustainable and resilient society and our team is essential to deliver on this strategy. That’s why we prioritize our people, to ensure we provide a strong culture and development opportunities which enables our team to thrive and to live our purpose. The best part is that you will work with people that care passionately about you, our clients, and our communities.
The Client Business Data Analyst is responsible for managing, maintaining and interpreting the business client data logical data model and data transformation to support CRM initiatives. Provide business client data information to management teams, business partners. Design and conduct data mining for creating business intelligence reports for prioritization and decision making. Liase with stakeholders across business units, interpreting the business client data model and data transformation to ensure that client data is consistently and efficiently used and displayed throughout all source systems.

How you will create impact:
Manage, maintain, and interpret the business client data logical data model and data transformation to support CRM initiatives. Develop, maintain and support the business client data mapping between multiple client systems and source systems. Develop data models, data mapping and transformation.
Resolve complex, multi-faceted problems to meet business requirements. This includes conducting investigation and analysis in order to accurately define business requirements, processes and workflows.
Create project scope, document business analysis, gather and create requirements documents for projects specific to client data.
Design and conduct data mining for creating business intelligence reports for prioritization and decision making. This involves extracting, analyzing and reporting on business client data.
Liase with stakeholders across business units, interpreting the business client data model and data transformation to ensure that client data is consistently and efficiently used and displayed throughout all source systems.
Track and monitor how business client data is utilized by various business units and how changes on client data impact workflows, procedures and source systems.
Manage adhoc requests for data analysis.

How you will succeed:
You have an innovative mindset to improve operational efficiencies and ability to influence change, with a primary focus on client needs.
You use critical thinking skills to recognize assumptions, evaluate arguments, draw conclusions and proactively propose solutions.
You have strong communication skills to clearly convey messages and explore diverse points of view.
You build trusting relationships and provide guidance to support the development of colleagues.

What to expect:
You will be subject to a Criminal Record and Employment Verification background check as a condition of employment, in the event you are the successful candidate.
Extended work hours, including weekends, may be required.

To join our team:
Minimum 5 years of related experience in business data analysis including agile project experience with Salesforce Tools and Data.
Proven knowledge in database principles, data structures, data mining, logical data models, business process models; workflow tools.
Expert business/systems knowledge and comprehension of applications, procedures and workflows.
University degree or equivalent within business or information technology.

What's in it for you?
Training and development opportunities to grow your career.
Flexible work options to support personal and family needs.
A holistic approach to your well-being, with physical and mental health programs and a supportive workplace culture.
Volunteer opportunities to give back to your community.

100 King Street West Toronto Ontario,M5X 1A1
BMO Capital Markets is a leading, full-service North American-based financial services provider offering equity and debt underwriting, corporate lending and project financing, merger and acquisitions advisory services, securitization, treasury management, market risk management, debt and equity research and institutional sales and trading. BMO Capital Markets has over 2,800 professionals in 32 locations around the world, including 18 offices in North America.
BMO Capital Markets is a member of BMO Financial Group (NYSE, TSX: BMO), one of the largest diversified financial services providers in North America with US$836 billion total assets and approximately 47,000 employees as of October 31, 2022.
We are committed to providing undergraduate students with opportunities to learn, grow and contribute to our diverse and inclusive culture. BMO’s Zero Barriers to Inclusion 2025 is a multi-year strategy focusing on providing access and opportunities both inside and outside the bank. Driven by our Purpose to Boldly Grow the Good in business and life, we are committed to removing barriers, and building an inclusive society through equity, equality, and inclusion. There are 10 scholarships available: each in the amount of C$10,000
Scholarship recipients also receive an offer of paid employment for a 15-week Summer Analyst intern position at BMO Capital Markets in Toronto, Montreal, Calgary, or Vancouver in 2024
Recipients will be paired with a Capital Markets professional to provide coaching and mentorship throughout their internship
Students receive formal and on-the-job training, opportunities to network and collaborate with other student interns, and access to ongoing professional development throughout their internship
Eligibility Criteria:
Individuals who self-identify as members of the following:
Women
Black community
Indigenous (First Nations, Inuit, Métis) persons of Canada
Person of Colour
2SLGBTQ+ community
Persons with Disabilities
Qualified Expectations:
Students at an accredited Canadian University in full-time undergraduate studies graduating in December 2024 or April 2025
Students from all academic programs including and not limited to Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts, and Math (STEAM)
Students available to work full-time from May-August 2024
Strong academic record with minimum GPA of 3.0
Canadian citizens, permanent resident of Canada, and individuals who are legally eligible to work in Canada up to and including September 2024
What roles are available?
Investment Banking Summer Analyst Intern
Corporate Banking Summer Analyst Intern
Global Markets Summer Analyst Intern
Global Markets Quantitative/ Developer Summer Analyst Intern
What do you need to apply to be considered?
Please submit all (3) items as a single PDF file and process under the Resume section of the online application.
1 page resume including cumulative GPA
Cover letter detailing:
Summer Analyst role of interest (Investment Banking, Corporate Banking Analyst, Global Markets Generalist or Global Markets Quantitative/Technology)
Location preference: Toronto, Montreal, Vancouver, or Calgary
One page essay highlighting an accomplishment or impact you have had which exemplifies what you would bring to BMO to support Our Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life
How does the Selection Process work?
We appreciate all student interest to work at BMO Capital Markets. Applications will be reviewed by recruitment and business leaders across BMO Capital Markets.

We will proceed with the following format:
Application deadline: March 20, 2023
Shortlisted candidates will be notified and invited for a virtual/in-person interview March
Final round interviews will take place in March/April
Scholarship recipients will be notified and announced by April
Successful candidates will join the 2024 Summer Analyst Class
Next steps…
Review the detailed job descriptions below
Gather your application requirements
Submit your application online via (Workday)
Global Markets Summer Analyst Intern
What’s in it for you?
Summer interns will work on one desk in Global Markets over a 15-week period. Interns will be provided with desk job descriptions prior to starting and will be placed based on preference and skill set. Each intern will complete one week of onboarding and training with other interns across BMO Capital Markets. There are continuous professional development activities throughout the summer. These activities include teach-ins, trading games, meetings with senior leaders, and networking events with both peers and Senior Leadership.
A variety of desks host Summer Analysts including Equity Sales and Trading, Clearpool E-trading, Prime Finance, Structured Notes Sales and Trading, Leveraged Finance, Securitized Products Sales and Trading, Origination, Debt Capital Markets, and US Interest Rates Sales and Trading.
What will you do?
Summer interns are fully integrated into an assigned desk. Responsibilities will vary widely from day to day based on the needs of the business and the current market environment. Depending on the assigned desk, intern skill set, and business needs, responsibilities may include:
Development and deployment of business solutions such as pricing and risk models
Market data capture and display, spreadsheet development
Providing insight into trading strategies leveraging quantitative modelling
Improving on existing technology involving system infrastructure, internal reporting, client/management presentations, etc.
Bespoke projects requiring market, portfolio, or client research and data analytics
Creating client presentation materials using PowerPoint and Excel
Developing client trade ideas
Planning client events
Recapping and organizing market data and events
Shadowing and learning from Trading, Sales, and Strategy professionals
What are we looking for?
Highly motivated individuals who can work well in a team-based environment and seek a challenge.
Currently enrolled in an undergraduate or Master’s program (non-MBA) with a graduation date of December 2024 or April 2025;
Strong academic record and extracurricular achievement;
Demonstrated interest in and knowledge of financial markets; with knowledge of programming and quantitative trading as an asset;
General knowledge of financial strategy / accounting / economic / capital management principles;
Excellent research and analytical skills, able to collect, analyze and interpret data;
Detail and results orientated;
Strong interpersonal skills used within a demanding team environment;
Demonstrated proactivity, resiliency, positive attitude and high motivation;
Strong written and oral communication skills;
Ability to attentively review, assess and provide detailed information daily on multiple projects in an organized manner;
Strong work ethic and a high level of professional integrity.
Technical Skills:
Knowledge and familiarity with data manipulation / Excel/spreadsheet skills including VBA are an asset as well as strong quantitative/statistical background
Database experience (SQL, Oracle);
Knowledge of Excel, including scripting and efficient spreadsheet design;
Strong technical writing ability.
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.
Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Knowledge of data warehouse/business intelligence concepts, architectural components is considered an asset.
Analyze data to provide insight and ad hoc reports…
Descriptions:
REALTOR.ca is the most popular real estate listing and information platform in Canada. It builds business for REALTOR® members and establishes consumer trust and loyalty by supporting Canadians through their home-buying and selling journeys. It operates under the guiding principles of delivering value to consumers and members and continually evolving to meet and exceed market expectations. REALTOR.ca is more than a listing service – it’s the nexus of the Canadian property buying and selling journey.
Summary
The Senior Business Systems Analyst supports the creation, enhancement, and maintenance of CREA’s IT Services by documenting requirements, contributing to system design, and assuming a leadership role throughout the Systems Development Life Cycle of REALTOR.ca and related products and services.
Function
This position is a rare opportunity to join the REALTOR.ca Analyst team. We are looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst who is personable, results-driven, and has proven leadership experience working across complex, multi-team projects. The Senior Business Systems Analyst has a strong background in Business Systems Analysis and Solutions Architecture and proven ability to perform in an Agile environment.
Core Competencies:
Leadership Skills
Business Analysis
Systems Analysis
Solutions Architecture
Data Analysis
Creative Problem Solver
Critical Thinker
Business and Technical Writing
Presentation Skills
Customer Service
Position Accountabilities
Lead a high-performing team of analysts
Lead the development and enhancement of REALTOR.ca and supporting technology solutions on behalf of REALTORS®, consumers and Real Estate Associations:
Organize and facilitate requirements gathering sessions with project stakeholders, team members and end-users.
Document requirements that meet the needs of the Business and Technology
Present solutions to key business stakeholders
Analyze data to provide insight and ad hoc reports to product managers and IT stakeholders
Take a leadership role in designing, planning, and coordinating projects that involve multiple scrum teams
Establish, improve, and enforce requirements standards within the Business Systems Analyst team
Participate in meetings related to product release activities
Contribute to the creation of QA and UAT test strategies.
Consult on integration and acceptance testing
Contribute to IT architecture, design, and product implementation activities.
Act as a liaison between Business, Development, and Quality Assurance teams.
Identify risks to project deadlines or budget.
Facilitate integration activities with external partner organizations and third-party vendors.
Contribute to assessing project scope and feasibility
Contribute to troubleshooting enhancement and production support-related issues
Mentor colleagues in documentation best practices
Motivate and support the team in achieving on-time, on-budget, on quality solutions
Advise on BSA team roles and responsibilities, including project assignments and scrum team balancing
Identify any issues and make recommendations to the IT management team
Contribute to the establishment and adherence to IT security best practices
Requirements
University degree (IT, IS, or business administration with IT focus) or equivalent certification or experience
At least 10 years experience as a Business Systems Analyst or similar role
Experience managing staff
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment
Advanced use of SQL
Proficient in written and spoken English; bilingualism an asset
Demonstrated track record with consumer-facing, web/mobile-based projects considered an asset
Knowledge of data warehouse/business intelligence concepts, architectural components is considered an asset
This is a Hybrid position, with a mixture of working on-site-minimum two (2) days per week and remotely.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those under consideration for the role will be contacted.
At CREA, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:
Dental care
Employee assistance program
Extended health care
On-site parking
Vision care
Work from home
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Work Location: Hybrid remote in Ottawa, ON

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Experience in business intelligence / data collection from WMS desired.
Identifies inefficiencies and gaps in current data warehouses and leverage solutions.
Descriptions:
Your tasks
Position Description Summary
Reporting to the Operations Manager and Continuous Improvement Manager, the successful candidate will work with warehouse operations teams to monitor the health of the supply chain, with a particular focus on the performance of the warehouse network.
Principal Accountabilities
Proactively monitors various data streams for indicators of supply chain health including inbound shipments, warehouse performance, merchandise flow, etc.
Creates and modifies dashboard reports to track performance and trend information for key performance indicators.
Build Macros to automate data collection from warehouse management system (WMS) for analyzation.
Implements and modifies systems, process, configurations, and change/optimization projects in accordance with plans.
Identifies inefficiencies and gaps in current data warehouses and leverage solutions.
Ensures that integration planning and practices are aligned with strategic business goals and the company's overall strategic vision.
Performs analysis of a variety of data sets to measure performance, identify trends, model impacts of contemplated resource changes, and discover optimization opportunities.
Provides analytics assistance the performance of Root Cause and Correction Action investigations of part shortage, near miss, and other system and process failures to ensure continuous improvement and learning.
Fosters a professional, respectful, and welcoming work environment, while maintaining DB Schenker standards for personal and operational excellence.
Requirements
Knowledge and Skills
2+ years of experience in Data Analytics, supply chain, or logistics.
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Engineering, or equivalent experience or evidence of exceptional ability.
Expertise in Excel required. Experience in business intelligence / data collection from WMS desired.
Ability to write, speak, and present effectively and persuasively at all levels.
Strong analytical and organizational skills; ability to manage multiple high priority demands simultaneously; ability to achieve success in situations with high degrees of variation and complexity.
Demonstrated communication, leadership, and problem-solving skills.
Self-driven initiative to gain and implement a broad knowledge of warehousing and supply chain best practices.
Proven project and system management skills.
Passionate and high energy, possessing the diplomacy and cooperative style to positively influence outcomes.
Our offer
At DB Schenker, you are part of a global logistics network that connects the world. A network that allows you to shape your career by encouraging you to contribute and truly make a difference. With more than 76,000 colleagues worldwide, we welcome diversity and thrive on individual back-grounds, perspectives and skills. Together as one team, we are Here to move.
Contact
Accommodation and Commitment to Equity
Schenker of Canada is proudly committed to ensuring equitable hiring practices and believes in giving each and every applicant an equal opportunity to succeed on his or her own merit. Schenker of Canada strives to ensure that all recruiting processes are non-discriminatory and barrier-free and will provide accommodations throughout the recruitment process to applicants with disabilities. If you are selected to participate in our recruitment process, please inform either the recruiter or the hiring manager of the nature of the accommodation(s) that you may require. Information received relating to accommodation needs of applicants will be addressed confidentially.

Title: Data Analyst Intern/Senior Co-op Student
Description:
Proficiency in Python for data analysis, data manipulation, and data visualization.
Develop data pipelines, preprocess and clean data to make it usable for…
Descriptions:
About e-Zinc
e-Zinc is an energy storage venture based in Toronto with a breakthrough technology poised to disrupt the market. As the global energy grid moves to higher levels of penetration of renewable energy, there will be an exponential increase in demand for low-cost, flexible, long-duration energy storage. This is the market targeted by e-Zinc, the first in the world to "metalize" electricity.
e-Zinc is on an incredible trajectory, which is illustrated by many significant funding and award milestones that recognize its unique technology and strong business plan, including:
Recently closed a $30M Series A financing
Won a $1.6M grant through Breakthrough Energy Solutions Canada
Won a $2M grant from Sustainable Technology Development Canada
Won a USD $1.3M grant through California Energy Commission
Won a $700k grant as a finalist in NRCan's Charging the Future Challenge
Now that the company is well-capitalized, e-Zinc is now looking to expand its talented team to bring its technology to market to support the renewable energy transformation.

Opportunity
We are looking for a motivated Data Analyst Intern or Senior Co-op student to join our Engineering department in Etobicoke, Ontario. In this role, the successful candidate will closely collaborate with the Battery Management System (BMS) engineers to explore and address complex problems. The key responsibilities will include analyzing data, identifying patterns, and developing models to predict battery performance, while also discovering opportunities for improvement. The position will entail working with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to develop and implement solutions, and effectively communicate insights via reports and visualizations. This is an exceptional opportunity to gain practical experience and work on challenging problems in BMS.
Responsibilities
Collect and analyze large data sets related to battery performance, usage patterns, and other relevant parameters
Develop data pipelines, preprocess and clean data to make it usable for analysis
Work with engineers to develop models that can predict battery performance and identify patterns in data
Monitor battery performance, identify trends, and recommend improvements
Work with cross-functional teams to develop and test battery management systems
Document data analysis processes, algorithms, and models
Handle ad-hoc assignments as and when required by the team

Qualifications
Required:
Currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's degree program in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
Proficiency in Python for data analysis, data manipulation, and data visualization
Familiarity with statistical and machine learning techniques
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to details
Good communication and collaboration skills
Personal accountability and commitment to achieving and exceeding goals and objectives
Superior time management and organizational skills
Ability to work independently as well as with cross functional teams
High energy self-starter and multi-tasker who thrives in a fast-paced startup environment
Excellent communication skills
Preferred:
Familiarity with battery technology and energy systems
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI
Knowledge of SQL and relational databases
Familiarity with time-series databases such as InfluxDB
Experience with cloud computing platforms such as AWS or Azure
Transportation and Housing
Students are responsible for arranging their own transportation and housing. Our facilities are within walking distance from major public transit routes and stations.

Studies show that individuals in underrepresented groups tend to not apply for roles if they feel they do not meet all the listed criteria. If you find you are passionate about a role and meet a good portion of the items listed, we encourage you to apply!
At e-Zinc we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer where we consider, celebrate, and embrace diversity. We thrive in an environment of mutual respect and welcome all applicants.
Accommodations will be provided as requested by candidates at any stage of the hiring process. If you require accommodations, please email careers@e-zinc.ca.

Title: Data protection and Data privacy Analyst
Description:
Conduct privacy and data protection impact assessments for clients.
Minimum 2 years of direct experience in data protection and privacy.
Descriptions:
At Valtech, we imagine and create the world of tomorrow!

With more than 5,000 innovative profiles, creatives, developers, designers and digital experts working in its 50 offices around the world, Valtech distinguishes itself by its end-user centric approach and its innovation process. With its values of sharing, boldness and authenticity, Valtech makes sure to put the human element at the heart of the digital experiences it develops - for its clients as well as for its employees.

At Valtech_Commerce, we are more than 300 employees who are passionate about e-commerce. By joining us, you'll be part of a company that puts people first and you'll be able to grow and evolve with access to a global network of innovators.
What you will do:
The Data Protection Analyst will work hand-in-hand with Project Manager, Solutions Architects, Cybersecurity Analysts and dev teams on major eCommerce projects in B2C and B2B. The analyst will provide technical recommendations for our client’s compliance with privacy legislation. These include, the General Data Protection Regulation ("GDPR"), the Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act (known as "PIPEDA"), the Act to Modernize the Personal Information Protection Laws of Quebec (Bill 25"), the California Consumer Privacy Act ("CCPA/CPRA") and other similar legislation around the world.



Provide guidance to clients on their privacy and data protection compliance position.
Evaluate and establish partnerships with third party providers of data protection technology solutions such as CMPs.
Develop a prioritized action plan and recommend appropriate measures to help clients comply with privacy and data protection regulations and best practices.
Establish guidelines and recommendations to clients to ensure compliant technology implementation related to data protection.
Monitor changes in legislation, making recommendations as necessary to support clients in their compliance.
Implement and manage the privacy compliance program.
Act as a subject matter expert in the review and development of privacy and security policies and procedures.
Conduct privacy and data protection impact assessments for clients.
Develop and provide awareness and training to staff on privacy and data protection.
Support the sales function in engineering sales related to privacy services, which may include assisting with proposal writing and attending meetings with prospects.
What you should have:
Minimum 5 years of regulatory compliance, cybersecurity and/or project management experience.
Minimum 2 years of direct experience in data protection and privacy.
Strong knowledge of Canadian and provincial privacy legislation (PIPEDA, Act 25, GDPR, CCPA/CPRA).
Knowledge of other related privacy legislation is an asset (i.e. ePrivacy, HIPPA, etc...)
General knowledge of the cybersecurity threat landscape and computer security systems.
Experience in eCommerce and online customer journey is a plus.
Bachelor's degree in civil and/or common law is a plus.
Privacy and/or project management certifications (e.g., ISO27001/27701 Lead Implementor, CIPP/E, CIPP/US, CIPP/C, CIPM, CIPT...) is a plus.
Knowledge of one or more major economic sectors (banking-insurance, distribution, industry, etc.) is an asset.
Perfect bilingualism in English and French is mandatory.
Advantages:
Flexible PTO Policy!
Valtech_ is lucky to collaborate with amazing organizations (local to global). If you want to learn and grow as an eCommerce specialist, this is the place for you.
Flexible schedule, with a 37.5 hour work week.
The possibility to work remotely and $500 to outfit your home office when you first start.
The possibility to work from wherever you want (subject to approval).
Life, medical and dental insurance with 24/7 access to counseling and telemedicine & an employee assistance program (EAP).
Company contribution to your retirement savings.
A community of supportive people (from your day-to-day colleagues to the company owners).
Offices all across the globe including in Montreal and in Sainte-Thérèse, on the northshore of Montreal.
A strong corporate culture where the values Share, Dare and Care are a part of the company’s DNA.

Title: Procurement Analyst
Description:
Excellent knowledge of data systems and experience conducting data analysis.
Responsible for MYB data collection and reporting.
Descriptions:
Location: Toronto, Canada
Thales people architect solutions that support 85 million mainline and suburban passenger journeys, worldwide, every day. Our Rail Signalling and Communication systems are used on metro lines across major cities, and 72,000 kms of route, 52,000 trains per day in 16 countries are controlled by our Traffic Management Systems. Together We deployed the first-ever nationwide ticketing system which processes over 50 million ticketing transactions in 100 cities daily.
Thales provides world-leading Communications-Based Train Control (CBTC) and interlocking for mass rail transit applications globally. The Centre of Competence for Urban Rail Signalling is located right before you at mid-town Toronto. As the largest office in Canada, we house a department for every step of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)! This includes Software, Hardware, Systems Design, Verification & Validation, Operations, etc. The supporting corporate shared services teams in Finance, Human Resources and IT is also located at the office. Our office space was designed to provide a sustainable, healthy workplace that expresses TRSS’s brand while increasing collaboration. Features include Greenguard furniture, EnergyStar appliances, low-emitting adhesives, sealants, and sliding glass doors on internal offices provide daylight and views to the outside. Come join the big Transport family, here in Toronto!
The Procurement Analyst provides procurement and analytical expertise, including tool analysis, cost modelling and analytical support services, to inform procurement and category management, decision-making and strategy. The Analyst will mainly be responsible for gathering data, and putting together analyses of that data for the management team to support continuous improvement projects for the department. To provide and support the company in the measurement and analysis of procurement supply chain metrics and objectives at all levels of the organization
Key Responsibilities:
Work with procurement and other stakeholders to assess their business needs and contribute meaningfully to the development of procurement and category management strategies
Review, analyze and evaluate the business system and Procurement needs in order to generate the business reports/KPI
Gathers requirements from the business and generate departmental KPI’s aligned with organizational strategic objectives using cause and effect relationships, and business intelligence/analytics/reporting tools.
Analyze/report/automate KPIs in line with organizational strategic objectives to deliver projects On-Time, On-Cost, and on required Quality level using ERP and other data analysis tools.
Provides support and knowledge transfer of SAP Solutions to SME’s and End-users in Procurement Supply Chain.
Manage complex databases and apply analytical tools, techniques and systems to analyze and interpret a wide range of Purchasing scope and organizational information to support procurement planning and decision making
Undertake tool research, cost modelling and analysis of supply markets to identify opportunities and information for procurement strategies
Gather information to generate the reports required by the business to support effective management of Procurement performance
Construct workflow charts and diagram studying the system capabilities
Utilize SAP, Microsoft Access, Microsoft Excel, to find, retrieve, filter and validate data
Recommend improvements for the current practices used to generate reports
Provide procurement reports by collecting, analyzing and summarizing the information trends
Support the monthly KPI, Dashboard / Scorecard reporting and annual Multi Year Budgeting and Medium Term Industrial
Responsible for MYB data collection and reporting
Communicating technical reports and analyses in a meaningful way to procurement stakeholders given the complexity of procurement analysis
Continually building understanding of contemporary developments in procurement analytics and capability in applying analytics tools and methods given the rate of change in these areas
Consistent Data output from the ERP
Propose solutions to produce different reports from Country and Thales Group more efficiently.
Propose ways of automating the KPIs.
Key Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree in Supply Chain, Business Management, or related field
3-5 year of Experience in Business process and Supply Chain
Advanced Excel/SAP/ Power Point and data mining skills
Experience in Process improvement
Excellent knowledge of data systems and experience conducting data analysis. Additional experience in advanced data analytical tools is strongly preferred
Ability to communicate and collaborate with international colleagues on the Global Operations
Preferred Requirements:
Proactive Team player with strong interpersonal skills, and high attention to details
Ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
#LI-Hybrid
Thales is an equal opportunity employer which values diversity and inclusivity in the workplace. Thales is committed to providing accommodations in all parts of the interview process. Applicants selected for an interview who require accommodation are asked to advise accordingly upon the invitation for an interview. We will work with you to meet your needs. All accommodation information provided will be treated as confidential and used only for the purpose of providing an accessible candidate experience.

Your Employer:

Title: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Supports assessment of data integrity/quality, preparation, and validation of data between varied systems both on-prem and in the cloud.
Descriptions:
Department: Information Services
Job Type: Full-Time
Position Type: Non-Union
Location: Calgary, Alberta
Country: Canada
% of Travel: 0-10%
# of Positions: 1
Job Available to: Internal & External

Canadian Pacific is a transcontinental railway in Canada and the United States with direct links to major ports on the west and east coasts. CP provides North American customers a competitive rail service with access to key markets in every corner of the globe. CP is growing with its customers, offering a suite of freight transportation services, logistics solutions and supply chain expertise. Visit cpr.ca to see the rail advantages of CP.

PURPOSE OF POSITION:
In the role of Specialist Business Systems for the Information Services (IS) Crew Management Systems team, the BA will work with our internal business partners to understand their business processes and design and implement successful IT infrastructure solutions that meet the business needs and align with the overall company strategic goals. Managing the systems used in order to crew our trains is a critical component of ensuring our Precision Scheduled Railway (PSR) operates efficiently and effectively.
POSITION ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Apply a variety of techniques to elicit and gather business and user requirements from stakeholders. Understand business issues and opportunities. Analyze and define both the “As Is” and “To Be” business processes and perform a gap analysis. Contributes to estimates for the business analysis effort based on scope and complexity;
Participate in the design, development and maintenance of custom-built functionality and interfaces for SAP and other Applications and work with other developers in this area.
Performs investigational analysis to provide recommendations on solution design feasibility proposed by vendor functional consultants
Supports assessment of data integrity/quality, preparation, and validation of data between varied systems both on-prem and in the cloud
Performs testing to ensure quality of the end product
Collaborate with support team members to ensure effective implementation of solutions;
Identify and communicate issues or risks impacting the scope or plan;
Participate in the definition and validation of solutions ensuring that business needs, goals and objectives are met;
Contribute in the development and execution of implementation plans for business process and organizational changes;
Collaborate with technical support in troubleshooting of incidents or defects that arise in Crew Management applications and ensure a timely resolution. Lead or participate in cross functional teams involved in issue resolution, ensure that partners/stakeholders are kept advised of status;
Ensure the operating efficiency of existing application systems;
Enforce adherence to best practices for enhancements and support; ensure adoption and adherence to defined support processes (e.g. incident management, change management, etc.);
This role requires participation in a 24 X 7 on-call support rotation.
Comfortable working on multiple projects and tasks simultaneously

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

Prefer University Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, Science, Commerce/Business Administration or equivalent practical experience;
2 or more years’ experience in business analysis including diagnosing, isolating and debugging software problems.
Experience with using testing methodologies, platform standards, software development process/life cycle (agile and waterfall);
Experience with release management processes

NICE TO HAVE:
Experience in application support tools preferably including ServiceNow

WHAT CP HAS TO OFFER:

Flexible and competitive benefits package
Competitive company pension plan
Employee Share Purchase Plan
Performance Incentive Program
Annual Fitness Subsidy
Part-time Studies Program
Flexible Work Environment

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION:
As an employer with national presence, the possibility does exist that the location of your position may be changed based on organizational requirements.

Background Investigation:
The successful candidate will need to successfully complete the following clearances:
Criminal history check
Reference check

Management Conductor Program:
Becoming a qualified conductor or locomotive engineer is the single best way for a management employee to learn the business at CP. You may be required to obtain a certification or to maintain your current certification/qualification as a conductor or locomotive engineer.

CP is an equal opportunity employer committed to the principles of employment equity and inclusion. We welcome applications from all qualified individuals. All applicant information will be managed in accordance with the federal Personal Information Protection and Electronic Documents Act ("PIPEDA").

Title: Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
Candidates who are 18 years or older are required to complete a criminal background check.
Details will be provided through the application process.
Descriptions:
Referred applicants should not apply directly to this role.
All referred applicants must first be submitted through Workday by a current Loblaw Colleague.

TD Description

Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
The Business Governance and Control team are the protectors of our businesses guided by the Three Lines of Defence Risk Framework: Risk Ownership, Risk Oversight, and Internal Audit. Our overall goal is to oversee the compliance of business risk, controls and oversight activities, while lending a critical voice as a consultant contributing towards a mutual goal. If you are excited to make your career where you can develop a deep knowledge of risk, governance and control issues, then join our team to drive the business forward and take your own career to new heights.
Job Description
Are you a seasoned professional with a deep knowledge of business governance and control that loves to bring about change and make a real impact? Are you ready to function as a brand ambassador for your business area? If so, then we are looking for you. The Governance and Control Analyst III would be looked to provide guidance and support for a business and implement policies, processes and initiatives to meet business objectives. In this role, you will provide complex reporting, analysis, testing and assessments at the functional or enterprise level and is generally a lead for a given area.
Provide specialized business governance and control related advice / support to management / leadership and respective teams for area(s) of specialization
Lead on the implementation of governance and control initiatives in support of the overall business/function strategy
Handle a set of business governance and control work activities requiring coordination across multiple areas
Ensure programs / policies / practices are well handled, meets business needs / priorities, and aligns with internal / external requirements
Exercise discretion in handling communication / correspondence, information and all matters of confidentiality
Conduct research projects; support the development / delivery of materials and presentations to management or broader audience
Experienced working professional role providing specialized services, advisory or processes / program support within their own area of specialty
Require business experience, conceptual and practical knowledge of own specialty and knowledge of broader related areas
Accountable for own work and acts as an escalation point or knowledge resource for others
Participate as a member of the team, support a positive work environment and ensure timely communication
Support team by regularly enhancing knowledge / expertise in own area and participate in knowledge transfer
Keep current on emerging trends/ developments and grow knowledge of the business, related tools and techniques
Job Requirements
Undergraduate degree in the related field is preferable
A dynamic professional with over 4 years of relevant experience required
Broad knowledge of business and risk and control environment
Experience with various data analysis and reporting techniques
Proficiency in using analytical software tools including MS Office suite
Strong written and verbal communication skills to build and maintain strong working relations with cross functional teams
An extraordinary leader who can make the team function in partnership and independently
Possess high degree of judgement and decision-making skills and integrity to process and handle confidential details with discretion
Excellent organizational skills with the ability to multi-task while meeting deadlines and adapt to change in a fast-paced dynamic environment

We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. Description
Representing Strategic Way Consulting, this assignment is at our Client location situated on the Lake Huron shoreline between the towns of Kincardine and Saugeen Shores. We are looking for a detail-oriented, methodical, and collaborative Data Analyst to join our growing team of driven professionals. Working in a dynamic and fast pace environment this individual will be required to be responsive, take initiative, manage multiple priorities and work with minimal direction.

Experience
Minimum 3-5 years working as a Data Analyst or similar role
Proficient in SQL Server

Understanding of Maximo ERP software considered an asset
