Title: Business Intake & Compliance Analyst (12-Month Contract)
Description:
Experience in database searching and interpreting data.
Review and resolve data to ensure content integrity.
University degree or College diploma in Information…
Descriptions:
Osler, Hoskin & Harcourt LLP is one of Canada’s leading business law firms. Advising many of Canada’s corporate leaders, as well as U.S. and international parties with extensive interest in Canada, our more than 1,000 firm members are based in offices in Toronto, Montréal, Ottawa, Vancouver, Calgary and New York.

Osler prides itself on attracting and maintaining some of the brightest talent in the legal field. Our lawyers, students, management and staff have created a unique firm culture which nurtures mentoring and the exchange of ideas. Osler is a dynamic and exciting place to begin a career or carve out a new path.
The Business Intake & Compliance Analyst provides an efficient and seamless business intake process for opening new matters. Responsible for conducting business research and database content analysis to provide information to legal professionals so that they can confirm that the acceptance of new business does not negatively affect the interest of current or past clients and it does not affect the Firm's ability to impartially represent current, former, and new clients. Responsible for the Firm's new business intake, include matter openings, client matter amendments and conducting conflict of interest searches for the Toronto, Ottawa, Montreal, Calgary, Vancouver and New York offices. This is a detail-oriented position with focus on time management skills, and ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Major Responsibilities
Conduct conflict of interest searches according to the Firm's procedures
Search multiple databases to identify potential conflicts of interest using established procedures and adhere to flag lists and special instructions
Prepare timely, accurate and succinct conflict reports by reviewing, retrieving and summarizing relevant information from multiple databases
Review and resolve data to ensure content integrity
Send search results to the legal professional for matter opening decision
Open new client matters in accordance with the Firm's procedures
Receiving and reviewing requests for matter openings
Functions in a quality control role to ensure accuracy of information submitted. Revise incorrect information as required
Review requisition forms for amendments

Maintain Firm's client management system and update related information. Monitors the system for irregularities or inefficiencies. Review the system for stalled requests, assists users with delegating requests, troubleshoots and corrects user errors and reports system issues
Educate and provide guidance to Firm members regarding the policies and procedures of new business intake and conflict management

University degree or College diploma in Information Management, Library Science, Information Science or Library & Information Technology plus three years experience in legal environment or professional services firm. An equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be accepted. Legal industry experience is an asset. Bilingualism is an asset.
Knowledge and Skills
Demonstrate advanced research, investigative and problem solving skills, think strategically, with the ability to gather and analyze information, exercise sound judgement to resolve related issues in a timely manner
Experience in database searching and interpreting data
Strive for continuous improvement, flexible approach, promote quality; demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; strong attention to detail; highly motivated and results driven

Exceptional negotiation and teamwork skills to interact/collaborate with various groups

Descriptions:
Job Posting #916302
Position: Knowledge Management and Translation Analyst (Humanitarian Innovation)
Location: MaRS Discovery District, Toronto – (Currently Temporarily Remote)
Department: Grand Challenges Canada – The Humanitarian Grand Challenge
Reports to: Program Officer, Humanitarian Innovation
Compensation: CAD $58,500.00 per annum plus additional total compensation elements including pension contributions and health/dental benefits
Hours: 37.5 hours per week
Status: Permanent Full-time
Grand Challenges Canada (GCC) is seeking a Knowledge Management and Translation Analyst (Humanitarian Innovation) for the Humanitarian Grand Challenge department.
GCC is dedicated to supporting Bold Ideas with Big Impact®. Funded by the Government of Canada and other partners, GCC funds innovators in low- and middle-income countries and Canada. The bold ideas we support integrate science and technology, social and business innovation – we call this Integrated Innovation®. We have a determined focus on results, and on saving and improving lives. GCC works closely with a global network of partners to bring successful innovation to scale, catalyzing sustainability and impact.
Through the Transition to Scale program, GCC provides catalytic investment to innovators who have achieved proof-of-concept and are now seeking to scale their solution. GCC provides both grant and non-grant financing, as well as technical support, to best support the growth and impact goals of innovators. Since 2011, GCC has supported >230 innovators in >100 countries globally at Transition to Scale.
As one of the largest impact-first funders in Canada, GCC has funded over 1,300 innovations championed by innovators in more than 106 countries. These innovations have already improved 10 million lives, and are expected to save up to 1.78 million lives and improve up to 64 million lives by 2030.
“Creating Hope in Conflict: A Humanitarian Grand Challenge” (HGC) is a partnership of the U.S. Agency for International Development (USAID), the UK’s Foreign and Commonwealth Development Office (FCDO), the Government of the Netherland’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs (NMFA), Global Affairs Canada (GAC) and Grand Challenges Canada. Together, we seek life-saving or life-improving innovations to help the most vulnerable and hardest-to-reach people impacted by humanitarian crises caused by conflict.
Knowledge Management & Translation Analyst
Reporting to the Program Officer, Humanitarian Innovation, in collaboration with the Director, Humanitarian Innovation, and working closely with the GCC’s KMT team, the Knowledge Management & Translation Analyst will ensure relevant knowledge from the Humanitarian Grand Challenge portfolio is efficiently created, managed, shared, and integrated with internal and external audiences to improve humanitarian and programmatic outcomes.
Responsibilities
Manage knowledge and support development of knowledge products
Support the Programs Team in reviewing innovator results and identifying where additional validation is needed (i.e., where further validation by the Senior Manager or experts in the sector is needed, or where site visits are required to further validate results)
Provide guidance to innovators on monitoring and evaluation, and on reporting requirements
Support the development of materials/webinars to support innovators on M&E and reporting
Data management including data entry and cleaning, and ensuring the overall integrity of the data
Regularly assess the grant management system to ensure it is being used optimally within the Humanitarian Grand Challenge team, and to identify areas for improvement
Lead data analysis and synthesis of results in preparation for
internal documents including:
GCC’s annual portfolio review
donor reports
reports for the Board of Directors,
public communications, and
other reports as necessary
External documents including:
knowledge products on topics such as: lessons learned, gender integration, successful exits, policy influence
case studies
summary briefs and presentations
outcome statements
reports
white papers
Occasionally contribute content to blog entries, social media posts, website articles, and other storytelling materials in partnership with the Communications Officer
Occasionally, conduct site visits to validate results and gather information for knowledge creation purposes
Support the development of webinars and other materials and disseminate information to innovators and others in the HGC network
Contribute to the development and implementation of the HGC learning agenda
Knowledge integration and systems improvement
Support planning and integration of new approaches to Knowledge Management & Translation;
Identify opportunities to improve and streamline Knowledge Management & Translation processes and systems; and
Adapt tools, frameworks, processes to incorporate new sectors, challenges, and priorities, and to ensure optimal use.
Qualifications
Relevant education and/or a minimum of three (3) years relevant work experience, preferably in monitoring and evaluation and/or research
Demonstrated interest in and knowledge of innovation and private sector engagement, specifically in humanitarian assistance and disaster reduction in conflict
Proficiency with word-processing, database, spreadsheets and other data management software
In-depth knowledge of statistical analysis and research methodologies, and the realities of conducting research and evaluations in humanitarian contexts
Excellent verbal and written communications skills
Willingness to travel (less than 5% of workload)
Don’t meet every requirement? Studies have shown that women, people of color, people from LGBTQ2S+ and disabilities communities are less likely to apply to jobs when they do not meet every qualification. At Grand Challenges Canada, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, authentic, and accountable workplace, so if you are excited about this role but your experience does not align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply, as you may be the ideal candidate we are looking for.
People with disabilities are encouraged to apply. People with lived experiences in relevant thematic areas are encouraged to apply.
Term
Start date: May 1, 2023
Full time, Permanent
Application process
Please send your resume and cover letter
Applicants must be eligible to work in Canada

Vaccines (COVID-19 and others) are a requirement of the job unless you have an exemption on a medical ground pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code.

UHN thanks all applicants, however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.
UHN is a respectful, caring, and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity and welcomes all applicants including but not limited to: all religions and ethnicities, LGBTQ2s+, BIPOC, persons with disabilities and all others who may contribute to the further diversification of ideas. Descriptions:
399835BR
Enterprise Data & Analytics
Toronto, ON
February 15, 2023
Company Overview
Tell us your story. Don’t go unnoticed. Explain why you’re a winning candidate. Think “TD” if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us. Here’s our story: jobs.td.com
Department Overview
Business Information Management (BIM) at TD is part of a creative, enterprise-wide data and analytics ecosystem. Roles in BIM are highly professional and valued, specialized yet inter-connected and focused on making the availability of business information to designers, developers and decision-makers a priority, all with a united purpose to serve customers and continually build a better bank.
We’re looking for analytical and agile professionals who can merge and translate data into technology and business information, serving today’s business needs and setting in motion TD’s longer-term goals and strategic objectives.
If you get data, its power and potential, we think you’ll love working at TD, where data knows no bounds and where your professional expertise will help to drive the business forward and take your own career to new heights.
Job Description
Are you an experienced analytical thinker, at ease working on your own or driving forward the success of your team? If so, this role offers a hands-on and high-career growth opportunity to provide business information management support for a range of activities in data and analytics.
Enjoy partnering with and learning from experts? In this experienced professional role, you’ll work within your team as well as lead projects or work streams within broader projects, to help design, develop and support key business information management solutions for TD.
As Business Information Management Analyst II, you will:
Focus on providing specialized business support, in your area of specialty
Lead projects or work streams within broader projects of moderate risk and be accountable for managing own work, while acting as contact point for raised issues and ongoing activities, processes and functional programs
Conduct a range of data analyses, demonstrating your experience with very large datasets and big data technologies; assessing business information-related data requirements aligned to business needs and for specific data platforms, applications systems and servers
Partner and collaborate with internal team and business and technology partners to elicit information / data requirements and articulate requirements
Resolve data / application issues and support the user community by helping them interpret data
Develop and maintain knowledge of data available from upstream sources and data within relevant platform / applications (e.g. through data profiling, data quality reporting tools, business metadata capture)
Define, build and manage data dictionary / catalogue for data platforms, systems, servers, applications
Gather, review, analyze, profile, validate and map system data warehouse to meet reporting needs
Run quality assurance reports and ensure metadata and data lineage is captured, compatible and maintained in compliance with data management tools and processes as well as enterprise data standards, policies and guidelines
Participate fully as a team member, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality and innovation and, ensure timely communication of issues/points of interest
Requirements
What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
Three (3) or more years relevant experience from a business administration, statistical, mathematical, scientific or financial background
Sound conceptual knowledge in your area of specialty
Fluent in one or more programming languages
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Solid knowledge of various data sources, tools and technologies used in preparing summaries/reports
Knowledge of competitor and market trends
Strong ability to analyze, organize and prioritize work while meeting multiple deadlines
Expertise in using analytical software tools, MS Office, data analysis methods and reporting techniques
Proficient to work together and independently, communicate positively and professionally (both in speaking and writing), follow instructions/direction, and help building positive relationships across teams and functions
Act as a brand champion for our business area / function and TD, both internally and externally
Additional Information

Title: BI Analyst
Description:
Knowledge of data governance and data management practices an asset.
The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for supporting the Strategic Analytics…
Descriptions:
Location
Office

City/Town
Toronto

Department Name
Information Services

Description
About Us:

Since 1997, the Technical Standards and Safety Authority (TSSA) has delivered public safety services on behalf of the government of Ontario. With headquarters in west Toronto, the TSSA is a self-funded, not-for-profit organization that employs approximately 400 staff across Ontario. The roles within the TSSA are as diverse as the Province we serve. It takes all kinds of people with varied skillsets and backgrounds to meet our organizational goals, but our employees share a few key traits:
We are passionate about public safety.
We are highly skilled, problem-solvers.
We are collaborators who are invested in the communities we work in.
We are more than employees; we are serving the greater good.
We are committed to life-long learning and development.
We operate with the highest integrity.

TSSA provides our employees with competitive compensation, excellent benefits, and — most importantly — a sense of purpose. Our work is vital to the success and safety of the Province, and it’s our people who make it possible.

Job Purpose:

The Business Intelligence Analyst is responsible for supporting the Strategic Analytics team with data analysis and report development, in addition to data quality and data governance activities. In support of the transformation of TSSA to a data driven organization, this role is critical to improve and enhance the utilization of data and analytical tools for strategic decision making at all levels of the organization.

Scope of the Role:

Collaborate with other departments – for example: Policy, Operations, Intake – to generate insights from data to advance strategic directions through data discovery, data visualization and reporting.
Create new PowerBI reports and support maintenance of existing ones to ensure business reporting needs are addressed.

What you will do?
Analytical Skills: work with large amounts of data, with the ability to see through the data, find patterns, analyze it and to draw conclusions to support decision making
Communication Skills: to be able to tell the story through data; present their findings and translate the data into understandable concepts, need to write and speak clearly, easily communicating complex ideas
Critical Thinking: look at the numbers, trends, and data and come to new data-backed conclusions; be able to translate business problems into questions answered by data
Attention to Detail: Vigilant in their analysis, capturing all aspects of complex business processes to draw correct conclusions; diligent with delivering to commitments
Math Skills: Comfortable with basic statical analysis to help data manipulation and analysis Data Governance: Familiar with data quality concepts and be able to investigate quality issues in addition to assessing the impact of quality on conclusions drawn from the data
Support business process improvement by identifying any possible gaps seen through data and data quality monitoring

What will you need to succeed?
Bachelor's degree or master’s degree in Data Science, Data Analysis, Engineering, or equivalent experience
5+ years of experience as Data Analyst or in a similar analytical role
3+ years of experience with data management, data integration, conversion, transformation, and cleansing
3+ years of experience with data analysis and visualization tools like Excel and Power BI
Knowledge of relational SQL databases and SQL in at least one of the following environments: Microsoft SQL Server or MySQL
Knowledge and experience in R and Python an asset
Knowledge of data governance and data management practices an asset
Experience in Microsoft Dynamics CRM, Microsoft DevOps, Scribe, Epicor Financial Management, FinancialForce Human Capability Management and SharePoint is an asset
Well-developed interpersonal, oral and written communication skills, strong analytical and problem-solving skills and effective conceptualization, pattern recognition, presentation and facilitation skills
Ability to work independently or as part of a team, establishing project plans and milestone goals
Proven skills to work effectively across internal functional areas in ambiguous situations

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

TSSA is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We are committed to building and maintaining collaborative, caring and positive work environments so that our employees bring their whole selves to work each and every day. We encourage all qualified applicants to apply without regard to race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status or disability. Only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

TSSA is pleased to offer accommodations for applicants with disabilities. If you are interested in applying for a job opportunity, or are contacted by us regarding a job opportunity, please advise of any accommodations you may require.

Please note that applicants who receive any conditional offer of employment from TSSA will be required to provide proof that they are fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine approved by Health Canada as a condition of employment and to maintain their status as fully vaccinated as a condition of continued employment. TSSA will consider individual requests for accommodation by applicants who cannot be fully vaccinated due to grounds protected under the Human Rights Code.

Leasepath is the 100% Cloud-Hosted, Mobile-Enabled Asset Finance & Leasing Platform for Customer Engagement & Originations. Leasepath Customer Engagement (CRM) enables sales to track and automate follow-ups to ensure our clients win more deals. Leasepath uses combination of technology and leasing experience to help clients gain the benefits of modern technology.
Leasepath is a front-end leasing solution developed as an extension of Microsoft Dynamics 365, by Turnford Systems Inc. Turnford Systems was established in 1998 to develop technology and e-commerce solutions for the finance and leasing industry. Leasepath has office locations in Canada, USA, and UK.

Title: People Rewards Analyst
Description: Support the team with research, data analytics and modeling, analyzing internal and external practices to further design our total rewards programs.
Descriptions:
About Enable:

Market forces are dramatically reshaping supply chains, forcing drastic changes in trading behaviors between manufacturers, distributors and retailers. Many key business decisions are being made without a single source of truth to back them up, resulting in struggles to keep up with consumer expectations and increased disputes between partners.

At Enable, we believe in removing barriers between trading partners to create a healthier supply chain — and there’s no better way to do this than with rebates. Rebates drive partner behaviors, while increasing loyalty and trust. They help businesses and their trading partners better understand their data, boost their financial performance, mitigate risks, and drive efficiency and trust. When trading partners can make the best decisions for their businesses, everyone wins: manufacturers, distributors, retailers and, most importantly, end consumers.

That’s the core of what we’re doing at Enable: creating a healthy, vibrant supply chain ecosystem where partner collaboration drives the best products, services and values to customers.

As a People Rewards Analyst, you will be responsible for the analysis and administration of competitive total rewards programs that are innovative, compliant, cost effective and which support the growth of Enable’s Total Rewards strategy. The ideal candidate is analytical and organized with a passion for compensation data, as well as benefits and wellness programs. Acting as a subject matter expert, you add value by applying technical expertise to support the development of total rewards programs, completing cost modeling, preparing compensation reports, presentations and analysis for various stakeholders. In this role, you will report to the Director, Total Rewards and join a highly motivated team at an exciting time.

What we are asking you to do?!
Total Rewards
Assist and provide support in the semi-annual compensation cycle including market research, creating and administering merit increase data files, and contributing to the continuous improvement of the compensation process. Work very closely with the Finance team.
Support the team with research, data analytics and modeling, analyzing internal and external practices to further design our total rewards programs.
Take a lead role in conducting and participating in total rewards surveys that support the ongoing development of our Total Rewards strategy. Analyze results and present data to show overall market trends and competitiveness. Complete ad hoc market requests for the business.
Maintain all policy and program documentation related to Total Rewards.
Lead or be a key member on a variety of projects related to changes in Total Rewards (ie. Job Description project, Pay Equity, Salary Structure review, etc.).
Lead the Open Enrollment process (in US and Canada) to ensure employees have an opportunity to make changes to their benefit plans.
Drive the wellness program throughout the organization by aligning to company strategy.
Work closely with the People team in answering inquiries related to our total rewards program and processes.
Act as a liaison for our total rewards programs with people managers and employees.
HRIS
Own the integrity and security of Enable’s People data between systems and employee detail changes.
Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance and accuracy.
Play a key role in the Dayforce workflow for review and approval of employee data changes
Assist with the buildout of Dayforce (i.e. data setup, understand Dayforce capabilities, etc.) and help the broader People team with the next evolution of the tool.
Help with the expansion into new states and countries from a systems and total rewards perspective.
Payroll
Assist in new US state setup and tax accountability as needed.
Participate in the project to move from Sequoia PEO US to internal tools and systems.
Help prepare US payroll inputs and audit final registers for USA, and Canada when needed.
Manage state relationships and ensure payroll tax remittance is done accurately and on time.
What we are asking you to bring?!
Minimum 3 years of People (HR) experience, with a focus on compensation/benefits
Working toward an HR professional designation (CCP, CEBS or other equivalent designation)
Strong excel skills (i.e. pivot tables, lookups, advanced formulas, etc.) with the ability to model moderate to complex data sets.
Highly organized with strong attention to accuracy and detail
Excellent communication ability – both verbally and written – to present information clearly and effectively
Ability to explain complex plan details to Managers, Employees
Ability to operate with absolute confidentiality
Abiility to work in an environment of fast change and ambiguity
Proactive mindset
USA Payroll experience in multiple states an asset
HRIS experience, with specific Ceridian Dayforce experience a plus

Title: Service Mgmt Analyst - Data
Description:
Experience with data analytics and/or dashboarding technology would be considered an asset.
Thorough and detail-oriented professional with passion of ITSM,…
Descriptions:
Job Title: ITSM Process Coordinator (IT Asset Management)
Company, Department: Nova Scotia Power – IT
Location: Halifax, NS – Hybrid
Type of Employment: Regular, Full Time
Closing Date: April 9, 2023
Reference Number: 11124
The Opportunity:
We are currently looking to fill the position of ITSM Process Coordinator (IT Asset Management) in a Permanent position. We’re hiring solution-minded people excited to help us grow into the future.
Reporting to the Manager, IT Service Delivery, the ITSM Process Coordinator understands and has proven experience with ITIL service asset and configuration management processes in an operational environment and will take the stewardship of NSPI’s centralized IT/OT hardware and software asset repository, CMDB and the enabling technology.
This role is a key player contributing to the health and maturity of CMDB and IT/OT asset management. This role also contributes to NSPI's cyber security program success, improves the alignment of IT service asset and configuration management practice within ITIL best practice framework.
Key Responsibilities:
Practice ownership of Hardware Asset Management (HAM) and Software Asset Management (SAM) practices. Ensures these processes deliver business values, documented, clearly communicated, understood across the enterprise, and continue growing Asset Management maturity across IT/OT domains.
Contributes to and enables a long-term roadmap of technology capabilities and process improvements related to the HAM and SAM practice.
Performs day to day ServiceNow platform administration work specifically related to HAM/SAM and CMDB, IT contract management modules.
Primarily responsible for overseeing and driving the integrity and completeness of asset and CMDB data;
Being the ITSM practice steward and advocate, works with all the groups within IT operations and across the enterprise where technology assets are captured and managed on ServiceNow platform; performs day-to-day asset and CMDB data administration.
Works with NSPI IT MSP service providers to ensure Asset and Configuration Management processes and policies are being followed.
Delivers regular management report and continually manages the asset management health dashboard and analytics reporting of measurements and KPI results.
Closely works with other ITSM practice owners, IT operations leaders on continual improvement of CMDB and asset management related standard, process, procedures and enabling technology.
Skills, Capabilities and Experience:
Thorough and detail-oriented professional with passion of ITSM, asset management and data.
5+ years experience in an ITIL environment or Service Management discipline with direct exposure and understanding of asset management, end-user computing, business applications, could, mobile & telecom and infrastructure support services;
Experience with CMDB/Discovery technology and hands-on experience in using and maintaining CMDB health (CI data and CI relationship completeness and integrity validation) would be considered an asset.
Ability to collect, evaluate and consolidate data and information from multiple sources, resolve conflicts and streamline solutions and tactics.
Proficient in using Microsoft Office 365 such as Teams, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint, and collaboration tools to perform data analysis, create reports and document processes/workflows.
Experience with data analytics and/or dashboarding technology would be considered an asset.
Experience in using ITSM solutions and/or ServiceNow platform would be considered an asset.
Effective written and oral communication skills.
We offer remote work opportunities, to be discussed with your leader, however you are required to live in or be willing to relocate Nova Scotia for this role.
At Nova Scotia Power, everyone is a leader in their own right. Our Leadership Competencies set standards that advance our business strategy, deliver results for customers, and provide career development for employees. The successful individual in this role will take ownership and acts with integrity, cultivates innovation and embraces change and builds strong and collaborative relationships.
Why join our team?
Flexibility: Hybrid work model with flexible remote workdays.
Health & Wellbeing: A comprehensive benefits plan, access to a free on-site fitness centre Employee and Family Assistance Program, parental leave top-up plan and wellness benefits.
Grow Your Career: Opportunities to advance within and between our affiliate companies, a focus on employee development and available sponsored education programs.
Community Engagement & Care: Corporate investments in the places where our people live and work, mentoring opportunities, fundraising-matching & volunteer programs, and scholarships for children of employees.
Competitive Compensation: A comprehensive benefits plan, short-term incentive plans and employer matching RRSP contributions.
At Nova Scotia Power, we are committed to providing safe, reliable electricity so that our customers and communities can thrive. We work across the province, from Yarmouth to Wreck Cove, to prevent power outages and to strengthen our electrical system—for today, and for the future.
As a subsidiary of Emera Inc, we provide 95% of the generation, transmission, and distribution of electrical power to approximately 540,000 residential, commercial, and industrial customers. Our company is focused on new technologies to enhance customer service and reliability, reduce emissions, and add renewable energy.
We are proud to live and work in Nova Scotia. It is why we work to understand how we can give back meaningfully, support local organizations and work collaboratively to enhance the communities we call home.
We believe that every unique perspective should be valued and that everyone should have a sense of safety and belonging—at work, and in our communities. Leveraging the thoughts of a diverse workforce helps us to be innovative and provide the best service to our customers.
If working in an environment focused on innovation, safety and putting customers and community first inspires you, we want to hear from you. Apply by April 9, 2023, and tell us what excites you about this role.
Finally, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We are dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team, so if your experience is close to what we have listed above, please consider applying. If you do not see yourself in this role but want to join our team, please set up a Job Alert to learn about future opportunities!

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
§ Database SQL query language knowledge for data-analysis an asset.
§ Adopt a data driven approach in all activities, not only when giving an opinion or arguing…
Descriptions:
Job Title: Business Analyst
Division: Beazley Shared Services - IT
Key Relationships: Underwriting, Claims, Operations and Support, Enterprise Architecture, IT Development, IT Testing, IT Operations.
Job Summary: Build strong relationships with key business stakeholders in order to collaborate and accurately and efficiently elicit, challenge, and document requirements, processes, and scope to enable the successful delivery of business change.

Beazley:
Beazley is a specialist insurance company with over 30 years’ experience helping people, communities, and businesses to manage risk all around the world. Our products are wide ranging from cyber & tech to marine, healthcare, financial institutions, and contingency, covering risks like the weather, film production or protection from deadly weapons.

We are a flexible and innovative employer offering a friendly, collaborative, diverse and inclusive work environment. We encourage applications from all backgrounds. We empower people to choose where to work given the work that needs to be done. Collaboration in office spaces is important but we do not mandate a set number of days in the office or from home – you decide what works best for you and the role you are in.

We have a wonderful mix of cultures, experiences, and backgrounds at Beazley with over 1500 of us working around the world. Employee’s diversity, experience and passion allow us to keep innovating and moving forward, delivering the best. We hire people with wide perspectives, and we have set bold diversity targets as we work towards excellence.

Key Responsibilities:
§ Gain an in-depth understanding of the business to support modernisation and business as usual (BAU) initiatives.
§ Elicit, understand, challenge and translate business needs into requirements and/or user stories, creating appropriate functional and non-functional specifications.
§ Work within a variety of project and solution design frameworks as required at Beazley, including agile, SCRUM and Use Case tools or any other approach agreed within the team.
§ Work closely with the Product Manager and delivery team to ensure that any user story is detailed, thorough and ready for development, owning the story from conception to final delivery of value.
§ Help formulate and challenge new IT approaches and systems required to improve business productivity and profitability.
§ Contribute to the identification and design of innovative solutions to address business needs.
§ Provide the link between the internal stakeholder, technical teams and any third-party regarding software functionality, throughout the project lifecycle.
§ Work with the test team to ensure that the business requirement is adequately represented in the defined test plans.
§ Work with the architecture and data team to promote best practises and investigate opportunities to improve the system landscape.
§ Ensure solution designs align with Enterprise Architecture principles as well as any design principles and strategy decisions made within your product team or the platform, ensuring guidance is sought if necessary.
§ Proactively monitor and communicate industry, functional, and technology trends to stakeholders as well a coach them as to how best harness these to drive business value.
§ Adopt a data driven approach in all activities, not only when giving an opinion or arguing a point but being a guardian for how data flows through the organisation and how it must be respected as a key performance driver.
Outputs (to include but not limited to):

During discovery activity
§ Detailed business requirements accurately interpreted for IT use.
§ End to end process maps (in conjunction with and confirmed by the business) where required.
§ Identification of process improvement opportunities and the associated costs and benefits
§ Detailed functional and non-functional requirements for agreement by the project stakeholders

During design and build activity
§ Detailed change requirements accurately interpreted for IT use.
§ Revised process maps as appropriate.
§ Business process documentation, user manual changes and training.

During test and release activity
§ Overview of developing training needs of user community.
§ Any emerging changes / fixes requiring new specs.
§ Responsibility for the delivery and QA of system and user documentation.

Relationships:
§ Develop relationships with senior management and staff in all relevant areas of Beazley and ensure that there is an open and constructive dialogue regarding IT needs and issues.
§ Ensure that all relevant staff receive clear and frequent updates regarding business analytical tasks and progress as necessary.
§ Work with all in the business to elevate the perception and capability of IT.

Personal Specification:
Education and Qualifications
§ International Diploma in Business Analysis desirable.

Skills and Abilities
§ Ability to understand business strategy and the work of other departments within the organisation.
§ Ability to see the big picture and have experience of successfully shaping strategic issues through to implementation.
§ Ability to coordinate inputs from several departments, in order to reach a shared vision for IT requirements.
§ Ability to use structured techniques for evaluating business processes and documenting user requirements.
§ Ability to negotiate and network with stakeholders

Knowledge and Experience
§ Experience as a Business Analyst within the Insurance sector.
§ Highly skilled in the analysis and documentation of complex business processes.
§ In-depth experience with multiple methods for the elicitation, validation, and documentation of requirements for complex Information Systems.
§ Exposure to a wide range of complex Information Systems across a global enterprise.
§ Extensive experience working with global project teams, software providers, and outsourcers.
§ End to end experience of the project lifecycle over numerous medium and large-scale projects.
§ Results orientated with good communication and interpersonal skills.
§ Desire to be involved in continuously improving Change Delivery governance processes.
§ Broad understanding of project delivery practices and management methodologies
§ Experience as a Business Analyst within the Lloyd’s of London market, advantageous.
§ Use of various analysis and project management tools covering scope definition, requirements documentation and progress reporting.
§ Database SQL query language knowledge for data-analysis an asset

Competencies
§ Managing resources effectively.
§ Technical competence expertise.
§ Problem solving.
§ Purposeful communication.
§ Broad-based thinking.
§ Business Awareness / Corporate Thinking.
§ Creativity / Innovation.
Don’t meet all the requirements? At Beazley we're committed to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace. If you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t perfectly align with every requirement and qualification in the JD, we encourage you to apply anyway. You might just be the right candidate for this, or one of our other roles.

Title: Manager, Data and Systems Analyst
Description:
Strong technical skills regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques.
Experience with MS Office suite required.
Descriptions:
Build Your Career at Aecon
Aecon is proud to build some of the most impactful infrastructure projects of this generation. From the roads and transit systems that connect our communities, to the communication networks that link us from coast-to-coast, and the water infrastructure that supplies our businesses and homes. Our integral work includes constructing the pipelines that join provinces with the energy that fuels the nation, and the airports and ports that connect us all. Aecon is there, safely and sustainably building the future.

We lead the infrastructure industry with purpose, and our people are at the heart of everything we do. Our business success relies on strong execution and continuous improvement – driven by the diversity, expertise and teamwork of our employees. We are always searching the globe for exceptional candidates to join the Aecon family and be a part of our forward-thinking, innovative, best-in-class organization!

Position Overview
As a Manager, Data and System Analyst, you will play a key role in providing ongoing support to the business unit in the area of data analytics, digital system implementation, data management for the various projects. This support also includes ongoing risk analysis in the areas of operational performance, safety, quality and cost when providing ongoing analysis and reporting of production data. This position reports directly to the Senior Manager Technical Services.

Please note, this positon requires the individual to travel to remote work sites as needed.

What You'll Do Here
Manage and maintain Third Party data and information systems.
Manage and monitor performance metrics and prepare reporting processes that monitor and report progress
Act as a subject matter expert for digital application, integrations, and customizations
Collect, manage, and interpret data from the different digital systems to help identify trends
Interpret data and ensure timely and appropriate professional publications
Develop/Implement recommendations for further enhancement of existing systems
Prepare information reporting and statistics for use by Projects and/or Business Units
Construct workflow charts and diagrams, study system capabilities and write specifications
Perform functional testing on enhancements, modifications, and system changes.
Write improved procedures, workflows, and user guides.
Be able to coach, teach, and mentor on the use of the digital systems and supports education and training programs
Assist with and/or lead the gathering of requirements and developing formal business specifications when adding new functionality to different digital application.
Support development and delivery of training to business and project users
Creation of ad hoc reports as well as support of existing reports
Perform functional testing on enhancements, modifications, and system changes.
Maintain test/development environment
Liaison with different 3rd party digital system providers
Independently required to plan, schedule and manage own time, including taking into account the plans of others
Development of reports, and procedures as required

What You Bring to the Team
Minimum 3 – 5 years’ experience in data analytics or project engineering in a construction or EPC environment
Bachelor's Degree preferred, in programs related, in a Data Analytics or Engineering discipline
Excellent analytical and organizational skills
Excellent interpersonal skills
Excellent communication, publication and presentation skills
Experience with the Construction industry preferred
Experience working with users to gather requirements
Understanding management processes and database experience required
Experience with MS Office suite required
Strong technical skills regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets (Excel, SPSS, SAS etc)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Adept at queries, macros, report writing and presenting findings
Understanding of business intelligent platforms and supporting platforms (preferably with Microsoft product knowledge) i.e. Power Bi, Power App, Microsoft Flow and Excel
The skillset to design and implement databases to support the business unit

Aecon fosters diversity, inclusion and belonging within and across our organization. We welcome all to apply including, women, visible minorities, Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, and persons of any sexual orientation or gender identity.

We are committed to adhering to the objectives and requirements outlined in the Accessible Canada Act (ACA), and to meeting the accessibility needs of persons with disabilities in a timely manner, through the implementation of the requirements of the ACA and its applicable regulations. If you require accommodation under the ACA Act during any step of the application process please click here.

Title: Computer Programmer/Analyst (Machine Learning Data Analyst)
Description:
Experience with streaming analytics and processing of raw data ingested in real time and process of data in hot storage or data lake.
What we’re looking for.
Descriptions:
What you will do
We have an exciting opportunity to join our Software Development Team as we are actively recruiting for a Computer Programmer/Analyst responsible for developing and maintaining machine learning models, data integration systems and software systems which utilize generated models in an automated manner. This position reports to the Software Development Manager.
Our company
CenterLine (Windsor), Limited is a recognized leader in manufacturing standard configured products and custom designed resistance welding, spot welding, arc welding and metal working equipment. A dynamic vertically integrated family-owned business since 1957, CenterLine is proud to be recognized as one of Canada’s Best Managed companies. Our company is growing and offers additional career opportunities as you develop skills and gain experience. Please see our website WWW.CNTRLINE.COM for more details on opportunities within our company.
Our people are our key competitive advantage in today’s global market. We are committed to bridging the digital gap between the organization and our customers by aiming to develop Machine Learning methodologies which will take us from mere data analysis to data insights for actionable intelligence.
We believe that the day-to-day functioning of our organization and industry 4.0 connected machinery, generates data which is ripe for analysis via Machine Learning methodologies. Unlocking insights gained from this dataset would prove valuable towards providing our customers with much required visibility.
Commitment to our People
You belong here. You will gain extensive process and product experience to expand your knowledge and personal development in a family-oriented culture that promotes engagement and work/life balance.
What we’re looking for
Understand various data sets within the organization and create models for data analytics / machine learning
Write, test, and deploy code for various data insights and data visualization needs
Help architect cloud-based systems to proficiently process and analyze data and to train and deploy ML models
Participate in architecture design decisions, and investigate SDKs, frameworks and APIs
Support internal processes through the creation of data models, workflows, and automation
Support company training and continuous improvement initiatives by knowledge sharing
What you need to succeed
Computer Science degree, or Web Development / Data Analytics related diploma, with a skillset proven through relevant work experience or personal projects
Proficiency in data analysis, modelling and visualization using modern Business Intelligence tools
Adept in developing ETL automations and Data Integration processes by understanding the data flow according to the requirements
Knowledge of MS Azure Serverless offerings (Example, Azure Functions, Event Hub, Blob Storage, Azure Digital Twin, Azure Data Explorer).
Experience with streaming analytics and processing of raw data ingested in real time and process of data in hot storage or data lake
Knowledge of object-oriented programming, client server architecture, relational database management
Knowledge of Data Science / Machine Learning related technologies and methodologies
Web Development experience an asset
Additional Benefits
Company matching pension plan
Continued education opportunities
Employee Assistant Plan
Employee Profit-Sharing Bonus
Health, dental, and vision care
Life insurance
Retirement benefits
Social Committee
Tuition Reimbursement
Wellness Committee
CenterLine (Windsor) Limited is committed to having a workforce that is reflective of diversity, equity and inclusion and strongly encourages applications from qualified individuals from the designated groups.
In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Centerline Windsor Limited will provide accommodations anytime throughout the recruitment process to applicants with disabilities. If selected to participate in the recruitment, process, please inform the Human Resources staff of the nature of any accommodation(s) that you may require.

Title: Analyste de données/ Data Analyst
Description:
Ensure data integrity and accuracy to drive trust and adoption in the data solutions.
Demonstrated 2+ years experience using data to drive results and decisions…
Descriptions:
Data Analyst - Montreal

WE ARE KLEVER

Take a bold step in your career by joining the team at Klever Programmatic, a global leader in programmatic advertising solutions and one of the fastest growing companies in North America. Klever allows advertisers and agencies of all sizes to advertise on a wide array of digital programmatic channels (display, video, CTV, programmatic audio, DOOH, native, mobile…). Programmatic advertising is a complex and fast-growing field where Klever’s expertise is scarce and essential.

Summary
Already one of the fastest growing independent trading desks in North America, Klever is looking for a Data Analyst to join its team. Under the supervision of our Director of Finance & Analytics, your role will be to work alongside our high-performing traders, our tech team and many other stakeholders to provide data-driven insights into programmatic campaigns. We are looking for a candidate to work out of our Montreal office (hybrid). The ideal candidate has a track record of using large advertising datasets to tell convincing stories, drive decisions and improve results.

Job Description
Develop deep expertise in programmatic campaign data. Analyze and trace its data lineage from its sources, through its transformations, to its final usage in reports.
Ensure data integrity and accuracy to drive trust and adoption in the data solutions.
Analyze large datasets to drive campaign optimizations and provide recommendations on campaigns using statistical modeling.
Help the trading team with their advanced client reporting needs.
Build, develop, maintain, document Tableau dashboards, gather requirements from traders and other business departments, and with support from the tech team.
Contribute to driving results on strategic data projects for the business by liaising between the business and engineering and providing recommendations.
Support client reporting automation and client channel attribution projects.
Proactively manage stakeholder expectations and resolve data issues in a timely manner.


Qualifications
Hard experience and skills
Demonstrated 2+ years experience using data to drive results and decisions, preferably in the digital marketing world
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field
Experience with visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
Proficiency with SQL and relational databases
Experience applying statistical analyses and modeling to business problems
Python, R and other coding skills are a plus
Experience developing data solutions for clients is a plus
Soft skills
Outstanding story-telling, communication and presentation skills to be able to be an effective bridge between business teams and the technical team
Creative thinker with excellent problem solving abilities
Ability to work efficiently in a fast-paced, agile environment
Self-motivated and entrepreneurial, but also can work well in a team
Detail-oriented and organized, demonstrated ability to work independently


___

Analyste de données - Montréal

NOUS SOMMES KLEVER

Faites un pas audacieux dans votre carrière en rejoignant l'équipe de Klever Programmatique, un leader mondial des solutions de publicité programmatique et l'une des entreprises à la croissance la plus rapide en Amérique du Nord. Klever permet aux annonceurs et agences de toutes tailles de faire de la publicité sur un large éventail de canaux digitaux programmatiques (display, vidéo, CTV, audio programmatique, DOOH, natif, mobile…). La publicité programmatique est un domaine complexe et en pleine croissance où l'expertise de Klever est rare et essentielle.

En résumé

Déjà l'un des experts en programmatiques indépendantes à la croissance la plus rapide en Amérique du Nord, Klever est à la recherche d'un analyste de données pour rejoindre son équipe. Sous la supervision de notre directeur des finances et de l'analyse, votre rôle sera de travailler aux côtés de nos gestionnaires hautement performants, de notre équipe technique et de nombreux autres intervenants pour fournir des informations basées sur les données dans les campagnes programmatiques. Nous recherchons un candidat pour travailler à partir de notre bureau de Montréal (hybride). Le candidat idéal a fait ses preuves dans l'utilisation de grands ensembles de données publicitaires pour raconter des histoires convaincantes, prendre des décisions et améliorer les résultats.

Description de l'emploi

Développer une expertise approfondie dans les données de campagne programmatique. Analysez et tracez la lignée de ses données depuis ses sources, en passant par ses transformations, jusqu'à son utilisation finale dans les rapports.
Assurez l'intégrité et l'exactitude des données pour renforcer la confiance et l'adoption des solutions de données.
Analysez de grands ensembles de données pour optimiser les campagnes et fournir des recommandations sur les campagnes à l'aide de la modélisation statistique.
Aidez l'équipe de négociation à répondre à ses besoins avancés en matière de rapports sur les clients.
Construisez, développez, maintenez, documentez les tableaux de bord Tableau, recueillez les exigences des commerçants et d'autres départements commerciaux, et avec le soutien de l'équipe technique.
Contribuer à l'obtention de résultats sur des projets de données stratégiques pour l'entreprise en assurant la liaison entre l'entreprise et l'ingénierie et en fournissant des recommandations.
Soutenir les projets d'automatisation des rapports clients et d'attribution des canaux clients.
Gérez de manière proactive les attentes des parties prenantes et résolvez les problèmes de données en temps opportun.

Qualifications
Solide expérience et compétences
Expérience démontrée de plus de 2 ans dans l'utilisation des données pour générer des résultats et des décisions, de préférence dans le monde du marketing numérique
Baccalauréat dans un domaine pertinent
Expérience avec les outils de visualisation (Tableau, PowerBI, etc.)
Maîtrise de SQL et des bases de données relationnelles
Expérience de l'application d'analyses statistiques et de modélisation à des problèmes commerciaux
Python, R et d'autres compétences en codage sont un plus
Une expérience dans le développement de solutions de données pour les clients est un plus

Compétences non techniques
Compétences exceptionnelles en matière de narration, de communication et de présentation pour être en mesure d'être un pont efficace entre les équipes commerciales et l'équipe technique
Penseur créatif avec d'excellentes capacités de résolution de problèmes
Capacité à travailler efficacement dans un environnement rapide et agile
Motivé et entreprenant, mais peut aussi bien travailler en équipe
Souci du détail et organisé, capacité démontrée à travailler de manière autonome

Title: Senior Data Analyst, System Optimization
Description: Coordinates the exchange of data with various agencies, including but not limited to: Ministry of Health, Canadian Institute for Health Information, other…
Descriptions:
Why Fraser Health?:
We invite you to apply today and find out why more than 95% of new employees recommend Fraser Health to their friends as an exceptional place to work. A 2022 BC Top Employer, we value diversity in the work force and seek to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring & Trust.

Are you looking for that opportunity to put your information management expertise to use in healthcare? Do you want to work with a team dedicated to service excellence through the process of analysis and problem-solving of complex issues? If you have answered “yes”, then we want you to keep reading!

We are currently hiring a Full Time Senior Data Analyst to provide analytic leadership to the System Optimization team at Central City located in Surrey, B.C. - an ideal location with access to rapid transit, and shopping services as well as other amenities.

Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services to over 1.9 million people in 20 diverse communities from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional, ancestral and unceded territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka’pamux Nations, and is home to six Métis Chartered Communities. Our team of 45,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care.

Effective October 26th 2021, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization “WHO” approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines). Please note this applies to all postings, and individual medical exemptions must be approved by the Provincial Health Officer.

Curious to learn what it’s like to work here? Like us on Facebook (@fraserhealthcareers), follow us on Twitter & Instagram (@FHCareer), or connect with us on LinkedIn (fraserhealthcareers) for first-hand employee insights.
Detailed Overview:
Supporting the Vision, Values, Purpose and Commitments of Fraser Health including service delivery that is centered around patients/clients/residents and families:
The Senior Data Analyst provides analytics leadership support to System Optimization; identifies, develops, implements and maintains innovative responses to the information and analytical needs of the organization, as well as ensuring the department's technical infrastructure is developed and sustained. This position synthesizes information and requests from all levels of the organization, including operational and clinical management, to provide analysis, interpretations and recommendations that have direct impact on decisions relating to the financial, human resources, and patient care services. Other responsibilities include administrative coordination and supervision to technical staff, project management and support, training, managing confidential information, user needs assessment and liaising with end users of decision support technology. Provides senior expertise with respect to quality and performance measurement and evaluation, reporting process optimization, development and implementation of practice standards, utilization management strategies and information management and analysis. Partners with other senior members of the department in liaising with staff and leadership across multiple clinical operations and corporate portfolios. Responsibilities:
Provides leadership in developing, processing, evaluating and reviewing information as well as providing interpretations and recommendations to all levels of the organization for decision-making purposes.
Acts as senior analytical resource to System Optimization, and provides senior expertise with respect to quality and performance measurement, best practices, evaluation, utilization management strategies, emerging analytics / technology trends, and information management and analysis.
Plans and coordinates quality assurance and quality control on the release of data for consistency with the organizational practices, including data definitions, metric calculations, reporting standards, and the protection of security and privacy.
Assesses, develops and evaluates the optimization of existing reporting procedures, explores automation opportunities, reduces redundancies and ensures analytic products offer actionable insight and interpretation.
Recommends departmental standards for database architecture and design; defines and maintains metadata; recommends requirements and standards for Extract Transformation and Load (ETL), including tools, methods and documentation.
Ensures that knowledge is transferred between Managing Consultants, Project Leaders, Data Analysts and other technical resources both before, during and after the development of decision support applications.
Identifies and monitors data quality issues within source systems and escalates the need to remedy to the data stewards for source systems.
Liaises with clients in partnership with other members of System Optimization to understand business analytical needs, and develop both short- and long-term solutions through decision briefs and an analytical plan.
Coordinates the exchange of data with various agencies, including but not limited to: Ministry of Health, Canadian Institute for Health Information, other Health Authorities, and external research groups.
Acts as a project manager for assigned analytics projects, including the development, monitoring, and evaluation of project plans and deliverables.
Provides supervision, coaching and mentorship to Data Analysts to support continuous learning, training, growth, and knowledge dissemination. Facilitates team-building and staff development by acting as an analytics role model and resource for the analytics team; determines appropriate assignment of staff resources; promotes collaborative work culture. advises the Managing Consultant of issues or concerns.
Works collaboratively and effectively with internal and external stakeholders to identify information needs and communicates those requirements to other System Optimization team members.
Qualifications: Education and Experience

Master's degree in Computer Science and/or related applied quantitative scientific field, plus five (5) years of related experience in decision support tools, data analysis, performance reporting, and/or health care management, as well as experience in managing technical projects and directing technical staff, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience. Proficiency in T-SQL and Power BI is preferred.

Competencies

Demonstrates the leadership practices of the Fraser Health Leadership Framework of Clear, Caring and Courageous and creates the conditions for people to succeed.
Professional/Technical Capabilities
Advanced knowledge of decision support tools, big data analytics, statistics, and databases
General knowledge of current health care systems, issues and trends
Ability to exercise sound judgement, critical thinking and effective decision-making
Ability to analyze and problem-solve complex issues towards effective solutions
Ability to translate complex data analysis and communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with all levels of the organization, including advanced report presentation and writing skills
Effective project management skills to define deliverables and develop project plans
Effective facilitation and negotiation skills
Ability to respond to changing priorities and unforeseen circumstances
Ability to organize, prioritize and balance work
Ability to operate related equipment, including computer software applications
Working knowledge of PDSA, Lean, Six Sigma and other flow process improvement concepts
Physically ability to perform the duties of the position

Descriptions:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they are doing!
We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.
Data Visualization Lead
Remote
Fractal is a strategic AI partner to Fortune 500 companies with a vision to power every human decision in the enterprise. Fractal is building a world where individual choices, freedom, and diversity are the greatest assets. An ecosystem where human imagination is at the heart of every decision. Where no possibility is written off, only challenged to get better. We believe that a true Fractalite is the one who empowers imagination with intelligence. Fractal has been featured as a Great Place to Work by The Economic Times in partnership with the Great Place to Work® Institute and recognized as a ‘Cool Vendor’ and a ‘Vendor to Watch’ by Gartner.
Please visit
Fractal | Intelligence for Imagination
for more information about Fractal
Position Overview:
This role would be focused on our business intelligence and data engineering development, and would be responsible for defining and leading thought-leadership on client engagement, defining visualizations for data & crafting engineering requirements.
Who We Are Looking For
We are looking for a Lead Data Visualization expert to lead requirements refinement and engagement of one of our business intelligence development teams.
You will be an effective technologist, passionate about Power BI, and approaches all new development empathetic to the user experience. You will implement and support the ongoing effort to use visualization standards, tool assessment methodologies, and training approach across squads.
You are a mature consultant, able to understand diverse requirements and engage directly with clients, providing a senior touch in order guide them to the correct data visualizations and expressions of requirements for optimally solving their problems. You are able to guide a conversation seamlessly, and you always show up prepared to meetings with an agenda, guidance, and are a proactive communicator.
What You Will Work On
Development of sophisticated data visualizations that lead to improved client performance and accomplishment of strategic and/or operational goals.
Helping customer team express their OKRs and results in an effective way.
Own relationships with diverse business partners to understand current and future customer and business needs, elicit platform requirements, and define relevant strategic questions
Support and evolve standards for all cycles of visualization development including requirements gathering, iterative prototyping, development, code/asset management and versioning, documentation, and maintenance.
Actively evaluate and continuously improve the approach, toolset, and implementation of visual analytics and reporting
Partner across data engineering, data science, client teams (to understand subject matter of their business) and other functional teams to accelerate and use visualization strategies, data capabilities, and insights as part of the company’s integrated data offense
Evolve analytics capabilities and champion visualization and dashboarding standard methodologies for UI/UX development, data quality, deployment, and sustainable maintenance, including fast, iterative experimentation and measurement
What You Will Bring
Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Technology, Computer Science or other related fields or combination of relevant education, experience and training
10+ years of relevant experience developing dashboards, data visualizations, analytical reports, and self-service tools preferred
5+ years leading or mentoring teams developing analytic tools, visual analytics, sophisticated analytics, or related practices Expert level proficiency in SQL preferred
Experienced business understanding, with a passion for business reporting, analysis, and working with business intelligence tools and large amounts of data
In-depth experience in solving sophisticated problems through data and analytics, including providing insights that are logical, data driven, simple to understand and aligned to business goals
Experience working together with key stakeholders (product & portfolio managers, product or merchandising managers, executives, etc.) to design and build data visualizations to support business performance and goals
Ability to develop strong partnerships across a multi-layered, fast moving, results-driven organization
Relevant experience in user-centered design and capturing and communicating user needs and coaching developers to promote these methods
Experience in navigating sophisticated business relationships while ensuring products are designed for optimal user experience and have measurable criteria for success
Expertise with visual analysis technologies such as Power BI, Tableau, Domo, SAS, QlikView, JavaScript, or similar tools
Knowledge developing in cloud environments such as Microsoft Azure, Power BI, Tableau, Google Cloud, and AWS; MPP, Big Data and NoSQL technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Impala, Hive, MongoDB, HBase, or Cassandra are a plus.
Excellent written, verbal and presentation skills – a visual and verbal storyteller who can guide and develop these skills across the team with a solid basis in business intelligence.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to interpret complex data and communicate insights effectively.
Proficiency in SQL, data modeling, and data analysis.
Expertise in creating and designing interactive dashboards, reports, and visualizations.
Preferred Skills
Certification in Power BI, Tableau or other data visualization tool, with an emphasis
3+ years in the Retail / CPG industry
Expertise in data warehousing, dimensional modeling, and the ability to drive standard methodologies in data management and governance
Solid understanding of various database management systems like as well as proficiency in working with large data sets.
Pay:
The wage range for this role takes into account the wide range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to skill sets; experience and training; licensure and certifications; and other business and organizational needs. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the position may be filled. At Fractal, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for their role and compensation decisions are dependent on the facts and circumstances of each case. A reasonable estimate of the current range is: $96,000 - $149,000. In addition, for the current performance period, you may be eligible for a discretionary bonus.
Benefits:
As a full-time employee of the company or as an hourly employee working more than 30 hours per week, you will be eligible to participate in the health, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability plans in accordance with the plan documents, which may be amended from time to time. You will be eligible for benefits on the first day of employment with the Company. In addition, you are eligible to participate in the Company 401(k) Plan after 30 days of employment, in accordance with the applicable plan terms. The Company provides for 11 paid holidays and 12 weeks of Parental Leave. We also follow a “free time” PTO policy, allowing you the flexibility to take time needed for either sick time or vacation.
Fractal provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

At Loblaw, we help millions of Canadians get through their best days, worst days, celebration days, and every day. Through our innovation and quality products, we’re here for our friends, neighbours, family members and colleagues.

The Senior Analyst, Allocations is responsible to support the review process on projected forecasts for all promotional and special programs. They will assist in determining the correct amount of inventory is allocated to stores based on store specific sales history, and seasonality impacts. The Senior Analyst, Allocations will provide the analytics to support the gap in projections between category and allocations while ensuring that both sales are maximized and inventory is minimized.
Accountabilities:
Provide forecast and allocation reviews on all regular promotional items and special programs
Provide an item specific total sales forecast review with the allocation team
Provide analytics to support the forecast/allocation position if there is a large discrepancy between the category and allocation estimates.
Determine item allocation according to store specific sales history, mapping and seasonality impacts, spread across all available buckets while considering data accuracy and integrity
Review item sell thru and propose action for increased or decreased purchases to optimize store sales and inventory.
Review ad change files to ensure that items are purchased or cancelled.
Partner with Category Team and Off-shore Allocation Teams to review promotional sales strategies and planning.
Collaborate with the Supply Chain Buying Customer Support (BCS) team on allocations

Strong analytical and communication skills
Ability to work in a team-oriented environment
Knowledge of SAP, JDA, and Supply Chain systems/processes an asse
Strong computer skills (MS Office including Excel
