Title: Laboratory Analyst (Lead-Pb)
Description:
Record data in a specified manner.
Clerical duties including report generation and data entry of sample receipt into LIMS System.
Descriptions:
EMSL Canada, the fastest growing provider of environmental laboratory services, is currently seeking a full time Laboratory Analyst specializing in Lead(Pb) analysis for its Mississauga, ON laboratory location, a suburb of Toronto.

Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Sample preparation and acid digestion for Lead (Pb) analysis on various media such as: paint, soil, wipes and cassettes.
TCLP sample preparation, extraction, and analysis by FLAA.
Setting up analytical batches and analysis, calibration, and maintenance of FLAA.
Should be able to perform basic chemistry tasks such as pipetting, utilizing analytical balances, performing volumetric measurements, preparation of reagents, and standards while maintaining documentation and record keeping.
Data analysis, evaluation and documentation of all results using LIMS
Maintain and operate laboratory instrumentation/equipment
Perform QA/QC practices and adhere to policies per company QA/QC manual
Record data in a specified manner
Clerical duties including report generation and data entry of sample receipt into LIMS System
Cross-training in other areas of analysis may be required to meet business demands.

Requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in Science a plus, chemistry preferred
One to two years' experience working in a lab setting with FLAA a plus and desired
Candidate must be able to distinguish between colors in order to perform analysis
Must be able to work independently or with a team
Must be able to work in a fast-paced setting, multi-task, and prioritize assignments
Must have good communication, computer, typing, and organizational skills

Available Shift:
Monday to Friday 9:00 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.
Training shift to start will be Monday to Friday 8:00 a.m. to 4:30 p.m.

EMSL Canada offers supplemental benefits and paid time off.

EMSL Canada is Canada's Premier Laboratory Testing Services Company.

For more than 30 years, EMSL has been a worldwide leader in asbestos testing, lead testing, mold testing, allergen testing, and other quality analytical laboratory services.

At EMSL Canada, we deliver materials testing, characterization, and forensic laboratory services for a wide range of commercial, industrial, regulatory and law enforcement clients in Ontario and throughout Canada. A majority of our services focus on supporting environmental investigations related to water quality, indoor air quality, food quality and much more.

EMSL Canada, Inc. is proud to deliver quality testing lab services to clients throughout Canada, including Toronto, Ottawa and surrounding areas in Ontario. We also serve Alberta, British Columbia, Manitoba, New Brunswick, Newfoundland, Labrador, Nova Scotia, Nunavut, Prince Edward Island, Quebec, Saskatchewan and Yukon. EMSL Analytical, Inc. is a North American company serving all areas throughout the United States and Canada.

To find out more about EMSL Canada, please visit our website at: www.emslcanada.ca/

To find out more about EMSL Analytical Inc., please visit www.emsl.com

EMSL Canada is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Title: Business Analyst, Corporate & Theatre Development
Description:
Compile, analyze, and distribute contractual, financial and performance data on existing clients to various stakeholders.
Ad hoc analyses as required.
Descriptions:
ABOUT IMAX

IMAX is not your everyday entertainment experience. With over 50 years of history as a global innovator in entertainment technology, our employees and their careers have constantly gone beyond the ordinary. From offices across North America, Europe, and Asia, we combine proprietary software, architecture, and equipment with industry-leading knowledge and connections to create experiences that take audiences beyond the edge of their seats to a world they have never imagined. Our Hollywood team are trusted movie business insiders with decades of production experience, acting as advisors to top filmmakers and studios across the world. Our technology experts are leaders in the industry, constantly pushing the limits of what is possible in entertainment. Our sales and marketing teams are talented professionals who build and enhance the IMAX brand globally.

IMAX's network is among the most important and successful theatrical distribution platforms for major event films around the world, and our growing Live and Enhanced businesses have allowed us to bring the IMAX Experience to our partnerships across live music, events and streaming to provide the best possible experience across any screen. As the world’s leading entertainment technology company, IMAX has revolutionized the way people experience movies, and continues to push the boundaries of entertainment experiences forward. Our employees are driven by a passion to take audiences around the world to places they have only dreamed of.

Come explore IMAX – where innovation, creativity and passion come together. Get inspired, get involved, and ignite your future with IMAX!

Job Description/Requirements

Responsibilities:
Compile, analyze, and distribute contractual, financial and performance data on existing clients to various stakeholders
Prepare deal summaries for restructuring negotiations and in cases of litigation
Maintain renewal database
Facilitate sales team negotiation of renewal agreements including identifying and acting upon contractual requirements for renewal
Support Sales team in negotiations with new and existing clients by providing performance analysis, exclusivity info and other supporting materials as required
Coordinate with Technical Services to satisfy refurbishment requirements for renewing theatres
Work with Finance and Theatre Design & Projects to ensure timely issuance of upfront invoices
Maintain and distribute monthly Upfront Report
Work with the Accounts Receivable team to track exhibitors on payment plans, distribute monthly payment plan report, and aid sales team in following up with clients for payment
Maintain database for legacy and new signed agreements
Prepare competitive analysis of major PLFs and track IMAX performance relative to industry
Maintain and update quarterly One-Pager report for major clients across the network
Prepare analysis and support Sales and Senior Management teams in advance of client meetings and industry conferences
Provide assistance and conduct analysis for Strategic Initiatives team as required
Track pending and unsigned deals and maintain database of CRFs and deals under negotiation
Update worldwide mapping and exclusivity information for all available regions and assist with circuit analyses while maintaining secure access and delivery of the maps/information
Prepare and review JRSA performance and ensure that any anomalies are identified, and appropriate parties are notified to initiate any potential remediation in connection with the appropriate affiliate teams
Prepare presentations for senior executives, Annual Sales Meetings & board meetings
Ad hoc analyses as required

Requirements/Qualifications:
A recognized university or college degree in business/economics and/or finance
Minimum 3-5 years of contract review management and business analysis experience
A broad knowledge of IMAX deal structures and contracts would be an asset
Efficient and highly organized; excellent time-management and adaptability skills
Excellent verbal, written communication and presentation skills
A commitment to professionalism and integrity, collegiality
A high level of planning and organizational skills
Advance Excel skills and proficiency in PowerPoint
SAP knowledge would be an asset
Personal responsibility for the quality and content of your work as it will be used by external stakeholders
Ability to maintain strict confidentiality
Attentive to detail and accuracy, committed to excellence, continuously looks for improvements, monitors quality levels, finds root cause of quality problems, owns/acts on quality problems
Our Commitment To You

IMAX is proud to be an equal opportunity employer!

At IMAX you will be part of a culture built on respect - one that recognizes the unique talents of everyone on the team. We're proud of the differences that make us all unique and we support unity, acceptance, and equal rights for all. Diversity and inclusion among our employees are critical to our success as a global company.

For consideration, please apply online. We thank all applicants for their interest in IMAX but only those selected for an interview will be contacted. Please note, IMAX is currently operating in-office 5 days-a-week. Additionally, all permanent full-time employment is subject to background and employment/reference checks.

Job Summary
A great opportunity to take the next step in your career
The Primary Care Division is responsible for setting provincial direction to support achieving a high functioning primary health care system that meets the needs of all British Columbians. This includes developing strategies and policies using a population-based methodology and health sector performance management framework, supporting implementation activities at the provincial, regional and local levels, and measuring and monitoring progress in alignment with the quadruple aim of achieving better health outcomes and experiences for both providers and patients, at sustainable system costs.

The Planning, Implementation and Oversight Branch actively and collaboratively works with health system partners to support planning and implementation of primary care policies and programs across the province. Further, the Branch supports the reforms that are built around team-based primary care provided through a mix of full-service family practices, Urgent and Primary Care Centres (UPCC), Community Health Centres and First Nations-led Primary Care Centers linked together with one another and with other primary and community care services as part of local Primary Care Networks. The Branch is regionally aligned and takes a client-centred approach to provide intensive, hands-on support to communities working to improve primary care. Additionally, the Branch provides provincial direction and support to UPCCs focused on implementation, service model optimization, and quality improvement.

As the Program Analyst, you will independently manage assigned projects focused on the development, implementation, performance measurement and monitoring, reporting, and evaluation of primary care initiatives.

Job Requirements:
Degree in Business or Public administration, or Health Sciences, Social Sciences or a related field and a minimum of 2 years progressive and recent, related experience* (if Master’s degree is obtained, then a minimum of 1 years of progressive and recent, related experience * is required) OR
Diploma in Business or Public administration, or Health Sciences, Social Sciences or a related field and a minimum of 4 years progressive and recent, related experience* OR
No degree and a minimum of 6 years progressive and recent, related experience*


*Progressive and recent related experience must include:
Experience managing programs and/or program components.
Experience conducting data analysis, identifying issues, and providing recommendations to leadership on policy, program and/or service issues.
Experience initiating and maintaining internal and external partnerships, including liaising and managing partner communications and meetings. (Preference may be given to applicants who have this experience in the health care or social policy sector.)


For questions regarding this position, please contact Wiktoria.Ploch@gov.bc.ca.

* Currently there are nine (9) permanent positions available: three (3) with the Vancouver Island Region, two (2) with the Interior Region, one (1) with the Fraser Region, one (1) with the Northern Region, and two (2) for Urgent and Primary Care Centres

The Director of Data Analytics and Health Information Management is currently seeking a Business Intelligence Analyst to join their team in delivering insights, analytics, reporting, data governance and subject matter expertise to the organization. The Analyst will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of reports and data visualizations in Power BI, building relationships with stakeholders and subject matter experts, raising issues of data quality for continuous process improvement and creating effective written documentation of their outputs.

Please Note: This position offers a hybrid work environment consisting of in-office and remote work. Office location is 500 Church St in Penetanguishene, ON.

Key Accountabilities:
Identify business intelligence requirements, interpret, and establish viable data modelling to complete analytical and visualization outputs.
Develop visualization tools using Power BI that follow best practices in the selection and use of data visualizations to provide insights and support evidence-based decision making.
Provide analysis, which may include descriptive statistics, forecasting and/or predictive models
Create and maintain report documentation and user guides, ensuring requirements are current, updating manuals as required and ensuring system users are familiar with manuals and updates.
Demonstrate tact and superior customer service skills in interacting directly with key stakeholders and subject matter experts to gather requirements, validate data and provide end-user training in resulting visualization tools (e.g. dashboards, reports).
Acting as a consultant, providing expert advice, coaching and feedback on the work of others as it relates to capturing, analyzing, reporting and understanding data and information organization.
Work to improve data literacy across the organization. Focus on improving the ability to access data & to understand potential insights from data.
Support, follow and contribute to information governance and data standards established by the organization.
Identify and document opportunities for improvement of data quality. Work in collaboration with decision support and clinical teams to determine root causes and business impacts

Requirements/Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree is required in the field of epidemiology, health information systems, computer science, computer programming or a related field.
1-3 years’ experience in an analytic role (previous experience in a healthcare setting preferred)
Proficiency using Power BI, or other data visualization technology.
Excellent oral and written communication skills with demonstrated ability to effectively communicate complex ideas/processes in simple terminology to key stakeholders, including all levels of management.
Strong quantitative, analytical, and problem solving skills.
Strong ability to manage different stakeholder perspectives and resistance to change.
Ability to influence and orient business executives and senior management audiences toward a common goal that is satisfies all stakeholders.
Demonstrated experience with validating and auditing data and understanding data governance principles.
Results-oriented with the work ethic to work independently and undertake tasks needed to accomplish work objectives and deliver quality, consistent and timely results.
Experience using SQL or any database query language.
Knowledge of analytical tools and technologies (e.g. Python, R).
Previous experience with Electronic Medical Records is preferred.
Proven ability to adapt to changing requests and competing priorities.
Demonstrated attention to detail and maintaining high quality standards.
Models and promotes core ethical practices while demonstrating Waypoint Values, and reflects an optimistic and positive attitude.
You must meet the requirements of our COVID-19 Immunization Policy by providing proof of full vaccination, or a request and receipt of an accommodation under the Ontario Human Rights Code, including a medical exemption

How do I apply?
Waypoint employees apply through the Employee Self-Service portal at https://employees.waypointcentre.ca and external applicants apply to http://www.waypointcentre.ca/i_want_to/join_your_team by quoting Job ID WC22-504 by close of business (5:00 pm) on April 1st, 2023. Waypoint welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon require for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process

Title: Business Analyst, Techno-functional
Description: And define data and technical requirements for data structures, source to target mapping and other technical requirements to support data flow.
Descriptions:
Some opportunities happen only once in a lifetime - like a job where you have the chance to change lives. At Alexion, people living with rare and devastating diseases are our Guiding Star. We are driven to continuously innovate and create meaningful value in all we do to help patients and families fully live their best lives. We value the uniqueness and diversity of our employees and recognize that nurturing the diverse perspectives and strengths of our people translates into innovative breakthroughs for patients.

This is what you will do:
Business analyst, technofunction will act as a key liaison between business (clinical operations, country ops, data management, etc.) and the technology teams across Alexion and AZ. They will drive understanding of the business needs and then translating that to technical requitements. This will involve working on details such as data structure mapping, data flow, working with tech teams to suppote create user stories, curate backlog, perform first and second level UAT etc.
You will be responsible for:
Build high level data flow architecture/diagram and educate study team on it.
Liaise with System owners at Alexion, AZ and vendors (CRO, e-COA, ePRO, etc.) and define data and technical requirements for data structures, source to target mapping and other technical requirements to support data flow.
Evaluate redundancy and latency of data flow/transfer.
Collaborating with stakeholders to drive alignment to ensure both Alexion and AZ are on same page.
Provide technical input into DTA (Data transfer agreements).
Help building playbook, SOPs, UAT scripts/testing and other artifacts for upcoming studies in the portfolio.
Provide support on any technical issues/questions.
Work with Development Operations, data science and technology at both AZ and Alexion teams to understand application requirements
Communicate with AZ product teams to convey technical requirements and follow up with business and tech teams to complete project deliverables.
Translate Clinical team needs to technical language for product teams, including necessary metrics
Support application testing and rollout with robust planning. Support change management teams as needed
Monitor and communicate program status, plans, issues, timelines, action items, and budgets internally and externally. Recommend and implement corrective actions.

You will need to have:
Education levels: Bachelors and/or Masters in information systems, Clinical data management, analytics.
Knowledge of data structure for systems used in clinical trials like CTMS, eDC, e-consent, IxRs, e-COA/EPRO, sensors etc.
Good knowledge of clinical drug development process and metrics
Knowledge of QA/Testing, CFR Part 11
The duties of this role are generally conducted in an office environment. As is typical of an office-based role, employees must be able, with or without an accommodation to: use a computer; engage in communications via phone, video, and electronic messaging; engage in problem solving and non-linear thought, analysis, and dialogue; collaborate with others; maintain general availability during standard business hours.

Alexion is a global biopharmaceutical company focused on serving patients and families affected by rare diseases and devastating conditions through the discovery, development and commercialization of life-changing medicines. Headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts, Alexion has offices around the globe and serves patients in more than 50 countries. Further information about Alexion can be found at: www.alexion.com.

Alexion is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where every single person can belong because of their uniqueness. The Company will not make decisions about employment, training, compensation, promotion, and other terms and conditions of employment based on race, color, religion, creed or lack thereof, sex, sexual orientation, age, ancestry, national origin, ethnicity, citizenship status, marital status, pregnancy, (including childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), parental status (including adoption or surrogacy), military status, protected veteran status, disability, medical condition, gender identity or expression, genetic information, mental illness or other characteristics protected by law. Alexion provides reasonable accommodations to meet the needs of candidates and employees. To begin an interactive dialogue with Alexion regarding an accommodation, please contact accommodations@Alexion.com. Alexion participates in E-Verify.

Reporting to the Manager, Risk Management, the Analyst’s primary role is to support CDS day to day financial risk activities, reporting and analysis, and to conduct studies, develop and implement risk management tools and contribute to the continuous improvement of risk management policies. The Analyst will also work closely with other teams within Risk Management.

Venture outside the ordinary - TMX Careers

The TMX group of companies includes leading global exchanges such as the Toronto Stock Exchange, Montreal Exchange, and numerous innovative organizations enhancing capital markets.

United as a global team, we’re connecting cross-functionally, traversing industries and geographies, moving opportunity into action, advancing global economic growth, and propelling progress. Through a rich exchange of ideas, meaningful collaboration, and a nimble operating model, we're powering some of the nation's most critical systems, fueling capital formation and innovation, bringing increased opportunity to business visionaries, product ingenuity to consumers, and career exploration to our team.

Ready to be part of the action?

Now Hiring: Analyst, Risk Management (15 month contract)

Job Description:
Reporting to the Manager, Risk Management, the Analyst’s primary role is to support CDS day to day financial risk activities, reporting and analysis, and to conduct studies, develop and implement risk management tools and contribute to the continuous improvement of risk management policies. The Analyst will also work closely with other teams within Risk Management.

The Analyst role includes the following functions:
Monitor and ensure accuracy of collateral calculations of the CDS' Central Counterparty (CCP), National Securities Clearing Corporation (NSCC) and Depository Trust Company (DTC) services for all participants by analyzing results of the calculation, identifying and resolving discrepancies.

Supervise and respond to results of backtesting of collateral requirements of all central counterparty (CCP) services participant funds and results of backtesting of security haircut rates ensuring accurate confidence level is being maintained.

Determine appropriate initial haircut rate for new issues by performing research of price history, industry volatility and IPO prospectus.

Investigate and adjust price history on equities, for example, changes resulting from corporate actions.

Monitor and ensure that all participants align with CDS standards and qualifications on an ongoing basis.

Monitor and ensure that all participants issuing money market securities comply with credit standards per the CDS Participant Rules.

Develop and maintain metrics on participants’ risk levels and prepare analyses summarizing results.

Document procedures for financial risk processes, and make recommendations to automate current processes and improve efficiency.

Skills and Experience:
Postsecondary education in Business, Finance, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent experience

Min. 1-3 years of experience in the financial industry with focus on market/financial risk management

Sound knowledge of financial risk management concepts and techniques, such as Value-at-Risk (VaR)

Working towards FRM (Financial Risk Manager from GARP) or PRM (Professional Risk Manager from PRMIA)

Excellent quantitative and data analysis skills with strong attention to details

Good communication skills both written and verbal

Excellent computer skills (MS Office Suite), knowledge of Crystal Reports and Bloomberg, as well as Google suite of products

Ability to apply Structured Query Language (SQL) to work with relational database systems

One to three years of programming experience in Matlab

VBA programming experience

Ability to reflect, summarize, and present sophisticated ideas

Self-confidence, positive outlook, pragmatism

Sense of ownership and accountabilities

Nice to Have(s):
Previous experience in financial services / capital markets industry

Knowledge of Canadian Securities industry

Enrolment in CFA (Chartered Financial Analyst) program

In the market for…

Excitement - Explore emerging technology and innovation, as well as ventures and digital finance that shape the future of global markets! Experience the movement of the market while grounded in the stability of close to 200 years of success.
Connection - With site hubs in some of the world’s most multicultural cities, we leverage our size and structure to create rich connections and belonging while experiencing powerful global impact through our work.
Impact - More than a platform, we use our talents to power mission-critical systems that drive global economic advancement, innovation, and growth. As well, our employee-led Team Impact spreads social good via our giving strategy.
Wellness - From empathetic leadership to a culture of flexibility and balance, we believe wellness at work creates the maximum yield and a stronger “we”. Plus, with a cloud-first and hybrid workstyle, as well as generous time-off and leaves, we support a life well lived!
Growth - From a growth mindset in our work, to expansion in our business, TMX is home to action-takers energized by the achievement of ambitious growth.

Ready to enrich your career with impactful work, leaders who truly care, and the flexibility and programs to help you thrive as part of #TeamTMX? Apply now.

This role is required to know a language other than French as TMX is an international organization with operations across the globe and its clients, shareholders, competitors, stakeholders, regulators and employees communicate in English.

Dans le cadre de ce poste, le titulaire est tenu de connaître aussi une autre langue que le français, étant donné que TMX est une société internationale qui mène ses activités à l’échelle mondiale et que ses clients, ses actionnaires, ses concurrents, ses parties prenantes, les autorités qui la réglementent et son personnel communiquent en anglais.

TMX is committed to creating and sustaining a collegial work environment in which all individuals are treated with dignity and respect and one which reflects the diversity of the community in which we operate. We provide accommodations for applicants and employees who require it.

Descriptions:
At Paladin, we believe that flexibility can have a positive impact. That's why our employees have the power to choose when and where they are most productive and effective. If you are looking for an opportunity to work from home for a fast-paced organization, Paladin is the place for you!
Position Summary
The main responsibility of the Business Analyst is to provide high-quality analyses and provide strategic recommendations to achieve business objectives. This role encompasses the full spectrum of commercial analytics and sales effectiveness (collect, synthesize, and analyze data) including baseline data to monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and analyzing opportunities to improve performance of our key brands.

Work collaboratively with sales, finance, market access and other cross-functional teams on data requests to solve business problems.
Support the maintenance and update internal forecast models.
Support in the management of the CRM processes such as, bulk data loading, consolidation of multiple data sets and cross-checking calculations to ensure data accuracy.
Characteristics of a Good Candidate
Analytical skills
Problems solving
Forecasting skills
Attention to detail
Intellectual curiosity
Excellent communication & presentation skills
Bilingual
Ability to communicate with stakeholders

Candidate Profile
Required

Title: Senior Game Data Analyst
Description:
Minimum 4 years experience as a data analyst and preferably with free-to-play mobile.
Use historical data to predict ROAS breakeven of new campaigns &…
Descriptions:
As a Senior Game Data Analyst, your responsibility is to find actionable insights from data to help
guide the development of free to play mobile games. By performing quantitative analysis of player
behavior, you will identify problems and propose solutions to improve key performance indicators
of the game such as retention, conversion, and monetization. This includes working with the game
teams to identify changes that drive user engagement.

As an ideal candidate for this position, your skillset is broader than analyzing how users are
behaving in our existing games. You are also able to make informed predictions of how users will
behave during a game’s early stages of development and provide proactive recommendations to
help shape the game’s underlying economy. You should be able to deconstruct a game’s core loop,
systems, and player motivations.

During all phases of a project, you will actively monitor performance and make recommendations to
improve the success of the game. You will be involved during both the production and live
operations phases of the project.

Duties & Responsibilities:
Analyzing player behaviour to support improvement of the game’s key performance
indicators such as retention, conversion, timeplayed and lifetime value
Playing, deconstructing, and understanding our games and then formulating your own
questions, developing hypotheses, finding answers through data, then presenting your
results
Working closely with the game teams to effectively communicate the findings and
propose in-game improvements
Track & share results of AB tests that can measure the impact of new features or
alterations to existing gameplay.
Regularly update executive level stakeholders on game KPIs & any other analytics related
initiatives
Creating & maintaining dashboards at multiple levels of detail to meet the needs of
different stakeholders
Tracking and monitoring KPIs and investigating the underlying causes of any changes
Tracking and monitoring key economy-related metrics such as sinks, sources, currency
value, and inflation
Working with game teams to review in-game economies, systems, and features to lay the
foundation for healthy KPIs and overall product success
Developing and maintaining tools and dashboards for the User Acquisition team to track
ROAS and measure performance of campaigns
Use historical data to predict ROAS breakeven of new campaigns & communicate
findings with a variety of stakeholders including User Acquisition & Finance

Requirements:
Degree in a quantitative field, social sciences, game design or business management
Minimum 4 years experience as a data analyst and preferably with free-to-play mobile
games.
Must enjoy playing video games with familiarity in the mobile space
Strong analytical and quantitative problem solving ability
Excellent interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to communicate technical
concepts to non-technical people
Proficient in SQL
Proficient in creating visualizations and dashboards with Tableau, Qlik, Looker or a
similar platform (Tableau experience preferred)
Proficient in R and/or Python
Basic understanding of statistics and/or econometrics

We offer you:
An opportunity to have massive impact. Our growing scope means you’ll be able to have a large impact on the gaming industry
A group of exceptionally talented and dedicated peers with which to collaborate.
Remote environment (but if you live in Vancouver we have an office you can go to if you wish)
Professional development support to help develop your skills
Company Stock Options & RRSP matching
At Hothead Games, we strive to maintain a healthy workplace during the Covid-19 pandemic - and beyond. The successful candidate must be comfortable working at home, and have functional and private space available for work hours. Compensation includes competitive salary, vacation, RRSP matching, company stock options and extended health coverage.

WHY BEING INCLUSIVE IS IMPORTANT TO US
At Hothead Games, we are an Equal Opportunity employer and we value the diversity of the people
we hire and serve. We strive to build and grow our team that fosters variety in backgrounds,
perspectives, experiences and skills. We embrace inclusiveness in our workplace, so we can utilize
each person’s talents and strengths to make great games.
If you're seeking an awesome new challenge in a fun and engaging studio, we invite you to apply and
talk about the possibilities of beginning a rewarding new chapter of your career.

Title: Planning & Forecasting Analyst - Consumer Contact Centre Operations
Description:
You can easily collect and analyze data to size required staffing levels.
Experience with workforce management tools such as IEX is preferred and advance excel…
Descriptions:
Location: Montreal, Quebec, CA Edmonton, AB, CA Calgary, AB, CA Toronto, ON, CA Vancouver, British Columbia, CA
Req ID: 33096
Jobs by Category: Operations
Job Function: Planning and Analysis
Status: Full Time

Description

TELUS is looking for a dynamic individual to be part of a national team that provides support to our global Contact Centre operation.

Our wider team encompasses the full spectrum of Contact Centre disciplines including Scheduling; Forecasting; Technology; Finance/Budgeting, Planning and Real-Time/workforce management across a number of specialized queues supporting our customers across Canada.

Join our team and what we'll accomplish together

Through an in depth understanding of Contact Centre drivers, you will ensure our internal stakeholders and partners are educated on risks and challenges through analysis and thoughtful recommendations. By putting your recommendations into action, you will see the positive impact your efforts have on the Customer Experience.
As part of our team YOU:
Get to challenge the status quo by experimenting with new approaches, tools and techniques to plan and forecast, with a wide spectrum of autonomy in your respective portfolio
Get to you bring your unique skills and experience into our team to influence and deliver results
#LI-REMOTE
Qualifications

What you bring

You have both an analytical and operational lens of Contact Centres.
You have worked in finance, budgeting, forecasting, analysis, operations or workforce management, and know what good looks like.
You can design and build capacity scenario models that clearly show Expense vs Service Level tradeoffs
You can easily collect and analyze data to size required staffing levels.
You can build, design, maintain, and further refine spreadsheet models and resource plans to account for multiple factors, such as fluctuations in business volumes, productivity assumptions, attrition, training requirements, projects, and external influences.
You understand resource staffing levels, taking into account business plans, capacity, attrition, and other relevant factors.
You have strong communication (verbal and written), presentation, influencing and relationship building skills
You are used to the unpredictable nature of a Contact Centre environment and can pivot quickly when needed to reprioritize and adapt.
You are curious, and have the ability to influence peers and partners, without direct authority.
Experience with workforce management tools such as IEX is preferred and advance excel/modeling skills is a must
University degree (preferably in Business, Statistics, Finance or similar) OR 3-5 years of equivalent work experience in a relevant discipline (preferably workforce management) along with on-the-job personal development

Team Spotlight:

Our team works in a fun and challenging environment that directly influences the financial and operational performance of the Customer Experience business
Our team’s scope includes the Strategic Forecasting & Planning, Operational Resource Management, Performance Analytics and Partner Strategy & Governance
We work closely with Customer Operations teams, who directly manage our frontline team members
Our key stakeholders and partners include Operations, Marketing, Finance, and Technology Transformation
We provide opportunities for you to excel and show your stuff – work on high value and high visibility projects
We have flexible work styles with the ability to work in and out of the office
You will work in a team that actively supports your personal development with progressive training and development tools

Title: Business Analyst, Business Intelligence and Analytics
Description:
Manage master data and data governance processes.
Strong data modeling, data governance, data management and schema design skills.
Descriptions:
ROLE STATEMENT: The Business Analyst, Business Intelligence and Analytics will work with technical IT personnel and business analysts to provide data and analytics solutions to Calfrac’s business functions. Duties include creating data driven solutions, evaluating requirements, guiding data management and preparing design reports. This is an outcome-focused role. The role will incorporate both hands on solutions delivery, vendor management, and the ability to collaborate with business functional to design long term data strategies. This role will provide actionable insights to the business through dashboards, reports and well architected data solutions that collect, cleanse and curate our data for seamless access and high availability to the end user.

OUR CULTURE:
Calfrac, we believe in being an integral part of the communities where we operate and we support a variety of giving activities throughout the year. Our support falls under two main areas: volunteering or donation. Whenever possible, the initiatives and organizations we undertake to promote and support fall into the following categories: Environment, Education, Indigenous, Social Services, Arts & Culture and Community Sport.
SPECIFIC ACCOUNTABILITIES:
Create, refine and automate data processes to ensure information is collected and made available to the end user accurately, on-time and with minimal manual intervention.
Retrieve, analyze and convert data into information through visual representation of the data.
Actively identify and implement opportunities for improvement of data analytics and data management.
Identify opportunities, deficiencies or gaps in data models within the organization and take ownership for the resolutions.
Convert the data within operational data stores into consumable formats for business.
Manage master data and data governance processes

KEY ATTRIBUTES AND COMPETENCIES:
Strong data modeling, data governance, data management and schema design skills.
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server (SSIS, SSAS, SSRS)
Experience with Oracle reporting tools such as BI Publisher, OTBI.
Experience using Power BI Pro at enterprise scale, with cloud and on-prem datasets. (Power BI cloud gateway, etc.)
Experience with predictive analytics techniques and machine learning
Ability to utilize data virtualization, and modern data manipulation/management patterns (eg: data lakes)
Experience using Excel, SQL & NOSQL, XML, REST API, and JSON
Experience with Azure Databricks
Experience designing schema-on-read and schema-on-write data models.
Experience working with structured data, semi-structured data, and unstructured data, including data manipulation and/or mining.
Ability to create compelling data visualizations for decision making.
Ability to independently gather and formally document requirements from business stakeholders, document functional and technical specifications and scope documents.
Superior problem solving skills, as demonstrated in recent work history.
A highly energetic self-starter with a verifiable ability to work in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment while maintaining a high attention to detail and quality.
Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills across multiple levels of the organization, with the ability to challenge assumptions tactfully based on solid business and technical acumen.
Ability to communicate complex concepts to a non-technical audience to create understanding.
High degree of business acumen and an ability to understand operational use cases
Superior organizational and time management skills.

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:
Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or a combination of education and relevant experience.
Certification in data platform/architecture, analytics and visualizations, or business intelligence for Oracle or Microsoft (Azure).
Certificate in Data Governance or Data Management is an asset.




We would like to thank all applicants for applying to this role but only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: BI Analyst
Description: You'll play a pivotal part in informing and delivering upon our data strategy, by providing sales and marketing performance data, creating custom dashboards and…
Descriptions:
Today, TELUS business customers enjoy the best deals and communications. Behind the scenes, however, hundreds of different systems are at play determining how customers can enjoy these competitive rates and awesome customer service to keep their business running and profitable . The TELUS Business Solutions BI team builds solutions for our stakeholders using data from various sources to build algorithms that can predict customer loyalty, churn and stickiness. We love to turn data into stories - stories about money falling through the cracks, success stories about our products and services, but most importantly stories about our customers and how we can enhance their experience. We run like a start-up and we have embraced lean and agile methodologies. We celebrate our failures and see them as opportunities to learn. Our culture fosters collaborative learning and out-of-the-box thinking in a relaxed environment. Come help us to make something awesome!
Here's the impact you'll make and what we'll accomplish together



Working within a team focused on creating a culture of business ownership, you will be empowered to make decisions, drive strategy and innovate for the B2B marketing team. You will help us support our various stakeholder groups within TELUS, by building world class reporting and data architecture that will support all levels of our marketing channel.



Here's how
You'll play a pivotal part in informing and delivering upon our data strategy, by providing sales and marketing performance data, creating custom dashboards and visualization, and supporting marketing and financial strategies
Providing Advance analytical insights to the team and help them improve marketing strategies
Provide technical leadership to internal team members and various stakeholders
Operationalize and support our underlying data systems, improving our system reliability, accuracy and stability



You're the missing piece of the puzzle
You are analytical and outcome-oriented with a proven ability to translate technical considerations into business implications as well as to synthesize data into actionable insights
You are well-versed with Business Intelligence/ Market Intelligence processes and other marketing technologies
You have demonstrated the ability to successfully deliver complex projects involving people, process, technology, and change management
You have experience with agile ways of working and a bias for action to break down barriers to get results fast with a test and learn mindset
You can assemble large complex datasets across multiple databases and sources by building automated pipelines (ETL)
Strong analytic skills related to working with unstructured datasets.
Must-haves
Strong Business Acumen
Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases, query authoring (SQL) as well as working familiarity with a variety of databases.
SAS knowledge
Business Intelligence/ Market Intelligence processes and other marketing technologies understanding
Technical or data-driven educational background (computer science, engineering, statistics, data science) and/or Masters of Business Administration (MBA) degree
3+ years of progressive and relevant work experience
Takes ownership, initiates improvements, and is self-directed
Able to effectively engage stakeholders to establish cross functional alignment for projects
Great-to-haves
Prior telecommunications expertise
B2B marketing
Who is TELUS?
We're a high-performing team of individuals who collectively make TELUS one of the leading telecommunications companies in Canada. Our competitive consumer offerings include wireline, wireless, internet and Optik TV™. We also deliver a compelling range of products and services for small, medium and large businesses; and have carved out a leadership position in the health, energy, finance and public sector markets with innovative industry specific solutions.
Everyone belongs at TELUS. It doesn't matter who you are, what you do or how you do it, at TELUS, your unique contribution and talents will be valued and respected. Because the more diverse perspectives we have the more likely we are to crack the code on what our customers want and our communities need.
Do you share our passion?
At TELUS, you create future friendly® possibilities.
At TELUS, we are committed to diversity and equitable access to employment opportunities based on ability.

Title: Client Billing & Data Analyst
Description:
Managing the billing and revenue data for the various client portfolios, and liaising with clients on the same.
Strong written and verbal skills are required;
Descriptions:
Position: Client Billing and Data Analyst – Global Entity Services
Location: Montreal
About Us
The Maples Group is a global leader in financial services, trusted by many of the world’s largest hedge fund managers, private equity firms, and international corporations.
Our side-by-side financial and legal teams consistently deliver award-winning services to a global client base, offering unrivalled learning and career opportunities to our 2,500 colleagues worldwide.
What’s it like to work here?
We are driven to excel, and collaboration is key to our continued success. We can go further for our clients because we go further for each other too. Our inclusive culture creates an environment where people can be themselves at work while doing their best work. No matter where you work in the Maples Group, you will be part of a global team.
The Opportunity
We are looking for an accomplished Client Billing and Data Analyst to join our Global Entity Services team as part of our financial services business in Montreal.
Consistently recognised as one of Montreal’s Top Employers, the Maples Group established our operations in the central downtown area in 2009. Our Montreal office exemplifies our culturally rich and entrepreneurial organisation, with over 300 colleagues from 50 countries collaborating to deliver best-in-class solutions to clients worldwide. As part of our Montreal team you will:
Ensuring data is maintained accurately, and in accordance with service agreements and protocols, through analysis using various tools to look for exceptions and issues;
Managing the billing and revenue data for the various client portfolios, and liaising with clients on the same
What You Bring
In addition to indisputably high ethical standards and autonomy, the ideal candidate possesses the following:
The aptitude and commitment to continue to learn various IT platforms and additional software skills is essential.
This role is ideal for an organized, detail-oriented individual with well-developed critical thinking skills and possesses the ability to manage multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment;
The ideal candidate will have an innate desire to consistently strive for excellence, take pride in carrying out their responsibilities efficiently and with impeccable execution, and proactively looks for opportunities to recommend improvements to systems and processes;
The individual must also be a self-starter who works well within a team, is energized by a continuous learning environment and possesses an ability to work well under the pressure of deadlines;
This role is suited for an individual with a College Diploma or equivalent, preferably with a business or legal concentration, and 1-2 years’ of experience in a professional services environment;
Strong written and verbal skills are required;
Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook is preferred;
The aptitude and commitment to continue to learn various IT platforms and additional software skills is essential;
Fluency in English is required.
Poste : Analyste de la facturation des clients et des données – Services aux entités mondiales
Lieu : Montréal, Canada
À propos de nous
Le Groupe Maples est un leader mondial des services financiers auquel font confiance de nombreux gestionnaires de fonds de couverture, sociétés de capital-investissement et entreprises internationales parmi les plus importants au monde.
Nos équipes financières et juridiques, qui travaillent côte à côte, fournissent constamment des services primés à une clientèle mondiale, offrant ainsi des possibilités d’apprentissage et de carrière inégalées à nos 2 500 collègues dans le monde.
Milieu de travail
Nous sommes déterminés à exceller et la collaboration est la clé de notre réussite constante. Nous pouvons aller plus loin pour nos clients parce que nous allons aussi plus loin les uns pour les autres. Notre culture inclusive crée un environnement où les gens peuvent être eux-mêmes au travail, tout en donnant le meilleur d’eux-mêmes. Quel que soit votre lieu de travail au sein du Groupe Maples, vous ferez partie d’une équipe mondiale.
L’occasion
Nous recherchons un Analyste de la facturation des clients et des donnéesaccompli pour se joindre à notre équipe Services aux entités mondialesau sein de notre activité de services financiers à Montréal.
Constamment reconnu comme l’un des meilleurs employeurs de Montréal, le Groupe Maples a établi ses activités dans le centre-ville en 2009. Notre bureau de Montréal illustre bien la richesse culturelle et l’esprit d’entreprise de notre organisation, avec plus de 300 collègues de 50 pays qui collaborent pour fournir des solutions de premier ordre à des clients du monde entier. En tant que membre de notre équipe de Montréal, vous devrez :
Veiller à ce que les données soient conservées avec précision et conformément aux ententes de service et aux protocoles, par l’entremise d’analyses utilisant divers outils pour rechercher les exceptions et les problèmes;
Gérer les données relatives à la facturation et aux revenus pour les différents portefeuilles de clients, et assurer la liaison avec les clients à ce sujet.
Votre contribution
En plus d’une autonomie et de normes en matière d’éthique incontestablement élevées, le candidat idéal possédera les caractéristiques suivantes :
L’aptitude et l’engagement de continuer à apprendre diverses plateformes en TI et à acquérir des compétences relativement à d’autres logiciels sont essentiels;
Ce poste convient parfaitement à une personne ayant le sens de l’organisation, le souci du détail et une pensée critique bien développée, ainsi que la capacité de gérer plusieurs tâches dans un environnement évoluant rapidement;
Le candidat idéal a un désir inné de viser l’excellence de façon constante; il est fier d’assumer ses responsabilités de façon efficace et de les accomplir de façon impeccable. Il cherche activement des occasions de recommander des améliorations aux systèmes et aux processus;
Cette personne doit avoir un grand sens de l’initiative et savoir s’intégrer à une équipe; elle est stimulée par un environnement où l’apprentissage fait partie du quotidien et elle peut continuer de bien travailler sous la pression des échéances;
Ce poste convient à une personne possédant un diplôme d’études collégiales ou l’équivalent, préférablement avec une concentration en commerce ou en affaires juridiques, ainsi qu’une année ou deux d’expérience dans un environnement de services professionnels;
De solides compétences sont requises en communication écrite et verbale;
Une connaissance pratique des applications Excel, Word et Outlook de Microsoft est préférable;
L’aptitude et l’engagement de continuer à apprendre diverses plateformes en TI et à acquérir des compétences relativement à d’autres logiciels sont essentiels;
La maîtrise de l’anglais est requise.

Title: Reporting Analyst, Email Marketing and Digital Analytics
Description: Reporting to the Director, Fundraising & Marketing Analytics, the Reporting Analyst, Email Marketing and Digital Analytics is responsible for the delivery of…
Descriptions:
Who we are
At Heart & Stroke our mission is to promote health, save lives and enhance recovery. We are committed to a culture that exemplifies our core values: champion health, practice humility, embrace change, drive impact, learn and grow and be heartfelt as we work together to beat heart disease and stroke.
We believe in equity, diversity and inclusion ― it’s embedded in our values and core mission work to support all people in Canada to lead healthier lives. We are committed to applying this principle to cultivate a welcoming environment that embraces diversity among our employees. Candidates from diverse backgrounds, including but not limited to, Indigenous peoples, racialized communities, LGBTQ2IA+ communities, women, and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply.
To learn more about our mission, values, commitment to EDI, and the difference Heart & Stroke makes in the lives of people in Canada at every age, please visit our website.

Who we need
Reporting to the Director, Fundraising & Marketing Analytics, the Reporting Analyst, Email Marketing and Digital Analytics is responsible for the delivery of reports and data-driven insight in support of the Foundation’s digital and email marketing fundraising programs as to best drive net revenue growth, supporter loyalty and supporter engagement. We’re interested in candidates who have back- end experience using Power BI, and SQL skills.
This includes email platform support in data operations, analysis, segmentation, targeting, A/B testing as well as process documentation and data management.
Working collaboratively with departmental and organizational peers the role will provide analytics support in a fast-paced, fluid environment to ensure data-driven decision-making advances progress toward our mission.
(Please note this is a two-year contract and remote working role. The successful candidate can work from anywhere in Canada.)

How you will make an impact every day
Analytics, Reporting and Visualization support (70%)
Configure dashboards and reports of Foundation’s Email Campaigns and Journeys in Power BI and Salesforce Marketing Cloud Datorama (Intelligence Reports)
Configure and analyze A/B Tests related to email Campaigns and Journeys in Salesforce Marketing Cloud
Configure dashboards and reports of Foundation’s Digital Campaigns in Power BI and Data Studio
Evaluate tactics and develop data insights to identify opportunities to improve supporter communication, upgrade, cross-sell, retention and lifetime value through email and digital channels.
Campaign Planning, Data Operations and Data Management (30%)
Collaborate in the planning, execution and evaluation of the Foundation’s multi-channel Direct Marketing campaigns by giving input and recommendations based on performance of Digital and Email channels.
Work with key stakeholders and media vendors to support email and media campaign planning and determine appropriate evaluation plans.
Work both independently, and with IT team, in development of data pipelines to support Email and Digital analytics work.
Work across the organization to keep informed of other Foundation programs and activities to identify opportunities for learning, insight and collaboration.

What you bring
Educational Requirements
University degree in analytics, data science, statistics, finance or equivalent
Work Experience
Minimum 2 years of analytics or data management experience in a customer-centered organization
Minimum 2 years experience using Salesforce Marketing Cloud and SFMC’s suite of reporting tools to analyze email campaign and journey results.
Experience working with Google Analytics (Universal Analytics and/or GA4) and reporting on results
Experience reporting on email, digital and media campaigns
Experience delivering data analysis and insight through storytelling and visualization
Experience in data-visualization and data modeling using tools like Power BI or Tableau
Experience working with CRM systems, and Cloud Analytics environments like BigQuery, Snowflake or Redshift
Skills
A good understanding of Salesforce Marketing Cloud capabilities, as well as fluent use of it’s reporting and data extraction tools
A good understanding of tactics evaluation using Google Analytics (Universal Analytics/GA4)
Data-visualization using tools like Power BI/Tableau/Datorama/Data Studio
Solid experience and understanding of data to inform integrated digital/offline campaign operations, tactics evaluation and results monitoring
Exceptional data analysis skills using Excel, SQL, DAX
A good understanding of customer experience
Ability to translate complex ideas to layperson language
Understanding of A/B and other testing methodologies
Strong interpersonal skills including collaboration and consultation as part of a team

What we offer
In addition to a competitive salary, Heart & Stroke believes that time off is integral to the personal health and wellness of our employees. We offer paid wellness days and personal days. In addition, we provide health, medical, dental and vision benefits. Furthermore, our staff enjoy flexible hybrid working arrangements and support with reimbursement for mobile phones and home office set up.

Apply now
If you want to join the fight to beat heart disease and stroke, please apply by sending your resume by February 10, 2023.
Only those candidates that qualify will be selected for an interview. At this time, all interviews are being conducted via phone and/or video call ― we look forward to “virtually” meeting you!
Accommodation
We are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. If you have been contacted for an interview and require accommodation to participate in the recruitment and selection process, please let us know and we will do our best to address your needs.
Please note: Heart & Stroke has a vaccination policy that requires all employees to be fully vaccinated unless they have a valid exemption. You can view our policy here.
YGBEKL3PNa

Title: Statistical Analyst
Description:
Experience in developing processes to clean data, transform raw data for use, and assessing the impact on data quality.
Highly developed attention-to-detail.
Descriptions:
Working in a team environment, you will be providing statistical analysis, quality assurance and research studies on examination and other pertinent data.
What you’ll do
Analyze examination data, process scores and conduct quality assurance to ensure the integrity and quality of all data and results – includes performing statistical and psychometric analyses, anticipating next steps and providing short summary of results, understanding data trends and detecting unusual results, reporting and resolving issues to ensure system integrity and accuracy of data
Draft and maintain procedures for processing examination data in collaboration with psychometrician and/or senior statistical analyst
Prepare tables and figures for examination reports (e.g., Report to the Deans, Technical Reports) and assist in automation of report generation to increase efficiency and decrease errors
Suggest or perform ad hoc analyses and studies for examination scoring and quality assurance purposes in collaboration with the Psychometrician
Lead or assist in analyses and participates in research studies for development purposes
Update and conduct routine maintenance of databases and analysis tools
Create, update and run routine and more complex SAS code
Support Psychometricians, in both written and oral formats, in presenting results to various stakeholders
What you need to succeed
Experience:
3+ years’ experience in a data environment
Technical Skills:
Knowledge of statistical, research and measurement principles and procedures
Experience with performing statistical analysis and programming code in accordance with company standards
Experience in developing processes to clean data, transform raw data for use, and assessing the impact on data quality
Proficiency in Python programming (data extraction, data wrangling, analysis and visualization)
Proficiency in SAS (standard SAS procedures including PROC SQL and SAS Macros) to conduct analysis on large or complex datasets and generate reports
Advanced level and or certification in SAS is an asset
Experience with database management, processing, manipulating and merging large datasets
Experience with documenting code and procedures
Competencies:
Highly developed attention-to-detail
Ability to manage multiple changing priorities, including under pressure and while working to deadlines
Ability to work independently or within a team
Ability to learn effectively
Education:
Masters in statistics, mathematics, educational measurement, psychometrics, psychology, quantitative methodologies or equivalent
SAS Certified Professional Advanced Programming would be considered an asset
Language:
Excellent oral and written skills in English; Oral and written skills in French is a strong asset
The perks:
A defined benefit pension plan
A complete benefit package your first day on the job
Three weeks’ vacation right off the bat
A company paid holiday closure in December – our gift to you!
A 35-hour work week
Compressed and telework programs
Free onsite parking - any day, any time
Free virtual Mobility and Strength & Conditioning classes
MCC’s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. All offers of employment are conditional upon successful job candidates attesting to their vaccination status and providing proof of vaccination or requesting and being approved for an accommodation for medical , religion or other human rights based grounds.
Visit our Careers page to learn more about the many reasons you can thrive at the MCC.
The MCC is an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace at all levels of its organization.
Accommodations can be provided at all stages of the hiring process; we ask applicants to make their needs known in advance.
Please note that only those invited for an interview will be contacted.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Application & Infrastructure Analyst II - Data and Application Integration Analyst
Description:
Map source system data to data warehouse models.
Four (4) years work experience in application integration, message queues, data modeling, database development,…
Descriptions:
Application & Infrastructure Analyst II - Data and Application Integration Analyst
Job Number : 46222

The Information Technology Branch of the Edmonton Police Service requires one (1) Data and Application Integration Analysts to support the vaious integration initiatives of the service. The successful candidate must be well-versed with application integration using COTS and custom solutions, have experience configuring and maintaining messaging queues and have an understanding of data warehousing and business intelligence principles. They should also be self-motivated, well organized, highly analytical and have excellent interpersonal skills. Responsibilities of this position include:
Providing technical expertise and consultative work involving all phases of research, feasibility, design, development, implementation and support of application integrations, message queues, data warehouse, data marts, and administration of the Informatica IICS data and application integration suite.
Work with business requirements analysts to identify and understand the integration points between various systems.
Map source system data to data warehouse models.
Develop and test application and data integration processes.
Define and capture metadata and rules associated with integration processes.
Adapt integration processes to accommodate changes in source systems and new business user requirements.
Be part of a team that is a technology leader in data and application integration processes, products, knowledge of 3GL/4GL programming languages and data integration products.
Providing daily operational support of various application integrations, data warehouse data loads and various integration and intelligence tools.
Creating system documentation including application integration models, data models, systems designs and operational support documents.
Working collaboratively with all members of the IT Branch to ensure that all application issues are addressed in a timely manner and that proper coordination is carried out to minimize disruption to the provision of IT services.
Performing related duties as required.
Qualifications:
Degree in a related discipline and four (4) years relevant experience OR Post Secondary Diploma in a related discipline and five (5) years relevant experience OR One (1) year related certificate* and seven (7) years relevant experience (*relevant computer certificiate programs generally have a minimum of 700+ hours and will include relevant course work to the position. Completion of the twelfth (12th) school grade or GED is required).
Four (4) years work experience in application integration, message queues, data modeling, database development, data warehousing, data marts and operational data stores.
Experience with the following would be considered an asset: Microsoft SQL Server, Informatica Power Center, Informatica IICS, Data Vault 2.0, IBM Cognos, Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft Windows Server, Active Directory.
Experience developing & implementing integration standards & best practices.
Strong problem-solving and metadata skills.
Excellent organizational, interpersonal, verbal and written skills with a strong focus on customer service.
Experience or working knowledge of current public safety solutions would be an asset.
Ability to excel in a dynamic work and team environment.
Applicants may be required to undergo a knowledge or skills assessment test.
As part of your pre-hire screening you will be required to complete an Enhanced Security Clearance. Should you accept employment with the Edmonton Police Service you acknowledge and agree to participate in future Enhanced Security Re-Clearances at scheduled intervals or in any other circumstances, exigent or otherwise, as required by Human Resources Division.
Hours of Work:
33.75 hours per week between 0800-1600 hours, Monday – Friday. Hours of work may be subject to the terms and conditions of variable hours of work program. Incumbents must be available for call-out outside of these hours on a rotational basis.
Salary Range:
21M, Salary Grade 032, $48.10 - $61.38 (Hourly), $3,247.20 - $4,143.80 (Bi-Weekly), $84,750.75 - $108,152.07 (Annually). The rates quoted are in accordance with a collective agreement between the Union and the City of Edmonton.

General:
Civic Service Union 52 members are asked to send a copy of their application to the union office.
The City of Edmonton thanks applicants for their interest in this opportunity. Candidates considered for the position will be contacted.
We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome diversity and encourage applications from all qualified individuals.
Please include a current resume and covering letter with your online application.
Please note that the option to work remotely is not available at this time.
The Province of Alberta is a party to the Federal Agreement on Internal Trade, the Trade, Investment and Labour Mobility with British Columbia and the New West Partnership Trade Agreement with British Columbia and Saskatchewan. All of these agreements promote labour mobility between the Provinces. Applicants may obtain information regarding recognition of extra provincial credentials at www.newwestpartnershiptrade.ca.
