Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description: Support and conduct ad-hoc analyses using internal & external data sources for business specific issues supporting brand and category teams, including but not…
Descriptions:
Referred applicants should not apply directly to this role.
All referred applicants must first be submitted through Workday by a current Loblaw Colleague.
Location:
1 Presidents Choice Circle, Brampton, Ontario, L6Y 5S5
At Loblaw, we help millions of Canadians get through their best days, worst days, celebration days, and every day. Through our innovation and quality products, we’re here for our friends, neighbours, family members and colleagues.

We succeed through collaboration and commitment and set a high bar for ourselves and those around us.

We’re looking for adaptable people who are thrilled to join us in our goal of helping Canadians Live Life Well®. Whether you are just starting your career, re-entering the workforce, or looking for a new job, this is where you belong. We promote leaders at every level and support our people to follow their passion.
Summary
The Sr. Business Analyst plays a key role in applying data and analytics to measure performance of critical objectives and key results in the Loblaw Brands Business. Reporting to the Sr Manager, Data & Analytics, this critical role is responsible for key reporting, insights and analytics to support the growth and development of Loblaw Brands This role supports critical department processes and handles tools to effectively measure against goals and key performance metrics. This multifaceted role works directly with and supports many areas of the business and levels within the organization to deliver results.
Accountabilities:
Financial Performance and, Objectives and Key Results (OKRs)
Develop and track Control Brand performance metrics, prepare weekly and periodic scorecards and reports, with informative commentary on trends/results
Reporting, insights and analytics of financial measurements and performance indicators for major control brand programs (i.e., Insiders, Marketing Discovery Programs)
Support the development, analysis and reporting of Control Brand financial and OKR performance, with insightful commentary on key drivers, trends and outlook for the leadership and executive team
Base Business Analytics, Enablement and Measurement
Run key reporting and analytics for check points and initiatives to enable the overall LBL team to effectively lead their base business portfolios, including but not limited to: reporting to support cost management, base business forecasting, cost gapping to national brand and competitive control brands, new item performance to plan
Support annual business and category reviews to determine strategic opportunities to drive performance
Liaise with cross-functional business partners to acquire relevant data, solve problems, and build efficient processes
Role Requirements:
Post-secondary education in Business, Finance, Math, Computer Science, or related field
3+ years of experience in an analytics role. Previous experience in retail operations, merchandise planning, and analytics is an asset
Proficiency in Microsoft Office (advanced Excel and PowerPoint)
Hands-on proficient experience with SQL, Python, and Tableau, or comparable Programming tools/languages
Experience with Query Tools (Teradata, SAS, MicroStrategy, SAP)
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, comfortable presenting to various levels within the organization
Strong analytical skills, with the ability to analyze large data sets to bring forward key takeaways into an easy-to-read framework
Independent problem solving and ability to think critically
Knowledge of Loblaw systems, data sources, and metrics is an asset
Support the development of the appropriate financial performance measures for key LBL processes (Stage Gate, Quarterly Product Plan). Conduct market reviews of division competitive landscape and category deep dives on an ongoing basis
Support and conduct ad-hoc analyses using internal & external data sources for business specific issues supporting brand and category teams, including but not limited to consumer research, market audits, customer data analytics
Identify risks and opportunities to be addressed with the business unit using Data Analytics that lead to strategic plans
Work with transactional data to find key customer insights and identify gaps
Loblaw is committed to sustainability by sourcing products with integrity and making a positive difference in the community. Our CORE Values – Care, Ownership, Respect and Excellence – guide all our decision-making and come to life through our Blue Culture. We offer our colleagues progressive careers, comprehensive training, flexibility, and other competitive benefits – these are some of the many reasons why we are one of Canada’s Top Employers, Canada’s Best Diversity Employers, Canada’s Greenest Employers & Canada’s Top Employers for Young People.
Employment Type:
Full time
Type of Role:
Regular
We have a long-standing focus on diversity, equity and inclusion because we know it will make our company a better place to work and shop. We are committed to creating accessible environments for our colleagues, candidates and customers. Requests for accommodation due to a disability (which may be visible or invisible, temporary or permanent) can be made at any stage of application and employment. We encourage candidates to make their accommodation needs known so that we can provide equitable opportunities.
Please Note:
Candidates who are 18 years or older are required to complete a criminal background check. Details will be provided through the application process.

Title: Sr Business Analyst, IT
Description: Perform data mappings, reverse engineering, documenting as-is flows, performing gap analysis and elicit requirements to support to-be end state.
Descriptions:
Summary: This position is a hybrid role and requires time in our Toronto office. The Senior Business Analyst is responsible for analyzing business operations and recommending solutions to align individual business functions with organizational goals. This role requires thorough understanding of the structure, policies, and operations of the organization, and recommends solutions to improve general business processes and planning. This position will collaborate with one or several business units or functions.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities:
Perform business analysis related activities including understanding of business objectives, planning, eliciting, scoping, analyzing, documenting, prioritization, managing changes, maintaining traceability, managing backlogs, stakeholder analysis and effort estimation.
Establish, enhance and enforce business analysis related framework, processes, standards and templates, knowledge repository.
Perform data mappings, reverse engineering, documenting as-is flows, performing gap analysis and elicit requirements to support to-be end state
Partner with the business and technology, internal and external teams to conduct problem analysis, requirements identification and solutioning.
Analyze and document detailed business and solution requirements.
Lead requirements prioritization and leverage techniques to drive out business priorities.
Establish, enhance and enforce requirements framework, processes, standards and templates.
Facilitate working sessions with stakeholders to address process change management and key measurement metric management.
Support technical solution development and delivery.
Verify requirements for quality and validate requirements with the impacted stakeholders.
Identify and qualify opportunities to address operation process issues, risks and constrains with the goal to achieve operational excellence and straight through processing.
Define technology solution user acceptance criteria and assist in functional testing.
Enable successful implementation and adoption of process and technology changes.
Work with project manager(s) to deliver key projects and initiatives as the functional champion.
Leadership Competencies:
Results Oriented
Two-way Communication
Building Relationships
Critical Thinking and Decision Making
Adaptability and Change Leadership
Technical/Functional Expertise
Client Intimacy
Education / Experience Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree required in business administration, information management or equivalent relevant work experience.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in business processes, project management.
Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously and adapt to the changing needs of the business while meeting deadlines.
Track record of successful participation and execution of projects.
Ability to work independently.
Proficient in the use of Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
Experience
Required
5 year(s): Experience in business processes, project management.
Education
Preferred
Bachelor's degree or better in Business Administration
Behaviors
Preferred
Thought Provoking: Capable of making others think deeply on a subject
Team Player: Works well as a member of a group
Innovative: Consistently introduces new ideas and demonstrates original thinking
Enthusiastic: Shows intense and eager enjoyment and interest
Dedicated: Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity
Motivations
Preferred
Self-Starter: Inspired to perform without outside help
Work-Life Balance: Inspired to perform well by having ample time to pursue work and interests outside of work
Goal Completion: Inspired to perform well by the completion of tasks
Flexibility: Inspired to perform well when granted the ability to set your own schedule and goals
Ability to Make an Impact: Inspired to perform well by the ability to contribute to the success of a project or the organization

Title: Business Intelligence Dashboard Developer
Description:
3+ years of experience working in a data analyst role, business analyst role or related field.
Analyze data from multiple sources.
Descriptions:
Please note: Canada-based applicants only
We will only be accepting applications through our website: https://yellowpencil.com/careers/
6 MONTH EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT, CANADA REMOTE
At Yellow Pencil, we're transforming the public sector. We partner with governments and public sector organizations to help design and build citizen-centered digital solutions.
We are looking for a Business Intelligence Dashboard Developer who is passionate about information and can accelerate our business intelligence reporting.
Data is everywhere at Yellow Pencil and cutting through the noise is important to making healthy decisions. We need someone who can help us get there. We have the data, we need the insight. We are looking for someone who can build useful dashboards for mission critical business intelligence. You should have experience building dashboards and analyzing data from multiple sources.
We need your ownership and support. You don’t have all the answers but you are resourceful and great at problem solving and figuring things out without supervision. In this role, you’ll work collaboratively with Directors, Content Strategists, Project Managers, Designers, and Developers to produce high-quality business intelligence. You need to be proficient in both written communication and meeting facilitation. Most importantly, you need to be able to translate data into meaningful business intelligence.
Responsibilities
Understand our business’ needs and translate them into useful dashboards using Klipfolio
Analyze data from multiple sources
Own the requirements gathering and definition process
Turn feedback from team members into actionable tasks
Craft training and/or support documentation to facilitate a successful hand-off
Identify bugs/problems during the test cycles, and report defects in a clear and concise manner
Qualifications
3+ years of experience working in a data analyst role, business analyst role or related field
Experience building intelligent dashboards
Experience facilitating requirements gathering meetings
Experience working in an agency environment
Ability to understand and document customer needs
Experience using Klipfolio, Looker, Tableau or similar tools
Detail oriented with strong analysis and problem-solving skills
Ability to work with minimum or little supervision
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
If your experience doesn’t quite match up with this list, but you know you’ll be a phenomenal fit, we’d still like to hear from you. We’re committed to adding diverse experience and new perspectives to our team. And we’re always ready to have our minds expanded by new ideas.
Where we are
As our next temporary team member, you'll be joining us remotely. We have a shared workspaces in Edmonton, Calgary, and Vancouver for you to work from if you are located in either area.
Who we are
Yellow Pencil is a group of like-minded individuals, collaborating on complex problems for public sector clients. Our work makes the internet more accessible and usable for clients and their users.
We help good people do good work.
Our mission
We return value to service organizations through automation, content operations and managed services.
Our values
Empathy
Integrity
Growth
Craft
Collaboration
Impact
Working at Yellow Pencil means:
A constant commitment to learning and growth.
Delivering the highest quality work possible on every project.
A people-first workplace. We want you to love being here as much as we do.
Work/life balance. We like that people have lives outside of workplace.
Job Type: Fixed term contract
Contract length: 6 months
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Work Location: Remote

Title: Data Integrity Analyst Surgical Program (NSQIP)
Description:
Update data elements file and data source maps in database.
Adjust data with Manager approval to respond to issues.
Descriptions:
Position Profile:
Humber River Hospital. Lighting New Ways In Healthcare.

Five years since opening our doors as North America’s first fully digital hospital and we remain unwavering in our belief that we can change the hospital where we work, the community where we live, and the world of healthcare beyond our borders. Serving a community of 850,000 residents in North West Toronto, Equity Inclusivity and active participation in the North West Toronto Ontario Health Team are key initiatives important to our Team. At Humber River Hospital, we use a custom combination of technology and clinical expertise to rebuild elements of care. We make technology work for staff and physicians; giving them more time to spend with patients, to eliminate inefficiencies, and to reduce the chance of errors. Humber River Hospital is formally affiliated with both the University of Toronto and Queen’s University and committed to becoming a community academic hospital. Clinical Excellence, Optimizing Care through Technology and Community Connection frame our Research Strategy.

At Humber River Hospital, we’re not hoping for a renaissance, we are making it happen. As part of our dynamic team, you can lead the way, as we continue our journey towards high reliability care!

Right now we’re looking for a Data Integrity Analyst to work with our Surigcal Program , National Surgical Quality Improvement Program (NSQIP)

Reporting Relationship: Manager, Clinical Programs

Hours of Work: Days, Monday to Friday

Responsibilities:

Prepare and submit monthly Activity Level Reports (ALR) in collaboration with IS&T/Health Records
Develop quality flow and reporting processes (e.g. QA process map) in consultation with Manager
Analyze and coordinate changes to meet newly updated reporting requirements\
Update data elements file and data source maps in database
Adjust data with Manager approval to respond to issues
Discuss changes to funder strategic plans with Manager to analyze impact and transfer knowledge of changes
Creating meaningful utilization reports using various systems (WTIS, iport, Meditech, abstracted and financial data) to package key monitoring information that would be user friendly and available in real time.
Providing regular statistical and narrative data on Wait Time activities with interpretation to support the various clinical programs.
Providing regular statistical and narrative data on Decision Support activities with interpretation to support the various clinical programs.
Educating health care providers in the benefits of appropriate documentation and identifying the impact of documentation gaps as it relates to wait time and financial Information.
Assisting in the procurement, testing and implementation of valid and reliable tools for clinical resource utilization monitoring and analysis
Working in collaboration with the Information Systems Specialist to maintain/update/change dictionary entries of Wait Time Information System as required.

Requirements:
Completion of diploma or degree in health sciences, health administration, epidemiology, information management, or related programs. A combination of experience and education will be considered.
Minimum three years experience in database systems and activity level reporting.
Sound knowledge of medical terminology and documentation systems an asset.
Demonstrated report writing capabilities.
Demonstrated computer knowledge/expertise in MS Office i.e. Power point, Excel, Access, Word - spreadsheets, graphs and databases with report writing skills.
Experience in CIHI data and ICD-10 coding preferred.
Ability to facilitate, deliver and evaluate training programs.
Excellent interpersonal, written/oral communication skills, organization and problem solving skills.
Demonstrated ability to work with hospital staff of all levels and specialties in a positive, cooperative manner.
Demonstrated ability to prioritize workload and function in a changing and sometimes stressful work environment.
Ability to work independently and as a member of a team.
Location: Humber River Hospital – Wilson site

Employee Group: Non Union

Why Humber? Why Now?

Humber River Hospital is on an exciting transformation journey of redefining patient care, as we leverage the most advanced technologies to enhance all aspects of delivering high-quality, safe care. We continue to build a people-centered workplace with excellent staff and physician engagement by hiring passionate, diverse and inclusive healthcare professionals. People who care and encompass our values of Compassion, Professionalism and Respect. People who are committed to making a positive difference.

We are a Huron Consulting hospital, focused on building our evidence-based leadership practice and hardwiring a culture that WOWs.
Humber River Hospital is a member of the Toronto Academic Health Science Network (TAHSN), which is a dynamic network of academic health organizations providing leading edge research, teaching and clinical care.

We have collaborated with TAHSN member institutions in addressing the challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic. Our membership in TAHSN supports our strategic pillar of advancing Humber River Hospital as a community academic hospital.

Humber River Hospital was the recipient of the 2021 Excellence in Patient Safety Award by the Canadian College of Health Leaders. This award recognizes teams that are committed to improving patient safety within a healthcare environment, through leadership, innovation, culture, and best practises.

Why? Because at Humber River Hospital, we know it is our people and our ability to innovate that allows us to consistently deliver a great patient experience and the best quality outcomes. After all, we are the hospital that believes exceptional care...healthier community.

This description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by the employee within this position. However, the actual responsibilities, duties, qualifications and experience may vary. Employee may perform other related duties as required to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. Information contained in this job posting/description is subject to change.
Humber River Hospital is committed to inclusion and diversity. We believe that diversity drives our culture of innovation. By bringing together a variety of different perspectives, it fuels our creative thinking, generates new ideas and creates solutions designed to address tomorrow's healthcare challenges today. We take pride in providing professional development and career advancement opportunities for our employees including minorities, women, veterans and individuals with physical and developmental disabilities. We also provide accommodation to applicants and all of our employees - from hire to retire.
Let us know what we can do to help you be successful during your recruitment experience at Humber River Hospital.

Please be advised that in order to be eligible for employment at Humber River Hospital, all new hires must have received the full series of a COVID-19 vaccine or combination of COVID-19 vaccines approved by Health Canada (e.g., two doses of a two-dose vaccine series, or one dose of a single-dose vaccine series); AND have received the final dose of the COVID-19 vaccine at least 14 days prior to the hired employee’s first date of employment Medical exemptions or any other kind of requested exemption based upon the Hospital’s obligations pursuant to the Ontario Human Rights Code will be considered on a case-by-case basis

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Design and perform manual data analysis on live production data for detection of data anomalies and anti-fraud purposes.
Ability to work under tight timelines.
Descriptions:
About GeoComply

We’re GeoComply! We're a market-leading, hyper-growth technology provider with teams across five countries and three continents with a global customer base. And we have no plans to slow down.

Achieving 650% growth in annual revenue over the past three years and dubbed a tech “Unicorn,” we’re revolutionizing how people and businesses use the internet to instill confidence in every online interaction. Trusted by leading brands and regulators for the past ten years, our geolocation solutions are installed on over 400 million devices and analyze over 10 billion transactions a year.

At the heart of it all is the people - we are deeply committed to creating and sustaining a world-class experience for our employees and partners, and providing for the needs of our customers.

The Role

We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our team in Vancouver, Canada who will match our ambitions, and help us Better ourselves and achieve our goals.

The Senior Data Analyst role contributes to GeoComply’s success by developing and enhancing rules for our products and providing quality analysis based on data collected from our end customers, as well as providing insights to help business and technical teams make informed decisions. This position reports and takes direction from the Data Analytics Lead on a day-to-day basis.
Key Responsibilities
Design and perform manual data analysis on live production data for detection of data anomalies and anti-fraud purposes
Design and script reports based on requirements (moderate scripts)
Develop and maintain test plans, test cases and checklists related to the anti-fraud and compliance.
Stay informed of configuration, deployment, and database changes to ensure analytics tools are always working as expected
Review and analyze existing anti-fraud dashboards, tools, and reports, as a means of improving manual review methodologies
Research and investigate new geo-blocking bypass methodologies
Develop and maintain a thorough understanding of the company’s technologies, process and teams
Who You Are
Bachelor degree or above with good results in Computer Science, mathematics, statistics or similar fields.
Strong knowledge of and experience with databases (SQL, NoSQL etc), programming (Python), visualization tools( Kibana will be a plus)
Minimum 3 years’ experience in a similar role
Ability to combine knowledge of computer science, Machine Learning modeling, statistics and mathematics to solve problems.
Ability to work in small collaborative teams in a dynamic working environment
Good communication and interpersonal skills when working with the team
Sound experience in performing both QA testing and data analytics; the ability to look beyond testing tasks and think ‘outside the box’
Ability to work under tight timelines
Bonus Points
Knowledge in scikit-learn, keras, pytorch, deep learning framework will be a plus

Our values aren’t just a buzzword

From a professional development budget to local training opportunities, knowledge-sharing sessions and more, we are continually investing in employee career growth and development.

Our Impact division focuses on philanthropic and social responsibility initiatives, including supporting our local communities, advancing equality, and harnessing our technology to protect vulnerable groups. We care about our team

We value in-person collaboration

Title: Decision Support Analyst
Description:
Experience and demonstrated expertise in data extraction, data management, descriptive statistics and data analysis.
3 years relevant experience required.
Descriptions:
Req ID: 153374
Company: Nova Scotia Health
Location: Provincial Zone, Halifax Infirmary Robie Street Entrance - QEII
Department: PPA Clinical Analytics CNS
Type of Employment: Permanent Hourly FT (100% FTE) x 1 position(s)
Status: MGMT/NON-Union Management/Non Union Position
Posting Closing Date: 11-Apr-23

Nova Scotia Health is the largest provider of health services in Nova Scotia, with some specialized services also offered to clients throughout Atlantic Canada. We’re on a mission to achieve excellence in health, healing and learning through working together, which is reflected in the hospitals, health centres and community-based programs we operate across the province. Our passionate team of professionals provides a variety of high-quality inpatient and outpatient services including academic, tertiary, and quaternary care, as well as continuing care, primary health care, public health, and mental health and addictions. Join a diverse team of innovators, collaborators and creative thinkers today.

Nova Scotia Health employs professionals in all corners of our beautiful province. We believe there's a place here for everyone to call home, from vibrant cities with exuberant nightlife to quaint towns with picturesque trails. The work-life balance that comes with an Nova Scotia Health role means you'll have the time to explore, discover, and participate in that coveted Atlantic lifestyle. Visit us today and check out www.novascotia.com to see why more people from across the globe are moving here.
About the Opportunity
Reporting to the Manager, Clinical Analytics and through the Manager to the Director, Analytics, the Decision Support Analyst has the primary responsibility to Nova Scotia Health of supporting the mission, vision and strategic directions of the organization by assisting in the establishment and implementation of performance measurement tools that can be used throughout the organization.
The Decision Support Analyst position supports and enhances the use of evidence-based decision making through the provision of information and analytics in tailored reports. The Analyst liaises with key stakeholders to clarify data requests, performs extraction, management, synthesis, analysis of the data, and reporting of the data drawn from clinical information systems, administrative databases, and also other internal and external sources of data and information.
About You
We would love to hear from you if you have the following:

Baccalaureate degree in health related field, informatics, mathematics / statistics, or business required (An equivalent combination of education and experience will be considered)
3 years relevant experience required
Experience and demonstrated expertise in data extraction, data management, descriptive statistics and data analysis
Proficiency with micro-computer applications (e.g., Microsoft Office suite of products including Excel, Access, PowerPoint and Word).
Comprehensive knowledge of information management principles including information dissemination and exchange, data collection methodologies and data quality
Experience and demonstrated expertise with information systems, such as CIHI, Meditech, STAR, EDIS, etc.
Experience working with and synthesizing large, complex datasets and high volumes of information
Broad knowledge of the Health Care system and the continuum of care, current health system issues, trends, policy and legislation
Ability to produce professional reports and presentation materials
Capable of identifying different ways of presenting data and selecting the method most appropriate based on the goals of the analysis
Possess critical thinking and problem solving abilities
Demonstrate strong interpersonal and communication skills
Ability to develop and foster relationships with all levels of administrative and clinical management
Ability to communicate with leaders, managers and teams regarding sensitive and confidential matters
Capable of working independently
Competencies in other languages an asset, French preferred

Please ensure your resume is up to date and includes all relevant education, experience, training, and certifications.
Hours
Permanent, Full-time position, 75 hrs bi-weekly
Compensation and Incentives
$29.44 - $36.80 Hourly

Successful candidates may be eligible for our benefits package which includes health, dental, travel, long-term disability, and life insurance coverage as well as a defined benefit pension plan.
Once You've Applied
Thank you for your interest in this position. Only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.

This is a Management/Non Union bargaining unit position. Preference is given to bargaining unit employees for unionized positions. Employees are encouraged to view their seniority hours and dates in their SuccessFactors online profile. Successful applicants changing unions, bargaining units or employment status, are advised to seek clarification regarding their seniority, benefits, and vacation entitlement and/or usage, prior to accepting the position.

Preferred candidates must be able to demonstrate proof of primary series of COVID -19 vaccine at time of hire.

Nova Scotia Health is committed to being a workforce that is free of discrimination, values diversity and is representative, at all job levels, of the people we serve. We encourage all qualified applicants who self-identify as Indigenous, Black/African Nova Scotian, Persons of Colour, Foreign Nationals/Newcomers, Persons with Disabilities, 2SLGBTQIA+ to apply and self-identify.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description: Strong data warehousing technical skills and abilities including multi-dimensional modeling, data management procedure ETL/ELT development.
Descriptions:
Overview:

BCLC’s two offices are located on the traditional, ancestral and unceded lands of the xʷməθkʷəy̓əm (Musqueam Indian Band), Sḵwx̱wú7mesh (Squamish), and səlilwətaɬ (Tsleil-Waututh) Peoples in Vancouver and the Tk’emlúps te Secwépemc territory, situated within the Secwépemc Nation in Kamloops. We honour and respect the people, the territory, and the land we are part of.

Joining the Business Technology team at BCLC means you’ll be working with cutting-edge technology to help build a world-class entertainment company. This is an engaged, innovative, capable group of talented individuals working in digital enablement, product delivery services, technology platform enablement, enterprise services, integrity and operations. This enables us to execute the purchase and validation of lottery tickets at over 3500 lottery retailers, manage a complex network of 12,000 slot machines and electronic table games across the province and provide the backbone for BCLC’s eGaming platform, and much more.
We have offices in Kamloops and Vancouver and can also support 100% remote (from within British Columbia) for this position.

Job Summary:

The objective of the Senior Data Analyst role is to manage and execute the delivery of professional technical services and data delivery solutions to the organization so Enterprise Business Intelligence and other business stakeholder groups can deliver insights.

This role is responsible for the development and implementation of Enterprise Data Warehouse (EDW), administration on diverse data and business intelligence platforms, ETL and ELT engineering from source to destination. Managing and designing for our Microsoft SQL Server EDW, and in our Snowflake EDW. The Senior Data Analyst will proactively resolve complex operational technical issues and use innovative thinking in delivery of Data Warehouse solutions, including making recommendations for innovative approaches to technical work and issue resolution. The Senior Data Analyst role acts as a consultative partner by providing expertise, analysis, and advice to internal stakeholders within BCLC, as well as external to the organization, in the areas of Data Warehousing and Data Management; to enable the business to provide products and services efficiently and effectively.
Key Accountabilities:
Produces Enterprise Data Warehouse solutions for all BCLC data stakeholders including:
Requirements gathering and design, data modeling, development of required data warehouse & OLAP objects, ETL/ELT engineering, data management development, lead consultation to QA activities, and implementation.
Operational support of all data pipelines.
Data platform cloud and on-premises infrastructure administration, support, lifecycle management and compliance.
Provides input to overall data warehouse and business intelligence strategies.
Develops, maintains code repositories, and required project documentation.
Directs business units by building operational and tactical relationships regarding data warehouse and business intelligence methods and tools.
Communicates to key stakeholders for product delivery and incident management.


Minimum Required Qualifications:
Education and Experience
University degree in a relevant discipline or a two-year college diploma supplemented by industry recognized professional courses.
3-5 years progressively responsible experience in a database/data warehouse ETL/ELT development.
Data platform and system administration.
Knowledge of Cloud Data Warehouse technologies and infrastructure.
Understanding, and development experience in Kimball design methodology.
Equivalent combination of education and/or experience considered.
Technical Requirements
Platform administration of environments like Cognos, IBM Infosphere DataStage, Matillion, Collibra, SQL Server, Qlik Sense and Snowflake database.
Strong data warehousing technical skills and abilities including multi-dimensional modeling, data management procedure ETL/ELT development.
Microsoft SQL Server database object development and data manipulation.
Experience developing ETL/ELT data solutions using software platforms such as IBM Infosphere DataStage and Matillion considered an asset.
Database administration experience including SQL Server, Snowflake, Oracle, MySQL, and Informix is an asset.
Technical knowledge of Big Data / Data Lake systems such as Snowflake, Hadoop and related cloud technologies considered an asset.
Microsoft Windows and Linux system administration is an asset.
Knowledge of Agile and Waterfall methodology project management considered an asset.
Excellent written, verbal, communication, and people skills.
Excellent problem solving and analytical thinking/innovation.
Exceptional time management and multi-tasking skills.


Additional Information:
Effective November 22, 2021, BCLC requires all employees to be fully vaccinated (as defined by Health Canada). Full vaccination will be required before commencing employment with BCLC unless a legal exemption is obtained.
To build a rich diverse workforce representing the communities which we serve, we welcome applications from people of all colours and cultures, persons with diverse abilities, and members of the 2SLGBTQIA+ community.
BCLC values work life balance and offers remote work options for its employees.
Relocation assistance is available for successful job candidates.
If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance at any step of your application, please send an email with your request to recruitment@bclc.com.
For over more than a decade, we have been recognized as one of BC’s Top Employers – and we are constantly seeking ways to improve our employee and player experience. To learn more about BCLC, please visit: https://corporate.bclc.com/careers/overview.html
Please Note:
This opportunity will remain open until a qualified candidate pool has been established.
Candidates must be legally entitled to work in Canada and be 19 years of age to work at BCLC.

Title: Senior Data Sourcing Analyst
Description: Establish automated processes with data management and data engineering throughout the data iteration to simply the execution of the responsibilities of a data…
Descriptions:
About the position
A Senior Data Sourcing Analyst manages, administrates, and monitors licenses of externally licensed data that is used by TS Imagine internally or within our products (to be consumed through our customers). The identification and discovery in collaboration with product management and procurement is also a key responsibility. With detailed knowledge about data license agreements, terminology, licensing of external data from exchanges and redistribution of data the Senior Data Sourcing Analyst advise finance, product management, data management and development on best practices around externally licensed data. In addition, monitoring and enforcing the compliance with our license agreements with data vendors is part of the core responsibilities.
Who will love this job
A data guru – you enjoy solving problems through the consumption of externally licensed data and work with subject matter experts together to identify, procure and operationalize externally licensed data. You are the voice of our data vendors.
A teacher and learner – you like investigating and troubleshooting data related issues across all dimensions of data quality
A helper – you relish acting as the front-line support resource, handling client requests related to TS Imagine's data offering
A trusted subject matter specialist – you own contributing to the constant evolution of our data management maturity and data management capabilities in metadata management, data quality management and data governance
An author – you like finding new information and documenting such information to establish repeatable, scalable, and transparent processes for the management of externally licensed data
What you'll do
Assist product management in the definition of data requirements that must be met by externally licensed data
Discover in collaboration with product management alternative data sources to be meet the data requirements
Support procurement in procuring of externally licensed data as a subject matter expert
Maintain and monitor the inventory of all externally licensed data
Proactively identify upcoming renewals
Lead and manage any audit from data vendors and ensure compliance of TS Imagine with the active data license agreements; Act as the single point of contact for data vendors on any audit
Define global policies for the usage, integration and redistribution of externally licensed data and monitor adherence to such policies
Establish automated processes with data management and data engineering throughout the data iteration to simply the execution of the responsibilities of a data sourcing analyst
Calculate and track user counts to understand the consumption of externally licensed data
Establish reoccurring measurement of the consumption of externally licensed data
Ensure that existing processes, results and work artifacts pertaining to data sourcing activities are properly organized on SharePoint
Review and approve invoices coming from data vendors
Maintain data vendor contacts inventory and liaise with data vendors on data sourcing matters
You should have
A relevant Bachelor's Degree or Equivalent
At least 5 years of relevant work experience
Knowledge on core functionality of our products for trading, portfolio management, risk management or margin management would be an advantage;
Familiarity with the terms and conditions of license agreements for externally licensed data
Knowledge of financial instrument data vendors, such as Bloomberg, Refinitiv, ICE or FactSet
Solid knowledge about exchanges, live price data licenses and user reporting to exchanges
Solid skill on MS Excel, MS Word and MS PowerPoint
Why TS Imagine / Benefits
Currently hybrid home-office (3-4 days in the office)
5 weeks vacation and 3 personal days
Annual bonus and salary review
Training budget $1,500
RRSP with 3% company matching
Health insurance
Subvention for public transportation (Opus & Cie)
*** Only Montreal applicants will be considered - job not remote
About TS Imagine
Created out of the combination of two best-in-class SaaS platforms, TradingScreen and Imagine Software, TS Imagine delivers integrated trading, portfolio and real-time risk solutions for capital markets. The platform is uniquely positioned to streamline complex and time-consuming workflows across front, middle, and back office functions. TS Imagine has close to 400 employees in 10 offices worldwide, serving approximately 500 global buy-side and sell-side institutions across North and South America, EMEA, and Asia Pacific including hedge funds, traditional asset managers, pension funds, mutual funds, and financial institutions.
We challenge our employees every day to think creatively and innovate across silos and across platforms.
Join us!

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Knowledge of data warehouse/business intelligence concepts, architectural components is considered an asset.
Analyze data to provide insight and ad hoc reports…
Descriptions:
REALTOR.ca is the most popular real estate listing and information platform in Canada. It builds business for REALTOR® members and establishes consumer trust and loyalty by supporting Canadians through their home-buying and selling journeys. It operates under the guiding principles of delivering value to consumers and members and continually evolving to meet and exceed market expectations. REALTOR.ca is more than a listing service – it’s the nexus of the Canadian property buying and selling journey.
Summary
The Senior Business Systems Analyst supports the creation, enhancement, and maintenance of CREA’s IT Services by documenting requirements, contributing to system design, and assuming a leadership role throughout the Systems Development Life Cycle of REALTOR.ca and related products and services.
Function
This position is a rare opportunity to join the REALTOR.ca Analyst team. We are looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst who is personable, results-driven, and has proven leadership experience working across complex, multi-team projects. The Senior Business Systems Analyst has a strong background in Business Systems Analysis and Solutions Architecture and proven ability to perform in an Agile environment.

Leadership Skills
Business Analysis
Systems Analysis

Data Analysis
Creative Problem Solver
Critical Thinker
Business and Technical Writing
Presentation Skills
Customer Service

Lead a high-performing team of analysts

Organize and facilitate requirements gathering sessions with project stakeholders, team members and end-users.
Document requirements that meet the needs of the Business and Technology
Present solutions to key business stakeholders

Motivate and support the team in achieving on-time, on-budget, on quality solutions
Advise on BSA team roles and responsibilities, including project assignments and scrum team balancing
Identify any issues and make recommendations to the IT management team
Contribute to the establishment and adherence to IT security best practices
Requirements
University degree (IT, IS, or business administration with IT focus) or equivalent certification or experience
At least 10 years experience as a Business Systems Analyst or similar role
Experience managing staff
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment
Advanced use of SQL
Proficient in written and spoken English; bilingualism an asset
Demonstrated track record with consumer-facing, web/mobile-based projects considered an asset
Knowledge of data warehouse/business intelligence concepts, architectural components is considered an asset
This is a Hybrid position, with a mixture of working on-site-minimum two (2) days per week and remotely.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those under consideration for the role will be contacted.
At CREA, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, barrier-free and accessible environment. Part of this commitment includes arranging accommodations to ensure an equitable opportunity to participate in the recruitment and selection process. If you require an accommodation, we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Building Performance Analyst
Description:
Experience with net-zero energy buildings and advanced metering technologies is preferred.
Develop research, case studies and white papers to present findings…
Descriptions:
CannonDesign has an exciting opportunity for a Building Performance Analyst based in our Toronto, ON office. Take a look at the description below. If you think your skills and experience make you a good match for this position, we'd love to hear from you. We're looking for creative, curious, empathetic people to join our Living-Centered Design movement.
ABOUT OUR FIRM
CannonDesign is an integrated design solutions firm focused on helping people continuously flourish. Whether designing for innovations in health, new scientific discoveries, equity in education or the next big idea in business, we use our Living-Centered Design approach to help organizations realize widespread change. Our ability to design transformational places, plans and strategies is why Fast Company named us a World Changing Company and one of the most innovative design firms in the world.
ABOUT THE ROLE
You will be a member of our multi-disciplinary sustainability team, collaborating with design and technical leadership as an integral part of project teams across the firm.
WHAT YOU WILL DO
Perform building performance analysis and produce graphical representations of results for communication with our multi-disciplinary teams across multiple markets and office locations.
Develop visually appealing graphical representation of building energy consumption, thermal envelope performance, daylighting, glare, thermal comfort, renewable energy analysis, climate analysis, massing, orientation and other performance metrics for project pursuits and active design work.
Develop detailed energy and daylighting analyses to complement early design simulations and feedback.
Manage the documentation for LEED energy credits, energy code compliance reports and other performance rating systems.
Research performance modeling methodologies, workflows, and software to improve how the firm delivers high-performance design solutions.
Develop research, case studies and white papers to present findings and recommendations.
Assist in the production of narratives, approaches, and fees for project proposals.
May perform related duties as required.
ABOUT YOUR QUALIFICATIONS
Associate degree in Architectural, Environmental, Civil or Mechanical Engineering or related degree. Bachelor's degree in related field preferred.
Minimum 4 years of related experience which includes at least 2 years of building performance analysis.
Must have experience in data analysis, energy modeling, and visualization tools, and be well versed in A/E/C industry trends related to high performance buildings. Experience with net-zero energy buildings and advanced metering technologies is preferred. Experience with a broad range of building typologies, including but not limited to healthcare, laboratory, office and educational facilities is preferred.
Complete proficiency with at least one of the building energy modeling software with a strong desire to have multiple software proficiency: EnergyPlus, OpenStudio, IES-VE, eQuest, EnergyPro.
Must have familiarity with ASHRAE Standard 90.1, ASHRAE Standard 62.1, LEED Reference Guides, California Title 24, IECC, and other energy related codes.
Strong verbal and written communication skills as well as interpersonal skills are essential.
Proficiency with BIM applications strongly desired.
Experience in computational design and programming languages such as Python strongly desired.
This position may require travel to other CannonDesign offices as well as client locations.
One or more credential such as LEED, CPHC, BEMP or similar strongly desired. PEng a plus.
ABOUT WORKING HERE
We are relentless in our pursuit of client adoration (not simply satisfaction). Consistent delivery of the best service is what we are about.
We are committed to ensuring our practice is equitable for all employees, representative of the communities around us – and focused on the future of design. We advocate for equity, diversity, and inclusion efforts through the leadership of our DEI Council, Employee Resource Groups and other community advocacy initiatives.
We're about communication and transparency here. If you want to talk to someone about an idea you have, or a challenge that needs addressing, we're ready for you.
Please note that candidates can only apply to our positions on our company Careers site. It's not uncommon for scammers to create positions that look legitimate on other sites; never enter your information or apply for CannonDesign positions on any platform. Should an issue arise that you feel we should be aware of, please contact us. Please provide your resume and portfolio when applying.
As a condition of employment, all employees are expected to complete mandatory training, including compliance training, within required timeframes and adhere to our internal policies and our Code of Conduct.
CannonDesign recognizes the value of diversity in our workforce and is committed to Employment Equity and the Federal Contractors Program. We encourage applications from qualified aboriginal Canadians, persons with disabilities, members of visible minorities and women. CannonDesign is committed to providing accommodation for people with accessibility needs due to disabilities in all aspects of the hiring process. If contacted, please advise Human Resources if you require disability-related accommodation.

Title: Data Analyst, International Portfolio Management
Description: Design systems to automate the data collection and data load process for the International Real Estate team; aim to create reliable data to drive real estate…
Descriptions:
About QuadReal Property Group
QuadReal Property Group is a global real estate investment, operating and development company headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia. Its assets under management total $67.1 billion. From its foundation in Canada as a full-service real estate operating company, QuadReal has expanded its capabilities to invest in equity and debt in both the public and private markets. QuadReal invests directly, via programmatic partnerships and through operating companies in which it holds an ownership interest.
QuadReal seeks to deliver strong investment returns while creating sustainable environments that bring value to the people and communities it serves. Now and for generations to come.
QuadReal: Excellence lives here.

Role Description
QuadReal is looking for a high calibre candidate to fill the role of Data Analyst, International Portfolio Management (“Analyst”). This position will report to the Vice President, International Portfolio Management. We are seeking a highly motivated individual with a background in Data Science or Data Analytics who is looking to develop their career in an entrepreneurial and high-energy environment. This position will play a pivotal role in the continued buildout of QuadReal's International data analytics platform.

Responsibilities
Work with a variety of structured datasets (sourcing, cleaning, and visualization); present results to various stakeholders and gather feedback for improvement
Assist in the preparation of regular reporting for senior management; look to leverage technology to automate these processes in a timely manner
Investigate opportunities to help improve business efficiencies, analyze portfolio management pain points, and maximize use of QuadReal's enterprise applications
Work closely with various groups to deliver best-in-class system implementation rollouts, upgrades, and process improvements every step of the project lifecycle
Design systems to automate the data collection and data load process for the International Real Estate team; aim to create reliable data to drive real estate market insight and decision-making for senior management
Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members process stakeholders, support groups, business partners, to ensure collaboration and cooperation to meet timing of projects
Maintaining and updating database platforms based on information provided by both internal and external partners.
Support process improvement and global data initiative adaptation by having a thorough understanding of available and upcoming technology across the industry

Education and Qualifications
University degree in a quantitative discipline (e.g. Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field) OR a background in Economics, Finance or a related business field. CFA or similar a plus
Advanced knowledge of Excel (VBA and PowerQuery a plus); direct experience designing and creating data visualizations (e.g. PowerBI); good understanding of programming languages (Python/ SQL/ R); experience with real estate management system (Yardi) and Anaplan a plus
2+ years experience with data extract, transform, and load processes, data analytics/ visualization / database management
Accurate and detail-oriented with strong analytical skills; able to take initiative and work independently with minimal direction; able to allocate one's time effectively, work under pressure and meet tight deadlines; able to handle competing priorities, and adapt to new ideas/ constant changes

Title: IT Business Analyst
Description: Explore the current functioning of the organization through research, which could include employee interviews and quantitative data collection.
Descriptions:
Job Description

Your life at Canam
As a Business Analyst, Global Experience Technologies, you will have a concrete impact by suggesting ways to operate more efficiently at Canam. You will meet the needs by observing the current operation through research. You will persuade internal and external stakeholders of the benefits of new technologies and provide training. Process improvement will be at the heart of your days, and you will be the link with our IT development teams. You have a great curiosity, and you have strong skills for solving complex problems? Then this position is for you! That said, it's your team that will give you the most satisfaction, because at Canam, we are a strong bond of well-being and achievements!
Use data modeling techniques to identify ways in which the organization, business unit or department can operate more efficiently.
Communicate with senior management in the organization, business unit or department to find out what they hope to accomplish.
Formulate ways for the business to improve, based on previous research.
Persuade internal and external stakeholders of the benefits of new technologies or strategies.
Oversee the implementation of new technologies and systems.
Lead workshops and training.
Explore the current functioning of the organization through research, which could include employee interviews and quantitative data collection.
Explore different solutions, their risks, benefits, and impacts.
Propose solutions to the leaders of the organization and keep them informed of progress.
Create documents to describe the proposed changes and the steps involved.
Ensure that changes are made – for example, overseeing the implementation of a new technology or approach.
Contribute to the training and support of those affected by the new systems and processes.

Qualifications
Bachelor's degree in business administration, computer science or any other related field
Minimum of 3 - 5 years of experience in a business analyst role, with at least 2 years of experience in an advisory role with business sectors with a view to aligning business needs and IT solutions.
Commercial awareness, business acumen.
Experience working with complex data and systems.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and the ability to work with people at all levels of an organization.
Time management, problem-solving and organizational skills.
Interest and understanding of project management techniques.
Advanced understanding of Microsoft Office Suite and/or Google Workspace, and Smartsheet.
Knowledge of data systems and structures.
Ability to read plans, specifications, bills of material.
Experience and knowledge in using CRM in sales, marketing in the manufacturing field, and the logistics of loading and transporting bulk materials and finished products in the manufacturing sector is an asset.
Experience and knowledge in commercial and/or industrial construction project management.
Knowledge of Web portal, Web analyzes and statistics, management of social networks, campaigns, CRM are assets.

Additional Information

Why Work for Canam?
Competitive salary based on experience and qualifications.
Flexible schedule (36.5-hour week) for your work-life balance.
Possibility of teleworking so that you can take advantage of your renovations.
Bonus based on company performance because we like to share success.
Group insurance from your first day with employer contributions (life, disability, medication, dental and travel) to have peace of mind.
Defined contribution pension plan because we all retire one day.
Employee Assistance Program for when you need it.
Access to a free telemedicine service because no one likes waiting at the clinic.
Career movement because we all grow up differently.
Gym subscription partially paid because your ability for problem-solving only makes your brain stronger.
Canam, an employer that makes you want to stay
Since 1960, Canam has been an employer with a strong, unifying and family culture, rallying its 3,500 employees. With offices in Canada, the United States, Romania, India and the Philippines, our company continues to grow thanks to the innovation and know-how of everyone involved. Moreover, to build structures known and recognized for their quality across North America, you must feel that you have everything you need to succeed in these large-scale projects. Proud of our achievements, we are here to stay, and it is with you that we want to do it.

Additional Information
Canam Group Inc. appreciates your interest in this position. Please note that only those selected for an interview will be contacted. In accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 and the Ontario Human Rights Code, Canam Group Inc. is committed to providing employment accommodation. If you require accommodation to apply, or if selected to participate in an assessment process, please advise Human Resources of the nature of any accommodation(s) needed.

Title: REPORTING ANALYST LEAD

Descriptions:
Company Description

Denodo is looking for a smart, highly motivated, detail-oriented and data-driven team player to join our North America marketing team. Reporting to the Director of Marketing in North America, this individual will own and drive a plan to accelerate and scale the growth of our business through the online marketplaces with our top cloud alliances.
This is a key and strategic role that balances marketing strategy and execution. You will design and build exceptional marketing campaigns and buyer journey experiences that drive new customer acquisition and build long-term loyalty.
Denodo is the leader in data integration and management enabling enterprises to implement a true logical data fabric across the broadest range of on-premises, cloud, structured / unstructured, and streaming data sources two-thirds faster, involving less effort, and quicker time-to-revenue than traditional approaches. The award winning Denodo Platform logically integrates, manages, and delivers data for agile BI, advanced analytics, hybrid/multi-cloud applications, and enterprise data services. Denodo’s customers have gained more than 400% ROI and millions of dollars in benefits, with a payback of less than 6 months.

Job Description

The Lead Reporting Analyst will help drive critical business decisions by designing reports, conducting analysis and driving analytical capacity within supported departments. They will contribute to the overall improvement of business reporting by maintaining the company's data system to increase the effectiveness and integrity of data reporting, and conducting full lifecycle analysis.
Reporting analysts will be responsible for the following duties:
Create and maintain metrics and KPI reports to drive growth and identify areas of improvement within region to meet objectives
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Support various departments, including Marketing, Sales, Partner Channel Sales, Pre Sales and Post Sales , in reaching their goals through analysis
Track and analyze large sets of data to contribute to the development of sales plans and strategies
Analyze trends and provide modeling and scenarios to improve sales efficiency
Collaborate with the Operations team members to expand coverage of reliable data and automate recurrent data needs
Communicate the results of data analysis in written and verbal form to
seniorManagement

• Demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize time to meet reporting deadlines • Skilled in Power BI report authoring and editing, advanced MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Teams, Salesforce reporting and dashboarding
• Strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively articulate data analysis • Excellent critical thinking skills to help solve business problems and make decisions • Ability to pay close attention to small details that could impact results
General knowledge of business operations, objectives, strategies, process and information flow

• Demonstrated ability to manage and prioritize time to meet reporting deadlines • Skilled in Power BI report authoring and editing, advanced MS Excel, MS PowerPoint, MS Teams, Salesforce reporting and dashboarding
• Strong written and verbal communication skills to effectively articulate data analysis • Excellent critical thinking skills to help solve business problems and make decisions • Ability to pay close attention to small details that could impact results
General knowledge of business operations, objectives, strategies, processes, and information flow.

Title: Business Analyst - Home Health/Primary Health Care/Integrated LTC AL
Description: Documents reports on data quality and provides recommendations to resolve data quality and collection issues; provides technical advice to staff regarding data,…
Descriptions:
Why Fraser Health?:
We invite you to apply today and find out why more than 95% of new employees recommend Fraser Health to their friends as an exceptional place to work. A 2022 BC Top Employer, we value diversity in the work force and seek to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring & Trust.

Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional, ancestral and unceded territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka’pamux Nations, and is home to six Métis Chartered Communities.

Effective October 26th 2021, all new hires to Fraser Health will need to have full COVID 19 vaccination (have received a full series of a World Health Organization “WHO” approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines). Please note this applies to all postings, and individual medical exemptions must be approved by the Provincial Health Officer.

Position Details:

Bring your expertise and demonstrated skills in data analysis, data mining and performance reporting to provide evidence-based review of service utilization, health interventions, technology assessments and performance analysis. An exciting opportunity awaits you as a Temporary Full Time Business Analyst – join our team and support the Integrated Long Term Care & Assisted Living Services in Central City Tower located in Surrey, BC.

This position will be availble until July 31st, 2023.

Connect with us!

Connect with us on our Careers social channels where you’ll learn about exciting opportunities, get career tips from our recruiters, and meet some of your future team members! You can also visit us on Indeed and Glassdoor.
Instagram | Facebook | LinkedIn | Twitter | TikTok

Detailed Overview:
Supporting the Vision, Values, Purpose and Commitments of Fraser Health including service delivery that is centered around patients/clients/residents and families:
Provides leadership and support by applying expert knowledge in health economics and skills in data extraction, data manipulation and analysis to advise on evidence-based clinical practice and operational decision making; plans and develops reporting requirements by reviewing clinical, financial, human resource and operational data to develop strategic business cases; prepares supporting documents, briefing papers, strategic and tactical reports for an assigned area and/or portfolio for submission to funding organizations, Fraser Health Executive and other stakeholders; works collaboratively with clinical teams and other internal stakeholders in the support of the mission, philosophies and goals of Fraser Health.
Responsibilities:
Coordinates work activities related to data collection and the production of key performance metrics reports and evaluation measures related to the Integrated Primary and Community Care (IPCC) or Integrated Long Term Care & Assisted Living initiatives and other assigned projects.
Verifies the accuracy, consistency and integrity of data and information by consulting with project and work team leads to confirm and validate the data and contents of reports and documents.
Provides detailed multi-source data analysis, interpretation and advice by compiling and reviewing financial, human resource, clinical and operational data.
Documents reports on data quality and provides recommendations to resolve data quality and collection issues; provides technical advice to staff regarding data, statistical analysis and related data support to improve and maintain consistent data quality and collection.
Collaborates with staff and the Health & Business Analytics team to identify reporting needs, analyses current processes and identifies opportunities to reduce redundancies and ensure accurate and consistent reporting processes to support key business objectives and project initiatives.
Provides work direction and expert advice on methods to address business needs through the improved use of automated tools; facilitates discussion on future requirements in consultation with users and prepares business cases to document and assist in refining existing work processes.
Prepares strategic documents for program service planning and delivery including briefing papers, confidential business cases and operational/clinical reviews for area/department leadership.
Provides expertise during different phases of information system implementation to ensure reporting requirements meet established guidelines and standards; responds to data requests as required.
Develops annual performance plans including goals and objectives for assigned area of responsibility in collaboration with the Manager, Clinical Services or appropriate designate.
Participates on internal/external committee meetings as requested.
Qualifications: Education and Experience

Bachelor's degree in Health Economics, Statistics, Computer Science or related discipline, supplemented with five (5) to seven (7) years' recent related experience in decision support, data analysis and/or health care management, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Competencies

Demonstrates the leadership practices of the Fraser Health Leadership Framework of Clear, Caring and Courageous and creates the conditions for people to succeed.
Professional/Technical Capabilities
Demonstrated knowledge and understanding of the health care system.
Demonstrated ability to analyze clinical, administrative and financial data.
Demonstrated understanding of relational and multi-dimensional database concepts.
Knowledge of other health care disciplines and their role within healthcare.
Working knowledge of health care economics and statistics.
Ability to operate related equipment including applicable software applications.
Physical ability to perform the duties of the position.
