Title: Information and Data Analyst, Population Health Observatory
Description: This includes identifying inaccurate data and following up with data entry staff on missing, erroneous and duplicate data and correcting data errors in a timely…
Descriptions:
Why Fraser Health?:
Fraser Health is responsible for the delivery of hospital and community-based health services from Burnaby to Fraser Canyon on the traditional, ancestral and unceded territories of the Coast Salish and Nlaka’pamux Nations, and is home to six Métis Chartered Communities.

Our team of 43,000 staff, medical staff and volunteers is dedicated to serving our patients, families and communities to deliver on our vision: Better health, best in health care. Learn more.

We are currently looking to fill a Relief Full Time opportunity for a Information and Data Analyst, Population Health Observatory at Central City located in Surrey, BC. This relief role is available until November 2023 or until return of incumbent.

Come work with us!

Fraser Health is proudly recognized as a BC Top Employer. Joining our team offers you opportunities to work in a rapidly growing organization with health professionals who are excellent in their respective fields, career growth and advancement, a competitive compensation package (including four weeks of vacation to start, comprehensive health benefits, and pension plan), and the rewarding opportunity to make a difference every single day in health care.

Effective October 26, 2021 all staff for all positions across health care in British Columbia are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (have received a full series of a World Health Organization “WHO” approved vaccine against infection by SARS-COV-2, or a combination of approved WHO vaccines). Please note this applies to all postings, and there are no exceptions.

Fraser Health values diversity in the work force and strives to maintain an environment of Respect, Caring and Trust. Fraser Health’s hiring practices aspire to ensure all individuals are treated in an inclusive, equitable, and culturally safe manner.

Connect with us!

Connect with us on our Careers social channels where you’ll learn about exciting opportunities, get career tips from our recruiters, and meet some of your future team members! You can also visit us on Indeed and Glassdoor.

Instagram | Facebook | LinkedIn | Twitter | TikTok
Detailed Overview:
Supporting the Vision, Values, Purpose and Commitments of Fraser Health including service delivery that is centered around patients/clients/residents and families.
Provides information and data management expertise and analytical support for health assessment and disease surveillance functions. Partners with members of the Population Health Observatory and across Population and Public Health to generate and disseminate appropriate health information. Responsibilities:
Collects and collates regional health assessment and surveillance data; uses analytic reporting tools to retrieve data, design reports, and summarize health information; maintains routine surveillance reports and outputs; develops and produces regular and ad-hoc reports of key performance indicators that monitor trends and healthcare utilization to support decision-making.
Acquires data from accessing on-line resources, requests data from other departments, regional, provincial and national agencies; assists as needed with the gathering and entering of data from health units and other frontline teams to ensure data collection and entry are complete.
Facilitates the preparation of data requests by performing duties such as extracting, linking, manipulating, analyzing, and summarizing data at the request of internal and external partners such as medical health officers, directors, managers, and community partners for the purposes of program planning, quality improvement and performance measurement.
Supports the epidemiologists in analysis of surveillance data for the preparation of reports and advises on data quality and data limitations for analytic purposes. Performs quantitative data analysis using descriptive and statistical methodologies, statistical software (e.g. SAS, R), and coding; automates routine analyses using standard programming tools; consults with epidemiologists and biostatistician to validate content and methodology of statistical reports.
Performs data management and preparation activities, including data extraction, data cleaning and documentation; develops and maintains data collection and storage systems such as databases and spreadsheets, including designing ad hoc reports; automates routine data management tasks using standard programming tools including structured query language (SQL); partners with relevant stakeholders to ensure reporting needs are met for assigned databases.
Uses ArcGIS, ArcCatalog and other relevant spatial software to create, organize and maintain geographic maps; uses cartography, geoprocessing, geocoding, vector and raster mapping, spatial joining, spatial editing, and Python and VBScript coding to conduct geospatial data analysis and create GIS maps; maintains appropriate metadata and documentation to describe maps, spatial analyses and processes and shapefiles; uses GIS maps, geospatial analysis, and spatial epidemiology of disease and its risk factors to assist in public health planning and evaluation, disease surveillance, outbreak investigations, and emergency preparedness.
Maintains the Population Health Observatory geographic content, including the Community Health Atlas, the Census, health, forward sortation area (FSA) and neighbourhood boundary files, and the environmental, transportation, health and other shapefiles and geodatabases; liaises with external partners such as BC Stats, BC Ministry of Health, and local governments to acquire spatial data.
Monitors and ensures quality and integrity of data from various public health information systems; advises about any identified data issues to ensure that data used for analysis or distributed to stakeholders is of the highest quality. This includes identifying inaccurate data and following up with data entry staff on missing, erroneous and duplicate data and correcting data errors in a timely manner. Documents and updates the processes for these procedures.
Plans system development, enhancement, and maintenance by performing duties such as evaluating existing and emerging data collection/analysis technology; executes project plans for implementation in a timely manner.
Prepares and maintains documentation and reports such as user guides, data collection procedure manuals, metadata, code documentation, data security policies and data dictionaries.
Participates on internal and external committees, as necessary, including provincial GIS committees such as the Health Authority Geographic Information System Committee; and liaises with the committee to communicate geographic and spatial data issues related to health assessment and surveillance with other jurisdictions.
Provides Manager, Population Health Observatory with budgetary costs for GIS related expenses such as software and data licensing, hardware upgrades, and training/education.
Maintains Population Health Observatory SharePoint site and departmental content on the intra/inter-nets. Recommends and implements changes to, and development of, websites and website content.
Supports data security by assigning and deleting access for various applications and network file systems. Ensures the secure transfer of confidential data to authorized stakeholders.
Supports the analysis and dissemination of information through the development of data visualization products. Ensures that the right tool and type of visualizations are used to draw insights for different analytical scenarios.
Qualifications: Education and Experience

Bachelor's Degree in Health Informatics, Health Sciences, Statistics or related field, plus three (3) to five (5) years' recent related technical experience with health information and data analysis or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.

Competencies

Demonstrates the leadership practices of the Fraser Health Leadership Framework of Clear, Caring and Courageous and creates the conditions for people to succeed.
Professional/Technical Capabilities
Demonstrated ability to use a variety of software applications (including GIS, R, SAS, Tableau, D3.js) to analyze and visualize health information.

Title: Analyst, Material Pricing
Description:
Receive, review and understand product data packages from our external customers.
Communicate with external customers to resolve missing and/or inaccurate data.
Descriptions:
Req ID: 115656
Remote Position: Hybrid
Region: Americas
Country: Canada
State/Province: Ontario
City: Toronto

We are currently seeking an Analyst, Material Pricing based out of Toronto. This opportunity offers an ideal environment to learn and grow. In this role you will build your experience by being exposed to a wide cross-section of business functions and customer teams while working on strategic business opportunities and improvements. The role offers an opportunity to become a leader in a global organization, leveraging technology and analytics to drive real value to both Celestica and our Customers.

***As this position involves work that is subject to the Canadian Government's Controlled Goods Program (CGP), your employment offer is conditional upon the successful completion of a security assessment by Celestica and/or its authorized agents, per the Controlled Goods Regulations.

Preferred Skills:
Understanding of general aerospace products and industry
Basic manufacturing system knowledge
Good written and verbal communication skills
Excellent time management skills
Ability to prioritize and work on several tasks at the same time
Knowledge in Microsoft Office suite (Word, PowerPoint, Excel)
Experience working with macros is considered an asset

Activities:
Receive, review and understand product data packages from our external customers.
Send and negotiate quote tenders with suppliers to establish cost and set pricing
Interface with manufacturing and supply chain teams to prioritize engineering changes and data setup based on production schedule.
Complete bill of material, component and assembly data set up within Celestica's internal databases to enable material procurement and manufacturing.
Communicate with external customers to resolve missing and/or inaccurate data.
Manages customer pricing proposals and maintains historical Database of quotes
Supports precise cost estimating using historical data, as well as estimating costs of parts
Coordinates and manages the material cost activity for select customers and/or sites
Prepares material pricing independently for new business opportunities (bids) including generation of Bill of Material, cost analysis, negotiation with suppliers, collaboration with Commodity Management and presentation to team leaders and managers.
Updates material prices database and analyzes Bill of Material for competitiveness.
Negotiates with suppliers on RFI tenders.
Participates in kick-off meetings and interacts with global customer’s units as well as counterparts in other regions.
Audits and analyzes quarterly cost variances.
Consolidates, tabulates, analyzes and reports on various topics, commitments and performance metrics.
Work with multi-disciplinary teams on continuous improvement initiatives as necessary to enhance processes to meet cost, quality, and delivery.
Work guided by detailed instructions, routine, procedure and under close supervision. Will receive detailed instructions on all work assignments.
Opportunity on more complex duties as proficiency improves.
Deals directly with immediate supervisor, co-workers and team members with guidance.
Research Aerospace customers’ products and market trends.

Physical Demands, duties of this position are varied and will include:
Duties of this position are performed in a normal office with exposure to manufacturing environments.
Duties may require extended periods of sitting and sustained visual concentration on a computer monitor or on numbers and other detailed data
Repetitive manual movements are frequently required (e.g. data entry, using a computer mouse, using a calculator, etc.).

Area: Aerospace and Defense

Experience:
Two to four years relevant experience.

Education:
Bachelor’s degree in related field (Business or Engineering), or consideration of an equivalent combination of education and experience.

Celestica is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment and will not be discriminated against on any protected status (including race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran or disability status or other characteristics protected by law).


At Celestica we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. Special arrangements can be made for candidates who need it throughout the hiring process. Please indicate your needs and we will work with you to meet them.

COMPANY OVERVIEW:
Celestica (NYSE, TSX: CLS) enables the world’s best brands. Through our recognized customer-centric approach, we partner with leading companies in Aerospace and Defense, Communications, Enterprise, HealthTech, Industrial, Capital Equipment and Energy to deliver solutions for their most complex challenges. As a leader in design, manufacturing, hardware platform and supply chain solutions, Celestica brings global expertise and insight at every stage of product development – from drawing board to full-scale production and after-market services for products from advanced medical devices, to highly engineered aviation systems, to next-generation hardware platform solutions for the Cloud.

Headquartered in Toronto, with talented teams spanning 40+ locations in 13 countries across the Americas, Europe and Asia, we imagine, develop and deliver a better future with our customers.


Celestica would like to thank all applicants, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted.


Celestica does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruitment agencies or fee based recruitment services.

Title: Business Analyst
Description: 3-5 years of related work experience with a background in business analysis of big data and traditional business intelligence solutions.
Descriptions:
Job Description:
At Arterra Wines Canada, we love inspiring the big and small moments that happen when our products are shared and enjoyed. For us it’s not just about what’s in and on the bottle, it’s what happens in people’s lives when we’re a part of them that keeps us thirsting for more and not resting on our laurels as Canada’s largest and most enjoyed wine company. Recognizes and validates existing and potential systems opportunities in order to provide advice and guidance.

Completion of a degree in Computer Science or a related discipline - or a combination of education, training and experience deemed equivalent
3-5 years of related work experience with a background in business analysis of big data and traditional business intelligence solutions
1-2 years working on large scale IT deployments
Critical thinking, superior verbal, written, analytical, organizational and problem-solving skills are required
Proven strong customer focus
Effective and clear communication skills with customers
Ability to work on multiple projects concurrently with shifting priorities
What we offer:

Benefits and Pension Plan
Product Allowances & Safe Ride Home Program
An organization that cares about Corporate Social Responsibility
Tuition reimbursement
Training & Development Programs
An opportunity to learn about the world of wine

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Knowledge of data warehouse/business intelligence concepts, architectural components is considered an asset.
Analyze data to provide insight and ad hoc reports…
Descriptions:
REALTOR.ca is the most popular real estate listing and information platform in Canada. It builds business for REALTOR® members and establishes consumer trust and loyalty by supporting Canadians through their home-buying and selling journeys. It operates under the guiding principles of delivering value to consumers and members and continually evolving to meet and exceed market expectations. REALTOR.ca is more than a listing service – it’s the nexus of the Canadian property buying and selling journey.
Summary
The Senior Business Systems Analyst supports the creation, enhancement, and maintenance of CREA’s IT Services by documenting requirements, contributing to system design, and assuming a leadership role throughout the Systems Development Life Cycle of REALTOR.ca and related products and services.
Function
This position is a rare opportunity to join the REALTOR.ca Analyst team. We are looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst who is personable, results-driven, and has proven leadership experience working across complex, multi-team projects. The Senior Business Systems Analyst has a strong background in Business Systems Analysis and Solutions Architecture and proven ability to perform in an Agile environment.
Core Competencies:
Leadership Skills
Business Analysis
Systems Analysis
Solutions Architecture
Data Analysis
Creative Problem Solver
Critical Thinker
Business and Technical Writing
Presentation Skills
Customer Service
Position Accountabilities
Lead a high-performing team of analysts
Lead the development and enhancement of REALTOR.ca and supporting technology solutions on behalf of REALTORS®, consumers and Real Estate Associations:
Organize and facilitate requirements gathering sessions with project stakeholders, team members and end-users.
Document requirements that meet the needs of the Business and Technology
Present solutions to key business stakeholders
Analyze data to provide insight and ad hoc reports to product managers and IT stakeholders
Take a leadership role in designing, planning, and coordinating projects that involve multiple scrum teams
Establish, improve, and enforce requirements standards within the Business Systems Analyst team
Participate in meetings related to product release activities
Contribute to the creation of QA and UAT test strategies.
Consult on integration and acceptance testing
Contribute to IT architecture, design, and product implementation activities.
Act as a liaison between Business, Development, and Quality Assurance teams.
Identify risks to project deadlines or budget.
Facilitate integration activities with external partner organizations and third-party vendors.
Contribute to assessing project scope and feasibility
Contribute to troubleshooting enhancement and production support-related issues
Mentor colleagues in documentation best practices
Motivate and support the team in achieving on-time, on-budget, on quality solutions
Advise on BSA team roles and responsibilities, including project assignments and scrum team balancing
Identify any issues and make recommendations to the IT management team
Contribute to the establishment and adherence to IT security best practices
Requirements
University degree (IT, IS, or business administration with IT focus) or equivalent certification or experience
At least 10 years experience as a Business Systems Analyst or similar role
Experience managing staff
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment
Advanced use of SQL
Proficient in written and spoken English; bilingualism an asset

Title: Technical Business Analyst
Description:
As a Technical Business Analyst, you will be contributing to the design of Cloud-based Fintech systems for Fortune 500 clients.
Design API and Event interfaces.
Descriptions:
Who we are:
Indellient delivers leading-edge technology solutions that enable cloud transformation for our clients. Our solutions provide a competitive advantage for our clients by allowing them to offer new services and harness the power of the cloud. We build lasting relationships with our clients; and, in so doing, our clients view us as a high impact technology partner who delivers solutions that unlock sustained business value. The foundation of our delivery strength and stability is our team, motivated by a systemic focus on career development and professional growth.
*
About the Role*
Have a knack for business process and requirements gathering? Does creating sense and order out of complexity and ambiguity come natural to you? Want to work with a team that is shaping an industry? We’re looking for you!
As a Technical Business Analyst, you will be contributing to the design of Cloud-based Fintech systems for Fortune 500 clients. Working with Indellient solution architects, developers, project managers and client team members, you will translate business requirements into artifacts which enable the development and testing of sophisticated systems with world-class security and reliability. This role is key to helping organizations to apply Cloud, DevOps, and web solution technologies and best practices to their digital financial data initiatives.
You are passionate about helping clients transform their businesses through Cloud solutions, enthusiastic about deeply understanding client requirements, and have strong written, visual, and verbal communication skills.
Relevant work experience is desirable, but Indellient is an excellent place to develop these skills working for global enterprise clients with our experienced business, data, and systems analysts, and we are prepared to train a candidate with an outstanding aptitude and attitude for a long and exciting career.
What you will do:
Meet with technical stakeholders to obtain a detailed understanding of requirements, capture detailed integration mapping specifications and applicable business rules, then align to platform capabilities
Document current state and desired future state business processes via Process Diagrams, Data Flow Diagrams, etc., and conduct gap analysis. Ensure documentation is updated as designs are refined
Work with Project Managers to ensure development teams have necessary details on scope, and liaise with stakeholders to address questions raised during development if needed
Design API and Event interfaces
Design UAT Test Cases aligned with business requirements and test automation tool capabilities
Assist Senior Solution Designers with creating and maintaining design artifacts as needed
What you have:
Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Business (with technical electives) at University or College level
5+ years’ of working experience at technology companies
Must have demonstrated experience analyzing business and technical requirements and translating into design artifacts in an Agile environment
Experience leading meetings with a variety of business and technical stakeholders
Excellent written skills and client-facing presentational skills
Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Visio and LucidCharts, and Excel, Word
Eagerness to learn in a cutting edge and fast-moving environment
Devotion to Customer Service- ability to engage and build positive internal and external client relationships, while managing multiple initiatives, often with competing priorities.
Any or all of the following will really set you apart and get you noticed:
Agile development projects
Cloud platforms: Amazon Web Services and related technologies e.g. Kubernetes, Terraform, Elasticsearch, DevOps
Developing RESTful APIs
API integrations with mobile browser and native applications
Jira and Confluence
Previous experience with software solution design and development
Experience with scalable, secure Cloud-based enterprise -scale solutions
Integration technologies: XML, JSON, SQL, encryption
Why work with us?
Great people. We pride ourselves on hiring smart, kind, and supportive teammates
Growth and development. We equip our team members with all the tools they need to succeed
Be the driver of your career development. At Indellient, you are in control of your career growth. With multiple lines of business, internal and external facing roles, and new opportunities, exploring your career path with us is highly encouraged.
Flexibility. We offer flexible start and end times to accommodate our early risers and night owls and work-from-home arrangements. We also offer employees the option of working at the office, from home or hybrid depending upon your preferences.
Health and Wellness. We offer benefits from day 1, 2% RRSP Matching program, a $500 fitness reimbursement, and competitive PTO policy
Monthly Socials. Even though we are currently working fully remotely, we have tons of team bonding opportunities through regular donut dates, social hours, trivia nights, and more fun events because our culture and values still remain at the core of everything we do!
Whether you’re looking to drive transformational change or reimagine your career, learn more about our team, our core beliefs and what makes high value solutions provider here: Indellient Careers
Indellient is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. In addition, Indellient is committed to providing accommodations for people with disabilities during the recruitment and selection process. In the event you require any accommodations, please advise us in advance and we will work with you to meet your needs.
Job Type: Full-time

Title: Sales Operations Analyst (D344)
Description: Demonstrated data analytics ability to critically look at performance data and draw constructive conclusions from the results.
Descriptions:
Purpose of the position

The Sales Operations Analyst will be responsible for planning and enablement for SMART’s Unified Commercial Engine (UCE), while improving and optimizing the processes related to these duties. A person in this role will champion our mission to be a data and systems driven organization. This person will strive to improve operational efficiencies and work as a liaison between Sales, Marketing, Operations, and Finance to define new and improve existing cross-functional workflows. The successful candidate will have strong interpersonal skills, robust data analysis capabilities, and a natural sense of curiosity that drives them to identify trends and promote opportunities. This role with have focus on the North American market while ensuring simplicity, consistency and alignment globally.

Duties and Responsibilities

Planning and enablement responsibilities include:
Develop short- and long-term forecasting on a rolling monthly and quarterly cadence
Support the development of annual sales quotas and territory planning
Leverage data from Salesforce.com and PowerBI to perform deep analysis, and inform decisions to support the sales organization and drive company objectives
Become intimately familiar with conversion and close ratios and lead projects that drive system improvements required to improve insights
Ongoing evaluation of the technology stack related to your responsibilities for optimization and automation
Work closely with SMART's Data Science and Operations team to ensure UCE reporting is providing relevant and accurate information
Assist UCE leadership with financial modeling to evaluate business proposals and impact analysis
Support territory review and analysis. Review current size, coverage, and revenue potential from key markets. Provide recommendations and adjustments based on analysis.
Initiate, implement and administer customized support projects and programs to enable field productivity and revenue delivery
Keep a pulse on large opportunities and market trends
Assist with general sales support relating to phase-in and phase-out of new product, order fulfillment for special circumstances and more.

System and process optimization responsibilities include:
Review, optimize and maintain short and long-term forecasting processes to improve forecasting accuracy.
Champion new system that enable easier working conditions
Process mapping
Collaborate with Business Process Owners (BPOs) and subject matter experts (SMEs) to identify, model, and drive business process changes that improve workflows, leverage existing and new systems capabilities, and enable the automation of manual tasks.
Identify, design, document, test and drive business process changes with a focus on achieving positive outcomes for SMART

Other responsibilities:
Assist and lead projects as required
Other duties as required

Education & Work Experience
5 years of Sales Operations, Revenue Operations and/or Business Analytics experience
BA/BS in Business, Marketing, or a related field
Experience with a CRM Platform (Saleforce.com), BI Platform (PowerBI) and planning tools will be a significant advantage
Strong analytical skills (including mastery of Microsoft Excel) and experience with reporting and data analysis. Demonstrated data analytics ability to critically look at performance data and draw constructive conclusions from the results
Self-starter with high attention to detail who excels at multitasking and thrives in a fast-paced environment
Sound decision-making abilities and proven follow-through skills to ensure issues are fully resolved
Technically capable, excellent communicator, and a desire to improve processes
Effective leadership skills, with a strong focus on operations and business processes
Excellent time management skills with the ability to prioritize and shift workload to meet deadlines

Supervision:
This role does not have any direct reports

Additional Details
This role can be a hybrid or remote role. The candidate must work in a time zone that overlaps with the majority of the work day in Calgary, AB.

Title: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Experience with SQL and relational databases, as well as a solid understanding of data models and entity relationships.
Descriptions:
Job Description
We are looking to add a Technical Business Analyst to our corporate team!
The successful candidate will work as both a team member and independently in an agile environment to create documentation that will help to support and direct our technical teams.
This is a hybrid role. The selected candidate will work from the Toronto office 1-2 days a week.
What You’ll Do
Collaborate with c – level stakeholders to align our SaaS product roadmap with our strategic goals
Work with the Product Owner to define epics and user stories
Translate business strategy, vision, and customer insights into clear product requirements
Apply subject matter expertise to support team members
Work closely with the process team to ensure technical specifications align with organizational goals and objectives
Create documentation around process requirements
Contribute to the continual improvement of the software delivery process and team culture
What You’ll Bring
5+ years of experience as a Technical Business Analyst or Business Systems Analyst
Experience in the Information Technology space
Strong background and knowledge in application development and systems
Exceptional problem solving and analytical skills
Excellent verbal and written communications skills
Comfortable working with business and technical stakeholders
Ability to speak to technical and business stakeholders alike, as well as the ability to liaison between groups
Strong strategic skills, with an ability to effectively turn reporting and analysis into actionable insights and execution plans
Ability to breakdown and prioritize complex requirements into clear specifications
Self – directed, proactive, and able to define and execute projects
Nice To Have’s
Knowledge of and a keen eye for the design and development of web – based SaaS applications
A Bachelor's Degree or higher in Computer Science or Computer Engineering or a related field of study
Experience working with executive stakeholders
Experience with SQL and relational databases, as well as a solid understanding of data models and entity relationships
Experience working in an agile environment; CSM or CSPO certification is an asset
What’s In It for You
Work – life – balance: we empower our employees to build a responsible work – lifestyle that reflects the needs of their unique life situations and still enables them to achieve maximum productivity
Agile environment: we work in a highly agile environment, where you will be working in scrum teams to deliver complex product offerings
Growth: you will have the ability to learn and evolve at the speed of technology. Our leadership team is focused on performance, growth, engagement, and connection and provides the resources needed to bring you to the next level
Continuous education/ learning: we assist in the costs of continued education programs, courses, and certifications
Competitive compensation: we ensure that we are in tune with changing market rates. We offer yearly performance reviews, provide pay increases based on performance, and offer generous vacation packages
Comprehensive benefit plan: this includes health, dental, life, and a lifestyle benefits package
Fundraising activity: we have strong connections within our local communities and support many initiatives through employee – led events and fundraising activity
A Bit About Us
Procom Labs is building a world – class digital ecosystem of products to find, employ and manage the contingent workforce of today and tomorrow. Our products offer end–to–end solutions in Recruiting Technologies, Workforce Management, and Back – Office Processing. We are a group of people that love to try out creative and sometimes crazy solutions to solve complex problems. We want you to join us on our journey. You can find out more about our mission and products at https://procomlabs.procomservices.com/

Qualifications
Experience as a Technical Business Analyst or Business Systems Analyst: 5 years (Required)

Title: Service Performance and Development Analyst (temporary, up to 8 months)
Description: Considerable experience related to the duties listed above, normally acquired through a degree or diploma in business administration, statistics, engineering or…
Descriptions:
About Our Organization:
When you join the City of Guelph, you join a team of 2000 full and part-time employees who deliver services the community relies on every day. Together, we are bringing to life Guelph’s vision of an inclusive, connected, and prosperous city where we look after each other and our environment.

As a regional top employer, the City of Guelph values its employees and offers competitive salaries, excellent benefit packages, opportunities for professional development, a healthy work-life balance, and many roles with flexible work options. Our corporate values are integrity, service, inclusion, wellness, and learning. Guelph is consistently ranked as one of the best places in Canada to live, work, and play—all good reasons to consider a career in this beautiful city.
Job Summary:
Resumes are being accepted for the temporary position of Service Performance and Development Analyst in the Operations, Administration Division. Reporting to the Program Manager, Administration, Operations this position will provide high quality client servicing to support business services and optimize through process improvement. Guided by the goals and objectives of the City’s Strategic Plan and committed to the Corporate Values of integrity, service, inclusion, wellness and learning, the candidate will aid in the achievement of the Vision for an inclusive, connected and prosperous city.
Your Role
Responsible for identifying, leading, developing business improvement process through the application of sound business improvement methodology, innovative and critical thinking, problem solving and analytical skills.
Analyzes data, performance measures, goals and objectives and facilitates with organizational leaders reviewing existing business practices and processes for accuracy, effectiveness and/or efficiency.
Provides software application support, maximizes capabilities with existing and future software; develops and executes reports, review reports for accuracy and resolve errors.
Participate in strategic planning for the department as a member of Operations Administration team.
Provide recommendations to ensure tangible and sustainable benefits are realized and reported. Leads and assesses levels of performance and promotes the development of ideas in order to increase organizational efficiency and effectiveness.
Builds and foster strong working relationships and collaborations with internal and external partners and stakeholders, to meet business goals and objectives.
Participate in governmental or industry advisory committees as a representative of the City of Guelph.
Perform other related duties as assigned.

Qualifications
Considerable experience related to the duties listed above, normally acquired through a degree or diploma in business administration, statistics, engineering or a related discipline and considerable experience in business improvement. Candidates with an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered.
A valid Class G drivers licence with a good driving record. Successful candidates will be required to provide a current driver’s abstract prior to their start date to confirm their licence is held in good standing and that it has not been suspended or revoked under the Highway Traffic Act (HTA) or Criminal Code of Canada in the last 5 years. The City of Guelph will take into consideration the number of demerit points and/or nature of the infractions to determine if it meets our requirements.
Proven track record in driving change and delivering tangible benefits with sustainable results within complex organizations in various progressive industries/ environments, preferable in the public sector and unionized environment.
Knowledge of program and change management, lean six-sigma, data analysis, system optimization and procurement.
Experience managing diverse stakeholder needs and interests, building and maintaining effective relationships at all levels within an organization.
Ability to work well under pressure and effectively handle stressful situations.
Must be able to manage several activities on multiple projects, organize self and others to meet aggressive timelines.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate with all levels of staff, clients, stakeholders and the general public.
Advanced skills in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook).

In keeping with our corporate value of Wellness, The City of Guelph recognizes the many benefits of hybrid work arrangements including flexibility and better work-life balance for our employees. Where the work permits, employees will have the ability to participate in our Hybrid Work and our Flexible Time programs. Please note, this position is eligible for Hybrid and Flexible work arrangements (subject to change).

Rate
$38.99-$48.73

How to Apply
Qualified applicants are invited to apply using our online application system by Sunday, April 16, 2023. Please note all applicants must complete the online questionnaire specific to this position at the time they submit their resume and cover letter in order to be considered. Proof of qualifications will be requested at the interview stage.

The City of Guelph is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity in the workplace. Title: Specialty Access Program Analyst
Description:
Strong understanding of data analytics methodologies and tools used to present data in an informative way;
Additional programs that also support patient care…
Descriptions:
Who is eHealth Saskatchewan?
eHealth Saskatchewan is a Treasury Board Crown Corporation with a unique blend of healthcare, information technology, and citizen services. Our vision is “Connected healthcare, accessible to everyone, everywhere” with a mission to “Collaborate to transform healthcare through the use of information and innovative technology”. It is a complex environment, constantly evolving and quickly changing as we live our values of excellence, integrity, teamwork, courage, resilience and collaboration.
A large and complex organization, eHealth is comprised of 30+ clinical and non-clinical program (service) areas that all work together to support health care providers and teams across the province in delivering the best possible care to patients, providers, citizens, and health system users. Programs range from primary care to acute care, and includes laboratories, pharmaceuticals and diagnostics. Additional programs that also support patient care and information, include Virtual Care, the MySaskHealthRecord, and the Provincial Electronic Health Record. eHealth is also responsible for the administration of various pieces of legislation to manage the registration of/changes to all vital event records (e.g. birth, marriage, death, etc.), registration of legal name changes, registration of adoptions, and for maintaining the provincial health registry for health services eligibility and distribution of health services cards.
We are seeking an individual who is results and detail oriented with exception people, customer service, and communication skills to join our Provider Service team.
About the Role
Reporting to the Manager, Provider Services the Specialty Access Program Analyst provides the bridge between the eHS teams, external users of the provider services portfolio, and the technology solution. They will bring a broad base of working knowledge of Electronic Medical Records (i.e. Med Access/Accuro) and experience working in community clinics of both general and specialist providers. The Specialty Access Program Analyst will bring a level of community experience that will act as a subject matter expert (SME) and inform the business of areas where eHS technical solutions could be developed or redefined to ensure the business is responsive with the appropriate solution be it technological or process related.
You will possess exceptional interpersonal skills that will continue to build trust with end users such as referring and specialist providers and medical office staff. Our candidate will understand patient referral pathways at the clinic level which will support the development of the central intake workflows and enhance the Provider Service. You will have strong data analysis techniques in order to inform our training requirements to all users (both internal and external).
The Specialty Access Program Analyst will liaise with eHS internal staff, management, external healthcare providers and staff to acquire an understanding of all issues, troubleshoot and/or educate on appropriate processes and procedures to address all issues. When necessary work with the Manager, Provider Services and IT analysts to develop, test, and implement technical/process changes. Provide guidance to the development team on the specific business requirements requested in the solution and will be able to grasp the implications of technical details very rapidly and understand their inter -relationships and the impact on the environment into which the solution will be deployed . The Specialty Access Program Analyst will also be able to discuss those impacts with the project stakeholders to quickly resolve any conflicts between the proposed solution and the enterprise architecture.
The Specialty Access Program Analyst will conduct data extraction, analyze and populate existing monthly, quarterly and annual statistical reports that are supplied to the specialty department leads/heads, the Ministry of Health, and eHS senior leadership. Working with the IT App Support build SQL queries on an adhoc basis or to enhance existing reporting packages. The reports are utilized as part of the decision-making processes at all levels of management internal to eHS, Specialty dept. and/or Saskatchewan Health Authority on further growth opportunities of the programs.
Our ideal candidate will have knowledge of both healthcare and IT environments as well as thorough knowledge referral pathways through community clinics. Formal knowledge is typically obtained through completion of a minimum of a two-year diploma in office or business administration, undergraduate degree in healthcare field, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Some travel may be required.
You will have knowledge of:
Strong strategic information analysis and project management and planning techniques;
Strong understanding of data analytics methodologies and tools used to present data in an informative way;
Business process improvement methodologies, tools, and processes coupled with an understanding of organizational change management methodologies;
Strong group facilitation skills;
Requirements gathering and documentation process
Knowledge of the health system, clinical care, and clinical referral processes, and;
Have a minimum of 3-5 years of working in a community physician clinic.
You will have the ability to:
orally explain or present (technical) information to a wide variety of technical and non-technical individuals and/or groups in a clear, accurate and understandable manner.
demonstrate and promote the use and value of new technology, programs and services in a manner that creates understanding, captures interest and enhances users’ computer skills.
actively listen, paraphrase and ask precise questions in order to clarify and understand information being received.
facilitate group sessions on process to successfully implement technological change and business transition within the organization.
identify and respond to issues and concerns of others who may be angry or frustrated to reach a mutual understanding.
build cooperative working relationships with coworkers and clients to ensure credibility and confidence in services provided.
work independently and participate as a team member to meet the needs of clients and co-workers and to build productive, positive work relationships.
identify, explore and evaluate options on data processes and methodologies, information technology and potential systems design to make feasible recommendations
You will be:
Highly skilled and confident to make timely and accurate decisions;
Independently organized to prioritize and complete multiple tasks while dealing with frequent interruptions and tight deadlines;
A team player with good interpersonal skills to support the work of the team and/or organization;
Proactive in order to anticipate and identify issues (solution based);
Flexible and adaptable in order to meet new challenges;
Tactful, discreet and exercise good judgment when dealing with confidential and sensitive information and situations; and,
Thorough and attentive to detail to ensure quality work.
Valid driver’s license, where required by the job
If this role sounds like the opportunity you’ve been looking for to challenge yourself, showcase your abilities and support eHS vision – we would love to hear from you.
Level: 08SID – SGEU
Anticipated start date: As soon as possible
We are committed to workplace diversity.

Title: Service Mgmt Analyst - Data
Description:
Experience with data analytics and/or dashboarding technology would be considered an asset.
Thorough and detail-oriented professional with passion of ITSM,…
Descriptions:
Job Title: ITSM Process Coordinator (IT Asset Management)
Company, Department: Nova Scotia Power – IT
Location: Halifax, NS – Hybrid
Type of Employment: Regular, Full Time

Closing Date: April 9, 2023
Reference Number: 11124

The Opportunity:
We are currently looking to fill the position of ITSM Process Coordinator (IT Asset Management) in a Permanent position. We’re hiring solution-minded people excited to help us grow into the future.

Reporting to the Manager, IT Service Delivery, the ITSM Process Coordinator understands and has proven experience with ITIL service asset and configuration management processes in an operational environment and will take the stewardship of NSPI’s centralized IT/OT hardware and software asset repository, CMDB and the enabling technology.

This role is a key player contributing to the health and maturity of CMDB and IT/OT asset management. This role also contributes to NSPI's cyber security program success, improves the alignment of IT service asset and configuration management practice within ITIL best practice framework.

Key Responsibilities:
Practice ownership of Hardware Asset Management (HAM) and Software Asset Management (SAM) practices. Ensures these processes deliver business values, documented, clearly communicated, understood across the enterprise, and continue growing Asset Management maturity across IT/OT domains.
Contributes to and enables a long-term roadmap of technology capabilities and process improvements related to the HAM and SAM practice.
Performs day to day ServiceNow platform administration work specifically related to HAM/SAM and CMDB, IT contract management modules.
Primarily responsible for overseeing and driving the integrity and completeness of asset and CMDB data;
Being the ITSM practice steward and advocate, works with all the groups within IT operations and across the enterprise where technology assets are captured and managed on ServiceNow platform; performs day-to-day asset and CMDB data administration.
Works with NSPI IT MSP service providers to ensure Asset and Configuration Management processes and policies are being followed.
Delivers regular management report and continually manages the asset management health dashboard and analytics reporting of measurements and KPI results.
Closely works with other ITSM practice owners, IT operations leaders on continual improvement of CMDB and asset management related standard, process, procedures and enabling technology.

Skills, Capabilities and Experience:
Thorough and detail-oriented professional with passion of ITSM, asset management and data.
5+ years experience in an ITIL environment or Service Management discipline with direct exposure and understanding of asset management, end-user computing, business applications, could, mobile & telecom and infrastructure support services;
Experience with CMDB/Discovery technology and hands-on experience in using and maintaining CMDB health (CI data and CI relationship completeness and integrity validation) would be considered an asset.
Ability to collect, evaluate and consolidate data and information from multiple sources, resolve conflicts and streamline solutions and tactics.
Proficient in using Microsoft Office 365 such as Teams, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, SharePoint, and collaboration tools to perform data analysis, create reports and document processes/workflows.
Experience with data analytics and/or dashboarding technology would be considered an asset.
Experience in using ITSM solutions and/or ServiceNow platform would be considered an asset.
Effective written and oral communication skills.

We offer remote work opportunities, to be discussed with your leader, however you are required to live in or be willing to relocate Nova Scotia for this role.

At Nova Scotia Power, everyone is a leader in their own right. Our Leadership Competencies set standards that advance our business strategy, deliver results for customers, and provide career development for employees. The successful individual in this role will take ownership and acts with integrity, cultivates innovation and embraces change and builds strong and collaborative relationships.

Why join our team?

Flexibility: Hybrid work model with flexible remote workdays.
Health & Wellbeing: A comprehensive benefits plan, access to a free on-site fitness centre Employee and Family Assistance Program, parental leave top-up plan and wellness benefits.
Grow Your Career: Opportunities to advance within and between our affiliate companies, a focus on employee development and available sponsored education programs.
Community Engagement & Care: Corporate investments in the places where our people live and work, mentoring opportunities, fundraising-matching & volunteer programs, and scholarships for children of employees.
Competitive Compensation: A comprehensive benefits plan, short-term incentive plans and employer matching RRSP contributions.

At Nova Scotia Power, we are committed to providing safe, reliable electricity so that our customers and communities can thrive. We work across the province, from Yarmouth to Wreck Cove, to prevent power outages and to strengthen our electrical system—for today, and for the future.

As a subsidiary of Emera Inc, we provide 95% of the generation, transmission, and distribution of electrical power to approximately 540,000 residential, commercial, and industrial customers. Our company is focused on new technologies to enhance customer service and reliability, reduce emissions, and add renewable energy.

We are proud to live and work in Nova Scotia. It is why we work to understand how we can give back meaningfully, support local organizations and work collaboratively to enhance the communities we call home.

We believe that every unique perspective should be valued and that everyone should have a sense of safety and belonging—at work, and in our communities. Leveraging the thoughts of a diverse workforce helps us to be innovative and provide the best service to our customers.

If working in an environment focused on innovation, safety and putting customers and community first inspires you, we want to hear from you. Apply by April 9, 2023, and tell us what excites you about this role.

Finally, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We are dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team, so if your experience is close to what we have listed above, please consider applying. If you do not see yourself in this role but want to join our team, please set up a Job Alert to learn about future opportunities!

Title: Business Development Analyst
Description:
Compiling and managing virtual data rooms for both acquisition and divestiture processes.
Support or lead research work supporting new business development…
Descriptions:
Strathcona Resources Ltd. (“Strathcona”) is a Calgary, Alberta based oil and gas production and development company focused on maximizing oil and gas recovery from its low decline, high free cash flow oil and gas resource base. Strathcona's operations, infrastructure and land position are focused in Alberta, British Columbia, and Saskatchewan.

Strathcona is always looking for people focused on growth, both personal and professional. Those who love a challenge and get excited at the prospect of collaborating with talented people to continuously improve and innovate on tasks both large and small.

We are actively seeking a Business Development Analyst to join the Business Development, Sustainability & ESG team at our Calgary office. Reporting to the Manager, BD, Sustainability & ESG, the successful candidate will be a key contributor to the department. The candidates’ purpose is to facilitate and influence strategic decision making on opportunities such as asset acquisitions and CCUS. This role will both provide support for senior professionals on the team as well as take the lead on initiatives. The department offers a fast paced, dynamic environment with significant opportunities to build broad skills and experience.

Essential Functions:

Support the team in building and maintaining financial models.
Preparing high quality presentation materials, the majority of which are aimed at the executive and board level.
Compiling and managing virtual data rooms for both acquisition and divestiture processes.
Support or lead research work supporting new business development opportunities fitting within company strategy.
Maintain a database of competitor information, historical A&D and commercial transactions.
Following industry trends and news to assess impacts to the business and identify opportunities and risks.
Lead efforts to automate or increase efficiency in business reporting and processes.

Qualifications Include:

Proficient knowledge of the North American energy sector.
Self-starter thriving on solving problems and continuous improvement.
Humility, curiosity, creativity, and positive attitude key personality traits.
General understanding of upstream oil and gas industry.
Proficient in MS Office with advanced Excel skills; understanding of programming and data visualization software such as Tableau is considered an asset.
Strong attention to detail and ability to collaborate demonstrated in past work.
Excellent communication (oral and written), interpersonal and organization skills.
Previous experience or formal training in performing financial analysis and economics.
Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks under pressure and deliver quality work in a timely manner.

Education and Experience:

Bachelor’s degree in Commerce, Finance and/or Engineering, or another relevant discipline.
2-5 years minimum experience, in a similar role.

Work Environment:

This position is based at our Calgary office.

Great things aren’t done by one person, they’re done by a team.
Strathcona is committed to developing a high-performance culture through collaboration, trust, and agility. We value our work, our communities, and our commitments – but most of all, we value the team of people who make what we do possible.

Apply to Strathcona.
If you have what it takes to be a great Strathcona team member, we want to hear from you. We appreciate all interest in this opportunity but only those selected to advance through the process will be contacted.

Descriptions:
Job Summary

Zurich Canada is currently looking for a Business Systems Analyst II with 3+ years of experience working on Guidewire suite of products (PolicyCenter or ClaimCenter).

Imagine working for a company that truly cares about their employees, customers, stakeholders, and communities they serve.

Title: Data Analyst - Molecular Design & Engineering
Description:
Experience working with data provenance, and creating data architectures and databases.
Supporting the development of software tools to collate, organize and…
Descriptions:
AbCellera is a young, energetic, and rapidly growing tech company with an amazing team that searches, decodes, and analyzes natural immune systems to find antibodies that its partners can develop into drugs to prevent and treat disease. We are seeking a highly motivated Data Analyst to help integrate data and design software and data processes in the areas of antibody discovery and engineering. The successful candidate will interact with a diverse team, liaising between software engineers, wet-lab scientists, bioinformaticians and protein engineers, in a fast-paced environment. Our ideal candidate is able to multitask, problem-solve, think critically and demonstrate scientific rigor, and above all, someone who can learn and grow with us.
This is an exciting opportunity to join one of Canada’s most innovative biotech companies and to contribute to our cutting-edge research, driving the discovery of novel monoclonal antibodies for therapeutic use.
How you might spend your days:
Working with bioinformaticians and protein engineers to help develop and implement strategies for data analysis, curation, storage, presentation and interpretation to answer increasingly complex questions with ease
Collaborating with software engineers and data scientists across the organization to standardize processes, including integration into our data warehouse, laboratory information management systems (LIMS), and electronic notebooks (ELN)
Supporting the development of software tools to collate, organize and process data for integration with data analysis and visualization platforms
Contributing to the implementation and maintenance of analysis pipelines (typically in Python), ensuring data integrity, correctness and clarity
Organizing, supporting and collaborating with other team members to meet project deliverables and timelines
Analyzing and presenting data and analysis methods to colleagues
We'd love to hear from you if:
You are passionate about data science and want to work in an interdisciplinary environment
You are excited about the opportunity to integrate large-scale data with in silico tools to solve real-world drug discovery problems
You thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy bringing out the best in your teammates
You enjoy working in a fast-paced work environment and coordinating with your team to juggle multiple competing priorities
You take pride in being self-motivated, a fast learner, a team player and a creative problem solver
You can effectively communicate scientific data across disciplines and levels of experience
Required qualifications and experience:
MSc in Bioinformatics, Computational Biology, Computer Science, or a related field, or BSc in a relevant field with 3+ years of related experience
Proficiency in at least one programming language (Python preferred); demonstrated experience designing, testing, and debugging code in a collaborative development environment would be preferred
Experience working with data provenance, and creating data architectures and databases
Demonstrated ability to create flexible, reproducible data analysis pipelines intended for use by others
Excellent documentation skills with impeccable attention to detail
A background in relevant areas of life sciences is a bonus, including Structural Biology, Biochemistry, Molecular Biology, or Immunology
Offers & benefits:
The opportunity to work with an inspired team on challenging problems that matter
An attractive compensation package, including health and lifestyle benefits
A minimum of 3 weeks’ vacation
Opportunities for personal and professional development
About AbCellera:
At AbCellera, we’re solving tough problems and creating innovative solutions from the ground up - custom immunizations, microfluidics, high-throughput imaging, genomics, computation, machine learning and laboratory automation. We’re revolutionizing how our scientists can explore antibodies and the scale at which they can do so. This is life-changing research and you could be a part of it.
You’ll join a diverse and multi-disciplinary team of biologists, biochemists, engineers, bioinformaticians, computer scientists and physicists - all working together to bring better therapies to patients. We’re a growing company with a high-throughput pipeline and the drive to be the best in the industry. This isn’t just about having the best technology. We know we need a world-class team of visionaries and innovators. We look for people with drive and energy. Idealists. People we love and people we trust. This may be unconventional, but it is the key to our success. We’re looking for someone like you to help us get there.
To apply:
Please submit your application through our website and refer to Job ID 23056 in your cover letter. We apologize in advance, but we receive a large volume of applications and are only able to contact those who are selected for an interview.

Title: Business Intelligence Systems Business Analyst
Description:
May also be required to design logical and physical models for the data warehouse and data marts.
Uses RAD, JAD and user interviews determine business…
Descriptions:
Full-Time, Fixed-Term Employee Contract Until March 31, 2025
The Alliance for Healthier Communities is the voice of a vibrant network of community-governed primary health care organizations. Alliance members serve diverse communities across the province of Ontario, and they are rooted in the communities they serve. They share a commitment to advancing health equity through the delivery of comprehensive primary health care.
Our Vision: Equitable health and wellbeing for everyone living in Ontario.
Our Mission: Advance comprehensive primary health care and advocate for changes in Ontario’s health and social systems to address inequities.
POSITION
The Business Intelligence (BI) Systems Business Analyst provides analysis, assessment and business requirement documentation support to the Business Intelligence Reporting Tool (BIRT) project at the Alliance for Healthier Communities (Alliance) and towards the implementation of the Information Management Strategy (IMS) across the Province. More specifically, this role will support the documentation related to the Business Intelligence and support for operation of the Pan-Sector Electronic Medical Record (EMR) System.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Business Analysis
Conducts analysis of business processes and documents findings to support the IMS strategy and its various work streams.
Works with business and technical specifications to understand and address system structures and the downstream reporting needs.
Conducts and verifies the Source to Target Data Mapping (STDM) and conduct source system data analysis.
Documents all variances between various technical documents such as the STDM.
Develops prototypes to facilitate the gathering of end user reporting requirements.
Uses RAD, JAD and user interviews determine business requirements for data, reports, analyses, meta data, training, service levels, data quality and performance.
Develops the Business Requirements Document (BRD) and Report Specifications Document.
Prepares application storyboarding and the Functional Requirements Specifications (FRS).
Conducts systems analysis and author the System Requirements Specifications (SRS).
Works with architects to translate requirements into technical specs. May also be required to design logical and physical models for the data warehouse and data marts.
Develops the data mapping document and support the ETL team in developing the code to meet the business requirements.
Helps maintain and expand data standards for BI tools throughout the organization.
Coordinates the development and use of business metadata.
Analyzes current and future BI reporting functions and needs and plan for potential shortfalls, needs and enhancements.
Plans, facilitates and conducts user training and support.
Provides training and knowledge transfer of the project to the technical support team.
Plans, documents and executes SIT and UAT testing.
Defines and evaluates different BI solutions to support strategic business initiatives.
Participates in the development of new systems and modifies existing systems.
Develops detailed implementation plans for project roll-outs and manage the implementation process.
Facilitates process improvements across the business and within your team.
Works through and with vendors to resolve issues with BI reporting.
Project Liaison
Acts as a liaison between the business and the Business Intelligence technical team.
Participates on committees and working groups to define business needs, responds to inquiries and facilitates the identification and resolution of issues, identifies areas where IT can help.
Provides business expertise in support of strategic and business planning activities.
QUALIFICATIONS
An undergraduate degree with a minimum of 5 years’ experience as a Business Systems Analyst within an IT/ IM environment, preferably in healthcare.
4 to 5 years’ experience in business intelligence application development.
2 to 3 years’ experience with business intelligence tools.
Proficient with Windows and Microsoft Office for word processing, reports and presentations preparations.
Commitment to the principles of Health Equity, as outlined in the Alliance’s Health Equity Charter.
Ability to conduct work in keeping with the Alliance’s commitment to anti-oppression, anti-racism (including anti-Black and anti-Indigenous racism), French language services, and to being 2SLGBTQ+ positive.
WORK LOCATION
This position will have the flexibility of working from home and when on-site, it will be at the Alliance office in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.
COMPENSATION
Annual Salary: $76,931
The Alliance offers an exceptional benefits package, including pension with HOOPP, extended health and dental benefits, and a generous vacation package. Salary is set within Alliance’s established salary grid and policy guidelines.
APPLICATION DEADLINE March 31, 2023 at 10:00am EST
SUBMISSION INSTRUCTIONS
E-mail your cover letter and resume as one (1) document.
The Alliance for Healthier Communities is an equity employer and encourages applications from Indigenous peoples and individuals from racialized groups, francophone communities and people of all sexual orientations and genders and persons with disabilities. Fluency in both French and English is an asset.
Upon request, reasonable accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process.
We thank all applicants in advance however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

Monday to Friday

business intelligence application development: 4 years (required)
business intelligence tools: 2 years (required)
healthcare: 1 year (preferred)

Title: Inventory Control Analyst
Description: Coordinate cross-functional research activities to reconcile significant variances and refine the forecast model to reflect updated sales and marketing…
Descriptions:
About the job
Its an exciting time to be part of the Give & Go team as we are growing rapidly and want you to become a part of our growth and extraordinarily bright future!
Job Overview:
The Materials Planner will be responsible for the generation of a production plan to maintain the necessary inventory needs. The role will also be responsible to ensure that materials are ordered and delivered on time and that all manual and computerized records are kept up to date
Key Responsibilities:
Review both raw material (bulk & packaging) requirements, determine requirements, schedule production as per supply and communicate requirements to appropriate personnel
Review client orders and prepare production Plan (schedule) to ensure all orders are filled to meet the clients’ requirements
Collaborate with all operational departments including QA, Sales, Customer Service personnel as required to fulfill clients’ orders/requirements.
Coordinate cross-functional research activities to reconcile significant variances and refine the forecast model to reflect updated sales and marketing assumptions
Provide input to the department in the developing of inventory strategies on existing items, new products, and product phase-outs
Report scheduling, managing orders for deployment and manipulate spreadsheets
Prepare daily, weekly, monthly efficiency, yield, and productivity reports
Run the Planning Worksheet on an ERP to run the planning process
Data Entry into system for delivery of products
Review historical sales trends, research demand drivers, prepare forecast data, develop statistical forecast models, and evaluate forecast results
Ensure that there is ample supply to ship, organize materials, and make sure schedules are created and kept
Needs to be aware of orders on hold and when they are released
Manage order and delivery dates

Completion of bachelor’s degree in Business or Supply Chain Management
Minimum 3 years of experience in a manufacturing environment as a Production Scheduler
Experience implementing and utilizing ERP software
Extensive knowledge of MPS/MRP, Demand Flow, JIT, Forecasting, Inventory Planning and Supply Chain Design
Able to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing, lead business discussions and train others
Able to build and maintain lasting relationships with other departments
Proficiency with MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint)
Experience implementing and utilizing ERP software
Able to find new methods and principles and ability to incorporate them into existing practices as needed.
Highly focused and proactive

It’s an exciting time to be part of the Give & Go team as we are growing rapidly and want you to become a part our growth and extraordinarily bright future.
As we grow, we are committed to preserve the parts of our diversity & culture that is unique, people focused and are core to our success at every size. Our values of Quality, Direct Communication and Respect mean something.
Learning and growth; we are working to create an environment where sharing new ideas, experimenting and learning from each other is strongly encouraged.
Competitive benefits, along with work, life balance!
Great people, baking great products, for a great future.
Give & Go Prepared Foods Corp. is a proud member of the Mondelēz family and has been a leading and growing North American manufacturer of baked goods for over 30 years.
If you're looking for a company that will provide you with opportunities for career growth and development, while working with an energetic and team with deeply ingrained values of respect, direct and open communication, quality, and accountability, we’d love to have you join our team.
Our Consumer Brands: two-bite® brand, including two bite-brownies®, Kimberley's Bakeshoppe™, Mason St. Bakehouse™, and The Worthy Crumb Pastry Co™

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Knowledge of data warehouse/business intelligence concepts, architectural components is considered an asset.

Descriptions:
REALTOR.ca is the most popular real estate listing and information platform in Canada. It builds business for REALTOR® members and establishes consumer trust and loyalty by supporting Canadians through their home-buying and selling journeys. It operates under the guiding principles of delivering value to consumers and members and continually evolving to meet and exceed market expectations. REALTOR.ca is more than a listing service – it’s the nexus of the Canadian property buying and selling journey.
Summary
The Senior Business Systems Analyst supports the creation, enhancement, and maintenance of CREA’s IT Services by documenting requirements, contributing to system design, and assuming a leadership role throughout the Systems Development Life Cycle of REALTOR.ca and related products and services.
Function
This position is a rare opportunity to join the REALTOR.ca Analyst team. We are looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst who is personable, results-driven, and has proven leadership experience working across complex, multi-team projects. The Senior Business Systems Analyst has a strong background in Business Systems Analysis and Solutions Architecture and proven ability to perform in an Agile environment.
Core Competencies:
Leadership Skills
Business Analysis
Systems Analysis
Solutions Architecture
Data Analysis
Creative Problem Solver
Critical Thinker
Business and Technical Writing
Presentation Skills
Customer Service
Position Accountabilities
Lead a high-performing team of analysts
Lead the development and enhancement of REALTOR.ca and supporting technology solutions on behalf of REALTORS®, consumers and Real Estate Associations:
Organize and facilitate requirements gathering sessions with project stakeholders, team members and end-users.
Document requirements that meet the needs of the Business and Technology
