Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Workflow process and data models.
Works closely with and assists Project Managers in writing project statements, consulting with sponsors and stakeholders,…
Descriptions:
Job Title: Intermediate Business Analyst
Company, Department: Nova Scotia Power, Information Technology
Location: Halifax, NS - Hybrid
Type of Employment: Regular, Full Time
Closing Date: April 9, 2023
Reference Number: 11115
The Opportunity:
We are looking for Intermediate Business Analyst to join Nova Scotia Power's IT Team in a Permanent position. You will have extensive knowledge and experience in analysis, project execution and business process management. This role will be key to map current business processes to new systems or services and lead the evaluation engagements with IT’s customers for analysis of options, cost benefit analysis and recommendations.
This role will have a deep understanding of business analysis organization and an understanding of project management, system development lifecycle and business analysis methodology.
Key Responsibilities:
Assesses business requirements and opportunities, formulates options and defines the recommended solution by consulting with business owners and clients, IT support teams, researching industry best practices, evaluating current assets and architecture, and creating and proposing transformation opportunities. Solutions may be business, process, technology and/or service oriented.
Conducts and documents analysis for diverse, short and long-term projects related to departmental business and strategic goals.
Leads the preparation and documentation of:
System requirements
Business cases/opportunity assessments.
Business process definitions
Workflow process and data models
Implementation plans
Supports testing activities of proposed solutions (technical and business process)
Assists with business transformation activities resulting from projects or business improvement activities.
Plans, facilitates, and leads workshops with internal and external participants.
Plans, develops, and conducts interviews with management and staff of client departments.
Works closely with and assists Project Managers in writing project statements, consulting with sponsors and stakeholders, defining roles and responsibilities of project team members, obtaining signoffs, assisting with the creation of communication plans and change management plans, organizing meetings, scheduling resources, managing expectations of system owners, presenting results to sponsors and stakeholders, and evaluating the projects with respect to best practices and lessons learned.
Mentors other team members in the business analysis discipline. Negotiates for business and technical resources. Participates in stakeholder and team meetings. Delegates and coordinates work with other teams. Establishes / Manages competing priorities. Identifies opportunities for cross-departmental or corporate initiatives. Contributes to corporate Information Technology initiatives and the development of corporate standards. Monitors tasks and quality of work
You will be responsible for personal safety and that of co-workers by observing and ensuring compliance with all Occupational Health and Safety Rules and Regulations. You will be accountable for environmental performance as it relates to the environmental management system processes and initiatives.
You recognize yourself in most of the following competencies, and where possible possess the skills and experience listed below:
B.Sc. in Computer Science or similar Information Technology degree
3+ years' experience or acceptable equivalent.
A professional Business Analyst Certification is preferred.
Sufficient experience to demonstrate the ability to support business units.
Knowledge of project management methods to actively participate in and support Senior Project Managers in cross-functional projects.
Ability to problem solve, make decisions and/or recommendations.
Analytical skills to convert business requirements into business cases/opportunity assessments.
Ability to collect, evaluate and compress data and information from multiple sources, resolve conflicts and differentiate between actual and required user needs.
Knowledge of Office software such as Word, Excel, PowerPoint, email and collaboration software to write business cases and/or Opportunity Assessment, create reports and spreadsheets.
Ability to communicate technical concepts to clients including negotiation and convincing.
Knowledge and experience with Organizational change management.
Ability to proactively keep abreast of new emerging technologies and to interview, facilitate working groups and develop strong relationships.
Experience in user training and implementation of the IT solutions.
Requires excellent interpersonal skills, consensus building skills, team building skills and the ability to follow through and complete projects.
We offer remote work opportunities, to be discussed with your leader, however you are required to live in or be willing to relocate Nova Scotia for this role.
At Nova Scotia Power, everyone is a leader in their own right. Our Leadership Competencies set standards that advance our business strategy, deliver results for customers, and provide career development for employees. The successful individual in this role will take ownership and acts with integrity, drives operational success for customers and builds strong and collaborative relationships.
Why join our team?
Flexibility: Hybrid work model with flexible remote workdays.
Health & Wellbeing: A comprehensive benefits plan, access to a free on-site fitness centre Employee and Family Assistance Program, parental leave top-up plan and wellness benefits.
Grow Your Career: Opportunities to advance within and between our affiliate companies, a focus on employee development and available sponsored education programs.
Community Engagement & Care: Corporate investments in the places where our people live and work, mentoring opportunities, fundraising-matching & volunteer programs, and scholarships for children of employees.
Competitive Compensation: A comprehensive benefits plan, short-term incentive plans and employer matching RRSP contributions.
At Nova Scotia Power, we are committed to providing safe, reliable electricity so that our customers and communities can thrive. We work across the province, from Yarmouth to Wreck Cove, to prevent power outages and to strengthen our electrical system—for today, and for the future.
As a subsidiary of Emera Inc, we provide 95% of the generation, transmission, and distribution of electrical power to approximately 540,000 residential, commercial, and industrial customers. Our company is focused on new technologies to enhance customer service and reliability, reduce emissions, and add renewable energy.
We are proud to live and work in Nova Scotia. It is why we work to understand how we can give back meaningfully, support local organizations and work collaboratively to enhance the communities we call home.
We believe that every unique perspective should be valued and that everyone should have a sense of safety and belonging—at work, and in our communities. Leveraging the thoughts of a diverse workforce helps us to be innovative and provide the best service to our customers.
If working in an environment focused on innovation, safety and putting customers and community first inspires you, we want to hear from you. Apply by April 9, 2023, and tell us what excites you about this role.
Finally, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We are dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team, so if your experience is close to what we have listed above, please consider applying. If you do not see yourself in this role but want to join our team, please set up a Job Alert to learn about future opportunities!

Title: Senior Business Analyst - Workday/Peoplesoft ( Data Integration)
Description: Conduct a range of data analyses, demonstrating your in-depth experience with very large datasets and big data technologies; assessing business information…
Descriptions:
TD Description
Tell us your story. Don't go unnoticed. Explain why you're a winning candidate. Think "TD" if you crave meaningful work and embrace change like we do. We are a trusted North American leader that cares about people and inspires them to grow and move forward.
Stay current and competitive. Carve out a career for yourself. Grow with us.
Department Overview
Business Information Management (BIM) at TD is part of a creative, enterprise-wide data and analytics ecosystem. Roles in BIM are highly professional and valued, specialized yet inter-connected and focused on making the availability of business information to designers, developers and decision-makers a priority, all with a united purpose to serve customers and continually build a better bank.

We're looking for analytical and agile professionals who can merge and translate data into technology and business information, serving today's business needs and setting in motion TD's longer-term goals and strategic objectives. If you get data, its power and potential, we think you'll love working at TD, where data knows no bounds and where your professional expertise will help to drive the business forward and take your own career to new heights.

Job Description
Are you an expert level business information analyst, equipped with both conceptual and practical expertise in business information management? If so, this role offers a hands-on and high-career growth opportunity to provide business technical leadership across a broad range of information management functions to support various areas of data and analytics.
Enjoy partnering with colleagues and directing data traffic? In this advanced professional role, you'll work both independently and within teams as a senior data analyst. Colleagues and business partners will look to you to manage and direct activities related to impact analysis, design and support of business data management solutions, including larger projects.
As a Senior Business Information Management Analyst, you will:
Be the expert-level team analyst, considered an authority with in-depth knowledge and experience in data analysis and data migration as well as working knowledge of broader related areas in HR or Financial systems
Participate in Workday implementation activities including discovery, design, configuration, documentation, testing, and project review sessions related to data conversion activities
Facilitate data discovery workshops, downstream impact analyses and proactively manage stakeholder expectations
Lead projects of moderate to complex risk and data requirements; may lead end-to-end data conversion activities
Analyze and understand business and data requirements to develop complete business solutions (e.g. analysis of data models, entity relationship diagrams, data lifecycle management, governance, lineage, metadata and reporting elements)
Develop business requirements; design and implement complex business data information management frameworks
Apply automation and innovation on data platforms and on new development projects / initiatives
Conduct a range of data analyses, demonstrating your in-depth experience with very large datasets and big data technologies; assessing business information-related data requirements aligned to business needs and for specific data platforms, applications systems and servers
Partner and collaborate with business and technology partners to resolve data / application issues and ensure requirements delivery
Participate fully as a member of the project delivery team, support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality and innovation and, ensure timely communication of issues/points of interest
Job Requirements
What can you bring to TD? Share your most relevant experience, credentials and knowledge for this role, as well as these essential requirements and attributes:
Undergraduate degree or technical certificate
Five (5) or more years relevant experience implementing enterprise solutions with at least one full life cycle using Workday
Sound conceptual knowledge in your area of specialty
Fluent in one or two programming languages
Advanced analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficient knowledge of various data sources, tools and technologies used in preparing summaries/reports
In-depth knowledge of competitor and market trends
Proficient to analyze, organize and prioritize work while meeting multiple deadlines
Expertise in using analytical software tools, MS Office, data analysis methods and reporting techniques
Strong ability to work collaboratively and independently, communicate effectively (both speaking and writing), follow instructions/direction, and help building relationships across teams and functions
Act as a brand champion for our business area / function and TD, both internally and externally
Additional Information
Experience working with Workday or Peoplesoft
Data Migration and Data Integration
Inclusiveness
At TD, we are committed to fostering an inclusive, accessible environment, where all employees and customers feel valued, respected and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of our customers and communities in which we live and serve. If you require an accommodation for the recruitment/interview process (including alternate formats of materials, or accessible meeting rooms or other accommodation), please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Title: Product Analyst
Description:
Provide data analysis to support sales and inventory plans that align with the brands objectives.
As Product Analyst, you support in the creation, management…
Descriptions:
Company Description

Who we are:
At Reitmans (Canada) Limited (RCL), every moment of every day revolves around our customers and our love of fashion. We believe fashion empowers our customers to put their best foot forward when it matters the most. From the design table to the stores and our digital channels, we are always finding new ways to create memorable customer experiences, backed by a strong brand portfolio and powered by the most passionate people in the industry.

The Opportunity:
As Product Analyst, you support in the creation, management and execution of product strategies and inventory plans through in-depth product and assortment analysis. Reporting to the Manager Planning & Allocation, you are a partner to the Merchandising team, providing insights and analytics to quantify future orders to maximize sales.

Analyzes trends by commodity and color and makes recommendations for future season

Prepares insights and analytics for seasonal post-mortem

University degree in Commerce or equivalent
Minimum 2 years related experience
Skilled in Excel

A competitive benefits package (Full Time Employees Only)

Generous Employee Referral Policy

By the way, did you know that Reitmans (Canada) Limited has several hundreds of stores all across Canada and three fashion apparel banners? Get ready to join the Canadian fashion retail icon, with a great success story where you can have a voice and make a real difference.
There are many ways to wear a career at RCL! #ReadytoRCL

Title: Contractor - IT Operation Analyst
Description:
Maintain data files and monitoring system configuration to ensure data integrity.
Gather and analyze data in support of systems management, maintenance, and…
Descriptions:
Contractor - IT Operation Analyst - ( 2300002K )
Description
A growing global company. Endless career and development opportunities.
When you join Ritchie Bros., you’ll be part of a diverse, global team that’s focused on delivering great customer experiences. Our culture is centered around people and guided by our core values of Integrity, Unity and Vision. Learn more about our culture and commitment to diversity and inclusion at Candidate Portal.
If you have an entrepreneurial spirit and are passionate about making a difference, we invite you to join our growing team. Whether you’re out in the field or back at your office, you’ll be helping us achieve our vision of becoming the trusted global marketplace for insights, services and transaction solutions for commercial assets.
We’re looking for an IT Operations Analyst and is eligible for a fully remote work arrangement.
This is a contractor position.
The Opportunity:
The IT Operations Analyst will be responsible for ensuring that the performance obligations of in-house computing systems are met, and specifically for driving SCCM administration activities.

In this role you’ll:
Support project managers, systems administrators, and end users to define systems goals, and identify and resolve systems issues.
Participate in projects and program initiatives as technical SMEs in the areas of desktop computing, configuration and equipment setup, images and software installations, support and productivity tools, monitoring and automated updates.
Install new software releases and system upgrades, and participate in release management planning.
Planned, tested, and install system updates and assisted with coming up with the annual Operations roadmap for upgrades.
Participate in the planning of hardware refreshes
Assist database administrators, programmers, software engineers, and network analysts in the deployment and performance analysis of new systems and enhancements to existing systems.
Work within the production change control process.
Ensure ITIL practices are adhered to at all times.
Evaluate and install patches on the desktop (install-only on the server).
Provide tier 1/2 support for the firewalls and switches.
Responsible for image creation and maintenance (after the base image is created).
Responsible for job scheduling, Windows print services, basic filer administration, and User ID administration.
Perform system backups and recovery.
Maintain data files and monitoring system configuration to ensure data integrity.
Monitor and respond to network outages.
Monitor production batch processing, workflows, etc. for successful completion.
Document application job flows.
Gather and analyze data in support of systems management, maintenance, and performance.
Generate and compile reports, complete with probable causes and possible solutions to systems issues.
Provide tier 2 system support and ticket resolution.
Provide tier 1 system support and ticket resolution when needed.
Perform in-depth tests, including end-user reviews, for modified and new systems.
Analyze day-to-day functions and processes of software and database resources to ensure they are performing within predetermined guidelines, limits, and specifications.
Identify and resolve operating system issues in order to maintain services, enhance capabilities, and prevent system outages.
Responsible for Sharepoint, SCCM, and ServiceNow administration activities.
Maintain and update operational documentation.
Support and participate in SOX control audits
Provide support and backup coverage for the IT Field Services team
Actively support the RB Unreserved Commitment to Safety: to send everyone home, every day, the way they came to work, by taking personal responsibility for your safety and safety of your team, co-workers and customers.
Here’s what you bring:
College diploma or university degree in the field of computer science, information science, or management information systems and five to seven (5-7) years related work experience.
Proven experience in the operation and analysis of hardware, software, and standards.
Sharepoint Online administration/development experience
Intermediate skills and current experience with SCCM 2016
Administration/hands-on experience with some/all of the following:
MDM - InTune/EMS
ServiceNow
Office 365/Exchange Online
Active Directory
SentinelOne (or similar enterprise cloud AV solutions.
Hands-on experience in some/all of the following:
OS Imaging/Deployment
Software/Application packaging
Script writing (Powershell)
Database scripts (SQL)
Configuration files
Patch management (Software/Windows Update)
Familiarity and practical application of cyber security fundamentals.
Familiarity and practical application of ITIL practices in the areas of Incident, Problem, Change, Release, and Asset Management.
Experience supporting Apple products in an enterprise environment would be an asset (iOS and MacOS devices).
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and mathematical skills.
Excellent written and oral communication skills.
Excellent listening and interpersonal skills.
Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.
Flexibility to react quickly to changing business conditions.
Ability to communicate ideas to technical and non-technical audiences
Logical and efficient.
Highly self motivated and directed.
Keen attention to detail.
Strong customer service orientation.
Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.
Strong sense of community and teamwork.
Proactive, highly productive and willing to learn and adapt.
This job will require you to:
Work rotational shifts.
Work rotational on-call work.
Assist with support calls.
Sit for extended periods of time.
Lift and transport of moderately heavy objects, such as computers and peripherals.
International Travel may be required (including local trips between sites in the Lower Mainland).
Ritchie Bros. has grown from a small-town auctioneer to a global asset management and disposition company. Through our family of companies, we help our customers buy and sell a wide range of used and unused equipment for construction, mining, transportation, agriculture, oil & gas, lifting & material handling, forestry & other industries.
Ritchie Bros. is an equal opportunity employer and ensures nondiscrimination in all activities in accordance with all applicable laws. This position is open to all qualified applicants who are legally entitled to work in the country in which this job is located. Candidate selection is made by Talent Acquisition. Only electronic applications can be accepted. No agency calls, please.
If you required any accommodations, please send an email to: careers@rbauction.com.

Title: Senior Piracy Analyst
Description:
Analyze data and generate ongoing reports to identify trends in piracy that can be used to impact our strategy.
Knowledge of online marketplaces and app stores.
Descriptions:
At Rogers we’re committed to creating and growing teams that are collaborative, digital-first, fast-moving, bold-thinking, and focused on delivering impact in everything they do. The Legal and Corporate Affairs team is a fundamental part of our business supporting the company’s success. As our advisors on legal, regulatory, and government relations, our Legal and Corporate Affairs partners invest in our teams’ goals every step of the way by minimizing risk and increasing progress.

Are you up for the challenge and the fun? Come play a key role in building the future of innovation in Canada, Let’s make your possible.

Summary
Reporting to the Director of Copyright and Broadband, the Senior Piracy Investigator will contribute to Rogers Content Protection Strategy by investigating, analyzing, and drafting forensic reports on individual and organizations engaged in the authorized distribution of Rogers live linear channels and media assets.
The successful candidate must be a self-starter with experience running online forensic investigations from start to finish. These reports will be a core part of the Content Protection Team’s strategy to impact piracy. The ability to think outside the box and create creative solutions to complex and difficult problems is a must.
Key Responsibilities
Conducting detailed investigations into individuals, organizations, and technical infrastructures involved in copyright infringement.
Deliver investigative reports adapted to the intended audience that be relied upon as the basis for civil and criminal actions.
Provide testimony, serve as an expert witness for civil or criminal matters; attend legal/ court proceedings as needed.
Attempt covert purchases through suspect stores and online.
Analyze data and generate ongoing reports to identify trends in piracy that can be used to impact our strategy.
Demonetize piracy sites in collaboration with payment processors and ad networks.
Determine enforcement options and recommend the next steps for addressing piracy threats.
Work closely with internal and external partners involved anti-piracy work stream.
Monitor, analyze, and report on emerging trends and technologies in online piracy.
Proactively identify new potential piracy targets.
Provide internal monthly case reports and update investigation tracking log.

Qualifications, Knowledge, and Skills
5+ years of experience conducting online investigating, preferably in anti-piracy, digital forensics, security incident response, threat intelligence, or similar.
Good technical understanding of TCP/IP, Internet routing, HTTP(S), and DNS is strongly preferred.
Fundamental understanding of Internet governance and the relationships between ISPs, domain names, Whois, IP addresses, hosting providers.
Knowledge of legal and illegal online content distribution methods, including streaming video, online file hosting, and peer-to-peer file sharing.
Experience in the identification of, collection and handling of evidence.
Knowledge of social media platforms (discord, 4cham, telegram, TikTok, etc.) and how to investigate them.
Knowledge of online marketplaces and app stores.
Experience in copyright infringement investigations.
Ability to work independently.
Experience building relationships with cross-functional departments.
Experience working with an Internet Service Provider or content distribution company is a bonus.
Knowledge of copyright law or litigation is a bonus.
Strong interviewing skills a requirement.
Must have access to a reliable vehicle and hold a valid driver’s license.

Schedule: Full time
Shift: Day
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 333 Bloor Street East (824), Toronto, ON
Travel Requirements: Up to 10%
Posting Category/Function: Regulatory & Regulatory
Requisition ID: 283985

Relevant du Responsable ERP et Analytics, vous ferez partie d'une équipe dynamique, responsable du développement, du maintien et de l'amélioration de divers rapports et tableaux de bord, en utilisant Power BI. Title: Business Analyst, Cybersecurity
Description: As Analyst, Cyber Operations your primary responsibility will be to help advance Air Canada's organizational performance by gathering and documenting current…
Descriptions:
Description

Being part of Air Canada is to become part of an iconic Canadian symbol, recently ranked the best Airline in North America. Let your career take flight by joining our diverse and vibrant team at the leading edge of passenger aviation.

The Analyst, Cyber Operations will be working in a fast paced and innovative environment for one of North America's top airlines. Air Canada's cyber security systems are foundational to protecting the data and systems that allow its customers to fly safely. Air Canada is making significant investments to enhance its Identity and Access Management (IAM) capabilities through process maturity, and technology enablement.

The ideal candidate should have experience working with and implementing IAM solutions.

Purpose:

As Analyst, Cyber Operations your primary responsibility will be to help advance Air Canada's organizational performance by gathering and documenting current business processes and identifying ways to improve them. This position will be reporting to the Manager, Cyber Operations.

Responsibilities:

Participate in and/or conduct requirement eliciting workshops for IAM projects.

Analyze functional and business requirements and identify areas where IAM solutions can be implemented to improve the user experience, performance, security and compliance.

Assess current IAM related systems and identify areas for improvement or replacement.

Ensure that IAM solutions are integrated with other systems such as Active Directory, cloud platforms (Azure, AWS) and other on-premises applications.

Collaborate with IT, security, and business teams to define and implement IAM solutions that meet business needs.

Design and implement IAM workflows, policies, and procedures to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry best practices.

Coordinate the deployment of, and participating in, organizational change management (OCM), testing, training, and documentation.

Build and maintain good relationships with stakeholders, vendors, and other external partners to ensure that IAM solutions are aligned with business needs.

Keep up to date with the latest IAM trends, technologies, and best practices to ensure that solutions are current and secure.
Qualifications

A relevant University degree/technical certification, and/or relevant experience commensurate to the role.

3-5 Years of Business Analysis experience, which 2 years should be of gathering and process improvement experience, preferably within the IAM domain.

A good understanding of IAM concepts (Identity Governance and Administration, Access Management, Identity Lifecycle, Privileged Access Management) and technologies, including authentication, authorization, and directory services.

Experience with IAM platforms such as SailPoint IdentityIQ, SailPoint IdentityNow, Saviynt, Azure Active Directory, CyberArk, Delinea, etc.

Experience in creating governance documentation such as policies, procedures, standards and guidelines, role types and user access reviews, etc.

Experience in procuring software for an enterprise organization (i.e., RFP process.)

Experience in analyzing and managing multiple dependencies between projects with a proven track record of successful deployments.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills to identify, evaluate, and recommend solutions for business issues.

Strong communication and collaboration skills to work with different teams and stakeholders such as IT, security, and business teams.

Nice to have:

CISSP / CISA or equivalent certification.

Testing and test case development.

OCM and communication experience.

Knowledge of IAM standards and best practices such as NIST 800-63, ISO 27001, PCI-DSS, SOX, GDPR, etc.

Project management experience to understand the challenges of planning, prioritizing, and executing of projects.

Familiarity with scripting, programming, or automation tools like Python or PowerShell.

Conditions of Employment:

Candidates must be eligible to work in the country of interest, at the time any offer of employment is made and seeking any required work permits/visas or other authorizations which may be required is the sole responsibility of the candidates applying for this position.

Linguistic Requirements:

Based on equal qualifications, preference will be given to bilingual candidates.

Diversity and Inclusion:

Air Canada is strongly committed to Diversity and Inclusion and aims to create a healthy, accessible and rewarding work environment which highlights employees' unique contributions to our company's success.

As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome applications from all to help us build a diverse workforce which reflects the diversity of our customers, and communities, in which we live and serve.

Air Canada thanks all candidates for their interest; however only those selected to continue in the process will be contacted.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Knowledge of data warehouse/business intelligence concepts, architectural components is considered an asset.
Analyze data to provide insight and ad hoc reports…
Descriptions:
REALTOR.ca is the most popular real estate listing and information platform in Canada. It builds business for REALTOR® members and establishes consumer trust and loyalty by supporting Canadians through their home-buying and selling journeys. It operates under the guiding principles of delivering value to consumers and members and continually evolving to meet and exceed market expectations. REALTOR.ca is more than a listing service – it’s the nexus of the Canadian property buying and selling journey.
Summary
The Senior Business Systems Analyst supports the creation, enhancement, and maintenance of CREA’s IT Services by documenting requirements, contributing to system design, and assuming a leadership role throughout the Systems Development Life Cycle of REALTOR.ca and related products and services.
Function
This position is a rare opportunity to join the REALTOR.ca Analyst team. We are looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst who is personable, results-driven, and has proven leadership experience working across complex, multi-team projects. The Senior Business Systems Analyst has a strong background in Business Systems Analysis and Solutions Architecture and proven ability to perform in an Agile environment.
Core Competencies:
Leadership Skills
Business Analysis
Systems Analysis
Solutions Architecture
Data Analysis
Creative Problem Solver
Critical Thinker
Business and Technical Writing
Presentation Skills
Customer Service
Position Accountabilities
Lead a high-performing team of analysts
Lead the development and enhancement of REALTOR.ca and supporting technology solutions on behalf of REALTORS®, consumers and Real Estate Associations:
Organize and facilitate requirements gathering sessions with project stakeholders, team members and end-users.
Document requirements that meet the needs of the Business and Technology
Present solutions to key business stakeholders
Analyze data to provide insight and ad hoc reports to product managers and IT stakeholders
Take a leadership role in designing, planning, and coordinating projects that involve multiple scrum teams
Establish, improve, and enforce requirements standards within the Business Systems Analyst team
Participate in meetings related to product release activities
Contribute to the creation of QA and UAT test strategies.
Consult on integration and acceptance testing
Contribute to IT architecture, design, and product implementation activities.
Act as a liaison between Business, Development, and Quality Assurance teams.
Identify risks to project deadlines or budget.
Facilitate integration activities with external partner organizations and third-party vendors.
Contribute to assessing project scope and feasibility

Title: UX Research Analyst
Description:
Coordinate research studies by recruiting, screening, and scheduling participants efficiently.
Conduct research studies appropriate to product goals, including…
Descriptions:
Company Description

Part of Dentsu International, Dentsu Creative is a Global Creative Network that transforms brands and businesses through the power of Modern Creativity. Led by Global Chief Creative Officer Fred Levron, 9,000 experts across the globe work seamlessly together to deliver ideas that Create Culture, Shape Society, and Invent the Future. Dentsu Creative was launched in June 2022 to address a client need for simplicity and will be Dentsu International’s sole creative network by the end of 2022.

Job Description

Reporting to the Director of User Experience, the UX Research Analyst will work directly with a multidisciplinary team to help our product team deliver engaging and effective user experiences. You are passionate about data and human behavior, specifically how people interact with digital experiences. You are just as comfortable conducting user interviews and usability sessions as you are presenting your findings to stakeholders, designers, creatives, engineers, and product owners. Dynamic and driven, you are skilled at managing multiple projects efficiently and effectively and equally comfortable working independently or collaboratively.
Responsibilities
Conduct research studies appropriate to product goals, including user interviews, usability testing, survey design, ethnographic research, A/B testing, and more.
Coordinate research studies by recruiting, screening, and scheduling participants efficiently.
Effectively track research projects and contribute to our growing research repository.
Perform research that not only validates current ideas, but also allows for the discovery of new ideas, features, or products that help meet current business goals.
Collaborate with UX and UI designers, developers, and product managers to validate our assumptions and increase team empathy.
Work hands-on with designers to turn insights into real ideas and co-create wireframes, content requirements, prototypes and more.
Train non-research members in the art of user research. User research is a team sport, and we want to support all team members in their quest to understand our users.
Be an advocate for our users, our stakeholders and team members.
Use your presentation skills to effectively communicate research findings, their impact, and next steps to
Continuously learn and keep up to date on the ever-changing world of user research.

Qualifications

Experience /Education:
4+ years of experience in planning, facilitating, and analyzing a range of research methods from discovery to usability testing
Bachelor’s degree in any discipline. HCI, Human Factors, or related focus, preferred.
Experience working in an Agile environment, preferred
Familiarity with generative research methods
Familiarity with evaluative research methods
Familiarity with qualitative and quantitative data analysis, or willingness to learn
Expert knowledge of industry-leading research platforms like usertesting.com
Be a self-starter; we’re a small team and tend towards self-direction under the umbrella of our team goals
Strong organizational skills and able to manage multiple projects across different teams
Amazing communication skills, both internally and externally
Experience giving and receiving constructive feedback from varying teams.

Additional Information

We know through experience that different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds foster a stronger and more creative work environment that delivers better business results. We strive to create workplaces that reflect the clients we serve and where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.
We are committed to working with our candidates from all ability levels throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Canada.Recruitment@dentsuaegis.com or to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.

Descriptions:
One of the fastest growing branches of CMHA, the Canadian Mental Health Association York Region and South Simcoe (CMHA-YRSS) provides 30+ mental health and addiction programs to adults, youth (age 12+), family caregivers, local businesses and community organizations. Providing a safe environment for our staff and clients is of the utmost importance to us and we continue to closely follow COVID-19 protocols and directives from Public Health.
All CMHA-YRSS employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of hire. Rest assured that your well-being is our top priority and we have appropriate health and safety measures in place at each stage of the recruiting process and throughout our operations.
Why work for CMHA York Region?
We are a team committed to our vision of mental health support for all. We offer an inclusive, innovative and high-performance work culture that helps us deliver transformational impact. The organization cares about the growth, safety and well-being of employees and offers:
o Competitive Total Compensation (including salary, benefits, pension)
o HOOPP (Healthcare of Ontario Pension Plan)
o Comprehensive Health Benefits
o Robust Performance and Career Development program
o Learning & development opportunities
Benefits Package: Full Extended Health & Dental, Life Insurance, EAP, STD, LTD, & Pension Plan. Generous paid time off including vacation, sick, personal days after waiting period
Closing Date: April 3, 2023
Location: The HR Data Analyst will operate in a hybrid model, and will be required to work approx. 2-3 days per week on site from our Newmarket office, Located at (1101 Nicholson Rd, Unit 5, Newmarket, ON, L3Y 9C3) and will be required to occasionally travel to our other offices within York Region & South Simcoe. The hybrid model is subject to change in accordance with CMHA policies.
Job Profile: The HR Data Analyst is a part of the People and Culture (P&C) team responsible for maximizing technological capabilities with a variety of P&C tools to reduce manual processes as well as developing and administering ad-hoc/scheduled reporting for all portfolio areas within the department. This position will be the subject matter expert for all P&C related tools regarding functionality, maintenance, upgrading and training. In addition, the HR Data Analyst will be accountable for ensuring data integrity for all metrics based reporting and analyzing data, and communicating trends to support business decisions. This position will be responsible for responding to employee inquires related to various P&C tools, updating CMHA’s intranet for P&C related content and serving as a resource for continuous technical process-improvement tasks and special projects under the P&C portfolio.
The incumbent knows and abides by all CMHA York Region Branch’s (CMHA YR) organizational and departmental policies, sets personal standards and strives for high quality work in completing assignments, performs job duties in a timely manner, and represents the organization in a positive manner. The incumbent emulates CMHA YR’s Mission, Vision and common values (stated above) and is committed to promoting these values in behaviour and attitude in all staff.
Duties:
. System process and primary administration support using the Human Capital Management system UKG (formerly UltiPro) (CORE & Payroll, Time Management, Recruiting Gateway, Onboarding, Performance Management and future modules)
System process and secondary administration support for the policy and procedures system PPM and the learning management system RISE
Develop and run various reports within UKG, PPM, Rise to deliver information and provide analysis to various levels of management and Board of Directors
Work with internal partners including Finance/Payroll for mass updates, ad hoc P&C/Payroll related requests and ensure data integrity within UKG for P&C data
Supporting regular system maintenance testing requirements for upgrades and enhancements as it relates to designated system tasks
Becoming a UKG, PPM and RISE end-user subject matter expert and support the business regarding processes, changes and other system inputs and future module implementations
Developing and maintaining Standard Operating Procedures(SOP) documentation for all P&C technical tools and processes
Conducting audits of employee data in UKG to ensure accuracy and integrity is maintained
Assist with the support of all aspects of P&C as it relates to data requests, analyzing trends, ad-hoc reports, and projects where applicable
Assist in the enhancement and maintenance of P&C metrics scorecard
Collaborate with IT to develop/maintain a Help Desk ticketing system for P&C inquiries for technical support on tools and general P&C inquiries
Triage Help Desk tickets for employee and manager inquiries and provide support and answers as they relate to P&C processes and systems functionality
Monitoring all employee access to P&C technical tools and work with IT, where required to troubleshoot and resolve access issues
Creating and maintaining accurate employee records in UKG and makes updates accordingly and as directed. Communicate these updates to Payroll, as required.
Communicating with external vendors on technical tools subscription renewals and preparing external service tickets for system issues
Providing training and education around P&C tools to existing and new employees individually and groups.
Support the P&C team with various ad hoc projects where applicable
Requirements:
Education and Certifications:
Three year post-secondary education, preferably in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field
Prior Work Experience:
Minimum of two years of related experience including: Working with software and systems related to human resources including HCM, HRIS, LMS
Developing and running customized reports
Analyzing data and communicating trends in PowerPoint format
Previous experience using UKG (UltiPro) considered an asset
Experience with project management software and online forms/surveys; experience with Smartsheet; Surveymonkey considered an asset
Technical knowledge; basic understanding of coding
Previous work experience creating reports using Business Intelligence
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:
. Proficiency in computer applications, including Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel);
Previous experience facilitating technical training sessions one on one and small groups
Advanced Excel and reporting skills required
Passion for detail and a drive for accuracy
Previous experience and understanding of human resource processes and programs an asset
Personal Attributes:
Passion for, and ability to promote a supportive and productive work culture.
Good interpersonal & communication skills for a variety of internal and external audiences
Ability to act professionally and remain calm in stressful situations required.
. Able to work independently, while functioning as part of a passionate team and prioritize as needed
Having fun!
Working Conditions:
Working at a desk in an office environment, with moderate active work required during internal and external events. Work primarily in the Newmarket office and remotely from home in a hybrid model. Occasional travel with York Region and South Simcoe for training and meetings.
Disclaimer:
In keeping with mental health reform, best practices, funding and direction this position may later require knowledge, skills, abilities and working conditions not noted here.
Application Procedures: If you are interested in this opportunity, please visit https://cmha-yr.on.ca/careers/ search for Senior Director, People and Culture Job Posting, Click on the “Apply Now” button and proceed to upload your cover letter and resume.
Complete the application form and submit the following:
Cover letter with 300 words or less and tell us why you would want this role and why you should be considered for the position (PDF or Word)
Resume (PDF or Word)
CMHA-YRSS supports the recovery of people with mental illness and promotes diversity in the workplace. We welcome all applicants including persons with lived experience, women, aboriginal people, and people with disabilities, members of the 2SLGBTQ+, visible minority and immigrant communities.

Title: Business Analyst
Description:
Monitoring CSDS data quality for accountability reporting;
Supporting the CSDS business owner in completing the application maintenance plan to ensure system…
Descriptions:
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH
BUSINESS ANALYST
PAY BAND 5
OPEN COMPETITION
(An alternate work location may be considered within New Brunswick)
*REVISED*
The Department of Health is seeking an individual to join the Addiction and Mental Health Branch as a Senior Business Analyst. The role is an important position in the implementation of the Stepped Care Model accountability framework.
The Business Analyst will work collaboratively with the Addiction and Mental Health Branch Team, Regional Health Authorities, Health Analytics, and other government partners on the collection of data and information, developing of key performance measures and leading the development of dashboards to assist in the evaluation of performance in the delivery of programs and services to New Brunswickers who suffer from an addiction and mental health illness.
The successful candidate will report to the Addiction and Mental Health Branch and will be responsible for:
Understanding the Addiction and Mental Health business processes and information management system workflow, identifying gaps and assist in the development of future improvements for monitoring services;
Working collaboratively in the development and implementation of standards within the workflow of services such as data collection requirements for each level of service intensity;
Assisting in the development and implementation of performance indicators for these services within the Stepped Care Model accountability framework;
Leading the Addiction and Mental Health Indicator Working Group;
Leading and supporting the development of reports and dashboard requirement specifications for the Stepped Care Model accountability framework;
Organizing testing and completing result documentation for the CSDS Maintenance Team, and/or Health Analytics;
Monitoring CSDS data quality for accountability reporting;
Developing and delivering dashboard training.
Reviewing data requests, coordinating, and analyzing the output, and responding to the requestor (ex: Health council, RHA, etc.);
Supporting the CSDS business owner in completing the application maintenance plan to ensure system changes for new/modification of data measures are implemented in a timely manner;
Other related duties.
This position requires a strong organizational and results oriented individual who has statistical, analytical, interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to summarize and present data analysis and findings as well as lead and implement standards within an operation. The individual must be able to work independently and as part of a team.
ESSENTIAL QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor's degree in Business Administration or Information Technology and a minimum of five (5) years related experience. An equivalent combination of education, training and experience may be considered.
Written and spoken competence in English is required. Please state your language capability on your application.
Applicants must clearly demonstrate the essential qualifications to be given further consideration. Please ensure that preferred language for assessment is identified on your resume.
In the event that this competition poses difficulties in recruiting a qualified candidate, a covering off appointment at a lower level may be made. In that case, candidates with less than the required related years of experience may also be considered.
ASSET QUALIFICATIONS: Preference may be given to candidates that demonstrate the following asset qualification:
Project Management.
Subject to the response to this competition, candidates may be required to demonstrate on their application the asset qualification in addition to the essential qualifications in order to be given further consideration.
BEHAVIOURAL COMPETENCIES: The successful candidate will possess the following behavioural competencies:
Analytical thinking/judgment;
Strategic thinking;
Results orientation.
TECHNICAL COMPETENCIES: The successful candidate will possess the following technical competencies:
Records and information management;
Planning and organizing skills;
Knowledge of auditing.
Résumés should be in chronological order specifying education and employment in months and years including part-time and full-time employment.
Salary: $61,204 to $85,514 per annum
We encourage applicants to apply on-line at
Department of Health
Human Resources
4th floor, 520 King Street
Fredericton, NB E3B 5G8

E-Mail: HR-RH.DH-MS@gnb.ca

Title: Project Development Analyst
Description:
Basic data analysis and excel skills.
_Measurement and evaluation of potential project impacts through desk research and field data collection_.
Descriptions:
Taking Root is an international social enterprise on a mission to regenerate the world’s tropical forests. We do this by developing highly impactful reforestation projects on behalf of brands to help them meet their climate commitments. Taking Root’s unique impact comes from our use of technology to direct companies’ climate investments into verified forest impacts with farmer groups. Our innovative technology platform provides third-party forest and carbon reporting by combining local and satellite data with machine learning. This means companies have the information they need to invest in reforestation with confidence while ensuring farmers get paid for the trees they grow. Taking Root is driving reforestation with leading multinational and environmental brands in 9 countries across all 3 tropical continents. Find out more about Taking Root and our technology platform.
About the position
Taking Root’s Expansion Team is responsible for creating, updating, and developing the pipeline of potential projects, geographies, and partners that Taking Root can work towards its goal of being the world’s largest reforestation partner. The Project Development Analyst will provide key analyst support for the Expansion Team through performing desk and on-the-ground research, interviews, documentation review, insight compilation and presentation, report writing, note taking, and other tasks. Areas of content focus for the role will include: forest carbon projects, country-level and global policy review, economic modelling, tropical farming community input, and agroforestry systems with agricultural commodities such as cocoa and coffee, high-value timber, fuelwood, and fruits.
This is a full-time position, and we are open to full-time remote work within Canada. Our office is in Vancouver, BC, and is available for employees who prefer in-person settings. Salary is competitive and based on experience. We work with a diverse set of international partners and especially encourage Indigenous Peoples, members of racial minorities, people with disabilities, LGBTQIA2S+, and members of other underrepresented groups to apply.
Responsibilities:
Responsible for analyst tasks in the identification, selection and qualification of projects and partners through performing:
- Desk research
- Maintenance and population of the expansion rubric
- Field missions of due diligence and report writing
- Research on key industry frameworks and climate policies applicable to the valuation and reporting of project impacts
- Maintenance and recording of interested projects and notes on them
- Review of partner documentation and summarization of key insights
- Support on pipeline project tracking
Responsible for specific parts of the Expansion or Project Team’s production of strategic and compliance documents, such as the pre-feasibility study, stakeholders consultation, Project Design Document, Economic Models, etc. through:
- Writing of drafts
- Data compilation and analysis
- Project Management of the internal review process
Support impacts analysis and certification through:
- Measurement and evaluation of potential project impacts through desk research and field data collection
- Closely collaborating with the Methodologies and Standards team throughout the project development cycle, ensure that project design matches carbon certification requirements and that future project performance is in line with TR’s operational model and objectives
Support expansion-specific budgeting and any contractual agreements for the development of new forest carbon projects or other partnerships through:
- Compiling of cost data
- Creating budgets for specific tasks- such as travel or project development
- Drafting, reviewing, and updating contracts
Support best-practice creation of tools, procedures, and other frameworks through:
- Keep up to date with best-practices in the industry
- Contribute to the improvement of TR’s tools and procedures pertaining to new projects development.
- Support TR on technical topics within our area of expertise
- Disseminate knowledge internally
- Keep departmental knowledge-sharing and communication records
- Support on departmental meetings
Skills, Qualifications, and Experience required:
We especially encourage those with unconventional experience, education, or career paths to apply, even if you may not meet the precise requirements listed in this posting.
- At least 3 years experience in project management, research, or analysis; bonus, if tied to nature-based solutions, climate-tech, or carbon market; bonus, if 5 years of experience
- Experience in relevant fields including, but not limited to, sustainability management, forestry, agroforestry, carbon, environmental sciences, agriculture, political science, international relations, business; bonus, if you have a Master’s Degree in addition to work experience.
- Strong synthesis skills - experience applying research to inform business decisions.
- Strong communication and writing skills.
- A track record of organizational and project management work. Strong attention to detail. Ability to create and manage project plans and deadlines.
- Basic data analysis and excel skills.
- A professional level of English & Spanish (at least, intermediate);
bonus, if you have significant international living and work experience(need to flush this out).
Specialized Knowledge:
- Knowledge in agribusiness, market access or carbon certification for afforestation/ reforestation projects is an asset (PV, GS, Verra).
- Experience in project design, field monitoring, Measurement, Reporting, and Verification will be a strong asset.
- Experience related to the cocoa or coffee supply chain will be valued; or other tropical commodities (asset or required).
How to apply
Submit a cover letter and resume via our portal. We value every application; however, only those applicants selected for an interview will be contacted.
Taking Root has a diverse team of talented people across gender and racial spectrums. We have created a culture of innovation, diversity, and inclusivity, striving for open discussions, best hiring and operational practices. We hire and promote based on merit, competence, performance, successful milestones, and business needs. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind, be that based on race, colour, gender, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, ancestry, disability, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal or provincial laws.

Title: Consumer Sales Business Analyst, Co-op
Description:
Ability to gather, organize and ANALYZE complex data from multiple sources.
This will require extracting data and creative thinking to concisely communicate…
Descriptions:
HP Canada Co is a multinational tech company and market share leader in both Printing and Personal Systems (PPS). PPS is HP’s largest business unit in terms of revenue, with a product portfolio that encompasses personal computers, technical workstations, printers, graphics solutions, managed-print services and internet services for consumers, small/medium-sized businesses and large enterprises. Our products are inspired by our customers and reflect our passion to fuse form, function, style and reliability into great computers and printers. This focus, coupled with unmatched global scale, has made us the world’s leader in printers and PCs. We attribute our success to the expertise, passion and commitment of our people.
HP Canada Co. is looking for an eight to twelve month university co-op student to join the Consumer Sales Team.
The co-op student would be responsible for working closely with sales and category managers in Print and Personal Systems (PCs), on competitive market analysis (heat mapping), market share simulations, promotional return on investment (ROI), forecasting and analyzing sales trends for Canada’s largest retail accounts (Best Buy, Costco, Walmart, Staples, The Source, Amazon). Special projects and presentations will be required on an "as needed" basis. This will require extracting data and creative thinking to concisely communicate meaningful recommendations.
Key Responsibilities:
Preparing in depth ROI reviews to evaluate promotions and/or program spend and presenting findings to the business in a way that is objective and useful.
Collaborate closely with managers, individual contributors and other students on projects and assignments.
Forecasting sales trends by reviewing market outlook, promotional support, supply factors, competitive movements, and consumer demand.
Extracting raw data from in-house systems, if required, and using Excel and PowerPoint to provide meaningful recommendations from the analysis.
On occasion, may accompany sales managers on external meetings with major accounts or attend retail tradeshows.
As you progress through the co-op term, you will use your knowledge of business issues, key customers, company practices, procedures and systems to co-ordinate and manage processes and projects.
Getting every detail right the first time, every time, in order to create confidence in the work that is completed.
Utilizing academic knowledge to understand various business challenges in order to provide insights and recommendations to real world problems.
Education and Experience Required:
Preferred 3rd Year of University completed or currently enrolled in Masters program
Knowledge/experience in Business, Economics, Math, Finance and Statistics is an asset
Qualifications:
Experience with PowerBI software would be considered an asset.
Positive commitment to the business supported
Knowledge of IT and interest in consumer technology is an asset
Goal oriented approach
Highly skilled at Excel/PowerPoint/Word/Outlook

Title: Products Trading Analyst
Description:
Knowledge of modeling data mining, and data analysis.
Collaborate with traders and analysts across geographies to effectively organize data through dashboards,…
Descriptions:
Joining Suncor means you will work for one of the best companies in Canada, providing tremendous future potential where talented people thrive and lead. As our business evolves, so do our employment opportunities. Our work culture includes a dynamic mix of professionals, with a diversity of skills and expertise.
Do you want to be part of the Front Office Trading team working with various stakeholders? If so this role is for you! This person will ensure efficient and accurate daily processing of exchange traded derivatives and physical transactions for the Refined Product desk.
Minimum Requirements:
Two years of relevant experience, preferably in a commodity-based trading environment
A post-secondary education in business, finance, computer science, accounting or engineering
Knowledge of modeling data mining, and data analysis
Experience with CTRMs, particularly CXL is an asset
Knowledge of North American physical refined product or crude oil markets and logistics
Responsibilities:
Provide trade validation for all derivatives and physical trades booked into CXL (CTRM); identify trade capture errors and monitor results to ensure appropriate corrective actions are taken to reduce error frequency and minimize loss due to error.
Monitor and manage inventory and blending activities within the CTRM through accrual to actual cycles to ensure accurate measurement and valuation of in-transit and static inventories.
Prepare management reporting for functional leaders and provide commentary on trading strategy performance and value drivers.
Collaborate with traders and analysts across geographies to effectively organize data through dashboards, charts and reports.
Support the team in identifying, evaluating and modeling optimization opportunities related to pricing, forecasting, transportation and other commercial terms.
Advance the growth of the Refined Products business through the preparation, submission and presentation of new strategy requests to the appropriate governing bodies.
Location and other Key Details:
You will work out of our Calgary head office, located in the Suncor Energy Centre at 150 – 6th Ave S.W.
Hours of work are a regular 40-hour work week, Monday to Friday, with the potential for extended work hours based on business needs
Why Suncor?

Suncor's operations include oil sands development, production and upgrading; offshore oil and gas; petroleum refining in Canada and the U.S.; and the company's Petro-Canada retail and wholesale distribution networks (including Canada's Electric Highway™, a coast-to-coast network of fast-charging electric vehicle stations). Suncor is developing petroleum resources while advancing the transition to a low-emissions future through investment in power, renewable fuels and hydrogen.
With a strong strategy for growth and our long-standing approach to sustainability, operational excellence, capital discipline and technology and innovation, Suncor offers a solid foundation for you to continue building your career. We offer rewarding opportunities for you to learn, contribute and grow in a variety of career-building positions – all of which means tremendous potential for your future. We are focused on deepening our commitment to inclusion and diversity and creating a respectful workplace.
We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from all qualified individuals. We are committed to providing a diverse and inclusive work environment where every employee feels valued and respected. We have numerous employee inclusion networks to help foster an inclusive and respectful culture and drive positive change within Suncor. Current networks include both workplace inclusion networks (focusing on inclusion and respect for all), and identity-focused networks (focusing on building community and a sense of belonging and allyship). Through the Journey of Reconciliation, we are progressing the way we think and act to build greater mutual trust and respect with the Indigenous Peoples in Canada. Please note we will consider accessibility accommodations to applicants upon request.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst
Description:
Knowledge of data warehouse/business intelligence concepts, architectural components is considered an asset.
Analyze data to provide insight and ad hoc reports…
Descriptions:
REALTOR.ca is the most popular real estate listing and information platform in Canada. It builds business for REALTOR® members and establishes consumer trust and loyalty by supporting Canadians through their home-buying and selling journeys. It operates under the guiding principles of delivering value to consumers and members and continually evolving to meet and exceed market expectations. REALTOR.ca is more than a listing service – it’s the nexus of the Canadian property buying and selling journey.
Summary
The Senior Business Systems Analyst supports the creation, enhancement, and maintenance of CREA’s IT Services by documenting requirements, contributing to system design, and assuming a leadership role throughout the Systems Development Life Cycle of REALTOR.ca and related products and services.
Function
This position is a rare opportunity to join the REALTOR.ca Analyst team. We are looking for a Senior Business Systems Analyst who is personable, results-driven, and has proven leadership experience working across complex, multi-team projects. The Senior Business Systems Analyst has a strong background in Business Systems Analysis and Solutions Architecture and proven ability to perform in an Agile environment.
Core Competencies:
Leadership Skills
Business Analysis
Systems Analysis
Solutions Architecture
Data Analysis
Creative Problem Solver
Critical Thinker
Business and Technical Writing
Presentation Skills
Customer Service
Position Accountabilities
Lead a high-performing team of analysts
Lead the development and enhancement of REALTOR.ca and supporting technology solutions on behalf of REALTORS®, consumers and Real Estate Associations:
Organize and facilitate requirements gathering sessions with project stakeholders, team members and end-users.
Document requirements that meet the needs of the Business and Technology
Present solutions to key business stakeholders
Analyze data to provide insight and ad hoc reports to product managers and IT stakeholders
Take a leadership role in designing, planning, and coordinating projects that involve multiple scrum teams
Establish, improve, and enforce requirements standards within the Business Systems Analyst team
Participate in meetings related to product release activities
Contribute to the creation of QA and UAT test strategies.
Consult on integration and acceptance testing
Contribute to IT architecture, design, and product implementation activities.
Act as a liaison between Business, Development, and Quality Assurance teams.
Identify risks to project deadlines or budget.
Facilitate integration activities with external partner organizations and third-party vendors.
Contribute to assessing project scope and feasibility
Contribute to troubleshooting enhancement and production support-related issues
Mentor colleagues in documentation best practices
Motivate and support the team in achieving on-time, on-budget, on quality solutions
Advise on BSA team roles and responsibilities, including project assignments and scrum team balancing
Identify any issues and make recommendations to the IT management team
Contribute to the establishment and adherence to IT security best practices
Requirements
University degree (IT, IS, or business administration with IT focus) or equivalent certification or experience
At least 10 years experience as a Business Systems Analyst or similar role
Experience managing staff
Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment
Advanced use of SQL
Proficient in written and spoken English; bilingualism an asset
Demonstrated track record with consumer-facing, web/mobile-based projects considered an asset
Knowledge of data warehouse/business intelligence concepts, architectural components is considered an asset
This is a Hybrid position, with a mixture of working on-site-minimum two (2) days per week and remotely.
We thank all applicants for their interest, however only those under consideration for the role will be contacted.

33 Dundas Street West Toronto Ontario,M5G 3C2

Supports the development of the strategy and roadmap for data quality and data analytics, data modeling, reporting, business intelligence, and the design and development of sophisticated decision support tools.
Designs, develops, and implements innovative analytical solutions.

Specialized knowledge.

We’re here to help

Job Description:
Business Systems Analyst
BlackBerry® QNX® is a trusted supplier of safe and secure operating systems, hypervisors, frameworks and development tools, and provides expert support and services for building the world’s most critical embedded systems. We are the embedded experts. BlackBerry QNX was born in embedded, and provides time-tested and trusted foundation software, including our deterministic microkernel real-time operating system (RTOS), safety-certified products, middleware and security solutions, all purpose-built for embedded systems.
BlackBerry QNX software is trusted by more than 68% of the Electric Vehicle market by volume, 23 of the top 25 EV manufacturers and is running in more than 175 million vehicles globally. Global leaders such as Audi, Ford, Jaguar Land Rover, General Electric, and Honeywell depend on QNX technology for their in-car electronics, medical devices, industrial automation systems, and other mission- or life-critical applications.
Are you the person we are looking for?
The Business Systems Analyst is directly responsible for supporting users, gathering requirements, designing solutions, and implementing configurations on Salesforce Service and Sales Cloud. The successful candidate will provide solutions to complex business problems where analysis of situations will require an in-depth knowledge of organizational objectives.

Title: Business Analyst- Manufacturing & Logistics
Description: Clients draw upon our deep industry expertise, program and change management capabilities, and analytical objectivity to help improve business productivity,…
Descriptions:
ABOUT US

Cognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating, and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build, and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the NASDAQ-100, is ranked 195 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com .

COGNIZANT CONSULTING

Within Cognizant is Cognizant Consulting, a global consulting organization delivering strategic and domain consulting through industry and technology expertise. With over 6,000 consultants worldwide, Cognizant offers high-value consulting services that improve business performance and operational productivity, lower operational expenses and enhance overall performance. Clients draw upon our deep industry expertise, program and change management capabilities, and analytical objectivity to help improve business productivity, drive technology-enabled business transformation and increase shareholder value. We provide a number of Business/IT Consulting Services including Business Strategy, IT Strategy & Roadmap Development, Process Re-Engineering & Transformation, Enterprise Architecture & Technology Selection, and Domain Solutions. The Cognizant Consulting team is a high performing organization that is continually expanding our client base and increasingly being recommended by analysts such as Forrester and Gartner. And we’re growing!

The Role

Our Manufacturing, Logistics, Energy & Utilities (MLEU) Consulting practice is looking for a Business Analyst join our ML growing practice. Cognizant’s MLEU Consulting is a team of advisory consultants & product managers working for global Industrial clients to create significant business value. The team leverages their technology savviness, functional expertise to lead and execute digital transformation initiatives.

Our solutions are in demand and we’re passionate about making a difference. If you have experience with the above, are a selfless leader, and are committed to client-facing environment; if you embrace complexity and if you want to grow your career with a team that wants to build something great together, we want to hear from you! Apply now!

Responsibilities

Business Analyst will analyze business problems to be solved with IT systems. In this role, BA will provide functional/domain expertise to identify, evaluate and develop IT systems and applications that are cost-effective and meet user requirements.

Provide support with end-to-end solution and process expertise when connecting IT and business stakeholders and identifying new technology-enabled solutions
Facilitate the translation of business needs into solutions/functional specifications and facilitate discovery sessions with business
Elicit business requirements and translate into high-level technical requirements, use cases, and user acceptance test plans Compare input from various sources to draw insightful conclusions.
Employ effective approaches when partnering with third party and internal teams Ensure development and sign-off of project scope.
Adhere to rigorous change management process.
Demonstrate skill when documenting current-state and future-state business process and data flows Lead user acceptance testing and ensure that systems addresses business needs from users’ point of view
Coordinate application development, quality assurance, training, and documentation with user sponsors and other IT personnel Strong communication and collaboration skills

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Business/Finance/Management/Information Technology/Computer Science/ Business Analytics or in any related field.
Masters level degree is a plus Min 3 years of experience in Life science domain and in business analyst in a client facing role
Good exposure to diagramming and product management tools like Visio, JIRA etc
Create process models, specifications, diagrams, and charts to provide direction to developers and/or the project team
Creating requirement documents such as Business Requirement Document (BRD), Use-cases, and any other artifact needed for the project Knowledge on Agile / Scrum methodologies
Demonstrable track record of business analysis and requirements analysis for projects with multiple stakeholders and high organizational or process complexity Mobile applications, API experience is preferred

Employee Shift : Day Job
Travel Required: No
