Title: Business Process Analyst
Description: You will be required to work directly with leaders, process owners and subject matter experts to proactively identify process automation opportunities, assess…
Descriptions:
Business Process Analyst (P3) / Senior Business Process Analyst (P4), Centre of Excellence, Finance Operations and Corporate Services - 00047K
Posting Date: Mar 17, 2023, 8:38:11 AM
Primary Location: Ontario-Ottawa
Job Type: Permanent
Schedule: Full-time

Export Development Canada (EDC) is a financial Crown corporation dedicated to helping Canadian businesses make an impact at home and abroad. EDC offers financial products and knowledge to help Canadian businesses confidently enter new markets, reduce financial risk, and grow their business.
When you join our team, you’ll be helping Canadian businesses learn the endless possibilities that open to them through export and help bring their vision, passion, and innovation to the world. Your knowledge and expertise will support more than 25,000 Canadian businesses and their customers in as many as 200 markets worldwide. You’ll work amongst the best and brightest in an inclusive, collaborative environment that fosters professional development and success. And you’ll know that you’re making an impact every day – for businesses, for Canada and for the people you work with.
Are you ready to make an impact? Join EDC, recognized as a Top 100 and Top Family-Friendly Employer, as we take on the risk so Canadian businesses can take on the world. #LI-Hybrid
Team Overview
The Finance Operations and Corporate Services (FOCS) Centre of Expertise (CoE) team is responsible for optimizing operations across Loans Services, Insurance & Receivables Services, Accounts Payable, Corporate Banking, Procurement, Vendor Management, Real Estate and Security processes. The COE supports operational teams in delivering on key outcomes: continuous improvement mindset and best practices, optimized operational efficiency and risk management, customer service level improvements, and data driven decision-making. The COE achieves these objectives by providing best practice thinking and hands-on support to teams with adopting continuous improvement practices, implementing process improvements, automation, BI reporting, and FOCS group planning and performance management.
As the Senior Business Process Analyst, you will play a key role in providing governance, asset management, bot development and support for RPA solutions, in partnership with technology and business teams. You will be required to work directly with leaders, process owners and subject matter experts to proactively identify process automation opportunities, assess anticipated value and readiness to implement automation solutions, design, develop, and deploy bot solutions, as well as monitor and support solutions through their lifecycle. You will also play a key role in the definition and implementation of other continuous improvements such as process improvements and BI reporting, FOCS group planning and performance management, and coaching teams to adopt continuous improvement practices.
As the Business Process Analyst, in partnership with technology and business teams, you will play a key role in FOCS group planning and performance management, coaching teams to adopt continuous improvement practices, problem solving, definition and implementation of process improvements, automation and BI reporting.
Key Responsibilities
Leads and/or provides coaching to operational teams on problem solving methodology and process.
Calculates and presents Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) results to operational teams.
Reviews trends and develops recommendations for improvement related to KPIs results.
Supports the FOCS leadership team in the development and implementation of operational improvement strategies generally.
Triages new continuous improvement initiatives and facilitates their prioritization.
Continuously researches and incorporates RPA, business process management, and continuous improvement best practices into CoE standard practices.
Proactively partners with business and technology teams to implement continuous improvement initiatives, provide expertise, technical advice, solutions, and the highest level of customer service.
Utilizes best practice project and change management practices to ensure initiatives are well managed throughout and monitored after completion to support the change.
As the Senior Business Process Analyst:
Works with business teams to review their manual processes to determine best fit for automation solutions.
Estimates efficiencies anticipated through automation solutions.
Participates in the prioritization of new automation solutions, facilitating effective engagement with business and technology teams to ensure investment decisions and business outcomes are optimized.
Designs, builds, and tests new automation solutions.
Analyzes and measures the effectiveness of implemented automation solutions and how efficiencies were materialized/utilized.
Screening Criteria
Undergraduate degree in Business Administration, Accounting, Finance, Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
Minimum 7 years’ experience (for level 4) and 5 years’ experience (for level 3) in business administration and/or finance operations or related experience
Knowledge of Finance and corporate services business processes and related systems, in particular one or more of the following processes: accounts receivable, accounts payable, insurance receivable, loans operations, banking, procurement, vendor management, facilities and security processes.
Experience facilitating problem-solving workshops.
Project management experience.
Knowledge of process automation approaches and tools (RPA or other).
Experience with programming, in any programming language.
Assets
Bilingual in both official languages (French and English).
Lean Green or Black Belt designation.
PMP or any other Project Management Certificate.
Experience in Change Management principles and practices.
Experience with UiPath and Microsoft Power Automate platforms.
Salary Range
$66,000 - $99,000, plus performance-based incentive (P3)
$91,700 - $137,600, plus performance-based incentive (P4)
How to apply

Only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.
Application deadline on www.edc.ca/careers : Mar 31, 2023, 10:59:00 PM
EDC is committed to employment equity and actively encourages applications from women, Aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and visible minorities. If selected for an interview, please advise us if you require special accommodation.
Candidates must meet the requisite government security screening requirements.
